story:
Short Summary

As an occupational therapist with over 35 years of experience, I have watched child after child on the autism spectrum struggle to master simple writing tasks .  Failing again and again at writing their name or a few letters of the alphabet,  they came to hate handwriting tasks and gave up.  Required paper and pencil tasks  became anxiety producing.  Students often acted out or were placed off to the side with an adult doing an unrelated task that did not involve handwriting.  Sometimes they were left to stare at the page or interrupt someone else's work because they just could not do what they were asked to do - even if that meant just writing their name.  An assumption was often made that they just did not have the intellectual ability to write or didn't have any thoughts worthy of expression.  I spent hours upon hours at home trying to create games, work sheets, songs and anything else I could think of to engage my students in handwriting tasks.  I went to all the workshops and tried all the methods.  None of it worked very well or very consistently with my diverse group of students.

A few years ago I was able to focus my efforts on the preschool population in classrooms with children on the autism spectrum and with other developmental disabilities.  They were 3-5 years old and most started out nonverbal with attention spans less than 10 seconds for any activity.  Many could not sit in a chair or hold a paintbrush or take off their jacket.  Absolutely nothing I had ever done in the past was working with these little guys.  And that is when it hit me.  It would never work.  It couldn't.  None of the "evidence based"  shape-first, single letter, sequential word building methods would ever work.  Those methods were developed for neurotypical children who did not have the same challenges as children born with an autistic brain.

So I threw away everything I had tried before, everything I had been taught for decades about the "right" way to teach handwriting.  I did what I knew my kids with ASD would respond to.  I stepped into their world and their way of learning and only asked them to do what they could.  And it worked!  No more laborious work trying to make the perfect "A" or focusing on only writing their name because that is what the common core says they have to do in kindergarten.  My students were writing words they had not yet learned to say!  By using language-limited, natural strokes, and focusing on writing whole words in connected script, my little guys were writing their names and object names like "car" and "ball".  One student even was able to write "help" when he needed it.  Those accomplishments exceed what the common core requires for neurotypical students entering kindergarten!

We know from current research that handwriting has very specific effects on the brain.  It is related to literacy later in life, especially when a child can write their name prior to kindergarten, errors and all.  We know that children with high functioning autism that are included in general education classrooms expend so much energy and time on handwriting that it can interfere with their ability to participate in other classroom tasks.  We know that neurologists are looking into the relationship between handwriting difficulties and socialization difficulties in children with ASD.

And we know one other thing.  The Write Connections method works.  Together we can limit the stress, the failure and the unnecessary struggle that so many children on the autism spectrum experience as they fall farther and farther behind in this crucial visual motor skill.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to develop the materials for teachers, therapists, parents, or anyone else who needs them to use.  We have to hire illustrators to make many very specific worksheets and characters.  We need to lay out the "how-to" of the method in a Kindle/e-book so therapists, teachers and others will have the confidence and the information to use The Write Connections method to make their students successful and proud of their work. 

Other methods charge $15 to $20 per booklet per student.  We want to make our materials more widely available by offering them in various combinations on our website as downloadable pdfs that can be copied and used with the buyer's own students or for personal use (but not commercially).  That is going to save school districts, teachers, parents and everyone else a lot of money.  We want people to have easy access so they can use it and see how effective it is.  Our goal is to change the system for children on the autism spectrum and for any child who has difficulty with handwriting.  The Write Connections method is so effective, straight forward and simple that it is also a great way for any child to learn handwriting.

The costs break down like this:

Illustrator fees for directed material development for approximately 50 pdf combinations preschool through 4th grade levels     $18,000

Webinar for Therapists                                                                                                                     $1000

American Occupational Therapy Association Approval as Continuing Education Provider  $1450

Instructional Videos 50 packets                                                                                                   $2500

E-book editing                                                                                                                                        $500

E-book formatting                                                                                                                                $400

E- Book artwork                                                                                                                                    $400

 

Support our campaign and help us make an impact on the autism community!  Look at what you get!

 

  • Every $2 donation gets a personal and heartfelt email thank you from the founder and creator of The Write Connections method, Angela M. Sarno, MS, OTR/L.  

 

  • Every $10 donation gets a Thank You shout out on our Facebook and Twitter pages!  Your friends should know how great you are!

 

  • The first one hundred $25 donations get 20% off all first generation preschool through 2nd grade level products.  As a discount coupon holder you will be emailed before new products go on sale!  You'll be a true TWC insider!

 

  • The first one hundred $50 donations get a free preschool level starter pack, designed for this campaign.  It includes the 5 basic pre writing strokes and the instructions to use them, all in pdf form.   Use a marker, crayon or paint brush to play with them but, above all,  have fun!  

 

  • The first one hundred $100 donations get the preschool set plus 40% off all first generation preschool through 2nd grade level products created by founder Angela M. Sarno, MS, OTR/L.  You'll be running in circles with joy over these!

 

  • Every $1000 or greater donation will get a year of free sponsorship on The Write Connections LLC website and print and digital promotional materials including brochures, Facebook and Twitter pages.  We want everyone to know that you're serious when it comes to supporting the autism community!

The Impact

Supporting our campaign is a direct line to supporting the autism community and children on the autism spectrum everywhere.  The first time one of my functionally nonverbal 4-year-old students wrote the word "car" when choosing between a ball and a car I cried!  He looked at me as if  to say "no big deal"'  but it IS a big deal!  He had made the connection between handwriting and communication, was able to retain the visual image in his mind and execute a complex fine motor task!  That was huge!  And he was only 4-years-old with a 20 word spoken vocabulary that he could not rely on to work consistently. But he could write to request a toy!  You can have that impact too!  Support our campaign and help children on the autism spectrum show us what they have to say.

 

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge right now is getting the word out.  Once the materials are developed we will be able to step up our efforts to educate therapists, teachers, administrators, parents and others about the method.  We need to get approval from the American Occupational Therapy Association as a continuing education provider.  We are already in talks to partner on a peer reviewed research study of our method.  Each one of these exciting challenges will further establish The Write Connections as the go-to handwriting instruction method for children on the autism spectrum.   Angela Sarno, the founder and creator of the method, is well prepared to continue moving forward on this journey.  She started her career in a pediatric diagnostic center and has over 35 years of clinical experience.  She has experience in corporate rehabilitation management, regional program development, rehabilitation services marketing and education.  She is a former author of the National Board of Certification in Occupational Therapy examination for occupational therapists and assistants in the United States.  Come join us and help Angela make The Write Connections method available for every child with ASD!

 

What if We Exceed Our Goal?

Any donations we take in that are  in excess of our goal will go toward developing an iPad app that can be used by children at all levels.  If our donations far exceed our goal we will also start developing our telehealth services so occupational therapists can provide live instruction via computer to children in rural areas and to those without access to their own therapist.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not ready to join the team yet,  please get the word out and share our Indiegogo campaign link on your Facebook, Twitter and other social media pages.  Tell your friends, family, coworkers and organizations.  We would appreciate it!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Some photos contributed by Markus Spiske / raumrot.com / CC-BY

story:
We are a group of friends. We are really interested in the history of our hometown (Lecce). We would like to highlight traces of our history that have been hidden throughout the centuries. All of us have different experiences but we worked together to found "Palazzo Taurino - Medieval Jewish Lecce". Our aim was (and still is) bringing back the history of the Jewish community living in Lecce in the Middle ages.


"Palazzo Taurino" is in the area where the ancient Jewish neighborhood was. Its cellars host some remains of the ancient Jewish settlements, however they have worked as a restaurant for over ten years. In February, we got the chance to manage this area. We have hence converted  the Palazzo cellars into a cultural centre, "Palazzo Taurino - Medieval Jewish Lecce".
Our main achievements have been:
  • Opening to public the area where the ancient miqweh are;
  • Setting up a permanent exhibition on the history of the Jewish community living in Lecce, curated by Prof. Fabrizio Lelli (Università del Salento);
  • Highlighting the presence of the remains of Jewish settlements in other areas of the building. In the Palazzo courtyard there's a groove where a mezuzah was fixed and there are some columns that show the area where the main synagogue in Lecce was;
  • Retracing how medieval Jewish clothing looked like in Italy and Europe in the Middle ages;
  • Hosting a photography exhibition about the "Song of Songs".

We are aiming to show accurately to the public Lecce ancient Jewish neighborhood. To achieve this goal we would like to create a scale-model of the area. The scale model will portray:
  • the ancient synagogue,
  • the baths for miqweh,
  • artisan workshops (Lecce medieval Jews were fine artisans - e.g. many tanneries or soap workshops were meant to be in the Jewish neighborhood),
  • Jewish homes.
All the buildings will be enriched by several characters. The number of buildings and characters will depend on you, all of them will be named after our supporters.
Fabrizio Ghio, archaeologist and architect, will be working on the scale model. Producing the scale model will be a long job.
First of all, Fabrizio will analyse the neighborhood to locate precisely the synagogue and the different homes and workshops. After that, Fabrizio can start building the scale-model. The overall work will take several months and to have a full scale model of the Jewish neighborhood 10'000 € are needed. If we do not get to the total amount, we will still be able to build a smaller scale model. As previously stated, the number of buildings and characters on the model will vary entirely on our supporters.
If you believe in our project, if you'd like to have a little building or character named after you or after your loved ones on our model, please support us and share our project.
Thanks a lot!

story:
As we advance in technology, each component of technology was deemed to revolutionize the educational system. Radio to television to computer to internet and now virtual reality but none proved to be effective. In the era of global network and vast ocean of information at our fingertips we cannot use them to create an effective system to educate people. Are these technologies really incapable of revolutionizing the educational system of this world? We don't think so.

Vision:

As we know the cost of education is rising year by year and yet we fail to provide the quality of education we expect. This platform is not for any specific individual but for entire world to use. We need to incorporate people from entire world and interact so that we can teach and learn together. Education should be same for all. Segregating people for education due to their race, color, ethnicity, location has divided our world. Imagine, if we had same knowledge given to us we would have lived in peace. So, we are providing a system that will benefit society as a whole.  The system of content with tools + analysis + management from institution will help every individual to become a responsible person in the society.

We have a vision of creating a well informed, educated society by providing freedom in education.

Our Product and users:

Currently, we have our web portal (www.kullabs.com) from where we are providing free educational resources to our users all over the world. Until now we have educational resources (i.e. notes, videos, things to remember,  solved question answers, MCQ quiz) for school level students, and we aim to provide all the academic content of the world at our website so that , each and every individual can learn without any restriction. We also aim to provide a educational network where each and every components of educational sector can be connected and be analysed.

We are providing active services to more than 170000 users monthly out of which 51% are from Nepal and 23% are from USA 10% from India and 16% comprises of rest of the world.

Our Info:

We are the group of people belonging to different educational background united to use these technologies for benefit of the education. We wish to expand our team to 250+ content developers, 20+ programmers, 10+ designers, 25+ researchers and 15+ managers from 30 content developers, 5 programmers, 2 designers who work relentlessly to fulfill our vision of changing the world through education by providing freedom in education.

Need:

We expect to raise $500,000 to improve our system along with creation of worldwide academic contents with educational network. We hope to achieve the goal within 6 months and provide all the data to our users.

Our Future Products for Students/Teachers

a. Textual notes 

b. Videos

c. Interactive animations

d. Simulations

e. Communication Platform

f. Other tools required for teaching and learning

Our Future Products for School

A complete institution management system

a. Asset management

b. Exam management

c. Mark sheet Management

d. Library Management

e. Transportation Management

f. Finance Management

g. Course Management

h. Human Resource Management

Our Future Products for Guardian

a. Learning environment

b. Complete educational report of their children

c. Direct interaction with teachers

d. Share their knowledge and experience

e. Find better guidance for their child.

Our Future Products for an Individual

a. Complete learning platform

b. Exposure platform for their talents

c. Communication Platform

d. Share ideas/knowledge and polish them through feedback from users and professionals.

Roadmap

Impact

The time when people of Nepal were still carrying heavy bags and spending so much money on books we had a clear idea of teaching people without books but with free content. With first level completed, we have informed students that they can learn using online content. Also school can use software With the completion of this project, we will be creating a new pattern for gaining knowledge. The traditional method of teaching that is mostly based on feeding information to children will shift to helping the children to learn as per their capacity. Education will help the children foster their inner talent and show it to the world. Now children will not think education as a burden of their life rather they will enjoy the process of learning. Every children's dream will come true through our platform. We will create a society that has educated members working together to create a better world to live.

We will unite the world under one roof through the universal educational platform.

Other Ways You Can Help

This is a huge project that is going to benefit society as a whole. We need your support to create a civilized society where education is not limited to an institution or single teacher. This is not only for us but for our future generation. If you cannot donate, it does not matter you can share and spread the word.

Education will help the children foster their inner talent and show it to the world. Now children will not think education as a burden of their life rather they will enjoy the process of learning. Every children's dream will come true through our platform. We will create a society that has educated members working together to create a better world to live.
We will unite the world under one roof through the universal educational platform.

Other Ways You Can Help
This is a huge project that is going to benefit society as a whole. We need your support to create a civilized society where education is not limited to an institution or single teacher. This is not only for us but for our future generation. If you cannot donate, it does not matter you can share and spread the word.

story:
The Story Behind the Notebook 

I've been a High School and Middle School Science Teacher for 14 years. As a teacher, I want my students to excel. I want them to be confident in their ability to understand and learn anything. The subjects I teach might be important, but there is one thing that I will always care more about: Teaching My Students Skills That Will Help Them All Their Life.

Being able to learn anything is one such skill. But you have to have the right tools and guidance.

Over the years, I've encountered many hard-working and dedicated students who experience a lot of frustration in tough classes such as Chemistry, Physics, or Math. If you are a diligent student trying very hard to do well, but you are unsuccessful, it is understandable that you'll be frustrated. I noticed this frustration and decided to do something about it. 

Because implanting you with a chip and uploading the information directly to your brain has not been invented yet, I came up with the Cornell Notes on Steroids Template and put it inside a notebook. 

It is a comprehensive school tool that improves organization, focus, note-taking, and study skills. It is designed for student success. It is designed to help students learn.

What's Inside?

  • The Cornell Notes on Steroids Notebook is a 8.5"x11" 120-page high quality academic notebook that contains an organizational template you can use while taking notes during a lecture, reading, or another class or home work activity.

  • The first page is the Table of Contents so you can quickly find topics you create.

  • The notebook comes in 2 colors, black with black coil binding or planetary purple with white binding (only 100 bundles of 3 of blue are available).
  • The front cover is laminated on both sides to make it durable, waterproof, and stain resistant.
  • The coil binding is made from durable plastic which looks better and does not deform as wire coil binding does.
  • The Cornell Notes of Steroids Template is designed for 2-sided writing. To prevent ink bleeding through, the Focus Notebook uses 50-lb paper, which is more than 3 times thicker than the 16-lb paper most notebook manufacturers use.
  • All 60 sheets are made from eucalyptus by Suzano Pulp and Paper, which is a manufacturer committed to a sustainable way of producing paper.

And, No Cockroach Milk, Remember?

How will the funds be used?

The money raised here will be used entirely to produce and deliver Cornell Notes on Steroids Notebooks. By pledging for a notebook bundle of 3 or more, you're not only helping me bring this project to life, but also becoming part of a community that supports education and innovation of products that improve education.

I hope you find this project worthy of your time and support and I’d love to hear your suggestions! 

The Impact

1. The Cornell Notes on Steroids Notebook is an organizational tool and a method of teaching and learning that decreases frustration and increases student success in any subject. As with all tools, the user needs to use this unique notebook properly to maximize its effectiveness. I believe that the notebook’s organization, space definition, and prompts provide an easy-to-follow method making the notebook a user-friendly and attractive learning tool. But, to make sure that everyone can optimize their teaching and learning using the notebook, I will provide everyone who buys a bundle with a link to the instructional "How To" video. 

2. I want everyone to have the ability to purchase the Cornell Notes on Steroids Notebook, because I know it can be a game changer. But if you are not ready yet, I am making the PDF of the template available to anyone who pledges $1 and I will provide you with a link to the instructional "How To" video.

3. If you are a student looking to be more organized and successful, or a parent looking to provide your child with a better academic tool, or a teacher seeking to add to your best practices arsenal, or an administrator looking to raise student achievement, please join me in making the Cornell Notes on Steroids Notebook a reality and pledge now. Thank you. 

Risks & Challenges

There are always challenges associated with bringing a new product to life. However, I already have a small inventory of the notebooks. The printer I chose and have been working with closely has the equipment, the know how, and the experience necessary for the project to be successful. The printing press plates are made. The paper and cover stock are ready to go.

I also have thoroughly researched and have a shipping infrastructure in place, so the notebooks can be shipped as soon as they are manufactured.

I promise you that I will work hard to make sure that you receive the highest quality product possible as soon as possible. Thank you for your support and trust!

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, if you like the project and want to help out, share it on social media by using the buttons in the top right corner of this page.

And, I will give the digital version of the Cornell Notes on Steroids FREE to everyone who shares the campaign! Just email me with a screenshot or link to your social share to oskar.cymerman@gmail.com.

story:
Why I believe the film, theater, stunt, tactical and entertainment world needs this material!

Hi, My name is Gina Vincenza aka Psycho Seamstress and I am a costume rigging expert, who has been doing Quick Change Clothing Alterations since 2011. I quit my "day job" in 2013 and have been making a professional living designing, styling, sewing, consulting, teaching and managing design and sewing related projects in costume and fashion.

Here's the Reader's Digest Version of me, my experience and this project:

  • My A List and Celebrity clients have included top names like Beyonce, Taylor Swift, Justin Bieber, Miley Cyrus, Rihanna, Pink, Paul McCartney, Janet Jackson, Michael Jackson's  Immortal Cirque du Soleil and MORE. Most of the alterations I've done for their concert tours, were for quick change rigging and to convert off the rack fashion into dance costumes by adding gussets, consolidating layered garments into one quick changeable item and to prevent onstage wardrobe malfunctions, like rigging the button fly of a very famous performer's designer DSquared Tuxedo pants, so his audience could't see his underwear anymore!!
  • I was recently featured in Beyonce's Behind The Scenes Fashion Video on her Formation World Tour, talking about what we were doing to convert her Designer Balmain Bodysuits from High Fashion into Dance Costumes. https://youtu.be/-INfSklAd_I  (Yes... I do know the difference between a dart and a gusset, but I was ambushed by a camera man and got flustered!)
  • Some of the Theater Shows I've done costume rigging for have included Guys and Dolls, Sister Act, Peter Pan, Hair, Mama Mia, Cirque du Soleil, Mel Brook's Young Frankenstein and more including on stage live quick changes, rigging, hats, wigs and shoes.
  • I've worked on films doing costume rigging for scenes and created distressed / destroyed multiple sets of identical costumes for continuity. 
  • I've been working as a Costume Fabrication Specialist at Universal Theme Parks since 2014. There, I do a lot of Costume Rigging on Marvel, Harry Potter, Seuss, Sindbad, Parade, Event, Stilt Walker and many other performer costumes throughout both parks. Being in Florida and working with out door performers, I do a lot of rigging that reduces the layering on garments, adds mesh panels where fabric would be and other things to keep the performer cooler. 
  • Among my private clients, I've made special garments for illusionists, strippers, ice skaters, aerialists, drag queens and more.
  • I've done tactical rigging on civilian clothes for law enforcement and business suit wearing security teams. I am working with ex-military personnel on a clothing line that allows for quick access to concealed weapons (Quick Draw Clothing) in clothing that looks normal and has no tell tale signs of being military or law enforcement.
  • I have been writing online on the subject of Costume Rigging for a few years now, on my PsychoSeamstress.com Blog and on other Social Media platforms including Control Room, Instructables, Pinterest and Instagram.
  • If you google "costume rigging" a lot of what comes up was written by me and because of this, people email me on a regular basis for help and advice on their rigging dilemmas. 
  • There are no books, that I can find on the subject of costume rigging, which is why I have been threatening to write this book for years!!
  • My goal is to provide a comprehensive first edition, but offer additional and an ongoing series of costume rigging techniques, tips and tricks, which can be added later via subscription and revised editions.
  • I started a facebook group entitled "Costume Rigging Tips & Tricks" and a launched a website with a blog at www.costumerigging.com.
  • So far, the response has been immediate and overwhelming and after launching these sites, I have gathered the names of many people around the world, who are interested in helping me make this happen by sharing their behind the scenes secrets to costume rigging as well!

What I Need & What You Get

Here is the plan for getting the first edition of this comprehensive guide together:

  • Create a List of the Top Most Common or Most Wanted Techniques using my current social media for polling and feedback from my core supporters. I'd love to hear from all of you on that!!

Some of the possible content will be:

  1. basic costume rigging
  2. uncommon costume rigging
  3. removable rigging for rented or borrowed items
  4. merging garments into one for quick change
  5. shoe and boot alterations
  6. millinery alterations
  7. wig tips and tricks
  8. fire stunt rigging
  9. water stunt rigging
  10. stilt walker rigging
  11. aerial costume rigging
  12. tactical rigging
  13. live watchable quick change rigging (usually a spinning quick change)
  14. high speed quick change rigging (where an object passes in front of the performer and they are wearing a different outfit)
  15. illusionist rigging
  16. to add to this list, please visit www.costumerigging.com
  • Illustrate each alteration using actual fabric, materials and garments to show a before and after, along with a step by step photo illustrated, written and video recorded guide on how it's done.
  • I estimate, if I prepare, perform, photograph, videotape and document one or more alterations per day at 5 per week, it should give or take about 10-12 weeks complete the whole project including editing, if fully funded.
  • I'd like to have everything ready to ship out books by Spring 2017 
  • I'll need funding for a Photographer to shoot all the photo images, who's time will coincide with mine and take additional hours to edit photos.
  • I'll need funding for a Videographer to shoot all the video footage, who's time will coincide with mine and take additional hours to edit footage and format it into an organized manner. (I realize I may be able to consolidate this into using one person to do both the photos and video or I may be able to buy a camera or two and tripod set up to do it all my self and possibly use the video to pull out the still images)
  • Funds for Graphic Designer to lay everything out in an easy to understand book format, suitable for teaching.
  • I will need to write the step by step dialog for each alteration and include some possible variations of the same. ie velcro, vs snaps, vs magnets options
  • I've found a company who can print books on demand in soft and hard cover editions.
  • I will need funds to set up an LLC for this project.
  • Funds for any other Legal Fees as needed to Legally Produce This Publication
  • Funds to set up the online distributions sites, so people can find and order this book online.
  • Any additional funds raised will be used for Marketing and Administration beyond this campaign, to get started on adding new material and automating systems that will allow me to be more productive. Thanks to www.fourhourworkweek.com for giving all the resources I've used to take this project this far!

Perks for Supporting This Project

  • Digital PDF version of "Costume Rigging Illustrated" that is eco friendly to download, print, or view on mobile, tablet, pc and mac. 
  • Digital Video of "Costume Rigging Illustrated" with each costume rigging alteration from beginning to end. Download or Watch Online on your mobile, tablet, pc or mac.
  • FREE PDF and Video Updates for all initial supporters
  • Full Color Soft Cover First Edition of "Costume Rigging Illustrated", suitable for teaching.
  • Full Color Hard Cover First Edition of "Costume Rigging Illustrated", suitable for teaching.
  • Signed Copy of the Full Color Hard Cover First Editions to a limited amount of supporters
  • KITS of PHYSICAL SAMPLES of EACH COSTUME RIGGING TECHNIQUE Made To Order
  • Virtual Consulting Packages of Phone, Video Conferencing and Email Consulting Specific to Your Costume Rigging needs will be offered, redeemable immediately
  • Dinner with the Author, redeemable immediately
  • In Person Training with the Author for a day, weekend or week for up to 10 people featuring curriculum Specific To Your Costume Rigging Needs, will be an exclusive perk redeemable immediately.
  • If I do not reach my funding goal, I will provide all supporters with a minimum of one hour vitural consultation and up to their full funding amount at the rate of $100 per hour. Supporters may redeem their non book related rewards immediately. I'd be willing to consult virtually or in person if geography allows on costume rigging or any other areas of my expertise including design, construction, sourcing, Wardrobe Styling, Social Media Marketing or the other wise allotted teaching, consulting, dinner and/or theme park time perk you choose will still be provided. 

The Impact

I have been talking for many years to my behind the scenes colleagues about writing this book, which has always been met with encouragement and support, 

I believe this book will:

  • become a valuable global teaching tool, that can be shared and translated into other languages
  • create through this book, blog and facebook group a community, where we can share our techniques and get help and advise from others, which can be used for future publications
  • invite others to collaborate online, in future updates and special editions
  • keep our trade and secrets alive for future generations

Risks & Challenges

My main concerns are:

  • (required by IndieGoGo) if I fall short on funding this book, instead of taking time off from my regular work, to focus on this project, I will have to do it on the side, while working on other things.
  • If that happens, it will delay the release of this book, because I will have to do it in my spare time and fund the other expenses involved in producing a teaching quality, well illustrated, teaching quality product. 
  • Now that I have established an interested crowd of prospects, through my facebook group, website and blog, all dedicated to this cause, I believe there are folks out there who'd be willing to step up and collaborate with me in making this happen
  • I launched my facebook group and had hundreds people join it from around the world, on the first day with very little effort to promote this group at https://www.facebook.com/groups/CostumeRigging/
  • I launched my CostumeRigging.com website and blog and have already had people subscribe to my updates
  • I am confident that this campaign will exceed my expectations
  • I am confident this book will become the costume rigging bible and a best selling teaching tool and reference guide for students and professionals in theater, colleges and universities that offer costume design, costume fabrication, dance, cosplay and other performance related venues and educational institutions.
  • This book could be sold in fabric, hobby and book stores worldwide and can be translated into may other languages, while the photos and video will serve as Universal illustrations of how it's done.
  • For the price of a yard of fabric, you can download the digital version and print it out, use it on your computer, laptop, table or mobile device. That's a bargain for the priceless knowledge and inside information this book will share. 

Other Ways You Can Help

YOU can also help me with this project by contributing your knowledge of and requests for costume rigging techniques, I'd like to collaborate with anyone who is willing to share their best secrets and give me feedback on what you want to hear about most.

I am looking for Costume Rigging Experts in and feedback on:

  • Costume Rigging for Quick Change, ETC...
  • any other content that would be of interest to this crowd, I'd be interested in looking at and collaborating in exchange for publishing credits, sale proceeds, special editions, seminars, events, teaching opportunities, consulting, blog posts, videos and more
  • Contact me with your ideas at info@costumerigging.com, visit my website/blog at www.costumerigging.com or join my facebook group at https://www.facebook.com/groups/CostumeRigging/
  • Share this post on your social media profiles and via email

And that's all there is to it!

YOU can also help me with this project by contributing your knowledge of and requests for costume rigging techniques, I'd like to collaborate with anyone who is willing to share their best secrets and give me feedback on what you want to hear about most.
I am looking for Costume Rigging Experts in and feedback on:

Costume Rigging for Quick Change, ETC...
any other content that would be of interest to this crowd, I'd be interested in looking at and collaborating in exchange for publishing credits, sale proceeds, special editions, seminars, events, teaching opportunities, consulting, blog posts, videos and more
Contact me with your ideas at info@costumerigging.com, visit my website/blog at www.costumerigging.com or join my facebook group at https://www.facebook.com/groups/CostumeRigging/

Share this post on your social media profiles and via email

And that's all there is to it!

story:
[WHAT IS SCHOOL OF SLUM]

School of Slum is an initiative of slum residence, attempt to run a local primary school in the slum of Haiti. Michel Cademis, our founder of School of Slum, grew up in a slum himself in Haiti. A victim of extreme poverty, he realizes the importance of education, and lack of such awareness in the country.

He became passionate about making minimum education possible for the poorest boys and girls in his slum, by initiating a self-funded & self-run “primary school” with a group of volunteer teachers. The “primary school” we runs provide free, full-time education for about 30 kids in Wharf Jeremie slum in Port-Au-Prince, in hope of empowering them for better future.

But our school has not came along easy. For Michel and his volunteer teachers, all from slums and merely turned 20s with little income; funding of the venue, facilities and stationaries is an immense challenge.

To make it worse, parents of these children do not believe education has the power to end poverty, and many are against it, thinking it's a waste of time. Therefore, we need your help in funding this education initiative, and ship this love to even more Haitian kids in the need.

 

[WHO GOT BENEFITED]

Josma Gerson, is a 10 years old boy benefited from this initiative.

Quoted from our chat with Josma, “My father died in the 2010 Haiti Earthquake, which killed a lot of people. I have been living with my mother in a temporary shelter since I could remember, and I have not gone to school because school is way to expensive, and far away from where I live. I am very happy about the new school that is established in my area, especially since it is free. For me, this new school is a blessing. I love going to school.”

 

[HOW THIS COME ABOUT]

The organization is established after the 2010 Haiti Earthquake and cholera outbreak, which killed more than 300,000 people. A bunch voluntary teachers from the slum have been working tiredlessly to run the school.

With the help a traveller, Kong Chek Yong who Michel Cademis met in 2013; a camera and tablet was donated. He has also helped enabling the set up of 5000+ likes FB page, and suggested the organization to go online for crowd-fudning.

 

[WHERE OUR VISION IS]

We envision our education to be provided to much needed children in the slums of all 10 districts in Haiti, though we now merely survive in helping 30 kids. We envision a complete school with computer lab for pupils to catch up with the fast moving news and technology out there; though we are now only in a shared tiny temporary classroom.

We envision a time where the pupils are energetically fed with rice and corn; though most of the time they came empty-stomached. We envision our pupil to have books to study and pen & paper to practice writing, though now they come to school empty handed. We envision our teachers to be rewarded with income and got trained by a good system, though they get nothing for all their effort at the moment.

We envision people around the world to believe in the same thing as we do. PEOPLE. EDUCATION. LOVE. And we look forward to hearing your response.

Thanks and be blessed as we do!

story:
Who am I?

I'm Mustafa 26 years old from Egypt.
BSc in Chemistry and Physics, Cairo University.
MSc in Water Engineering, Technical University of Berlin.
 
What is YIP?

YIP is a holistic education in Järna, Sweden that gives youth 18-28 a chance to explore their fullest potential and take initiative towards a better world.
To know more about the program;
http://yip.se/

Very short story:

I tried in the last few years to give a contribution to society by getting involved in charity, Human Rights and spreading peace culture organizations. Then, as my knowledge of the world has evolved and my perception of social issues has developed, I find myself pondering challenging questions about the role of the individual in facing global challenges.

My approach has shifted from the local to the global intervention: I think we should start working on our new world, in order to try to solve the cause of problems, not just its symptoms.  I have gained a solid practical experience during my volunteer activities and theoretical knowledge through my intensive research and reading ; now, I would like to turn my ideas into reality and I believe that YIP would be the perfect opportunity to achieve this goal.

What is next!

I believe we need to create a new world. Not only small changes here or there; We need new ideas, philosophies and behaviors towards the world, community and ourselves.   

Now, I have already spent two months with wonderful enthusiastic young people from other parts of the world who are chasing the same dream of building a multicultural and inclusive society, refusing violence and willing to fight prejudices. I think it is primarily important for us to gather and feel that we are not isolated, weird exceptions in our countries, but that we share a common project and we represents a huge potential to create our new world.

I think this exchange of experiences, ideas and feelings would be extremely enriching, would strengthen my motivation and would give me the right competences to play an active and effective role in this world.

Support I need:

The tuition fee of the program: 10000 Eur.

Diversity scholarship: 5000 Eur.
My savings: 1000 Eur .

I still need 4000 Euro to cover the tuition fee.
Internship expenses which will be for two month in Brazil: 1000 Eur.

story: The goal of the Madrona PK-8 Outdoor Ed Program is to teach our students essential life skills and support academic learning through hands-on place-based education. Our school has hired a part-time Outdoor Educator for the 2015-2016 school year, and we need YOU to make this program a success. Our goal is to raise $10,000 to provide the materials and the means for our over 300 students to engage in all aspects of growing, harvesting, and preparing nutritious, seasonal produce from their school garden. Just $65 provides one student with garden and cooking classes for the entire 2015-2016 school year, and every dollar counts. Please help us maximize the educational potential of our school garden by making a gift today!

story:
Help us to reach out to 200 million students worldwide

 

Millions of students in the world try their best to learn English. They want to be educated. They want to be skilled. They want to have their hand in creating better tomorrow.

 

This world is not ideal. Ridden with violence, poverty, and injustice, it becomes dangerous anywhere. Tsunami waves travel thousands of miles through the ocean and hit unsuspecting shores. Troubles that arise in Africa, Asia, or Latin America, affect our life in North America and Europe.

 

With your help, we are going to make this world a better place.

And this is how.

 

Nearly 1.5 billion people throughout the world, learn English language. We are going to help them to

  • Learn English, faster and easier
  • Learn and accept the basic principles of human rights, tolerance, gender equality, and protecting of environment

 

Applying methods used by polyglots, our lessons will make learning English faster and easier. Besides, students will learn to be responsible for this world, through carefully chosen examples and drills.

But this is not enough...

 

To make our lessons more appealing and wanted, each lesson will be translated into TEN most spoken WORLD LANGUAGES. These languages are spoken by half of the world population!

 

Imagine being able to share your message with a half of the world!

With your help, this is going to happen!

 

As a special thank you for your assistance, your name or your logo will appear at the background of a lesson, and EVERY ENGLISH LEARNER will know, who has helped him!

 

What We Need

 

As a first part of the project, we are going to create 60 short lessons, that correspond to the Beginners level. Each one of these lessons will appear in ten languages – Spanish, Arabic, Chinese, Hindi, Portuguese, Urdu, Bengali, Russian, Indonesian and Swahili. These languages open the door to a half of world population.

More languages, such as Persian (Farsi), Turkish, Vietnamese, Thai, Amharic and Hausa would let us reach 15% more students, but it would cost nearly 4,000$ more. So these and more African and Asian languages remain our sweet dream till the times we surpass our goal.

 

Where Does The Money Go?

 

First of all, quality educational material will be created by motivated teachers. Both English and Humanity covered.

Then, audio recordings will be made by native English voice talents, who understand the needs of English learners and have necessary experience in making recordings for educational purposes.

In parallel, a team of high-quality native speaking translators will translate the texts of the lessons into the first batch of ten languages.

Then come video editors, who combine it all together and produce video lessons, available for distribution.

Finally, English teachers and learners in Asia, Africa and Latin America will be contacted and encouraged to make use of our lessons.

 

We welcome everyone on board! 

We will love to put your name, your business logo or your brand name on our lessons. The more support we receive, the more students will learn about you, as we produce more lessons in more languages.

We gladly appreciate any help!

If we surpass our goal – and that would be more than great! – we will not stop. We will just make more lessons. There will be lessons for Elementary and Intermediate learners. We will translate the existing lessons into more languages, so that we can spread the message of humanity to even more students.

The perks of our project may benefit both your business and your spirit.

For VIP supporters we propose very special VIP perks.

story:
Hi!  I'm Jack Bonneau, 11 years (now) and founder and CEO of Jack's Stands & Marketplaces.  I started my business almost 4 years ago! I've been featured in the New York Times, Today Show and many other places!  I recently pitched my business on Shark Tank , where I got a deal from Chris Sacca!  Most importantly, I've been able to have hundreds of kids experience entrepreneurship, business, develop social and life skills; while having fun and making money! I've also been able to speak to over a thousand kids at schools, clubs and individually to hopefully inspire them to create their own businesses.  Please help me expand to reach even more kids and inspire them to learn and experience the skills that they'll need to be successful in their lives!

Please, support my effort to empower our nations youth in entrepreneurship!

What We're Asking For

Our goal is raise to $20,000 to launch Jack's Stands & Marketplaces at 2 locations outside of Colorado and support both Jack's Stands & Marketplaces within Colorado.  Each location will be self-sustaining! This will allow Jack's Stands & Marketplaces to reach an additional 1,000 kids, each year who can operate my stands and marketplaces; and sell their products!

Let us show you how!

Costs for each additional Jack's Stands & Marketplaces outside of Colorado!

How You Can Support Us & What You Get

Through your support you will receive great products from young entrepreneurs and support the growth of Jack's Stands & Marketplaces!

A few of the great young entrepreneurs at Jack's Stands & Marketplaces!

Jack's Logo Products

Jack's Stands & Marketplaces logo (above on stickers, t-shirt and hats).  By purchasing these products 100% of the proceeds go toward supporting and expanding Jack's Stands & Marketplaces!

 

Ry's Ruffery

 

11-year-old Ryan Kelly is the Founder of Ry's Ruffery. Ryan is a young man who started up his own dog-treats business after adopting a dog. He is changing the industry, creating all-natural dog treats that pet owners would love to give as much as their furry friends would love to devour.

Don't feed your dog what you wouldn't eat yourself! By purchasing Ry's Ruffery Shark Tank 3 pack special you'll give your best friend great treats, support a great young entrepreneur; while supporting Jack's Stands & Marketplaces to reach more kids to youth entrepreneurship!

 

Max'is Creations

When I was 8 years old, I had the idea to put a basketball hoop on a mug that I was making in art class at school.  

My mugs are not just for kids. Moms like my mugs because they help kids not fool around at the table. And adults who like sports like them too.  My product reviews have been really great!  My mugs are good for people who can’t go outside and play basketball. Like kids in the hospital.  And people needing occupational therapy.  I like sports and hot chocolate and that’s why I did it.  Thanks for letting me tell you about my mugs.

Purchase one (or more) of my mugs for yourself (or your kids) or friends you'll support my business and together we'll support Jack's Stands & Marketplaces and youth entrepreneurship!

Henry's Humdingers

 

So it all started one day when my mom I got on a plane and I happened to sit next to this beekeeper. He told me about the magical world of bees. Telling me about Colony Collapse Disorder. I learned humans couldn’t live much more than seven years if bees disappeared. At the end of the flight my mom said we could get a bee hive for my birthday. You see, I realized the bees needed a hero. So I decided to start my own company – that was when I turned twelve.

Henry’s Humdingers are unique, I have flavors ranging from sweet to spicy. Try my great flavors; while supporting Jack's Stands & Marketplaces and youth entrepreneurship!

 

The Impact

A Kaufman Foundation poll found more than half of millennials want to start a business, but that the key barriers are a lack of access to capital and a lack of knowledge. Jack's Stands' goal is to help young entrepreneurs surmount those barriers.

From 2015 to 2016, Jack's Stands & Marketplaces has hosted over 200 and over 500 kids respectively, with over 60% of them operating Jack's Stands & Marketplaces over multiple dates. In 2016, Jack's Stands & Marketplaces expanded from a single farmers market location in 2014 to 7 locations, including 3 malls in 2016.  In 2017, Jack plans to expand to many more locations and events within Colorado and expand to at least 2 locations outside of Colorado.  In 2017, Jack's Stands & Marketplaces will host over a thousand kids and sell the great products of dozens of young entrepreneurs; while sharing their inspirational stories.  The impact that this will have on participating kids--with your support--is immeasurable.  

Risk & Challenges

We are expanding outside of Colorado for the first time and their is a risk that this becomes a significant challenge.  We have been addressing this potential challenge by growing slowly in Colorado, working with sponsoring families and entities to create a model that we will be able to duplicate outside of Colorado. 

Can't Help Right Now?

If you're unable to contribute, you can still be part of the mission to have kids and their families experience entrepreneurship, learn about business, build confidence, make some money, and have fun!  All you have to do is help spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools below and letting everyone you know hear about Jack's Stands & Marketplaces!   

We hope to see you soon at a Jack's Stands & Marketplaces near you!  

Thank you,

Jack and Team Jack!

story:
Our story

A year-long piloting of Technology Nation project has proven to be a real life-changing experience for the participants who found new jobs with respect to their skills, knowledge, creativity and passion. Please follow our exciting story below.

We are BrainBasket Foundation - the Ukrainian charity Fund that functions to enhance one of the most dynamic sectors of Ukraine’s economy - Information Technology.

Our background counts for a range of educational, promotional and innovative projects, but our biggest pride is a nationwide educational project Technology Nation to retrain adult people in IT free of charge, aiming to grow a new generation of IT experts for Ukraine and for the world.

 

Why IT in Ukraine?

Because Ukraine is number one IT outsourcer in Europe and number 4 globally

*Stats are taken from the Ministry of Economy of Ukraine (year 2016)

 

Ukrainians bestowed a range of IT breakthroughs and innovations to the world. For sure you've benefited from at least one of these developments in your life

These are just a few of the examples of innovations or applications that developers with Ukrainian roots made/were one of the founders.

BrainBasket Foundation operates in IT sector as NGO, has a wide network of partners in IT industry. This specific background, synergy and tight cooperation with partners helped us to develop unique features of our Technology Nation project:

 

Number one

We use online courses of leading world universities.

Meaning our students get certified and globally recognized knowledge in computer programming upon completing the full four months course free of charge.

 

Number two

We use an innovative method of education: blended learning (a combination of online and offline education) 

According to Coursera statistics, a maximum of 7% of students completes a full online course.  According to our experience, when it comes to programming things are even harder (up to 5%) pass the final exam.

That’s why in Technology Nation project we came to a decision to enroll mentors - experienced programmers to hold practical evening classes for groups of 20 people during four months.  For the first wave of education, the mentors even agreed to lead groups free of charge, while now we offer them a symbolic fee for their important work.

Using this approach, in less than a year we are proud to reach a 42% completion rate of our free courses.

 

Number three

We transform outdated libraries across Ukraine into modernized learning hubs with computers, projectors and Internet access available to everyone.

To launch a new learning hub, we first collect computers and other needed equipment (mostly via donations from IT companies that function in Ukraine) and then place them in libraries.

 

Number four

Our target audience is adults, mainly those who lost their jobs, not because of their personal mishandling but due to regretful force majeure factors in Ukraine for the last years (military conflict, the annexation of Crimea, resulting in stagnation of the range of industries: tourism, legal, financial and many others). Thus, we give a chance to those passionate, motivated and talented people to get new jobs using the knowledge and skills our courses offer them. 

 

First results

These core features, a dedicated teamwork, and support from partners helped us to reach remarkable results in less than a year of a project running:

  • We launched 80 groups (up to 20 people each)
  • Hired 67 mentors - experienced developers
  • Donated 600 computers and other equipment to 40 local libraries
  • Enrolled 1250 people to the courses 

Graduates with graduation certificates, Zaporizhia city, Ukraine 

 

What your funds will be used for?

If we collect the full pledged amount of 50,000 USD:

  • We educate 1000 new IT specialists in only 8 months across Ukraine
  • We launch and equip at least 20 new learning hubs
  • We give a real chance for talented people to find new demanded jobs in IT

The more funds we collect, the more people in Ukraine get a chance for sustainable future.  

And the last but not least

World needs IT - Ukraine has the resources

By 2020 the world will lack 5,000,000 IT specialists, Europe 900,000, Ukraine 100,000.

Even if you are geographically far from us, you can help by donating funds to the Technology Nation project, a project that will:

  • help talented people in Ukraine find jobs in IT
  • lead Ukraine into more stability via enhanced IT sector
  • grant world new talented software developers for all the industries

 

Our Team

And a wide network of regional coordinators in the fields. Ukraine is geographically large country; therefore, each coordinator is responsible for sound activities running on the ground.

 

Partners who already engaged to support the project

  • IT companies that donated computers/mentors (Ciklum, Microsoft Ukraine, Miratech, GlobalLogic, Luxoft  and many others)
  • Business companies who supported financially (Ciklum, MacPaw, Vodafone, Arzinger and others)
  • Charity Foundations - International Renaissance Foundation

All this support gave us an intense start-up, however, we need your support to scale up and reach real impact

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, not only financial support matters to us. You will help our project by:

  • Circulating widely this campaign among your friends
  • Sharing the campaign in your social networks profiles (Facebook, Twitter, LinkdIn, etc.)
  • Following our campaign updates and visiting our website for deeper engagement in the activities we run

Please follow our exciting story below.We are BrainBasket Foundation - the Ukrainian charity Fund that functions to enhance one of the most dynamic sectors of Ukraine’s economy - Information Technology.Our background counts for a range of educational, promotional and innovative projects, but our biggest pride is a nationwide educational project Technology Nation to retrain adult people in IT free of charge, aiming to grow a new generation of IT experts for Ukraine and for the world. Why IT in Ukraine?Because Ukraine is number one IT outsourcer in Europe and number 4 globally*Stats are taken from the Ministry of Economy of Ukraine (year 2016) Ukrainians bestowed a range of IT breakthroughs and innovations to the world. For sure you've benefited from at least one of these developments in your lifeThese are just a few of the examples of innovations or applications that developers with Ukrainian roots made/were one of the founders.BrainBasket Foundation operates in IT sector as NGO, has a wide network of partners in IT industry. story:
We had a dream ... to create an educational software to learn languages ​​in an entertaining and meaningful way,  leveraging our passion ... music.

This is how MusíGlota was created, StartUp in Chile that develops technological solutions for learning languages. After almost 3 years of research and development we were able to create our App MusíGlota, which allows you to learn or practice languages ​​through music that each user has on their device, transforming their favorite songs in interactive classes.

We currently have a version to learn English, and with this campaign we want to finish a new version that also allows to learn Spanish and Portuguese.

We want to help and share our dream, making it possible for any child, young adult or adult to learn languages ​​ everyday and in playful manner through the music he or she likes.

If we fulfill the goal in 4 months we will launch the new version of the app. Also, if we exceed the goal we will use these extra resources to donate our software to schools in need in different countries.

Help us achieve this goal!

What we need and what you get

We need to raise $ 25,000, to develop and validate the new version to learn Spanish and Portuguese, make 2 pilot tests and validate the prototype, since all the software and engineering is good to go.

We have exclusive rewards such as:

- Personalized thank you with your name on the credits of the App

- Full Licenses for our App

- Exclusive Musiglota shirts with unique designs for you

- Customize the app interface with your photos or those of your friends, so you can always be a RockStar

- The option to donate our software directly to a course or school of your choice

If we do not achieve the goal, the funds will be used to improve the current version of the app (to learn English).


The impact

Our first and current prototype App was Selected in December 2015 as the best technological innovation of the year in Chile (Avonni prize). And we've had an amazing response from people in Chile, surpassing 200,000 users in 8 months since its launch.

With your help we want to bring this to other countries, add languages ​​and improve the app. We are convinced that many people in the world will be very happy to learn languages ​​with their favorite music, and we want the poorest schools to have this resource for free. We believe in playful, everyday and meaningful learning.

You can see more information about us on our web site www.musiglota.com where you'll see some experiences in schools, our awards, and of course, more of our solutions.

Risks and Challenges

We will take on the challenge of completing this new app  versión very fast  and to have all our engineering, design team and teachers  100% committed. We have over 6 years of experience in technology and education, so we are very optimistic about the results.

Ways to Help

We greatly appreciate your financial contribution, and that you can also help us share the campaign using the tools Indiegogo offers.

Thank you very much!!

story:
WELCOME TO THE 2016 WIDE HORIZONS CROWD FUNDING CAMPAIGN! Created by the 9th batch of Wide Horizons students! 

Our first student-led crowdfunding campaign! 

Please watch our video exclusively created by the students!


Where we are

The Wide Horizons Program is based in a growing border town called Mae Sot. This town lies on the border between Thailand and Burma, an area which is dotted by refugee camps, where more than 200,000 people have been ‘living’ for over 20 years after fleeing war and oppression in Burma. Mae Sot is also home to thousands of Burmese migrants, who came to Mae Sot to find a better life and earn money for their impoverished communities in Burma, where there are few schools or hospitals, and where decades of civil war has torn families apart. 

Our students come from those camps. From those migrant communities. From inside Burma.

They come to Wide Horizons to learn how to improve their communities and with your help, they can continue to do so! 

Who we are

Every year, a local network of grassroots organizations along the Thai-Burma border and inside Burma nominates young adult staff members to apply for our program. Every year, Wide Horizons selects 24 students from a competitive applicant pool from different communities and ethnicities and organizations. To study at WH school, the students need to have at least 1 year of work experience in an organization or school. 12 boys and 12 girls aged 20-35 years old are chosen to enter into an intense residential learning environment in Mae Sot while learning skills, traditions and cultures from each other.

Wide Horizons is a 2-years leadership development program dedicated to building the capacity of young adults from Burma and Thai-Burma border to work effectively in civil society organizations after completing the program. 

Community Based Organization Visit to AAPPB

Basically, it can be broken down as follows:

24 students each year

 + 5 staff members

+ 2 [intense] years of training

+ A network of community based organizations (CBOs) such as clinics, schools and grassroots organizations

+ Alumni community development projects

= 223 graduates (since 2006), developing and establishing their own organizations and schools in places that have been devoid of most services for years.

= Countless lives continuously changed on both sides of the Thai-Burma border.


Classroom activity for Community Development

What we do 

Wide Horizons strives to provide students with practical skills, focusing on community development and dedicated to building the capacity of young adults, as well as inspiring and empowering them.  

WH provides 3 subjects during the academic year: Advanced English, Community Development (CD) and Computer. The students receive many trainings such as video editing with DVB (Democratic Voice of Burma), financial literacy, translation and interpretation, reproductive health, child protection and design training. The students have goals to use these trainings and skills in the future for their communities.

After 10 months of studying full time (7 DAYS A WEEK!) at Wide Horizons, the students return back to their organizations to complete a 1-year work placement on the Thai-Burma border or inside Burma. 

This year, we have introduced alumni project opportunities that offers grants to alumni who want to complete community projects in their communities.

Also, with a successful election in Burma (Myanmar) in 2015, WH is researching opportunities and partnerships to expand our program into Myanmar. This requires our staff to complete research trips into Burma to meet emerging organizations and leaders in a transitioning Burma.

Wide Horizons staff are very proud that so many of our staff are working in prominent positions in community based organizations on the border like Mae Tao Clinic or World Education or inside Burma. Some students are starting new organizations in their ethnic states. It shows how amazing these students are and how much they have used their skills that they received from WH school.


Giving training to migrant communities

Mission of your help

Our aim is to keep this invaluable and life-changing program running as well as expand our impact into a changing Burma!

Wide Horizons operates with a very modest annual budget of $45,000 USD to house, feed, and educate 24 students for 10 months – the effects of which are immeasurable for the students and for their communities.

Unfortunately, our funding dropped significantly and we are currently facing difficulties in financing every year with funding shifts on the border. In order to keep our school operating and ensure we can continue providing a healthy and safe living and learning environment for our students and teachers, we need to raise funds with crowdfunding and in the field with student-led fundraising projects. Between the 2 fundraising projects, we hope to raise $10,000 to help supplement our funding for the next academic year and research endeavors into Burma.

The students are eager to learn everything from WH school to share with their communities around inside Burma and Thai-Burma border. We are here to help them and their communities. However, we need your help to support them and upcoming students and upcoming projects!

Any contribution, large or small will go a very long way to ensuring Wide Horizons continues to do such great work.  


Project Implementation at WH School and Elpis Dormitory 


Help us by Supporting us!


If you would like further info, check out our website at http://widehorizonsprogram.blogspot.com/ 

or email us if you have any queries on widehorizonsmaesot@gmail.com 

– and remember, you are always welcome to visit Wide Horizons at anytime!!

Please help us out in continuing the development of 24 young adults, 24 CBOs, 24 communities … you do the math!

story:
At any given time in the world, where there is open space and a ball, you will find people playing the world's game...football! We want to disrupt grassroots football, by enabling anybody, anywhere in the world, to have access to Premier League quality coaching and lifestyle support. Irrespective of who you are, who you support and where you are, you will have affordable access to Scorecher.

Scorecher is the first cloudbased resource to integrate football coaching, fitness, nutritional advice and sports psychology, for the next generation of football stars. It is an innovative interactive website, available 24/7 on any computer device, providing football coaching and lifestyle advice when you want it, where you want it.

Scorecher teaches you how to play, think and live like a professional footballer. Importantly, we want to deliver affordable access for everyone. We need your support. Please help us to have a successful campaign by buying one of the perks at the side of our campaign page. Please enjoy scrolling down to find a perk or perks to suit you. 

With your support and money, we will develop the platform, the content and help people get fitter, healthier and become better footballers through accessing Scorecher. We are prepared to give free access to some people and communities and donate 1% of all money we make from Scorecher to communities in need of support via football!

Professional footballers are amongst the most finely tuned athletes on the planet so having access to their secrets in areas such as coaching, fitness, diet, sports psychology is likely to have a profoundly positive effect on your life.

Football experts provide video content to allow people to train, play and coach like an elite footballer via Scorecher, giving budding athletes an insight into the training techniques and lifestyle advice professional footballers follow.

Members have the capability to access all of this, plus they have their own e-portfolio to share their successes, and they can compete against themselves and against others via the Performance Room!

Who knows? Scorecher could help discover the next Bale or Marta.

LAUNCH FEATURES:

  • Interactive coaching sessions (recorded and live) from FIFA-qualified coaches.
  • Assessments and downloads to help you to improve your skills, health and fitness.
  • Health and fitness coaching to help you to enjoy a healthier life and to play to your maximum potential.
  • Use your own 'My Profile' area to monitor your progress, using our easy to use member dashboard. We will also create a coach/manager/teacher dashboard so that your team can develop together.
  • Upload your own videos, photographs and documents to show your progress in your own 'soccerfolio'. Share with family and friends; perhaps you will be spotted by scouts and agents.
  • The Performance Room takes a gamified approach to football training, awarding players points for their skills, fitness and lifestyle. enter international, national team or bespoke leagues that you create yourself. Win rewards and gain certificates for your successes.
  • Scorecher Live offers a platform for live coaching, guest speakers, demonstrations and seminars, delivered by experts; and performance analysis, which can be recorded in HD audio and video

Health and Well-being

Our platform isn't just about developing football talent. We understand that access to coaching training and delivering health and well-being techniques, using football as a vehicle, is powerful. It can change lives. Here are some statistics from the WHO that motivates us:

  • Insufficient physical activity is a key risk factor for noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) such as cardiovascular diseases, cancer and diabetes.
  • Physical activity has significant health benefits and contributes to prevent NCDs.
  • More than 80% of the world's adolescent population is insufficiently physically active.

Further advice form the WHO includes:

  • Children and adolescents aged 5-17years should do at least 60 minutes of moderate to vigorous-intensity physical activity daily.
  • Physical activity of amounts greater than 60 minutes daily will provide additional health benefits. 
  • Adults aged 18+ should do at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity physical activity throughout the week, or do at least 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity physical activity throughout the week, or an equivalent combination of moderate- and vigorous-intensity activity.

Scorcher aims to help combat these issues by offering an easy and enjoyable way to get fit and healthy and to monitor progress. We want to help the world play football to a higher standard and get fitter doing so!

WHAT'S NEXT?

We are working on a prototype of Scorecher and legends of the Premier League and Fifa qualified coaches are on board and designing coaching programmes and interactive health and well-being content. Scorecher has been designed in part by some of the legends of the game, players who played (and managed) at the very highest level, for their club and country. They are helping to design coaching programmes based on their experience of training with some legendary managers and coaches, to FIFA pro standards. They are still active in the game through media, youth training and in development programmes around the world. 

Our developers will produce a unique, world class platform, that is easy to use yet retains a sophisticated and powerful engine to help people get the best out of Scorcher. Using responsive HTML5, Scorecher is easily and effectively accessible using mobile technology. Ideal for using out on the pitch!

We have partners on several continents, to help us share Scorecher with the global football community. To get this content made, our platform finished and launch Scorecher to billions of football fans around the world, we need your help. To thank you for your support we have provided a wide range of rewards to suit different budgets and supporters of different clubs.

FOOTBALL FANS, PRO PLAYERS AND EXPERTS IN ED-TECH AND DISTANCE LEARNING

Our team includes:

  • LearnerVerse, acknowledged by the world’s leading EdTech event BETT for two years running as one of the most innovation education solutions in the world. Featured in the Times SME supplement.
  • Premier League legends, such as: Emile Heskey, Lee Sharpe, David May, Neville Southall, Peter Reid, John Hartson, Matt Elliott and ladies football star, Natasha Harding.
  • FIFA-Qualified football coaches and health and fitness coaches.
  • Professional Football Club Development Teams and Scholarship Programmes.
  • Most importantly, you, the Fans! 

    FUNDING BENCHMARKS - WHAT WE'LL DO WITH YOUR SUPPORT AND MONEY

    * Scorecher and Performance Room, with interactive and shareable 'soccerfolio' - £241,000

    * Scorecher and Gamefied Performance Room with leagues and interactive features, with interactive and shareable 'soccerfolio' - £283,000

    * Scorecher and Gamefied Performance Room with leagues and interactive features, with interactive and shareable 'soccerfolio audition Room' - £450,000 

    * Scorecher and Gamefied Performance room with leagues and interactive features, with interactive and shareable 'soccerfolio', 'audition Room', plus development of virtual football academy - £850,000

    Some Interesting Facts and Figures

    A global community, united by the Beautiful Game

    270 million people are actively involved in playing in organised football around the world, according to FIFA’s Big Count, including:

    • China: 26 million+
    • US: 24 million+
    • India: 20 million+
    • Brazil: 14 million+
    • Indonesia: 7 million+
    • Nigeria: 6 million+
    • There are 29+ million women that play organised football, globally.

    Risks & Challenges

    The Scorecher crowdfunder is based on flexible funding, so the project will retain whatever level of funding it raises. The money raised goes towards creating  content and developing Scorecher and the Performance Room feature.

    The next phases of development include the interactive and shareable 'Soccerfolio', competitive leagues, and - should the campaign exceed its target - a live Audition Room for club scouts, and a virtual football academy.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    There are a number of ways that you can help join Team Scorecher and our vision, to bring professional Premier League quality coaching to every corner of the planet and make it accessible to everyone. 

    * Buy one of our amazing perks! Scroll down the side of our campaign page and you will find a perk to suit all pockets. We have everything from the sublime to the amazing!

    *You'll find us on Twitter, Facebook, YouTube and Instagram. We'd love to hear from you; show us your skills and how you play the Beautiful game.

    *Tell your family, friends and colleagues about us. Invite them to take a look at the Scorecher INDIEGOGO page. 

    *Send videos of you performing football tricks to win free prizes, awarded at the end of the campaign.

    *Say hello to the Legends for retweets and more using @TeamScorecher.

    * We're also launching some additional (and very exciting) rewards during the campaign (designed by our legends for the global football community) so bookmark this page or follow us on our social channels to stay up to date. We can't say too much about these rewards yet but trust us...they are worth waiting for!

    A big thank you to all of you in advance. Let's work together to disrupt grassroots football  offer affordable access to world class coaching, health and fitness media and to make Scorecher the greatest football resource ever made!
