Irrespective of who you are, who you support and where you are, you will have affordable access to Scorecher.
Scorecher is the first cloudbased resource to integrate football coaching, fitness, nutritional advice and sports psychology, for the next generation of football stars. It is an innovative interactive website, available 24/7 on any computer device, providing football coaching and lifestyle advice when you want it, where you want it.
Scorecher teaches you how to play, think and live like a professional footballer. Importantly, we want to deliver affordable access for everyone. We need your support. Please help us to have a successful campaign by buying one of the perks at the side of our campaign page. Please enjoy scrolling down to find a perk or perks to suit you. 
With your support and money, we will develop the platform, the content and help people get fitter, healthier and become better footballers through accessing Scorecher. We are prepared to give free access to some people and communities and donate 1% of all money we make from Scorecher to communities in need of support via football!
Professional footballers are amongst the most finely tuned athletes on the planet so having access to their secrets in areas such as coaching, fitness, diet, sports psychology is likely to have a profoundly positive effect on your life.
Football experts provide video content to allow people to train, play and coach like an elite footballer via Scorecher, giving budding athletes an insight into the training techniques and lifestyle advice professional footballers follow.
Members have the capability to access all of this, plus they have their own e-portfolio to share their successes, and they can compete against themselves and against others via the Performance Room!
Who knows? Scorecher could help discover the next Bale or Marta.

LAUNCH FEATURES:

Interactive coaching sessions (recorded and live) from FIFA-qualified coaches.
Assessments and downloads to help you to improve your skills, health and fitness.
Health and fitness coaching to help you to enjoy a healthier life and to play to your maximum potential.
Use your own 'My Profile' area to monitor your progress, using our easy to use member dashboard. We will also create a coach/manager/teacher dashboard so that your team can develop together.
Upload your own videos, photographs and documents to show your progress in your own 'soccerfolio'. Share with family and friends; perhaps you will be spotted by scouts and agents.
The Performance Room takes a gamified approach to football training, awarding players points for their skills, fitness and lifestyle. enter international, national team or bespoke leagues that you create yourself. Win rewards and gain certificates for your successes.
Scorecher Live offers a platform for live coaching, guest speakers, demonstrations and seminars, delivered by experts; and performance analysis, which can be recorded in HD audio and video


Health and Well-being
Our platform isn't just about developing football talent. We understand that access to coaching training and delivering health and well-being techniques, using football as a vehicle, is powerful. It can change lives. Here are some statistics from the WHO that motivates us:

Insufficient physical activity is a key risk factor for noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) such as cardiovascular diseases, cancer and diabetes.
Physical activity has significant health benefits and contributes to prevent NCDs.
More than 80% of the world's adolescent population is insufficiently physically active.

Further advice form the WHO includes:

Children and adolescents aged 5-17years should do at least 60 minutes of moderate to vigorous-intensity physical activity daily.
Physical activity of amounts greater than 60 minutes daily will provide additional health benefits. 
Adults aged 18+ should do at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity physical activity throughout the week, or do at least 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity physical activity throughout the week, or an equivalent combination of moderate- and vigorous-intensity activity.

Scorcher aims to help combat these issues by offering an easy and enjoyable way to get fit and healthy and to monitor progress. We want to help the world play football to a higher standard and get fitter doing so!
WHAT'S NEXT?
We are working on a prototype of Scorecher and legends of the Premier League and Fifa qualified coaches are on board and designing coaching programmes and interactive health and well-being content. Scorecher has been designed in part by some of the legends of the game, players who played (and managed) at the very highest level, for their club and country. They are helping to design coaching programmes based on their experience of training with some legendary managers and coaches, to FIFA pro standards. They are still active in the game through media, youth training and in development programmes around the world. 

Our developers will produce a unique, world class platform, that is easy to use yet retains a sophisticated and powerful engine to help people get the best out of Scorcher. Using responsive HTML5, Scorecher is easily and effectively accessible using mobile technology. Ideal for using out on the pitch!
We have partners on several continents, to help us share Scorecher with the global football community. To get this content made, our platform finished and launch Scorecher to billions of football fans around the world, we need your help. To thank you for your support we have provided a wide range of rewards to suit different budgets and supporters of different clubs.


FOOTBALL FANS, PRO PLAYERS AND EXPERTS IN ED-TECH AND DISTANCE LEARNING


Our team includes:

LearnerVerse, acknowledged by the world’s leading EdTech event BETT for two years running as one of the most innovation education solutions in the world. Featured in the Times SME supplement.
Premier League legends, such as: Emile Heskey, Lee Sharpe, David May, Neville Southall, Peter Reid, John Hartson, Matt Elliott and ladies football star, Natasha Harding.
FIFA-Qualified football coaches and health and fitness coaches.
Professional Football Club Development Teams and Scholarship Programmes.
Most importantly, you, the Fans! 






FUNDING BENCHMARKS - WHAT WE'LL DO WITH YOUR SUPPORT AND MONEY
* Scorecher and Performance Room, with interactive and shareable 'soccerfolio' - £241,000
* Scorecher and Gamefied Performance Room with leagues and interactive features, with interactive and shareable 'soccerfolio' - £283,000


* Scorecher and Gamefied Performance Room with leagues and interactive features, with interactive and shareable 'soccerfolio audition Room' - £450,000 
* Scorecher and Gamefied Performance room with leagues and interactive features, with interactive and shareable 'soccerfolio', 'audition Room', plus development of virtual football academy - £850,000
Some Interesting Facts and Figures

A global community, united by the Beautiful Game

270 million people are actively involved in playing in organised football around the world, according to FIFA’s Big Count, including:

China: 26 million+
US: 24 million+
India: 20 million+
Brazil: 14 million+
Indonesia: 7 million+
Nigeria: 6 million+
There are 29+ million women that play organised football, globally.

Risks & Challenges

The Scorecher crowdfunder is based on flexible funding, so the project will retain whatever level of funding it raises. The money raised goes towards creating  content and developing Scorecher and the Performance Room feature.
The next phases of development include the interactive and shareable 'Soccerfolio', competitive leagues, and - should the campaign exceed its target - a live Audition Room for club scouts, and a virtual football academy.

Other Ways You Can Help
There are a number of ways that you can help join Team Scorecher and our vision, to bring professional Premier League quality coaching to every corner of the planet and make it accessible to everyone. 
* Buy one of our amazing perks! Scroll down the side of our campaign page and you will find a perk to suit all pockets. We have everything from the sublime to the amazing!
*You'll find us on Twitter, Facebook, YouTube and Instagram. We'd love to hear from you; show us your skills and how you play the Beautiful game.
*Tell your family, friends and colleagues about us. Invite them to take a look at the Scorecher INDIEGOGO page. 
*Send videos of you performing football tricks to win free prizes, awarded at the end of the campaign.
*Say hello to the Legends for retweets and more using @TeamScorecher.
* We're also launching some additional (and very exciting) rewards during the campaign (designed by our legends for the global football community) so bookmark this page or follow us on our social channels to stay up to date. We can't say too much about these rewards yet but trust us...they are worth waiting for!
A big thank you to all of you in advance. Let's work together to disrupt grassroots football  offer affordable access to world class coaching, health and fitness media and to make Scorecher the greatest football resource ever made!

story:
There's too much hate in the air...

 

Here...there...everywhere...

 

Skin color, religion, tribe, political affiliation, sexual preference and any other “label” – when used as an excuse to either exact or explain evil is a false construct.

 

Hate-ism is the root problem!

 

“When hate enters the heart of humans there is no wall high enough that will keep evil from destroying a nation…for when hate enters the hearts of her people, evil is already on the inside.” (Coren Jonathan Allen)

 

What if it just started raining?

 

It's a simple question really...and once asked is difficult to dismiss...no matter what you throw at it.

When the soil of the earth is dry...

...survival very quickly becomes impossible. 

No water for plants, animals or humans spells imminent disaster.

When it rains (and rain falls for everyone), life is better. 

 

When the soul of humanity is dry...

...just read the daily headlines—Hate-ism is rampant everywhere. 

Evil acts justified by hatred and prejudice spell imminent disaster.

When it rains - when we are good to each other (and goodness is for everyone), life is better. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

WHAT WE NEED: Funding required to launch an initial "pilot" partnership for 7,000 students.

  • The Kambimbi Academy has formal approval from the Ministry of General Education, Republic of Zambia to reach 3.7 million students and teachers.
  • Partnering each classroom in Zambia with a classroom in the United States.
  • 1 book + 5 lessons & a football jersey = global change

Printing and producing books and jerseys at volume overseas.

  • At a volume of 7,000 units: $100 funds approximately 7 students in Lusaka, Zambia
    • $15/student is the “fully burdened” price tag that covers all costs associated to train + equip + sustain the program
    • This includes cost of production and shipping of units from multiple international locations into a land locked country, contracted personnel, local distribution etc...
  • Any/all funds raised below this campaign goal will purchase books & jerseys at a lower volume and higher price...but will still apply towards launching The Kambimbi Academy in The Republic of Zambia

WHAT YOU GET:

Book + jersey delivered in commemorative Kambimbi box with the original cover print on the box!

Kambimbi "kit" for The Republic of Zambia

Kambimbi "kit" for The U.S.A.

Certificate included in every Kambimbi gift box

Bottom of each gift box - original cover artwork for What if it Just Started Raining?

The Impact

Peace and stability.

Generational change and a global shift in social norms.

Risks & Challenges

Peace and stability threaten governments, industry and powerful individuals who profit in terms of power and money from Hate-ism, when the world remains divided and in shambles.

Other Ways You Can Help

Pay it forward.  Spread the good word and be a Kambimbi--a symbol of hope.  Make it rain right where you are!

story:
Not all young adults understand the value of money, where it comes from, and where it goes. Many spend money frivolously and without proper purpose. This is concerning for me.

I am worried about the next generation.

Without the knowledge of necessary money skills, the next generation will grow up lacking the proper spending and saving habits that they will need to maintain a comfortable lifestyle.

I have been a teacher for 12 years, teaching over 2000 students. In that time, I taught business studies. When it was time to cover finance, my students would become less engaged and often admit that they did not like finance because they thought it was difficult and intimidating.

We had many discussions that showed how people used money every day and it was almost a natural thing for them to do. They receive money, they spend money and therefore understood the basics of money. However very few had the skills to understand that their choices could impact their financial well-being, until quite often it was too late (i.e. debt).

Upon looking further into this problem, I saw a major connection between actions and consequences. In the age of going to college, running a household or even starting a business, basic financial skills are essential.

That is why I am devoted to developing the CashCrunch Senior Board Game; to help teach young adults to understand the importance of money, the value of money, how to save money, and how to manage their money. The board game complies with the current Personal Finance Standards and enables the learning of money skills in a fun and non intimidating way. I see CashCrunch Senior as an engaging and unique resource to educate the next generation.

story:
Thank you so much to everyone who supported the campaign! Even though the campaign has ended, you can still make a contribution HERE. Follow our activities on twitter @GENEius_Science and sign up for our newsletter to keep in touch!

 

Who are we? 

GENEius Science is a non-profit in the greater Toronto area (GTA) that engages youth in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) education through the lens of biotechnology. 

We help youth build essential skills in STEM by making sophisticated, cutting-edge laboratory tools and techniques and hands-on lab experiences in biotechnology accessible. We could not do this without the support of our awesome science education program partners, miniPCR, G-Biosceinces and Carolina Biological, and our program sponsors, BIOTECanada, Boehringer-Ingelheim Canada Ltd, Bio basic Inc., Sheddon Sports and Physiotherapy Clinic, SCWIST, and many individuals.

Meet the GENEius Science Team

Why biotech? 

Biotechnology offers innovative solutions to many modern challenges. From agriculture and environmental sustainability, to medical therapies and forensics, to biodiversity conservation and energy production, the interdisciplinary nature of biotechnology makes it an excellent portal for engaging youth in STEM. 

Canada has a long and proud history of innovation in biotechnology and this leadership has poised Canada to become a top global bioeconomy. Growing Canada's strong scientific community starts with providing our youth, especially those populations underrepresented in STEM, with educational opportunities aimed at building skills, confidence and sustained career aspirations in STEM. With this in mind, we created GENEius Girls to help inspire and support girls in STEM.

What is the GENEius Girls Program?

The GENEius Girls program aims to help girls feel confident in and ignite curiosity and passion for STEM through learning university-level lab skills with modern molecular technology. While practicing pipetting skills, running PCR (polymerase chain reaction) experiments and separating DNA with electrophoresis, girls learn about awesome women in STEM fields and get inspired to pursue careers in Canadian STEM sectors. 

What have we done so far?

On June 7, 2016, we launched the GENEius Girls program in Toronto through the support of generous community and corporate donors. Outfitted with pipettes, a PCR machine, and gel electrophoresis systems, the girls learned how to process and analyze DNA samples using lab investigations developed by our awesome program partners. If you know anything about science, you know that experiments sometimes have periods of down-time, like when making millions of copies of DNA molecules through PCR, or separating DNA fragments on a gel with electricity. This was a perfect time to engage the girls in candid conversations that explored gender bias and stereotypes in STEM, as well as the amazing contributions to STEM fields that women make. We also had time to make some #bioArt too!

"[The program] educated me about the importance of making women aware of STEM. Also I learned about the different fields you can go into using STEM." ~ 16 year old participant

Over the next six months we engaged over 5 dozen girls in over 23 hours of lab activities. The feedback we have received so far has been amazing!

  • Almost all (93 per cent) of the girls that participated reported an increase in confidence in doing STEM after participating in the program.
  • 89 per cent of girls expressed interest in pursuing a career choice in STEM prior to participating, and 72 per cent became more interested in pursuing a STEM career than they initially reported, after partaking in the program. The other 28 per cent remained equally as interested in STEM (note: all participants that initially reported no interest in pursuing STEM career reported an increase interest in pursuing a STEM career after participating in the program).
  • 99 per cent of girls said they value learning STEM in an all-girls environment.
  • 70 per cent of girls reported an extreme interest in having access to female STEM mentors.

"I enjoyed working on activities with other people and learning about the processes to finding/comparing DNA." ~ 14 year old participant

"I enjoyed the fact that we got somewhat of a heads up doing things we wouldn't normally do until university. We got to use professional tools and had an excellent learning experience that will surely open opportunities for the future."  ~ 14 year old participant

"I liked that there were girls my age... and I loved to learn and discover all this cool technology." ~ 13 year old participant 

"It inspired me to empower myself and believe I can have a career in STEM fields."  ~ 13 year old participant 

What's next?

We know that girls value learning STEM in an all-girls environment and want to learn more, so we're working hard to make that happen. With your support, we will be working to add workshop locations in time for the fall sessions. 

 

What will the funds be used for?

Some of the expenses to operate the program include:

 □ new biotechnology equipment

 □ further program development 

 □ lab consumables (lab supplies, reagents, etc.) 

 □ community space rentals 

 □ promotional materials

 

We currently charge a nominal fee to help cover some basic program costs. However, DNA science activities, although extremely cool and fun to learn, can be costly. So, we rely on the generosity of our supporters to keep the program running. With your help, we would like to offer the program for free (or continue to make the fee as low as possible) so that this experience is more accessible to all girls. If we exceed our funding goal, that will allow us to invest in more equipment and resources, putting us closer to offering an extended summer program that will allow more girls to explore biotechnology and related STEM subjects in greater depth. We will also be able to invest in program development activities that will help to make the second year of the program even more successful!

 

Our thanks...

... to you for supporting our campaign and spreading the word, and to the many amazing people and organizations who have helped us get this far:

Our program partners

miniPCR

G-Biosciences

Carolina Biological Supply Company

Our sponsors 

BIOTECanada

Boehringer-Ingelheim Canada Ltd.

Bio Basic Inc.

Sheddon Sports and Physiotherapy Clinic

Society for Canadian Women in Science and Technology (SCWIST)

And many generous individual donors!

 

Featured Perks!

Check out some of the great perks we're offering to our campaign supporters. Read about all the perks in the perks side bar.

Women in STEM T-shirt or hoodie* - we CAN achieve gender equity in STEM! 

*T-shirts/hoodies may not be exactly as shown. Hashtag is optional - please specify upon ordering.

 

Made with 100% DNA T-shirt*

Women in Science Card Game + Women in Space Expansion Pack - how many women in science do you know?

 

LifeScanner DNA Barcoding Kit - perfect for the curious citizen scientist!

 

How else can you help?

We would love your help with spreading the word about the GENEius Girls program. Most of our workshop participants hear about us through word of mouth. Please share the campaign link on your social media: https://igg.me/at/GENEiusGirls2017/x/13226765.&... Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, G+ or your favorite online networks increases our chances of reaching more girls and getting them on a STEM career trajectory. Follow us on Twitter @GENEius_Science and Facebook https://www.facebook.com/GENEiusScience/, visit our website www.GENEiusScience.ca, and sign up for our newsletter! 

Want to get in touch? We'd love to hear from you! info@GENEiusScience.ca

GENEius Science is a federally incorporated not-for-profit organization based in Oakville, Ontario, Canada, operating under the Canada Not-for-profit Corporations Act (NFP Act). To learn more about us, please visit our website.

story:
UPDATE (July 2016): The students are enjoying the new classrooms, bathroom, and water collection systems. We are still working with the community leaders and government officials to receive government funding. To help support the teachers in the meantime, please consider donating to the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project (and write "School" in the memo or comment) or donate to this new fundraiser from another chimpanzee researcher.

UPDATE (September 2015): The campaign has ended, and through Indiegogo and donations directly through the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project, we have raised $25,000. The new building is almost complete, but there is still more to be done. The school still needs two more classrooms to accommodate all the students in addition to benches and desks for all the classrooms. Please consider donating directly through the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project: 

http://ngogochimpanzeeproject.org/education/

(Your donation will support research, conservation, and education projects around Kibale National Park, but if you want all of your donation to go directly to the school, please write "school" under "+ Add special instructions to the seller" when confirming your donation online. You can also request a perk in the special instructions.)

THANK YOU!


Looking out from the top of Ngogo Hill, the view is a panorama of rainforest canopy, interrupted only by mist rising from valleys.

Kibale National Park in western Uganda is one of the last vestiges of tropical rainforest in all of East Africa, and a principal stronghold of chimpanzees. As researchers with the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project, it is also our home for the year. Our focus is on our closest living relatives, but we are also deeply committed to our own species. We work with Kyakagunga (“cha-kah-goonga”) Primary School, which is located in a rural village at the border of Kibale National Park. Our goal is to build a two-classroom building, which will enable them to acquire government funding, and thus hire qualified teachers and provide free education to students.

For twenty years, the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project has been studying the behavior of chimpanzees to discover what it means to be a chimp—and a human. It has also been working hard to protect chimpanzees and other wildlife. Despite being a national park, elephants, buffalo, antelope, and forest pigs are hunted for food and trophies. Chimpanzees, which are an endangered species, are also at risk, as they can be caught in wire snares set throughout the forest. The Ngogo Chimpanzee Project has anti-poaching teams that patrol the park to remove snares and protect wildlife. But conservation is not just about thwarting poachers.

To make a real change requires working with local communities to understand the importance of the rainforest. The solution is education.

Over the past five years, the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project has raised funds and worked with community members to strengthen the school. Through these incredible efforts, Kyakagunga now boasts four classrooms and teaches a conservation-based curriculum. But there is still more work to be done. Without state support to pay teacher salaries, many families cannot afford to pay tuition and the school cannot hire qualified teachers. Government funding will solve these issues, and Kyakagunga has never been closer to this goal!

The school needs only two more classrooms and an office to qualify for government funding. A UK-based NGO, One Brick at a Time, has estimated the cost of construction to be $30,000, and already nearly $10,000 has been raised. All that stands between Kyakagunga and its goal is $20,000. This is not a band-aid made of money—this is an investment in Uganda’s future, creating a sustainable source of education in an area that needs it desperately.

If we raise less than $20,000, we will build only one classroom or put the money towards other needs identified by the school committee, such as a rain collection tank for safe access to water, a separate latrine for girls and boys, or an agriculture plot to support a student lunch program. (And if we make more than our goal, extra funds will go to these projects.)

Any amount helps! By donating, you will be making a lasting impact on the lives of Kyakagunga’s children and, in the process, the Ngogo chimpanzees. We are operated entirely by volunteers and have no overhead costs. All proceeds from this fundraiser will go directly to the construction of classrooms at Kyakagunga (and production and shipping of the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project merchandise offered here).

Scroll down to see all the perks!

If you are unable to give money, you can still help by raising awareness! ‘Like’ our Facebook page, share this Indiegogo page through social media and email, and tell all your friends about this great opportunity to do good.

Thank you!
story_txt: UPDATE (July 2016): The students are enjoying the new classrooms, bathroom, and water collection systems. We are still working with the community leaders and government officials to receive government funding. To help support the teachers in the meantime, please consider donating to the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project (and write "School" in the memo or comment) or donate to this new fundraiser from another chimpanzee researcher.UPDATE (September 2015): The campaign has ended, and through Indiegogo and donations directly through the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project, we have raised $25,000. The new building is almost complete, but there is still more to be done. The school still needs two more classrooms to accommodate all the students in addition to benches and desks for all the classrooms. Please consider donating directly through the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project: http://ngogochimpanzeeproject.org/education/(Your donation will support research, conservation, and education projects around Kibale National Park, but if you want all of your donation to go directly to the school, please write "school" under "+ Add special instructions to the seller" when confirming your donation online. story:
Short Summary

We are back! Pi Kappa Phi has officially made its return to UNC Charlotte, and we're seeking support from alumni, family, and friends! We need funding to help us continue to operate and host events for the brotherhood. 

What We Need & What You Get

We figured $4,949 was an appropriate goal since we are the 49ers here at UNCC. All of the funds raised will go towards our operational budget so we can purchase items to make our events (such as Rush, retreats and intramural sports) successful! Bottom line, we need some money so we can do the things that will enable the brotherhood to succeed. Even if we don't reach the $4,949 goal, we will retain it for chapter funds.

When you make a contribution, there's a perk! Check out the different levels of contributions and you'll get a little something from us in return!

The Impact

The Delta Lambda chapter at UNCC has seen over 700 men come before us since the early 1970's. As "re-founding" fathers for Delta Lambda, we are committed to see the brotherhood prosper as it once did for the men that came before us, and for the future of Pi Kappa Phi at UNC Charlotte.

Risks & Challenges

The decisions we face today that are vital to the success of Delta Lambda for many years to come. As re-founding fathers, we are committed to leave a legacy where brothers who come after us have assets that will give them the flexibility to host successful events that will bolster their sense of brotherhood. If we unsuccessfully reach our funding goal, the Delta Lambda chapter will continue to live on. However, we wouldn't be leaving a very good legacy if we didn't exhaust every resource available to us.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign! Please let your extended family and your network know about our mission so we can reach our goal!

story:
Hi,

My name is Johnny Stewart and I have been blessed with a great career in the NDT aerospace industry for the last 20 years. I'm also a US Navy veteran (Seabees Equipment Operator ) from 87-92. I have volunteered with several veteran services and realized that most job training and current available jobs for the underserved, low income and veterans are low paying and likely well below the poverty line in Los Angeles. So I decided to walk away from my corporate job and start a Technical training center for for the underserved, low income and veterans to enter the aerospace industry so they can earn a relevant livable wage that will help them find the American Dream. I believe in the right to pursue happiness without having to take on tons of educational debt. Please donate today to help those who need it most. Godspeed!

www.americanaerospace.org

501(c)(3) corporation. Please speak to your tax person for information on how to deduct from your liability. Federal Status in process

C#209-482-0801

story:
“Inside The Entrepreneurial Mind”  is an audio series of interviews that goes beyond  the paperwork, and asks  entrepreneurs to share the personal side of their experiences of risk, doubt, hope, thrill and struggle. The series is produced by The Entrepreneurs Workshop, a verified 501c3 nonprofit company that works to provide educational resources for rising entrepreneurs.

 We've just finished Season One, launching twenty-one revealing interviews. In just 10 months, we're had more than 8,000 downloads, and we're climbing the charts on iTunes, our website and social media. 

We need your help to promote Season One, and create Season Two!

Hosts Seth Werner and Marcy Rosenbaum, both battle tested entrepreneurs, invite guests to dig deep beneath the surface of success and identify what it took for them to get there: what kept them awake at night; what served as a source of inspiration; and what they've learned along the way. Each 20-minute digital interview invites you to imagine yourself grappling with similar issues. Some of our entrepreneurs are idealistic twentysomethings;  others are innovative sixtysomethings. Our guests include men and women launching businesses in food service, software, professional services, biotechnology and education.  Right now, someone is doing what you dream of doing. What are they learning that you need to know? 

Our dream is to capture the "how of success " of  the entrepreneurial experience. We're developing great content you can listen to any time/ anywhere on any digital platform.  Your contribution will help us produce and distribute Season Two, and reach the hungry minds of people who want to build their own future. 

LONG TERM GOALS: Produce, Market and Distribute EntrepreneurRadio.org

1. Help us create an library of our best Entrepreneur Radio programs and host them on PRX, an online database that allows stations to upload content for local public radio stations to air. To ensure that our content is seen as the highest possible quality and improve our chances of being aired on top public radio such as WNYC, WHYY and WLRN,  we are raising money  money to “remix” our Season One interviews into shorter, snappier 10 minute segments that can be acquired by local stations for broadcast.

 2. We want to reach out to build listenership and grow our community. Our target markets are colleges and universities with programs in entrepreneurship; co-working spaces; conferences featuring start-ups and investors; and business owners who are constantly learning and looking for next big ideas.  We need funding to design and deliver pitch materials to these markets and get them to hear our programs. We've learned that once people discover us, they become friends, fans, listeners and, sometimes, guests.

story:
Our Passion:

Education is a basic human right. We are a group of public high school students from New York City who are concerned about the world's high rates of illiteracy and poverty. We have invested ourselves in building a school in Nicaragua this upcoming summer for a community that currently does not have one. 

As a group we have raised $14,000. We still need $12,725 to make this project a reality. 

Your donation will enable us to travel, to build relationships with community members, and to change the lives of many generations to come (not to mention ours). 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seven students, grades 9-11. 
  • $14,000 is going to the school's construction costs.

To break it down:

  • School construction costs: $2,000 x 7 students: $14,000
  • Plane ticket: $800 x 7: $5,600
  • In country fees: $875 x 7: $6,125
  • Total: $25,725
  • If you donate to this project, you will be providing the opportunity of a lifetime for us, American high school students to travel abroad and actually build a school! You will also enable us to fulfill our dream of helping eradicate the cycle of illiteracy and poverty. We are passionate about this goal!!!
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, funds will go to comparable projects that high school students are working on across the country.

The Impact

What your contribution will do:

  • Our project has immense value because it will help a rural community in Nicaragua. It will help current and future generations become educated, self-sufficient, and successful contributors to their society. It will enable Nicaraguans to uplift other Nicaraguans. 
  • Already, our project has helped us learn about the very serious issues of poverty and illiteracy, and how these issues negatively impact communities worldwide. 
  • Because of this project, we have become motivated, global advocates for education for all. 
  • We have raised $14,000. This has far exceeded our expectations. We are determined to raise the remaining amount and see our project realized. 

Risks & Challenges

  • When we started out, our teacher gave us a $300 deadline. None of us thought we could do it. We all were motivated to raise these funds in a short duration, and we all reached our goal by the deadline given. WE KNOW WE CAN DO THIS, with your help of course! 
  • We have faced multiple situations when we did not think we could make it. We have gotten to $14,000 by putting our heads together, taking on and delegating responsibility, and communicating with one another. So far, this strategy has proven to be a success!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Share out fundraising page, our video, our cause on social media and to your networks. Don't be shy!!!
  • You can share THIS Indiegogo campaign with just one click!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About What We are Doing

Our World Focus, a organization founded by Sandpoint, Idaho photographer, Marsha Lutz uses photography and cultural exchange to promote geographic awareness, and global connections. The program teaches basic photography skills, enabling students to document their surroundings while gaining valuable experience and increasing self confidence.

Our World Focus uses technology and photography to get kids excited to learn, and while they discover different cultures they gain an appreciation and respect for others.Through photographic images and personal interaction via the internet between participating classrooms in the US and abroad, students of Our World Focus explore and celebrate their cultural differences, as well as similarities. Beyond that of looking a a map, students involved in the project will identify with people who live in other places in the world. This awareness dispels fear, and fosters acceptance, which in turn leads to tolerance and more understanding.

Three classes from the Lake Pend ‘Orielle School District, in Sandpoint, Idaho, are collaborating with the Our World Focus program in the spring of 2015, and will be partnered with classes in Istanbul, Turkey.

While Marsha will be working within the sister classrooms in person, she will be coaching the LPOSD teachers and students through the duration of the project, remotely.

On the Our World Focus website the students will meet and interact with their sister classrooms using photography based projects, and engage in meaningful         discussions, while they create lasting friendships. At the conclusion of this project, each student will be asked to pick their favorite images to be publicly displayed at a community art opening. 

Why We Are Crowdfunding 

Tell me and I forget, Teach me and I remember, Involve me and I will learn. 
~ Benjamin Franklin, 1750 

While the Our World Focus program has already had success on previous years projects,the organization has lacked the funding necessary to expand and serve more students and communities. This year, we are excited to have received some funding, but for this specific project more will be needed to make it a reality. The students at Sandpoint High School, and Lake Pend ‘Orielle Alternative High School are excited and enthusiastic to have this opportunity and learning experience, and we need your help in funding it!  

What We Need & What You Get 

Our World Focus is a young organization, and is therefore building it's framework. In the past we were able to use donated cameras and find computer labs to make our projects work, but the reality is, we need reliable equipment to make the programs results consistent. Once we have the necessary equipment, it will be available for future class projects, and be used by deserving students. There is also other expenses that are not easily funded through the grant writing that we are currently doing, and most of the awards we have applied for will not be distributed until next school year.

You can get some great perks for donating to our cause, plus you'll get the satisfaction of knowing that your helping to inspire our students to become responsible and compassionate global citizens!

Our Goal

  • Equipment - 8 tablets with 5 mp or better cameras - $1600

  • Material costs for student art exhibit and venue - $675

  • Transportation for student photography field trips - $200

  • Total funding goal - $2475

If we exceed our goal, we will put this money toward the next upcoming project in the fall of 2015. We have many big ideas for this program, and more funding will allow us to pursue the next steps of the process without spending more of our time and focus to fund-raise and write grant proposals.

If we don't meet our goal we will continue our fundraising efforts through other means, and If necessary, we can forego some of our equipment purchases or buy lower-end models. We are dedicated to making this project happen, and will do so if even remotely possible. Even after the indiegogo campaign ends, we will happily accept donations through our fiscal sponsor, Fractured Atlas.

To learn more about the work of Our World Focus, please visit our website at

Our World Focus

Other Ways You Can Help

We can use all the help we can get! Here are ways in which you can help us reach our goal:      
                                                                                                                                              
  • Sponsoring education is investing in our world on a local and global level, but we realize it's not possible for everyone to financially support the project. If you would like to support us, please spread the word to your friends and family, and share this on social media.
  •  Indiegogo has easy to use share tools, so be sure to check them out!
  • We are in need of in good working condition digital cameras for our upcoming project, if you have one that you'd like to donate to the cause, please contact us!
Thank you, for all your support!

If we exceed our goal, we will put this money toward the next upcoming project in the fall of 2015. We have many big ideas for this program, and more funding will allow us to pursue the next steps of the process without spending more of our time and focus to fund-raise and write grant proposals.
If we don't meet our goal we will continue our fundraising efforts through other means, and If necessary, we can forego some of our equipment purchases or buy lower-end models. We are dedicated to making this project happen, and will do so if even remotely possible. Even after the indiegogo campaign ends, we will happily accept donations through our fiscal sponsor, Fractured Atlas.
To learn more about the work of Our World Focus, please visit our website at
Our World Focus

    Other Ways You Can Help
We can use all the help we can get! Here are ways in which you can help us reach our goal:      
                                                                                                                                               Sponsoring education is investing in our world on a local and global level, but we realize it's not possible for everyone to financially support the project. If you would like to support us, please spread the word to your friends and family, and share this on social media.




 Indiegogo has easy to use share tools, so be sure to check them out!

We are in need of in good working condition digital cameras for our upcoming project, if you have one that you'd like to donate to the cause, please contact us!

Thank you, for all your support!

story:
Across the technology sector, there is a major disparity between men and women. While 57% of occupations in the workforce are held by women, in computing occupations that figure is only 25%. This disparity is present at the college level as well. In 2010, although 57% of undergraduate degree recipients were female, but only 14% of them received computer science degrees at major research universities. Incredibly, this number has actually fallen in the recent years.

This disparity hurts the technology companies themselves. Research shows that women's choices impact up to 85% of purchasing decisions. By some analyses, they account for $4.3 trillion of the total U.S. consumer spending of $5.9 trillion, making women the largest single economic force not just in United States, but in the World.

The tech industry pays an annual wage of $93,800 which is 98% more than the average private sector wage. There are expected to be 1.4 million job openings for computer specialists by 2020. One would hope that women would be eligible for more than 25% of these future high-paying job openings.

Let's start by looking at some numbers

Clearly we have a numbers problem, that as Kristine Snow President of Cisco Systems Capital describes as, "a situation that does not optimize a diversity of ideas, innovation and ultimately a business's bottom line." Currently, women make up to only 10% of the engineering discipline when it comes to the top 500 companies. 
90% of schools still don't teach computer science
With the current technology trend, 9 out of 10 schools still don't offer Computer Science courses. Even when they do, they are not anywhere close to preparing students for the real industry challenges. With the competition today, it gets harder and harder to crack the technical interview and stand out among all the other qualified candidates.
What do we do
Kal Academy is here to offer unique, fun, innovative and specialized technical training for women and upon successful completion of the training, they will be placed in a job!! The students need to pass an evaluation/assessment test before being admitted to the training. This assessment will also help tailor the training packages to best prepare the students for the job. 
What we need
Our goal is to:
  • Train 10 teachers with professional background in the field
  • Get 100 women to participate in the program and be placed in the job upon successful completion
  • Customize the training curriculum to fit individual needs
We need at least 50,000$ for this. 
Why do we need this money?
With our 10 years of training, we've built some amazing courses that has a proven history of getting students into jobs in the past. Now we need your help to bring these courses to more students, keep it up to date with the ever changing technology, and add more courses to the curriculum.
As non-profit organization, we are incredibly cost-effective. We have <5% administrative costs. Money that is being requested is purely to train more teachers and enhance the curriculum to place more and more qualified women in jobs.
So, every dollar you donate will be used only to expand our programs and reach to more women in technology that are dying to get into this field.
We also need your help in spreading the word! Currently our mission is being accomplished by folks like you that are interested in bringing more women to technology by spreading the word.
Success stories

Since June of 2014, we have successfully trained and placed 21 women in technology companies. 

To name a few

Microsoft (FTE and vendors) as developers/testers/program manager

QBE as data analyst

Bill and Melinda foundation as developer

Vertafore as developer

Boeing as developer

AT&T (vendor) as developer

EMC2 as program manager

We aspire to do at least 100 women by the end of the year and hence your funds will help us drive to that mission.
Ways you can help
  • Your donation will take us places in achieving our mission. Every dollar counts
  • If you know of a woman interested in technology but waiting for that moment to make the break through in the field, please refer them to us.
  • Stay connected via Facebook, Twitter, or our site
The work we do touches many lives in a meaningful way - whether it be a single mom trying to provide for her family or a technology enthusiast trying to make a difference in this field. We thank you for every dollar you donate and so do the women whose dream is made possible with the donation.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are you a non-profit?  Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?Yes, Kal Academy NP is registered as a public 501(c)(3) nonprofit. Contributions to Kal Academy NP are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. Kal Academy’s tax ID number is 47-2627285.

How can I get a tax deductible receipt?When you contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution.  This email receipt can be used for tax deductible purposes. For all contributions over $250, you will receive an official receipt for tax-reporting purposes by email after the the campaign ends.

story:
Marquette Athletics, in partnership with the Diederich College of Communication's ADPR4953 class, announces a Blue & Gold Scholarship Fund initiative aimed at providing international travel opportunities to Marquette's athletic programs.

The demanding schedules and hard work it takes to compete at a high level prevents student-athletes from being able to participate in additional learning experiences like study abroad programs. Last summer, the women's basketball team took the trip of a lifetime. On a 10-day trip through Europe they played games, experienced foreign cultures and toured historical sites. On the trip they learned valuable skills that will stay with them long after they step off the basketball court. 



HOW CAN YOU HELP?

In order to make these opportunities possible for our other student-athletes, we have created the Marquette Athletics International Travel Fund. The goal is to jump-start the fund with a $2,500 base. This is where we need your help! Any contributions you give will go directly to helping teams take a foreign trip of their own. If you make a donation, there are six categories or levels that you can choose from with varying perks for making a contribution. Perks include everything from a social media shoutout on the Blue & Gold Fund Twitter or the Marquette Athletics Facebook page to lunch with vice president and director of athletics Bill Scholl. Any and all support is appreciated!

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

By giving to the campaign, you will be directly contributing to the lives and experiences of our student-athletes. The chance for our athletes to not only play the sport they love, but experience different cultures and beauty of the natural world is something they will take with them long after the games are over! 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

This campaign will be promoted almost solely through social media. We are excited about the opportunity, but sometimes this means we are working with a limited audience. If contributing to the campaign isn't something you can do, we still need your help! Throughout the campaign we will be posting on the Marquette Blue & Gold Fund's Twitter page. The best way you can help is to follow @MUBlueGoldFund and help spread the word! Any retweets or favorites will help get the word out and give us a better chance to reach our goal! 



We believe in the support from the Marquette community and are excited for you to come along with us. Without you though, this campaign won't get anywhere. We hope you choose to take that step of faith and support our campaign. 

Thank you in advance for any and all contributions. Everything from a retweet to a donation will help make this goal possible!

story:
Project Summary

Aloha.  My name is Nadia Stanis and I am a graduate student in Botany at the University of Hawaii at Manoa, studying native plant restoration and initiating a youth outreach program. 

Together with a small group of local high school youth field assistants, we are setting up monitoring plots of native plant restoration, and measuring plant growth and environmental factors at Limahuli Preserve on Kauai.

Along with the on the ground research, I am giving presentations and classroom activities to 4 local Kauai high school science classes this spring. Review my detailed master's project description here.  The youth and I need your help in the process of launching this vital work.  

What We Need & What You Get

I am raising $1000 to cover project funding from travel and outreach expenses.  I need funds for inter-island travel, as well as van transportation for the youth.  The high school has no funds for field trips, so I'm also raising funds for a school bus trip to the preserve.
In exchange for donations, you will receive updates and results of the inspiring work at the preserve, including a picture journal of the youth in the field.  

The Impact

Biodiversity in Hawaii is being lost at an alarming rate.  So much so that Hawaii has been named the endangered species capital of the world.

Green careers in the environmental sciences and STEM fields are more needed than ever before.  Globally, we are facing a crisis of biodiversity loss, and this is especially felt here in Hawaii.  And yet, numbers of undergraduates, and especially minority students entering STEM fields is lagging with only 28% of post-high school graduates entering these fields.

Challenges

I have been working steadily on developing and initiating the youth outreach program, and the restoration research, and putting in my own financial resources.  As the end of my masters studies approaches, these resources are stretched thin.  The youth have already had two visits to the preserve, but we need help to keep the project going.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you don't have the financial ability to donate monetarily.  We would still love your help: share this page with friends and co-workers who care about the future of our environment and our youth.  Get involved by spreading the work and showing your support.  Mahalo nui loa.

story:
Short Summary

I'm sure you are aware of the important role that Citizens Against Unfair Financial Practices plays in helping people whose lives are impacted by financial hardship. This important work is supported largely by the support of generous donors who contribute to our annual capital campaign. This year's goal is $10,000.00, which will allow Citizens Against Unfair Financial Practices to continue providing much needed services to those in our community who are in need of assistance. Without the continued support of generous donors like you, these needs will likely go unmet.

98.5 New Mix FM will be Memphis, TN. First noncommercial Bi-lingual radio station that will discuss the basics of finance. We will broadcast English and Spanish music by local, independent, and legendary artists. We'll spread the good word about what local entrepreneurs, non-profits, and social groups are doing to enhance our community. We will showcase powerful content like Whats Up Memphis! We will unite Memphis's diverse community of voices with original and creative programming. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to continue making a difference in the lives of individuals affected by the work of Citizens Against Unfair Financial Practices, it is vital for this year's capital campaign to be a success. Can we count on you to make a donation to this important cause? By making a tax deductible donation to our capital campaign, you'll be directly contributing to promote awareness to people struggling with financial hardship. Additionally, you'll be recognized for your generosity as a capital campaign supporter on the Citizens Against Unfair Financial Practices website and in the upcoming newsletter.

The Impact 

Our broadcast will cover the experiences of our local community. We strongly believe that our community can make wise decisions when informed and by streaming this effort, we can broaden our reach for others to see.

Risks & Challenges

It’s the nature of the beast. Uncensored, 100 percent democratic media is a social service. It can only exist through listener support or grant funding, or it’s content will be compromised by the special interests of advertisers and big business. We ask for your assistance in supporting a cause that reflects our local community without commercial influences.


Other Ways You Can Help

Remember any amount will help even if its $1.00
What if you can’t donate at this time? 

You can still help us. We want you as our friend. Please spread the word. Like our Facebook page. Share this Indiegogo campaign. If you believe in living local, honest talk, and good music by musicians who live in Memphis, please join us and become part of our radio community. caufp.org

story:
Human Trafficking Survivor

C.A.R.E. is a ministry of therapists and survivors committed to helping victims of human trafficking and other forms of abuse to heal, thrive and give back to the others.

Last summer, we had the joy of meeting a young survivor from Asia, who has no family or support. Like many survivors of human trafficking, her earliest memories are:

  • surviving hell on earth
  • being handed over for brutal sexual fantasies

She did her best, worked hard, kept up a good appearance at school, hiding year after year the nightmare life at home and the truth about the “vacations” and “camps” her family sent her on. She made it to college in her country and tried hard to help others in need, mentoring foster-care children and at-risk youth.

After spending a summer with our survivor community working on her own healing and learning how survivors can help other survivors to heal and thrive, she took the first step to dedicating her life to helping survivors skillfully by applying to do a Masters in Social Work (MSW) program at University of Michigan.


Our Urgent Need & Huge Challenge

We were all thrilled when she received her acceptance letter in late February 2015, until we read this requirement for applicants without US citizenship:

The University is required by U.S. government regulations to obtain documentation proving that international applicants have adequate financial resources to provide for their expenses for the duration of their program. You are required to submit certification of the availability of a minimum of $128,500 (U.S. dollars) to cover your expenses for the two-year MSW program.
The deadline for the affidavit is mid-April 2015.

The Impact

It has always been her dream to help other survivors. Please help us help Kai.
  • We are doing all we can to help her to raise the money to get trained and equipped to help other survivors.
  • Please stand with us and support this survivor.
  • Helping Kai will equip her to help countless other survivors.
  • No gift is too small!

Risks

  • For her safety we have blurred her image.
  • If we are unable to raise the needed funds for this year's class, we will continue to ask for financial help until the funding arrives.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Pray for continued safety for Kai.
  • Please let your friends know about this campaign.
  • Share it on Facebook and Twitter!

May the Lord bless you for your faithfulness.

All gifts received go 100% to support the needs of survivors. If for any reason Kai is unable to use some or all of the funds received, the funds will be distributed to meet the needs of other survivors of human trafficking.

The collages shown in the video were made by Kai on www.polyvore.com,
using images clipped from various places on the Internet. 

C.A.R.E. is an acronym for Consulting Advocacy Resources Education.
We are a 501(c)3 and all donations are tax deductible.
Our website is www.care1.org.

story:
Who are we? 

Hi, I am Lance "vom FASS" Chua Xianpeng, I am the guy responsible for the marketing for AYGL. Our team of 8 are currently working part-time on this project. Most of us with full-time jobs and for myself full-time school, all of us passionate about Dota2. We started this project as a bid to revive the SEA scene in terms of competitive gameplay and creating a community. Our hopes for it is to be able to showcase the talent in SEA, which we believe are able to compete with the best in the world. We are currently doing this for free and as a non-profit initiative, however if possible we would like to turn it into our livelihood and make our job all about the game we love.. 

What is AYGL?

AYGL is a SEA (South-East Asia) exclusive invite-only free-to-play in-house league for Dota2. The league aims to cultivate a community, where individuals without a formal team are able to experience high-level competitive gameplay. It is ideal for players who want to showcase themselves, meet like-minded individuals and bring their game to the next level.

The prospect of a strong professional eSports scene in SEA is present, but there is a lack of a platform to nurture this talent. By creating an in-house environment, AYGL hopes to breathe life into the SEA dota community. AYGL will be the platform where players with dreams of entering the professional scene can take their first step. We plan to be the hub where exceptional players and casters get noticed, and where sponsors scout potential stars and teams.


How the league works (What makes AYGL different?)

AYGL will be held over the course of 2 months, in two phases.

Phase 1, players freely engage in league skirmishes. These matches will rank each player according to their performance. AYGL employs a custom algorithm to determine each player’s skill level.

For Phase 1, teams will be formed by selecting 2 closely matched players to be captains, allowing them to draft a team from the readily available player pool.

This system of player drafting, promotes players to practice and assign themselves into specific roles. For example, a player wanting to improve his support play will list himself as a support player. Bridging the current problem in the valve system where players are randomly pooled and teamed together.

The ranking top players of this league, will move on to Phase 2 as captains. 

Phase 2, The captains will be gathered and through their experience in Phase 1, they will draft (from the available player pool) and form their very own teams. These teams will battle through a traditional elimination-style competition, promoting strong teamwork and synergy among teammates. Expect fierce battles and clutch plays from the best the league has to offer.

Teams will be competing for a prize pool of SGD$500 + community contribution from fund raising + sponsorship deals with our casting department.


Improving the Caster base

AYGL will also have another function, not just for players but to also cultivate a pool of casters. Budding casters will be able to hop into lobbies and start casting! Join our campaign and be part of our casting department! Drop us an email at aygldota@gmail.com 

This pool of casters and the broadcasting channel will be where AYGL will also seek to grow its prize pool. From the broadcasts of highly skilled games, AYGL plans to garner sponsorship to increase the prize pool and thus encouraging more players into the league. In the long run, this increases the legitimacy of eSports in SEA with higher prize pools and enables the SEA scene to showcase its vast pool of talented players.


What AYGL looks like currently


Login page

Homescreen


Why we need help? 


Cover the basic operation costs

The team is a small group of Dota2 enthusiasts who want to promote and grow the game we love. In order to successfully run AYGL, the team requires funding to pay for the operational costs, tools and expenses, such as capital to fund the website and its designers. All remaining proceeds will go into kick-starting the in-house league. 

Funds to accelerate development of the league

With more funding, we plan to increase the size of our team, boosting our ability to develop more features for AYGL. Our current team size is small, and the amount of time and resources we can cater to the league is limited due to us having full-time work commitments. 

These are the new functions planned for AYGL!

  1. Ongoing match details and live AYGL streams
  2. Supporting a friends system
  3. Private and group chats
  4. Advanced administration functionality to police and govern the in-house league.
  5. Auto-score updating system
  6. In-depth statistical data (derive a player's in-form heroes from past matches)
  7. ... and much more!

These things can happen sooner than later with your support!

Boost the prize pool

With the community’s help, we will be able to boost the prize pool in order to attract skilled talent to compete in the league, in order to afford a more rewarding user experience for AYGL players.


How can you help?

For those of you who are interested in the league and want to play without contributing, please do make yourselves available! Add yourself to our waiting list here!

Otherwise, support us by donating directly to the prize pool!

  1. $1 - Support AYGL and have your name on the wall of contributors

  2. $1 - 1 early access invite to AYGL

  3. $10 - 15 invites to AYGL

  4. $40 - T-Shirt + 15 invites

  5. $80 - Casting of the contributors’ game + T-Shirt + 15 invites

We will also be incorporating stretch goals for our Facebook and Twitter campaigns! SGD$100 from our own pockets for every stretch goal realised!
Facebook Page Stretch Goals
  1. 200 likes
  2. 500 likes
  3. 1000 likes
  4. 1500 likes
  5. 2000 likes
Twitter Stretch Goals
  1. 500 followers
  2. 1000 followers
  3. 2000 followers
  4. 3000 followers
  5. 5000 followers
Share this league as widely as possible on across all platforms! Pool your resources with your friends! All the support we get from this campaign will help not only us but also the eSports scene in South-East Asia! Where there is a ready and available platform from which talents are able to groom their own abilities in a healthy environment!

Most of us with full-time jobs and for myself full-time school, all of us passionate about Dota2. We started this project as a bid to revive the SEA scene in terms of competitive gameplay and creating a community. Our hopes for it is to be able to showcase the talent in SEA, which we believe are able to compete with the best in the world. We are currently doing this for free and as a non-profit initiative, however if possible we would like to turn it into our livelihood and make our job all about the game we love.. What is AYGL?AYGL is a SEA (South-East Asia) exclusive invite-only free-to-play in-house league for Dota2. The league aims to cultivate a community, where individuals without a formal team are able to experience high-level competitive gameplay. It is ideal for players who want to showcase themselves, meet like-minded individuals and bring their game to the next level.The prospect of a strong professional eSports scene in SEA is present, but there is a lack of a platform to nurture this talent. By creating an in-house environment, AYGL hopes to breathe life into the SEA dota community. This system of player drafting, promotes players to practice and assign themselves into specific roles. story:
Why NooshTube™ ?

noosh

noun \ ˈnüs\

: enjoyment of the soul [Persian]

: : a community where foodies from all backgrounds share their love of eating, culture, and tradition

Throughout the world, throughout the centuries, people connect through food.  A meal before a diplomatic summit breaks the ice.  A family convenes at the end of the day.  A special feast commemorates a holiday.  Friendships develop over food. Travelers experience another culture through the hospitality of a host.  Our enjoyment of food is universal.  Our connection to food is powerful…symbolic…essential…an expression of a culture…an expression of love.  In the NooshTube™  community, we believe that this connection is greater than differences, more powerful and longer-lasting than conflicts.  NooshTube is the starting place for Yummy Diplomacy™.

Features

We should look for someone to eat and drink with before looking for something to eat and drink... ~ Epicurus

Amateur and professional culinary and cultural enthusiasts will generate the majority of the site content by sharing their personal stories consisting of their cultural origin, travels, memories, recipes, and insights into cooking, and diverse cultural experiences with members of the Nooshtube community.

Photographs, videos and/or audio recordings,  travel descriptions, regional and historical information will complement the recipes and stories.

NooshTube will feature talented cultural food ambassadors, and renowned national and international chefs who will offer recipes of their own design while maintaining NooshTube’s cultural ethos along with tips and advice for the at-home chef.

Within the first year, NooshTube plans to launch eight website socials in select communities to raise visibility with target consumers to include: Washington, DC; Boston, MA; New York, NY; Philadelphia, PA; San Francisco, CA; Los Angeles, CA; San Diego, CA; Chicago, IL; Miami, FL

Why We Need Your Help And 

Why We Are A Viable Donor Opportunity?

Food is our common ground, a universal experience ~James Beard

We are asking for your support to build the first Beta version of the NooshTube interactive platform to  enable users to build a culinary community for cultural exchanges through sharing of heritage, traditions, recipes, and related stories.  Our goal on Indiegogo is to raise $30,000 that will allow us to build a customized beta version of the user-interface, a server infrastructure, and develop our branding design.  

The sales of ethnic ingredients continue to grow by double digits, in volume and value annually. These trends highlight the importance of population changes and increased multiculturalism. To make the picture better, the perceived healthfulness of the staple ingredients makes the conscious consumer a perfect target.

The  direct market includes almost four million individuals within the US spanning multi-generations and ethnic diasporas.  The initial projected annual gross revenue, including NooshTube's six initial income streams, is $ 20 million dollars.

In 2008, 22% of Americans consumed Mediterranean food and 15% Middle Eastern, while above 70% consumed Chinese, Mexican or Italian.  In 2013, Chinese and Italian restaurants went out of business at a higher rate than other ethnic food showing a potential over-saturated market space.  Therefore, the potential growth opportunities within the Greater Middle Eastern and Eastern Mediterranean food market space is immense.  

The Community Impact

Culture · Food · Community

The NooshTube mission is to provide a bottom-up social enterprise platform for cultural exchange through sharing of recipes, tradition, eateries, and food related stories.  By establishing a Global Foodiepeneur e-commerce platform, families across the world are provided with an additional revenue-generating opportunity by marketing their culinary expertise through sharing their family traditions.  NooshTube promotes cross-cultural exchanges through the beauty and shared commonality of food. The target audience is anyone with a passion for eating, cooking, and sharing stories on international cuisine.  

A universal appreciation for good food has inspired a new approach to diplomacy and NooshTube exemplifies this contemporary approach to cross-cultural relations. In the fall of 2012, the State Department launched the Diplomatic Culinary Partnership Initiative. At the official introduction of the “American Chef Corps,” Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton celebrated the role of food in diplomacy stating,

…the Office of Protocol has joined forces with bureaus across the State Department and the James Beard Foundation to create this initiative. By exploring the idea of “culinary engagement,” they’ve identified new opportunities to further intercultural dialogue and strengthen bilateral relationships, right at the dinner table

Risks & Challenges

Food is not rational. Food is culture, habit, craving and identity ~Jonathan Safran Foer

Like all social networking sites, the success of NooshTube will depend on funding and the desire from users to share their cultural culinary stories through the platform.

We plan to generate enthusiasm for the site with advertisements in targeted online and hardcopy food magazines, social media sites, blogs, etc. while building a network with farmers markets, grocery stores, restaurateurs, vendors and related stakeholders, and through an energizing presence at international food festivals and other outreach activities. Prior to product launch, NooshTube will open advertising space to its in-house e-commerce platform while continuing to build out its design and our unique revenue stream model.

Other Ways You Can Help

Through our cooking and our eating habits, we tell ourselves who we are ~ Jennifer Maan, PhD

 Connections made via food have the power to create an emotional and transcendent bond that can be felt even across language and cultural barriers.  

We sincerely appreciate your support. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us spread the word. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

15 March 2011 is a date that many people won’t forget. It marked the beginning of the conflict that is still ravaging Syria.  It’s been 3 years, 10 months and 1 day since more than 3.2 million refugees fled their homes into neighboring countries.

More than 1.5 million registered refugees are currently in Lebanon. Many of them live in tents in camps that hardly contain anything. Many of them are children. Many of them have lost their relatives, their homes, their belongings and their livelihoods. Many of them fled to Lebanon because they had no other place to go.

Last week’s storm covered with snow thousands of kilometers in Lebanon, leaving many people cold, traumatized, scared, and vulnerable.

Many of us no matter where we are know how it feels to have cold feet, don’t we? Many of us know how it feels not to sense our fingers, hands, and feet? So do you imagine how it would feel to be constantly cold, day and night, in front of this cold freezing weather?

We are a group of volunteers from different backgrounds who believe can make a difference. We would like to collect donations to buy blankets for the needy. We believe and we know that we can! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We would like to collect 5000$ to buy blankets for the needy. We will collect the money, buy blankets, and give them to NGOs in Beirut and Tripoli for distribution. 
  • If we reach our goal within 7 days (i.e. by the end of this campaign), we will buy blankets for the needy. If we don't reach our goal, we will buy blankets for the amount collected. In other words, no matter what, we are buying blankets for the needy. 
  • We found two types of blankets: Option 1: big size (210 x 160 cm) for 5.75$ each, and option 2: small size (125 x 160 cm) for 3.45$ each. 
  • If you donate 200$, you get an A4 wall calendar by Zeina Gabriel (who is  a passionate photographer).
  • If you donate 50$, you get an A3 photo by Zeina Gabriel with a quote on giving and receiving.
  • If you donate 25$, you get two postcards by Zeina Gabriel from Lebanon with quotes on giving and receiving. 

What We Already Did

On Thursday January 8, 2015, during the worst storm this year, we had the idea of collecting money to buy blankets. We posted a brief Facebook status asking for help. By the next day, on Friday January 9, 2015, we had collected enough to buy 150 blankets. We bought 150 blankets (112 small and 38 big) that same day and the next day on Saturday January 10, 2015, we gave them to the NGO "Lebanese for Refugees" who distributed them to the needy in the Bekaa and Tripoli. By Monday January 12, 2015, we had collected enough to buy 350 blankets. We bought these 350 blankets (175 big and 175 small) on Tuesday morning and we also gave them to the NGO "Lebanese for Refugees" who distributed them.  So far, we bought 500 blankets and helped 500 persons feel a bit warmer. We would like to extend our initiative to be able to collect additional money to buy more and more blankets. 
Do you imagine how many lives would be altered by your donation? Do you imagine how much hope, love and compassion, your small action will be making? 

Other Ways You Can Help

We believe that every person is unique and that every person can contribute in his/her own special way. If you can't contribute to this campaign by donating money, any small gesture will help: a like, share or comment, are highly valuable and appreciated. Please help us spread the word and the warmth. Thank you very much in advance.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Cody Pagach and I am a 4th grade student at Pearre Creek Elementary School in Franklin, TN. Every year we help our schools raise money for important things like art supplies, music equipment, gym equipment, etc. These are things that are not included in the very small amounts that these programs get from the county budget.

I am asking you to support me...Cody Pagach...in raising money for my school, Pearre Creek Elementary School in Franklin, TN. It is important to me because I love school and want to see these departments have everything they need to make school better for all of the students.

My Promise To You & What You Get for Every Donation

In past years my brother Jake agreed to let us give him a Pie-In-The-Face and my brother Tanner volunteered for a Gatorade Shower. Well this year it's MY turn.

I want to help my school raise money! So..if you donate ANY amount...I have agreed to allow my two brothers, Jake and Tanner, to dump buckets of Green Slime over my head. I will video tape it and send it to anyone that makes a donation for any size.  

I will also be exercising in your honor at our Annual FUN RUN on Friday, March 27th. We will complete as many laps around the course as possible in our allowed time.
