story:
Mises Hispano Institute is the main austro-libertarian reference in Spanish. It's an online 'think tank' run by an international team of volunteers from Spain, Latin America and the USA. Mises Hispano publishes translated articles, videos and ebooks since 2011 - all the content is of open access and without advertisements.

Since its creation, Mises Hispano has been run without funds, and it has avoided any state, partisan o corporative influence that allows the project to be intellectually radical and uncompromised with Power (but compromised with freedom principles). And it will be the same in the future.

Mises Hispano Institute desires to be an avant-garde model of think tank. We want to inspire an evolution in educational social entrepreneurship, organizing an international human capital through digital technologies and united around a social ideal of freedom and a language spoken by millions of persons.

For acomplish this goal, we are renewing our graphic design, web design, and communications strategy, and will also put the pillars for a more formal organization with the recruitment of staff. Currently, we don’t have any budget and this is the first time we have asked for funds.

Please, help us to continue with our mission to free minds in this part of the world through crowdfunding. That way we will have resources to provide contents full time and to keep our ideological independence.

Be an actor of the battle of ideas, get committed with your ideals.

Fabricio Terán

Director of Mises Hispano Institute

http://miseshispano.org/



*You can also donate by PayPal, to fabricio.teran@miseshispano.org*

*In the case that you don't be able to donate by Internet, please contact us  and we will give you a number of bank account (international bank transfer).*


Ayúdanos a continuar nuestra misión de liberar mentes en esta parte del mundo


Instituto Mises Hispano es el principal referente austrolibertario en español. Es un ‘think tank’ online a cargo de un equipo internacional de voluntarios desde España, América Latina y los Estados Unidos. Mises Hispano publica artículos, videos e ebooks poco explorados en nuestro idioma, desde 2011 – todo el contenido es de libre acceso y sin publicidad.

Desde su creación, Mises Hispano ha sido manejado sin fondos, y ha evitado cualquier inluencia estatal, partidista o corporativa, lo que permite al proyecto ser intelectualmente radical y no comprometido con el Poder (pero comprometido con los principios de libertad). Y así seguirá siendo en el futuro.

Mises Hispano aspira ser un modelo vanguardista de think tank. Queremos inspirar una evolución del emprendimiento social educativo, organizando capital humano internacional a travésde las tecnologías digitales y unidos en torno al ideal social de la libertad y a una lengua hablada por millones de personas.

Para alcanzar esta meta, estamos renovando nuestro diseño gráfico, diseño web, la estrategia de comunicaciones, y también construiremos los pilares para una organización más formal con una contratación de staff. Actualmente no tenemos ningún presupuesto y esta es la primera vez que solicitamos fondos.

Por favor, ayúdanos a continuar nuestra misión de liberar las mentes a través de crowdfunding, si ustedes nuestros usuarios nos financian tendremos recursos para dedicarnos a proveerles contenidos a tiempo completo y mantener nuestra independencia ideológica.

Sé un actor de la batalla de ideas, es momento del compromiso con tus ideales.

Fabricio Terán
Director del Instituto Mises Hispano

http://miseshispano.org/


*También puedes donar por PayPal, a fabricio.teran@miseshispano.org*
*En caso de que no puedas donar por Internet, por favor contáctanos y te daremos un número de cuenta bancaria (transferencia internacional).*
story_txt:
Mises Hispano Institute is the main austro-libertarian reference in 
Spanish. It's an online 'think tank' run by an international team of 
volunteers from Spain, Latin America and the USA. Mises Hispano 
publishes translated articles, videos and ebooks since 2011 - all the 
content is of open access and without advertisements.Since 
its creation, Mises Hispano has been run without funds, and it has 
avoided any state, partisan o corporative influence that allows the 
project to be intellectually radical and uncompromised with Power (but compromised with freedom principles). And 
it will be the same in the future.Mises Hispano Institute desires to be an avant-garde model of think tank. We want to inspire an evolution in educational social entrepreneurship, organizing an international human capital through digital technologies and united around a social ideal of freedom and a language spoken by millions of persons.For acomplish this goal, we are renewing our 
graphic design, web design, and communications strategy, and will also 
put the pillars for a more formal organization with the recruitment of 
staff. Currently, we don’t have any budget and this is the first time we
 have asked for funds. Please, help us to continue with our mission to 
free minds in this part of the world through crowdfunding. That way we will have resources to provide contents full time and to keep our ideological independence.Be an actor of the battle of ideas, get committed with your ideals.Fabricio Terán

Director of Mises Hispano Institute

story:
Hi I'm Moshin Juma and I helped to found the People Concern Children's Project  (PCCP) in 2006 in Kampala, Uganda. We have worked to instill fundamental life skills into disadvantaged Ugandan children and empower them to create a better future for themselves. PCCP, as a local Ugandan charity, aims to cultivate this through basic education, "green" education, computer skills, public speaking, craft-making, and fostering an environment to promote learning. By "green" education we mean at a basic level we work to help children understand how to take care of the environment in which they live. We are currently located in Kampala District in Makindye Division within Kabalagala Parish in a resource challenged neighborhood near Kikubamutwe. As residents of the neighborhood, we feel that it is critical that the children and youth understand how to take positive steps toward making their current environment clean, safe and productive. 

Our vision.

One day every child will have the basic tools to create a better future for themselves. Now, we feel to accomplish our objectives we need to build a school where children and youth can have a creative, and experimental learning experience. Our vision for the school is to provide the children skills while promoting environmental and social responsibility. To fully accomplish our vision we would like to initiate the New School Building Project. This project will help us build a model school that will allow the children and youth to grow the food that they eat, to find ways to reuse the waste that vulnerable communities generate, and test other ideas for creating sustainable, modern solutions to our pressing issues.

This project will be a dynamic, exploration into finding educational solutions for today - solutions that include children and youth as key participants in the solution design. We see the school as an ecosystem and feel that designing the school will be an evolving project. We will seek ways to reduce our footprint on the earth, teach children and youth to be good stewards of the Earth, and through experiential learning introduce them to principles to help them design better green solutions for their future. As part of the project we will create a "Farm to Table" experience in which the children and youth grow some of their own food. Also, we will promote a culture in which the pupils go beyond gardening and composting, and create an enabling environment in which the pupils can find ways to rethink how we deal with the waste that we generate as a school and community. 

PCCP is a registered NGO operating in Uganda. All of the current children and youth that we serve have financial disadvantages and are not enrolled in traditional schooling. The very reason PCCP was formed was to address the existing lack of schooling in the community. In 2006 we started with 26 children, by the end of 2006 we had 32, then when we started in 2007 we had grown to 50 students. By the end of 2007 the number had grown to 100. In 2009 there were 105 students. In 2010 we had 130 students and this grow to 185 students.  And now we have 201 students in the entire program.

One of our primary partners is Aktion Canchanabury (http://www.canchanabury.de/). Aktion Canchanabury is a German development organization that works to support projects that “empower the target groups in terms of ‘helping people help themselves’ to go their own way.”

At the beginning of 2014 Aktion supported some youth from the community to a gardening course at the Community Integrated Development Initiatives (http://cidiuganda.org/). Later in the year Aktion supported youth at PCCP with equipment for soccer academy. It was through these initiatives that our partnership has grown. We now have signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Aktion Canchanabury.

Our Roadmap

We recently received 16,000 Euro from our partners Aktion Canchanabury. This amount has allowed us to buy land outside of Kampala in Mpigi, approximately 45 km away. In this very initial phase we will build a groundkeeper’s house and toilet facilities for the build out process. In February 2016 we expect an additional 10,000 Euro which will allow us to build an administration block and one class block (6 rooms) for pupils in Nursery school and grades Primary 1-3. We expect to receive our first intake of pupils in September 2016. We then expect a final 8000 Euro from Aktion Canchanabury in early 2017. This funding will allow us to complete additional blocks. And yet, there is much more that we need to be able to accomplish our goals of creating a self-sustaining school.

What We Need & What You Get

Here we will explain more about our needs at PCCP for the New School Building Project and what you will get by contributing to the program:

  • We are requesting $40,000 to finish building and equipping a proper school for the children and youth that we serve
  • Specifically the funding will cover the costs of finishing construction on the school, building a football (soccer) field. The funds will also help us buy school books, furniture, science equipment, trees/seedlings, and a construct a library and a small computer lab for the children. See breakdown:
    • Furniture $6300
    • Football/soccer field - $10,000
    • Football/soccer equipment - $1000
    • Computer lab block - $7000
    • Computer lab equipment - $3000
    • Science equipment - $2000
    • Trees/seedlings - $700
    • Video camera & accessories $1000
    • Small vehicle - $2000
    • Library - $7000
  • Additionally, we will purchase a video camera and computer for creating a short documentary about the project. See cost above
  • Additionally, we hope to buy a small vehicle to transport staff between the Kampala site and the Mpigi site. See cost above.
  • PCCP will maintain a separate accounting of all funding raised via Indiegogo and maintain records of each expenditure that can be shared with those who donate.
  • As a perk for being part of the project you can receive a video documentary of the whole project and have your name engraved on a plaque that will be mounted at the school.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still buy supplies and build a portion of the school that we can and continue to seek funds for completion. We are passionate that we will see the school built.

The Impact


You can see how you can make a difference with your contribution:

  • By participating and giving a financial donation you will be contributing to the education of children and youth that live in a specific vulnerable community.
  • Additionally, you will be helping create more sustainable solutions to urban environmental issues.
  • PCCP has a history of success managing projects. 
  • We feel that your commitment to this PCCP New School Building Project indicates your willingness to be a part of locally-led solutions. While there are many good development efforts in Uganda and the region to build strong communities, there is a great need for finding solutions that originate from the communities themselves. PCCP is a community-led initiative and the leadership are committed to seeing the children and youth become a generation of strong resilient citizens.

Risks & Challenges

Each day in our community we face many risks and obstacles to carrying out our vision. These risks will always be here, but as we face them on the way to achieving our goal we commit to the following:

  • To be transparent with you as we work through the process. To this end we will create a documentary about the entire process. And as mentioned earlier, PCCP will maintain a separate accounting of all funding raised via Indiegogo and maintain records of each expenditure that can be shared with those who donate.
  • We will also teach the children and youth valuable video production skills along the way.
  •  We will describe the hurdles we may encounter along with our solutions. 
  • Specifically we will create a weekly news clip of the project and share this on Facebook/YouTube, In this way you can see how it is we plan for solving each of the challenges that emerge.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Another way that you can help is to get the word out and share our campaign with everyone in your network. You can easily do this using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • We also teach the children about emergencies and disasters and have been a part of a program with Tulane University's Disaster Resilience Leaderhsip Academy (DRLA) called the Young Disaster Resilience Leaders (yDRL). We have worked with local partners, Makerere University and others. If you have ideas how we can further prepare the children to help their community grow stronger we are always open to hear them.
  • Also, if you have expertise in green education, video production, writing newsletters, or building green sustainable structures in Africa, please let us know. We know that we can find a way to use your expertise to help us.
Thanks so much,
Moshin
moshinjuma@yahoo.com

story:
Have you missed our 5 days of new Perks?

Day 5 - Discounted 1 & 3 month Center of Gravity adult makerspace.
Day 4 - Learn to Draw your Inventions for Kids.
Day 3 - Private Wine & Cheese Tour of the new building before the official ribbon cutting.

Day 2 - THINQubator's Learn to Solder kit. The custom board is in the shape of the THINQubator logo. It has a battery & holder, and a blinking multi-color LED in the tail flame of the rocket. Give it a whirl!

Day 1 - Build a Box with a Bandsaw in a private class taught by Bob Bownes for just you and a guest (even your own child!) RARE opportunity for 1-on-1 time with Bob. Get it before they sell out!




Looking for some fun in your life?  Check out our new video cut!

****************

You Made It!

Welcome to the THINQubator!  A project of the Tech Valley Center of Gravity, the THINQubator is a kids makerspace that allows young people the opportunity to

  • explore and invent using tools like 3D printers, laser cutters, hand tools, power tools, electronics, and computers.
  • learn STEM and the arts in an integrated, interesting, relevant format
  • meet other kids who like the same things they do
  • find adult mentors & experts who can help them realize their potential 
  • have fun!
We're a group of engineers, educators, makers, tinkerers, artists and designers who love kids and want to support their dreams!


What We Need 

What You Get


Why Create the THINQubator?

The THINQubator grew out of a need.  We've been running a successful and growing adult makerspace since 2012 called the Tech Valley Center of Gravity in Troy, NY.  Members, and community members started bringing their kids into the space  Educators were calling regularly to see if we could host field trips and Professional Development.  Parents wanted summer camps.  The requests kept coming.  We did our best to accommodate them but the current space just did not meet the unique needs of kids.  

The Plan

The Center of Gravity has outgrown its building in just two short years and has received a state grant to move to a building 10x bigger just a block away.  We're nearing the end of a year long construction project. With the move on the horizon, the time was ripe to carve out some kids-only space; the THINQubator was born.  The THINQubator will occupy nearly 1000 sqft of prime space on the 1st floor of the beautiful, Victorian, four-story Quackenbush Building right in the heart of downtown Troy, NY.

The Impact

Imagine what you could have created if a place like the THINQubator was around when you were a kid?  Or when you were raising your kids?  Imagine what's possible for kids who have access to this space.  This generation will create a world that we can't possibly imagine.  Let's give them the cutting-edge tools to dream BIGGER!  We live in an area rich with academics, high-tech industry, and a teeming creative  community.  Kids at the THINQubator will have access to professors, researchers, artists, designers, architects, engineers, coders, applied mathematicians, and scientists.  We'll help kids find their passions.  We'll provide them with the resources to develop their skills and realize their dreams!


Risks & Challenges

We want to be honest with you so here's what you should know...

  • Building an awesome place like the THINQubator is A LOT of work.  We're going to start working on the reward shipments as soon as the equipment is installed but if we hit snags in meeting our delivery dates, we'll communicate it with plenty of notice.  Feel confident in the fact that we are working hard to create amazing experiences for kids and we can't wait to thank YOU for the opportunity!
  • We'll be updating IndieGoGo backers regularly so if you want to be in-the-know, chip in $1 to get on the list.  We can't wait to tell you all the cool stuff we're doing!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that's okay.  Here's what you can do to help...

  • Get the word out about how cool the kids maker movement really is by sharing our project with your friends, family, peers, and colleagues.  Every share is a HUGE help!!
  • Do you own a company or work at one that would be interested in partnering with us?  Drop us a line!  We answer emails in 24 hours or less. THINQubatorTroy@gmail.com
  • Are you all grown up and want a space like this for yourself?  You're in luck!  The Tech Valley Center of Gravity has been operating successfully for years and would love to have your individual or family membership!  More details here.
  • Check out our website www.THINQubator.org and consider getting involved!
  • Share our project page, our Facebook, and our Twitter with everyone you know!  https://www.facebook.com/thinqubatorTroy  and  @THINQubatorTroy
Thanks guys!  Pat yourselves on the back.  No really, you are awesome.

Check out our website www.THINQubator.org and consider getting involved!
Share our project page, our Facebook, and our Twitter with everyone you know!  https://www.facebook.com/thinqubatorTroy  and  @THINQubatorTroy
 
Thanks guys!  Pat yourselves on the back.  No really, you are awesome.

story:
Fundraising Goals:

We are looking to empower teachers. Plain and Simple. Your contributions will help the Infinite Curriculum run at full capacity, allowing for live on-board training, increased staff, and updated technology to fuel our dream. 

Live On-Boarding Training

We will hold three live on-site on-boarding conferences this summer. Each conference will enable attendees to obtain professional development credits and complete the activities necessary to be successful in creating content for the Infinite Curriculum Network.

Live-Teleconference On-Boarding Training

We will host on-boarding training and education via our ICN Web Conference Center once each month to guide participants through the process to be a certified contributor to the Infinite Curriculum Network.

Increase Our Support Staff

We will increase our support staff to enable us to train, on-board, and support members of the Infinite Curriculum Network. This includes professional development professionals, video and graphic artists, and copy editors.

Purchase Support Equipment

We will utilize portions of our proceeds to upgrade systems to add additional capacity and capabilities to the Infinite Curriculum Network, including mobile applications.

With your support, we will place our distribution platform in the hands of teachers and enable them to create and sell their own content across the nation.  Our system will not only place more money in teachers’ pockets but will drastically improve the educational system as a whole.

Teachers - We want to give you the world

The problem in today’s educational system is that our teachers, the enlighteners in our lives, are stuck in a fish bowl, unable to collaborate with other students and educators.  Brilliant ideas are crafted and used every day within classrooms yet like  unheard trees falling in a forest, these ideas are rarely noticed or shared outside the classroom.  These struggles need no longer exist as our system of change will open doors to teachers globally.

We believe teachers should be paid more.  We want to improve the quality of education. Not only are we devoted to this change but we have the tools necessary to make this leap forward. 


Why?

The best educators are the ones in the classrooms right now. They are on the front lines of our educational system recognizing the problems associated with teaching and creating the solutions. Once they leave, they're knowledge and techniques are no longer available to students and are rarely passed on.

  • 50% of teachers leave teaching in the first 6 years, frustrated at being isolated and feeling as if they have to reinvent the wheel.
  • When teachers retire or leave teaching early, schools, programs and classrooms falter instead of continuing the move forward from where the last teacher left off.
  • Publishing curriculum is a tiresome and often overwhelming task.   
  • The curriculum that is being created by outliers is outdated by the time it even reaches the classroom.

We have created a platform that enables teachers to share their ideas, providing an easier, more efficient process that moves education forward.


Giving Teachers a Voice: 
We are creating a system that can be accessed by all teachers, creating an expanding bank of knowledge that will make available ideas, knowledge and help to all. Not only can we give teachers a voice but by giving teachers up to 100% of the profits, we are giving them an added incentive to make a change.

How This All Works:

All teachers get 100% of the profit from the curriculum they develop. Yes, 100%! It is free to use, access, and publish the curriculum teachers have created, giving educators across the country a venue to share their innovative teaching ideas.

We also provide the services teachers need to help make their vision a reality. Whether it is curriculum assessments, design, or help outlining their ideas to make them more effective, our team is here to help.

Teachers every year are required to take classes to maintain their certifications. Most of these required courses are filler coursework that does nothing solve the problems they are faced with. Instead of taking mundane classes, what if we gave teachers the opportunity to take what they know and join our network, learning to create and sell their effective curriculum for the rest of the world to use. Through our Professional Development Boot Camps, teachers will not only learn how to create their own curriculum, but leave with a finished piece of curriculum ready for the market that will be immediately available for sale on the Education Supply Network.  There is no need for marketing, financing, distribution, or hassle. We do all the work for you!  




Our Vision: 
Our vision is to create a collective of schools and enable collaboration among teachers within schools, between schools, and making connections across the country. With our top educators instructing other teachers and students with their best methods, we can create an enhanced learning environment in all schools across the country no matter the size or resources.

"Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do." —Steve Jobs


Our Team:
From left to right—
  • Rick Dietrich: Vice President of ESN, Curriculum Coordinator, 20 years teaching experience at the middle, high school, and collegiate levels.
  • Clay Wilderman: Marketing, Curriculum Development, freelance educator at the middle and high school levels. 
  • Mike Dietrich: CEO of ESN
  • Brandon Lopez: Creative Development, Curriculum Development, freelance educator at the middle and high school levels.

story:
Introduction

My name is Logan Turner, I am 18 years old and I am a second year student studying at the University of Ottawa in the program Honours Bachelor of Social Sciences Specialization in International Studies and Modern Languages in French Immersion. I would define myself as a shameless idealist who is caring and passionate and always looking for new opportunities to make a positive impact in my local, national and international communities.

Recently I received the incredible opportunity to apply and be selected out of hundreds of applicants to be one of 17 members of Junior Team Canada with Global Vision, a youth-led delegation who travel around the world on trade missions to represent and promote Canadian industry. While on my 8-day trade mission, I will be connecting Canadian businesses and organizations with those in Peru, through gaining contacts, industry knowledge and cultural relativism. While there, I hope to focus especially on the green energy sector because it is so so important to reduce our populations global ecological footprint, and the green/renewable energy sector is currently booming in Peru, providing exciting opportunities for growth in the Canadian industry.

This is an incredible opportunity for me to not only represent Canada on an international level, but also to gain valuable experience that will help to shape me into a future, global leader. However in order to participate, I must raise $3,500 in partnerships with local businesses, organizations, and individuals who are passionate about giving youth unique opportunities to make a difference on an international level. People who are hopefully, just like you!

Give Me a Unique and Impactful Task!

As I previously mentioned, I need to raise $3,500 in partnerships with passionate and caring individuals and organizations. These funds will go directly to the organizing non-governmental organization Global Vision, a charitable organization founded in 1991 with the goal of providing opportunities to develop youth into strong global leaders. The funds raised go towards costs of the trip such as accommodations, flights, meals, and other means of transportation in order to fulfill the mandates given to us.

Personally, I am a very youthful and energetic young adult with an insatiable curiosity and desire to learn and experience new languages, cultures, and ways of life. Not only that though, I love to share my newfound knowledge and adventures with the world! It is for this reason that I am proposing every person who donates $100 or more can give me a funny, appropriate task or a cool activity to complete during my 8-day trip to Peru. The activities could be as wide-ranging as eating a traditional and weird Peruvian meal, or hugging a stranger, or kiss a llama. Then I will take a picture of me doing the activity and post it on a blog that I will create. In this manner we can work together to create a positive difference in Peru and help me make the most out of my trade mission to Peru!

The Impact

While my main goal is to represent Canada and its industries to Peru, together we can make an impact at a local level by committing random, appropriate and fun acts of kindness. Thus with the partnerships I will create with businesses and with individuals, I will be able to maximize the impact that I will have by promoting the green/renewable energy sector, and by spreading smiles, good cheer, and laughter  around the world!

Risks & Challenges

To be very honest, my biggest challenge with this incredible opportunity is the relatively short time period that I have to fundraise the amount of money that I need to in order to make the impact that I want to while in Peru. 

The other big risk that I am taking is this new concept of having people that I have never met give me a task over the internet that will likely, and hopefully take me out of my comfort zone. It will be a new and exciting challenge that I am prepared to tackle head on.

Other Ways You Can Help

While I understand that not everyone can help out by contributing funds to my campaign, definitely spread the word about my mission to make a positive impact in the world by using the Indiegogo share tools! And if you have a great idea of a cool little task that I can complete while in Peru, inspire other contributors by suggesting ideas of  potential tasks!

story:
Short Summary

The vision of the Emma Alderson Christian Academy is to meet the needs of families in our small, rural West Virginia community for high quality pre-school education/development and after-school care in a Christian environment. The Academy is a ministry outgrowth of the Old Greenbrier Baptist Church and her vision to reach out to meet real needs of families in our community.

The Alderson area community lacks adequate Pre-K (3 & 4 year old) educational opportunities and group after-school services for children in Pre-K to fifth grade. There is no Christian Pre-K program available in our area. Also, many of our public elementary school children are latch-key kids with no where to go between the end of school and the return of mom and dad from work. Our non-profit program centers on providing both education and care for our children in a Christian environment. We believe this ministry is critical to the future success of our children, our families, our community, and our world.

By contributing to our campaign you will not only help enable us to care for children and families today but also enable our children to be more productive, moral citizens who in-turn contribute to making a better future for our community and world.

What We Need & What You Get

We are committed to re-purposing our existing church facilities (e.g., a vacant parsonage) to provide necessary educational opportunities and services for our children. Unfortunately, our church alone does not have the financial resources necessary to fund the changes and updates to make the Emma Alderson Christian Academy a reality.

We need $25,000 in order to fund the items identified in our business plan to launch our Academy by August 2015. However, we have already raised $5,000. So, our Indiegogo campaign goal is $20,000. A more detailed funding plan listing specific items/costs in each category below is available upon request.

  • Classroom/Teaching Supplies                    $4,300

  • Administrative Supplies                                 $5,990

  • Playground Equipment                                   $4,000

  • Fire Alarm, Lighting, Panic Hardware         $5,550

  • Interim Administrator Salary (2 mo.)          $5,160  

    Grand Total Start-Up Costs                        $25,000

We will use all funds received to meet the needs of launching our Academy. We are not passively waiting for contributions to come in but also are actively working to gather these funds. Recently we held a Valentine's Dinner and Auction which netted $2,686.38. We are planning other fund-raising events for the near future. Also, we are receiving donations not only from church members but also from other churches and private individuals both in our community and from other areas. Many people are concerned about providing this ministry to our children and families.

As a perk, your contributions to this program are fully tax-deductible since the church of whom we are a ministry is an IRS recognized 501(c)(3) religious organization. We will gladly provide the documentation required by the IRS acknowledging your generous contributions. See the Perks section for details.

The Impact

The ministry delivered to our children and families by the Emma Alderson Christian Academy is valuable. The need for high quality developmental and educational opportunities in rural Appalachian communities such as ours is critical. If you and I are not willing to reach out to meet these needs as believers, then who will do so?

The lives of our children and families matter. If we can enable a child to learn and grow into an educated, moral individual, then we have certainly bettered not only our community but our world. If we can enable a family to have more time together in the evening since homework has been done in our After-school program, then we have bettered the quality of our families' lives and have helped them draw closer together. If we can enable parents to complete their work-day without having to take their child to an after-school program in another community or to worry about what their child is doing until they get home, then we have both removed stress from them and improved the quality of their work and lives in general.

We truly believe in the ministry of Emma Alderson Christian Academy, and we pray that you will too. We have an on-going commitment to meet the needs of families and children in our area through Christian programming. We reach out to families and children in our community on a regular basis with Sunday school programs and seasonal programs (e.g., Easter activities, Vacation Bible School, Christmas plays). We believe that launching our Academy will enable us to make deeper and more significant positive impacts on the lives or our families and children well into the future.

Risks & Challenges

Any new effort is not without risks and obstacles. We certainly face many of these and are working hard to overcome them.

Our program's cost to families (i.e., tuition and fees) must be kept low due to the economic challenges faced by families living in our area. At the same time we want to deliver high quality programming which is very costly. As a non-profit we commit to keep costs low by running our programs on a break-even basis. However, even though we are a non-profit, we must have sufficient cash-flow from donations and tuition in order to fund high quality, safe education/development opportunities for our children. We are working diligently to keep both our start-up and operating costs low, to find and utilize used equipment and supplies, to receive in-kind donations of goods and services when available, and to raise as much money as we can from local donors, However, we know that we will need many contributors, such as you, in order to enable this ministry at the high-quality level that we envision.

We determined early in our discussions not to receive any governmental funding, which is both available and significant, so that our programs may include Christian teaching and practices (e.g., prayer, Bible readings) without limitations. We stand on this principle and trust God to send us the resources we need to enable our work for his glory.

We believe the needs our Academy addresses in our community truly exist based on our community surveys and discussions with both public and private educators and consultants familiar with our area. However, there is always the possibility that sign-ups for the Academy may not achieve levels significant enough to enable the start of either or both of our programs (i.e., Pre-K, After-school) as planned in August 2015. We are fully committed to begin with the needs that self-identify in our community based on sign-ups. If we have applications sufficient to start either the Pre-K Program or the After-school Program, then we will start where the need identifies itself. In any event, we will work diligently to continue meeting the needs of our families and children through either the launch of our Academy at a later date or through other programs that we identify as we continue to reach-out to our community. Our efforts will never be wasted as we seek to meet the needs of our families and children and to glorify God in all that we do.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may be unable to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean that you can't help. Please consider supporting our efforts in these ways:

  • Pray for our children, families, community, and Academy. Ask God to bless and open the way for this vital ministry in our community.
  • Tell others who may be able to contribute about us.
  • Give goods, services, or your volunteer time to our ministry. We can provide you with in-kind donation IRS documentation for any goods or services donated.

story:
The SW Fossil Fuel Divestment Convergence has helped to empower fossil fuel divestment student leaders to form and sustain an active community and network. This convergence built our Southwest community through organizing-skills training, relationship building and political education. We situate ourselves within the climate justice movement, aiming to work in solidarity with frontline communities, and helping to foster the transition to a just and sustainable future.

So far, we've been able to raise $8,000.00 and we need about $1,500.00 more to reimburse for travel scholarships, lodging, and food for incoming students.  This project has taken about $12,000.00 to put together and we are seriously excited about this amazing opportunity to build mass power and momentum around fossil fuel divestment in the Southwest.  Your contribution will make that a possibility. We ask that people donate $20.00 to $60.00 though whatever you can contribute is always appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help today:

  • Please spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends!
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Toward a just and sustainable future,
The Convergence Core Team

This convergence built our Southwest community through organizing-skills training, relationship building and political education. We situate ourselves within the climate justice movement, aiming to work in solidarity with frontline communities, and helping to foster the transition to a just and sustainable future.  So far, we've been able to raise $8,000.00 and we need about $1,500.00 more to reimburse for travel scholarships, lodging, and food for incoming students.  This project has taken about $12,000.00 to put together and we are seriously excited about this amazing opportunity to build mass power and momentum around fossil fuel divestment in the Southwest.  Your contribution will make that a possibility. We ask that people donate $20.00 to $60.00 though whatever you can contribute is always appreciated.     Other Ways You Can Help Sometimes people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help today:  Please spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends! Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Toward a just and sustainable future,The Convergence Core Team

story:
WHAT?

A free, open source, mobile learning app that aids in teaching preschool children how to read, write and do basic math without needing a teacher. 

WHY?

  • Because 250 million children are unable to read, write or do math.
  • Because 5.2 million teachers are needed to teach these children. - UNESCO

    We are hoping to change the status quo, but we need your help.

HOW?

By standing together to fund and develop a free, scalable, open source, mobile application that could aid in helping these children to teach themselves, basic reading, writing and arithmetic. If we reach our main goal, this mobile app can be made available to the children who need it, at no cost.


THE TEAM?

My name is Simon Botes, I am the founder of AppCRAFT. 

AppCRAFT is a small African startup based in Plettenberg Bay, South Africa. We have been developing award winning educational mobile applications since 2009.  With your help we are now hoping to tackle our largest project ever. 

INVITATION:

This is your personal invitation to join hands with us. Lets make a difference in the lives of 250 million children by teaming up and developing the world's first, community powered, non commercial, advert free, open source Mobile Education Framework.  

WHY AppCRAFT?

The educational apps and ideas that my team and I have come up with in this field have already received honorable mentions by both UNESCO and the Pearson Foundation. We have also won multiple local and international awards for our other educational apps. 


To-date more than 450,000 people from 200 countries have benefited from some of our other free educational mobile apps, including our recent Breast Cancer Awareness App.   

COST?  

Our goal is to develop the first fully working beta version of our mobile learning app within 18 months for less than $1 000 000.00 

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

We are hoping that the online community will stand together and support this project by each giving $1.00 or more to support our project.

SOCIAL EXPERIMENT 

To make things interesting let's try a little social experiment and see if we can use the Six degrees of separation concept to fund development of this project. 

Once you have contributed $1.00, nominate a friend or seven to do the same.
If you want to nominate 2 friends give $2.00 and so forth.

If you have many friends, select the perk package that fits your needs.  

  • Step 1: Give just $1.00 (per nominated friend) to this indiegogo campaign.
  • Step 2: Take an "Uncle Sam wants you" Selfie.  (With or without a cool hat.)
  • Step 3: Nominate 1 or more friends on twitter or Facebook to take part.
  • Step 4: Tag your selfie & nomination with #ReadWrite2015 #PayItForward
  • Step 5: If your nominated friends accepts the nomination and takes part,  send them a little gift to say thank you for taking part.
  • Step 6:  Please Like and share this campaign on your social channels. 
Sample Tweet:

I gave $1.00 in support of #ReadWrite2015 and now nominate @FriendsNameGoesHere to take part #PayItForward (Attach your Uncle Sam Selfie and link to this indiegogo page.)


I will start this social experiment by giving $7.00 to this campaign and nominating 7 of my friends to take part. ($1.00 for each nominated friend) 

I am hoping that they will each then also contribute to this campaign and nominate some of their friends to take part and so on and so forth. If you are nominated please keep it going.


CAMPAIGN GOALS

Our main goal is to raise $1,000,000.00 - We are breaking the campaign up into a few smaller goals to be more realistic.

Goal 1: $500.00

The first $500.00 raised will be used to cover our teams entry fee into the XPRIZE.  

Goal 2: $5 000.00

The next $5000.00 will go toward R&D.

Goal 3: $ 10 000.00

If we raise an additional $10 000.00 we will be able to fund development by our core team for 3 months. 

Goal 4: $50 000.00

If we raise an additional $50 000.00 this will go toward development of the basic framework.

Goal 5: $500 000.00

This will be used to cover expenses for a small team working full time on our project for a period of 18 months.

Goal 6: $1 000 000.00

Reaching this goal will make it possible for us to expand the team considerably and help to deliver a much better app. 

If we raise more than $1million we will use these funds to keep improving the app.  

 

Thank you for taking the time to read and take part in #ReadWrite2015


Back 2 School and Reading/Writing Images. Original Images by: The Peirce Free Clipart Collection. CC BY 3.0 licence. Images later edited by Simon Botes.

 

"Child Reading, image by Dihl et Guerhard Manufactory (Boston, MA)," was taken by takomabibelot on Flickr, shared with CC BY 2.0 license edited by Denise Krebs.  



I love what you are doing! How can I help?

Contact us using this form for more info.

story:
Music programs have been proven to have a profound impact enhancing speech and language and increasing self-confidence and self-expression in children on the Autism Spectrum and other developmental delays. However, traditional music learning programs have long been inaccessible to many children with special needs. And that’s where we want to help. Founder and Clinical Director of Arts for Healing, Karen Nisenson, and Australian Music Educator and Founder of Simply Music, Neil Moore, have created a unique, adaptive piano program that transforms the issues that prevent a child with special needs from learning in a conventional way. 



The Simply Music Gateway program will be an online streaming program designed specifically for any child with special needs who thinks differently and needs to learn in a different style. 

Simply create an online account and access the customized training, support and guidance materials that have been designed specifically for occupational therapists, music therapists or music educators, as well as parents/guardians or care-providers. No extensive background or training is necessary, anyone can teach this program!






  • EMPOWER CHILDREN with special needs and their families through music.

  • PROVIDE SCHOOLS & ORGANIZATIONS with special needs programs.

  • Impact the special needs community on a GLOBAL SCALE.

  • Provide our program completely FREE OF CHARGE.







Jewels Harrison was diagnosed with Autism at the age of 3. He had major difficulties with speech and language and the inability to use his hands and fingers. Look at him now!




Using the Simply Music Gateway program, Jewels’ learned how to play piano in small steps that are easy, fun, and playing-based, rather than reading-based. By focusing on his learning differences one sensory system at a time, his motor skills improved vastly. Now at age 13, his fine motor skills have improved vastly, and he plays blues, classical, and popular pieces with ease! Simply Music Gateway has given him a new means of self-expression through music. 




The impact on students and their families is profound. Children with special needs, through acquiring musical self-expression, have a new means communicating and revealing their individual personalities and talents. The Simply Music Gateway programs offers a new opportunity for socialization and further inclusion in their school and greater community.





The core curriculum for the Simply Music Gateway program is under development and we are eager to begin production on this breakthrough program. Through this Indiegogo campaign we're aiming to raise enough funds to make the program reality.

• Producing the program student materials – Streaming video.

• Producing the specific instruction guides – Printable PDFs for parents/care providers, music educators and music/occupational therapists.

• Building the online delivery system for global distribution of the program.

• Testing and polishing the final program and making it ready for the public.


The program will be delivered via an online system. The only requirement you need to get access to the program will be a web browser and an internet connection!










Karen Nisenson is Founder and Clinical Director of Arts for Healing. She holds a Bachelor and Master of Music degree in Piano Performance from the Juilliard School, Bachelor of Science from Hunter College, a Master of Arts degree in Music Therapy from NYU, where she has been an adjunct professor and affiliated with the Nordoff-Robbins Center for Music Therapy since 1978. Karen developed the integrated music and art therapy methodology (IMAT) and the Adaptive Music Teaching Curriculum. She has also created early childhood academic programs specifically designed for children on the Autism Spectrum. Karen is a contributor to Special Parent Magazine and The Motor Story Online News Magazine. Karen consults to schools, and frequently presents talks and workshops to parents and professionals about the impact and importance of the arts in education.


Karen Nisenson has been a global leader in special needs for the past 30 years.As a Creative Arts Therapist using music and art as vehicles of expression,she saw the impact that music had on each individual, no matter the behavioral or emotional issues present. The elements of music, rhythm, harmony and melody provided paths to non-verbal conversations that communicated feelings and ideas, and stimulated speech in those that had no verbal ability. The power of interactive improvisation allowed anyone to make music, and so began her “playing-based” adaptive teaching method. 


Pairing Karen’s specialized piano program with Neil’s compositions and natural approach to playing piano, a program was created and designed specifically for children with special needs – ranging from ADHD, processing and developmental disorders, to the autism spectrum. The Simply Music Gateway program focuses on fine motor development while exploring and playing the keyboard. Familiar songs are learned without having to read music, and students, with a variety of processing disorders, were able to incorporate information and develop their musical skills.

story:
Dear Reader, thank you for taking out the time to read my story. My name is Aditya Sharma (from India) and I have always had a very deep passion for Music. I was an adolescent when I was diagnosed with depression. My unforgiving past made matters even worse. The only reason I am here, writing to you today is because Music saved my life; it has inculcated a sense of purpose in me and given me the courage to fight my battle(s) with strength that is steeped in the belief that, anything is possible.
     I completed my bachelor's in Business Management (BBM) from India with distinction in 2012 and am currently pursuing a double major in Music Composition & Music Business at Elmhurst College, IL, USA on the Dean's Scholarship. I have already completed 2 years (of the 4 year-degree) but am having serious financial problems and cannot afford to pay the tuition amount for the remaining two years.
     I have wanted to become a composer my whole life. I want to touch people's lives, giving them joy and hope through the music I make. I want them to feel the security and warmth that I feel when I compose. I will forever be indebted to you for letting my dream see the light of day. All I ask for is a chance to prove myself. Thank for reading this once again. Regards, Aditya. P.S.- I am willing to work for payments too. Please find attached a link to the Music I have made so far: https://soundcloud.com/aditya-sharma

story:
Funds raised here will be used to get this
project to every person worldwide!

Getting a wonderful idea to the world costs money and we need your help to raise funds to do this.

Your pledge towards this will help us to make possible what everybody wants but does not have the capacity to do...!

Because alone we can only do so much, together we can achieve the impossible!

The best way to predict the future is to create it! - Peter Drucker

WealthGapBreaker will enable every person around the world to access funds for basic goods they need to live better lives.
They will be able to buy/grow fresh food, have fresh water and safe shelter.

People are struggling around the world because they don't have money!
That is the basic problem. 

We've found the solution to help people get money and the standard of their lives will automatically improve. 

They can then focus on their education and self improvement as the basic needs are met!
It really isn't sensible to give people free internet or education when in reality, they don't have food or water or safe living conditions to start of with...

We need to work on the fundamental problem before tackling the other secondary problems that exist.

WealthGapBreaker will make money from services rendered to "businesses and richer people" and will then share this money with every person worldwide! 



Simply put, WealthGapBreaker makes money for every person, from the poor first then to richer, no matter what race, age, religion or country they belong too!

For example: 
If you had to join Wealthgapbreaker today, for the rest of your life, Wealthgapbreaker will generate money that will belong to you! 

Think of it like facebook, it's an amazing platform that Mark has designed where people are connected at common central point. Millions of People have joined facebook and facebook makes millions of dollars in revenue from advertising and promotions.

All this money generated then goes to the shareholders of facebook. 

WealthGapBreaker generates money in a similar manner but instead of the money going to a few shareholders only, 
we are going to share it with everyone from around the world that has joined WealthGapBreaker!

Every person will earn money from the system, but the poor will earn money more frequently than the richer will.
This is how we aim to reduce the "money gap" between the richer and the poor.

We have an amazing algorithm in the system that identifies the poorer from the richer (using lifestyle audit methodologies, LSM ratings etc) and the system then shares funds accordingly such that all poor people will benefit first compared to the richer. 

This ensures that no person will be unfairly enriched over another and that every poor person worldwide will receive funds that they can live on to have a decent life. 

Funds to ensure they can purchase the basic goods that they need to live comfortably. 

So...,
Can you now imagine a world where everybody has enough monies to buy the basic goods they need, not merely what they want, but what they need. 

No person on the system will be unfairly enriched while another is left being poor for the same duration they've been registered for in the system. 

Every person will ultimately earn equally with our Wealth Gap Breaker system!

...& we want to ensure that everybody worldwide can benefit from it! 

Measures have been put in place to prevent only a few people benefiting while others also require help. 

This may sound impossible now, but we have confidence that the Wealth Gap Breaker system is capable of achieving this!

Together we can do the impossible!


We believe this is something truly wonderful and a god send to us all on earth and we should do our very best to make it work!

We have wonderful perks/incentives on offer for your support! 
Please take advantage of it as best you can!

We humbly encourage you to make a pledge today so that we can help every person worldwide to join this programme. 


If any person you know, cannot afford the once off joining fee, please consider paying this fee for them (sponsor them) as you will be giving them the best gift of their life.  

You will be helping them to have a brighter and better future!

We sincerely invite all philanthropists and the worlds richest to match every pledge we receive through this campaign. 

A special invite goes out to: 
Mr Bill Gates and family
Mr Carlos Slim and family
Mr Amancio Ortega and family
Mr Warren Buffet and family
Mr Larry Ellison and family

...and also to all the rest of the worlds most successful and richest people! 

Please come aboard this system and help us make this work as this has so much potential to make the world a better place not just for us but also for our future generations...! 

We may not be here tomorrow, but we can at least leave the world in a better place than what we found it to be in our lifetime...!

Thank you for taking the time to learn about us and may you blessed with all it is that you need in your life!

The WealthGapBreaker Team!


Featured on:

story:
DeafVibe Foundation's National Tour:

  • DeafVibe's first National Tour (2013), helped the college enrollment process for hundreds of Deaf and hard of hearing students at private and colleges all over The United States. 
  • Your donation will help us TRIPLE the size of our 2013 Tour, which will help make over 3,000 private colleges and career training programs in the US equally accessible to the Deaf and Hard of Hearing.
  • Tour leaves March 5th 2015 and is currently slated for over 50 stops. 
  • Departing from Portland, OR and going as far east as Pittsburgh, PA and as far south as Miami, FL, the tour route spans 16,000 miles
  • We anticipate meeting and inspiring over 50,000 Deaf and hard of hearing!


Let's break it down...

     Total tour budget:                   $40,000
     Less sponsors & grants:         -10,000
     Total needed:                            $30,000

If we can get 1500 faces to contribute $20, we'll meet our goal.  And we'll put ALL THE FACES ON THE BUS!


The FaceToFace Impact:

Outreach through phone and/or other media is just not feasible.  Our clients use signed languages to communicate.  DeafVibe's National Tour is the most effective way to educate and inform Deaf and Hard of Hearing individuals about their equal access rights, many of whom would never even consider pursuing college if not for meeting our team FaceToFace. 

In the last four years The DeafVibe Foundation has received approximately 1000 applications from individuals seeking our services and over half of those were from folks we met on the last nationwide tour, which spanned less than three months!

Your donation allows for Face2Face life changing access to private education for the Deaf and hard of hearing!



About The DeafVibe Foundation:

The DeafVibe Foundation is a national 501c3 nonprofit organization.  We strive to ensure equal access to private higher education.

  • DeafVibe was established in 2011 in the Portland, Oregon metro area.
  • Now over 1,000 clients nationwide and growing... at least one client in each of the 50 states!
  • We provide each of our clients enrollment support,  interpreter matching support, tutoring, coaching/mentoring, and general equal access services.

Other Ways You Can Help Our National Tour:

SHARE! Share! SHARE! Share!

DeafVibe Foundation's National Tour:


DeafVibe's first National Tour (2013), helped the college enrollment process for hundreds of Deaf and hard of hearing students at private and colleges all over The United States. 
Your donation will help us TRIPLE the size of our 2013 Tour, which will help make over 3,000 private colleges and career training programs in the US equally accessible to the Deaf and Hard of Hearing.
Tour leaves March 5th 2015 and is currently slated for over 50 stops.  

Departing from Portland, OR and going as far east as Pittsburgh, PA and as far south as Miami, FL, the tour route spans 16,000 miles
We anticipate meeting and inspiring over 50,000 Deaf and hard of hearing!


    
Let's break it down...
     Total tour budget:                   $40,000     Less sponsors & grants:         -10,000     Total needed:                            $30,000

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We are Leap, a start-up that is looking to change the way high school students approach the college application process! We are looking to raise $20,000 in seed money to help us towards our goal of creating a website that allows students to be matched with the colleges that best fit them. We think a social stigma has been created in the past decade that being accepted into a certain group of schools means you are a better student, are smarter, and that these schools are a perfect fit for everyone. At Leap, we hope to challenge this thought and show that perhaps these artificially top ranked schools are not the best fit for all students.

If you want to check our website to learn more head to: Leap Website

What We Need & What You Get

The money we raise will go towards paying a company we have contracted that will design and code the website. The funds will also help us purchase a proper domain name as well as help market our company.

In return for your generous donation we will be forever grateful and you will also receive either a limited-edition Leap T-Shirt or sweatshirt and a free year pass to the site once it is up and running. 


The Impact

We believe Leap will ease the burden put on high school juniors and seniors by simplifying the process of finding the next step in life for them. In addition, Leap will save money and time. Students can do their research right from their couch and parents will be saved the need of hiring an expensive private college counselor. Leap will allow students from low-income families to be able to get an in-depth view of the colleges they like without having to pay for costly travel expenses.


Risks & Challenges

We realize that there are challenges to building a company with team members who have limited experience. However, we have great advisors who have already helped us immensely and will continue to keep us on the right path. The company we have contracted also has a great reputation. Our founder, Nojan Kazerouni, has had exposure with several start-ups and as a result wanted to begin his own. He hopes to use the knowledge at the his previous work experiences to put Leap on the right path.


Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand if you are not in a position to help financially, however there are many others ways to help us out.

As a start-up, we are always looking for new team members to join us at Leap. If you know anyone who would be interested, let us know! We also would love to hear feedback, advice, and network with those who have gone through this process.

Also we would really appreciate it if you would share the link with friends and family who you think would donate. Spread the word about Leap!

Thanks so much,

The Leap Team!

story:
Ecovillage Design Education Course

Olhos Verdes is here to help co-create a happy green planet. 


The vision is that together we can find sustainable ways of living in our planet. We celebrate its natural abundance, peace and beauty.

We are an international young organization based in Portugal, a community of young leaders and initiators working to support the transition towards a green and responsible society at local as well as global level.  

The group is supporting the Ecovillage Design Course as a step towards the foundation of an educational and demonstrative center. The Course will last 5 weeks.

For details about the EDE Azores see our website: http://edeazores.org/ 

This campaign is a very important step towards the realization of our dream of transforming our inner and outer world! We want to engage hearts and minds in learning, unlearning, experiencing, sensing and co-creating life in communities around the globe.  

Here is an opportunity to walk together with us on this path and to joyfully manifest a shared dream! 


A conscious use of your money

We need your contribution mainly to:

- support facilitators and team members reaching the Azores from all over the world

- support students and participants with fewer opportunities getting to the Azores and participating in the course

- pay expenses for material and personnel

- build the edible garden that will feed EDE participants and trainers

- support food and accommodation for volunteers helping to set up the hosting site and to organizing the course

To make this dream possible we need a total of 9.000 euros. 

Service Perks - Education and Consultancy

Our perks are aligned with our educative aims. All of them are completely sustainable, very good quality and provided with Love. And we offer some very unique and highly productive perks: consultancy and educational service!

On-line open webinars on:
- Basics of NVC, Mediation techniques, Restorative Circles, Meeting Facilitation, NVC in Parenting, NVC and Social Change, Moving from 'Power over' to 'power with' in our communities/organizations
- Nature planning, restoration and conservation, Sustainable water management
- Beekeeping
- Vegan Kitchen and Conscious Eating / Consumption
- Deep Ecology, Rewilding and Gratitude
- Social Permaculture, Permaculture from the Inside Out: Personal map and Vision building, Life Journey Learning Patterns
- Rewilding exercises, gratitude work, interspecies communication

Consultancy on:
- starting up your own Ecovillage Design Education
- the social dimension of the EDE
- the economical dimension of the EDE
- the ecological dimension of the EDE
- the worldview dimension of the EDE

Contribute with what feels right to you!

We feel grateful for your contribution!!

Please contribute with what your heart tells you to do!

Crowdfunding is also about community building, and this is one beautiful way of connecting with a project that embodies values that may be important to you too!

We ask you to be part of the project building relationships with us! 

Please share the campaign among your networks, communities, friends and people you know requesting them to share it further.  This campaign is like a bag of seeds, as we go on planting together we will see our common garden flourish!! 


Thank you for helping us funding this project!!

(cover image: ©Lagoa do Fogo, São Miguel)

story:
"Education is not a way to escape poverty, it is a way of fighting it."

- Julius Nyerere, former President of the Republic of Tanzania.


                           

Osanidde is an African word (in the Ugandan language) which is used in many Ugandan worship songs. It means "You are Worthy!" and it sounds just like "Oh Sunny Day!"  This word sums up our heart and vision for this unique Ugandan Orphanage.

Osanidde village is home to 160 energetic children who love Jesus with all of their hearts. This is a happy place, despite what it lacks.

These children were brought to Osanidde from the surrounding villages and islands of Lake Victoria. Unfortunately, little is known about these children prior to their being rescued. Often the chiefs of the village have little or no information about their background. It is not uncommon for both parents to have died due to the AIDS virus. 

But what they lack are the fundamental things that we take for granted, and this is where we come in.

                                   

                                

Sponsoring Purchase of School Equipment

The majority of the children and teenagers at the orphanage began their school year this past February lacking basic school equipment. In order to create a better learning environment and receive a better education, they need notebooks, pencils, pens, erasers, rulers, calculators and other school supplies. 

Buying Slippers & Clothes 

Some of these incredible kids walk around barefoot, most of them don't own a pair of shoes at all, and they wear the same worn-out, dirty shirt day in and day out. Because of the tropical weather it can get pretty cold, and the kids don't have warm clothes or jackets to protect them from the rain.

What If We Surpass Our Goal?

If we surpass our goal, our BIG Dream is buy them a tractor. They could use a tractor to facilitate food production on a larger scale. They have the land and the more food they grow the less they have to buy. Buying a second hand tractor will cost about $ 18,000 including transportation to the island.

If we significantly surpass our goal, our INNOVATION Goal (Phase II), we plan on buying 20-30 computers. We believe that today they can start learning to use and work with a computer and tomorrow they can go get their first job or go study a specific trade. We also will need to buy a generator because there is no electricity on the island. In addition we plan on hiring a local computer teacher and sponsor his yearly salary.

                                            

My name is Asaf. I'm a 27 year old guy from Tel Aviv, Israel. Recently I embarked on an incredible journey that changed my life. After completing my Bachelor's degree in Engineering, I packed a bag and got on an airplane to Uganda, Africa. 

My parents were confused, my friends a little surprised. "Why Uganda? Why now?" I could have looked for a job, made some money and gone out with my friends to pubs. The good life, right? But something inside me said: You need to do this.

And I'm so happy I did.

I decided to join the ART-Joy-Love volunteer program for a month (and later extended my stay for a couple more weeks) at a local orphanage called Osanidde on a tiny island located on the beautiful Lake Victoria. When I arrived I was greeted by 160 smiling children. Children who for some reason or another lost their parents, mostly due to AIDS. 

These children are blessed. They have people who take care of them, a place to call home and most of all each other. They go to school, play soccer and love to sing. 


What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

We decided to use flexible funding in this campaign so that people could have the option of paying with credit cards. In case we don't reach our goal (leaving us without enough to buy the tractor), with the help of your donations, big or small, your money will be sent directly to buying school equipment and clothes for these children. 

Our goal is for this to become an annual campaign to ensure that every year, all 160 children can start off the school year just like any child should. Just like we did. 

How do we plan to achieve these goals?

We have set up a verified bank account for this project. All donations will be managed by our Team.


          

                             

We would like to clarify one thing: Any and all donations will go to buy LOCAL equipment and clothes, helping to boost the local African economy. By purchasing locally, we feel we can help two worthy causes at once: the kids and the African economy. 
Furthermore, for every donation we promise to first thank you. From us, as project leaders, but also a big Thank You from the children themselves. 
For each $10 dollars you give, your name will appear on our wall of sponsors in the website and will be printed and given to the children.



If you're unable to contribute financially to our cause, you can still help!

Spread the word about these amazing children on social media and to your friends and family via email and help us raise awareness for about our campaign and hopefully bring in more donations. 

You probably know someone who can help, perhaps a friend or a family member, or a relevant company or organization. We ask that you share this campaign on your social networks, tell others around you and make some noise!

Good Tip: On the top left side there are is a 'SHARE' button to send the campaign to your friends.

       You see the girl in the picture above, her name is Hanifah (12 yrs old) and this is one sentence from one of many letters we exchanged. I just had to share it with you and can't describe how beautiful,amazing and humble she is!

      This is a letter from John Katongole (19 yrs old) and he told me he wants study mechanical engineering.

And how can I not introduce you, Olive (15 yrs old). She puts others people well being before hers and is truly a special person which I hold close to my heart.

story:
Our Mission for Change

Our strategy is to build the first Food Science Lab, a self-sustaining Urban Farm program in a high school (Schurz High School in NW Chicago) that would (1) support the classroom with a hands-on learning center, (2) create a much needed job training program providing business expertise in management, design, marketing and distribution, and (3) answer the call for fresh locally grown produce simultaneously.  The program will be in close collaboration with local businesses and be a model for other schools around the country.

We Need Your Help

We already have urban farming experts, chefs, package designers, marketing professionals, and teachers in place. We are now ready for Phase 1 of the new program:

Phase 1: The Indoor Lab  

We need of $15,000 of essential equipment to build our vertical growing system, the foundation piece of Urban Farming.  As the illustration video shows, we need shelving, trays, pumps, hoses, grow lights, nutrients and seeds to start our vertical farm system capable of growing 48 trays of baby and micro-greens per week --enough to supply classroom chefs, area restaurants and the local food pantry with fresh wholesome produce.  

This basic set-up will provide opportunities to train student managers in essential practices and be an expandable foundation on which to build the program, eventually including aquaponic seafood and soil-grown produce under the guidance of a master grower and food safety expert.  This will be the foundation of the program and the first of many more phases to come.

The Path to Achieve our Goal

The new Food Science Lab @ Schurz High School builds on relationships with local businesses and mentors to mutually benefit students and community.  It can nourish the whole community by answering the call for fresh local food supply, job training, and more. Our prototype lab will provide students hands-on experience, preparing them for growth careers including: 

•  Sustainable urban farming

•  Food handling industries

•  Business development and digital marketing

•  Package design

•  Molecular Gastronomy and the science behind food

•  Nutrition

And with this model in place, we can demonstrate feasability and practice to future schools who recognize the need to solve these issues.

Why the urgent push to teach Urban Farming?

Our nation is in a state of crisis with our traditional agricultural methods and we need to teach news ways to grow our foods.

  • Our nation is experiencing severe drought while using 60% of our drinking water for agriculture, yet only 80% of that makes it to the crops
  • We've depleted our local, wild seafood sources and need more sustainable methods for raising and harvesting healthy seafood
  • We compound the negative impact on the environment by transporting our food long distances, wasting up to 40% of it along the way
  • Our urban areas are spotted with food deserts with few options for fresh food
  • Many children have diets of processed foods and have little knowledge of where their food comes from and what they may be lacking

Hydroponics (growing crops with a soil-less system) and Aquaponics (growing crops and fish together in a re-circulating system) will be core methods taught, including some progressive soil systems teaching technologies aimed at solving this crisis.

What You Get Out of It

This program supports our collective well being. 

  • Help solve a global crisis
  • Further this concept that can be scaled to high schools and communities across the country.
  • Bring together a partnership between businesses, community experts and schools to continue innovation benefitting everyone.

Other ways you can help

Some of you may not be able to contribute to our cause but we can still use your help

  • Tell your friends about it and urge them to help
  • Visit the school, our website and commercial urban farms in your area to learn more about what we're doing
  • Support local farming and suppliers that do

Many children have diets of processed foods and have little knowledge of where their food comes from and what they may be lacking
Hydroponics (growing crops with a soil-less system) and Aquaponics (growing crops and fish together in a re-circulating system) will be core methods taught, including some progressive soil systems teaching technologies aimed at solving this crisis.

What You Get Out of ItThis program supports our collective well being. 

Help solve a global crisis
Further this concept that can be scaled to high schools and communities across the country.
Bring together a partnership between businesses, community experts and schools to continue innovation benefitting everyone.

Other ways you can help
Some of you may not be able to contribute to our cause but we can still use your help



Tell your friends about it and urge
them to help
Visit the school, our website and
commercial urban farms in your area to learn more about what we're doing
Support local farming and suppliers
that do

story:
In the aftermath of the massive 7.9 earthquake that hit Nepal on the 25th of April 2015, our team of independent professionals and friends came together with the intention to provide medical aid and sanitation awareness to earthquake survivors. Our journey began from the outskirts of the Kathmandu valley and so far we have provided medical aid to over 800 people in five different locations including Gorkha and Sindhupalchok which are the worst affected areas.

Following the initial relief phase we decided to work on mid-term to long- term reconstruction projects. We began by partnering with the Seven Summits Women - a team of lady mountaineers from Nepal - to build Temporary Learning Centres in Bhotenamlang VDC, Sindhupalchok to get children back to a safe learning environment. This helps in lowering the risk of dropouts and more importantly in preventing child trafficking, which is a prevalent social crime in the area. So far we have built Temporary Learning Centres in the villages of Gurungtole, Bhotegaun and Kafle and a permanent structure in the village of Gobre in association with Samata Siksha Niketan.

In order to further ensure that children stay in school and to provide incentive to parents to send their children to school, we have set a goal of providing approximately 2000 children in 8 schools with nourishing mid-day meals. The following is an estimate of costs for one year:

Estimated cost for school feeding program per child per day = 0.15 $
No. of school days in a month = 25 days
No. of months the school will be open in a year = 9 months

Cost for school feeding program per child for 1 year = 33.75 $  

Total cost of School feeding program for 2000 children for 1 year = 67,500 $

We have been overwhelmed by the constant support from friends, families and well-wishers throughout this journey. We hope to continue to receive your love and support in making whatever difference we can. We shall post pictures and updates here.

You can also follow us at: https://www.facebook.com/Rebuld.Nepal.2015

We have also uploaded our finances to ensure total transparency: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Lwj3nVQ...

We urge you to generously donate to our cause and share this with all those who can help.

Rebuild Nepal Team
