story:
WHAT, WHY & MY STORY

The truth is, there are countless actors out in the world, and they are all shooting for a similar dream with similar goals, in hopes to reach their end result. For me, I’ve pursued acting for the art of the discipline. But more importantly, it's the only thing I want to do with my life. Turning acting into a career is my goal.

Originally, I am from a small town in South Florida where, growing up, I felt stuck in a world that didn’t make me feel creatively motivated or provide opportunity to be imaginative towards your future. With the help of my best friend, I scraped up all the money I had (which wasn't much) and booked the cheapest one-way flight to NYC. It was sort of a 'no turning back' move, forcing me to take a risk. I didn't really know what the end result would be, but I knew that if I DIDN'T take that risk, then I would never know at all.

When I landed in New York City, I had a little less than $200 in my pocket. I was living in hostels for the beginning until I was taken in by newly made friends and found jobs that allowed me to finally save money and rent a room in an apartment. Once settled, I was able to pursue some small acting gigs. But, I wasn’t doing much and I didn't necessarily feel like I was contributing to the actual 'art' of the craft at all. I realized that if I was going to pursue something like acting for the rest of my life, I should actually know what I'm doing – I needed to learn.

I researched a program I connected to at The William Esper Studio where I could study through a two-year program and really uncover the skills and technique associated with being an actor. Really find out what it means to dig deep emotionally, physically and into past life experiences. And so far, one year into this program, I am absolutely sure of my decision to continue. I am deeply in love with this art of acting. There's nothing else in the world I would trade it for. 

THE ISSUE

The toughest part about paying for an accredited acting institution in NYC by oneself is there is very little financial help offered. Unfortunately, I cannot apply for a grant, any loans from the bank, or even FAFSA, which is typically a HUGE help for students in many cases. At this point, I am independently responsible for paying for my education to become an actor.

My course schedule is rigorous, leaving only nights available for working a part-time job. On such a small salary that is also used to pay my rent, for groceries, and necessities, I am in danger of not being able to participate in the second year of the William Esper program because I simply can't afford to. I need to pay off my debt from the first year in order to go through to the second year by July 31st, as well as be able to pay for the beginning of my second year, or I will not be able to continue.

YOUR SUPPORT

I'm reaching out in every way that I can for that little push to help me make it through this process. The financial goal is pretty high at this point, but every avenue I can pursue is a chance for me to continue the path towards my dream.And isn’t that the true goal in life? To spend every single day doing something you love?

I want to be clear that I am NOT just asking for a handout. Graduating from a program at William Esper Studio is a life-changing accomplishment in the world of acting. Although portrayed as glamorous by the media, only 2% of SAG actors are working. 2%!And they don’t get paying jobs as a favor – they get them through hard work and building upon their talent. The list of former students who have graduated from Wil-Esp can attest to that.

I am so appreciative of every dollar that comes my way towards continuing my education through the William Esper program. If there is a way to pay back every contributor, I will hopefully find it through the successes that I create down the line. Mostly,I would love to be able to supply you with proof that your generosity helped shape someone’s life.

Thank you in advance for believing in me. (too cheesy?)

story:
We Are Limitless - Year 3

I can't believe this is already our third year placing kids in boarding schools and providing them with a structure that was severely lacking in the orphanages and on the streets of Kigali. The phrase "Limitless Family" has been used by our students and the team in Rwanda for a while now but during our latest visit was the first time I heard it uttered by teachers and locals in the communities. We are definitely having an impact and being recognized for the extra emotional  support and individualized attention that WAL students receive.  "Limitless Family" is not just a phrase though. It has taken on a deep meaning among the students as they discover that just because they are orphans doesn't mean they can't build a vital family of their own. For instance, it is not unusual for a university student to take a bus ride for hours to check in on a WAL child in primary or secondary school who just needs an "older brother" to talk to.  There have also been numerous times where students have reached out to me via email to let me know of other WAL student's health issues or even to brag about another child's final exam scores.

Our Recent Visit

In May we returned to Rwanda to check in on the children and university students. We brought laptops, medical supplies, clothes, toys and school supplies graciously donated by many of you. We had some medical issues to deal with. Jean-Paul had Malaria, Erik was diagnosed with chronic allergic conjunctivitis and Emmanuel has a serious case of varicose veins that makes walking extremely painful. We scheduled his surgery for September to limit the amount of school he will miss but he is having a difficult time right now.

The trip also included a visit to assist our partner in The Democratic Republic of Congo. We delivered a three months supply of food for the 97 children that live in a 200 sq. foot house about 2 hours outside of the border city of Goma. In addition we brought them emergency medical supplies donated by Dr. Shahin Chandrasoma and toothbrushes and toothpaste donated by Jamie Sands, DDS. 

This trip was special in another way as we had guests with us for the first time. Anton Laines and Anna Dokoza joined us to meet the kids and deliver supplies. Later we were joined by Jon Thomas and Laura O'Keefe who came to help shoot Rebecca's short film and quickly found themselves also helping out with WAL. Laura arrived with her luggage filled with shoes and other supplies and Jon ended up donating his own laptop to one of our students to help him with his studies.

Student Updates

The frustrations and stress involved in operating an organization like WAL can be overwhelming. I often find myself staring at the ceiling at night wondering why I have taken on all of this... But then we return to Rwanda and I get to see a student like Queen and it all comes into focus.

Queen is 9 years old and has only been with us for a year. But since being moved to Maranatha School she has zoomed to the top of her class - 11th in her class of 85 to be exact.  This is the bright future of Rwanda.

Another standout continues to be Lillian who is ranked 5th in her class of 54. I always like to brag about her because, for those who remember, Lillian was one of the first children we moved from Noel Orphanage and scored terribly low on her school admissions test.

So low that the principal said she would be expelled before she completed her first year. Amazing what happens when determination and hard work is met with encouragement and support.

    Where We Go From Here

    As we continue to grow we continue to need more help. I understand that there are many places to donate your hard earned money. WAL can easily be looked at as simply another charity doing some good in the world -- but what makes it different from other similar organizations?  Well, the first thing is that we don't have any real overhead. With the exception of 1 full-time and 1 part-time employee on the ground in Rwanda, there are no paid workers. Everyone who works for WAL in the U.S. volunteers their time. That means that about 90% of the money received goes directly to helping a child reach their potential.

    This leads into another of WAL's special qualities. Individualized attention. Each child is treated as the individual that they are. Instead of placing all the children in one or two schools, which would allow for easier oversight and management, they attend schools that are best suited for each of them. And though this makes for a lot more travel for our staff to check on them, the children are reaching their full potential more quickly.

    But arguably our most unique aspect (especially in that part of the world) is that we are non-faith-based. That is not to say that we are against the numerous faith based organizations that are doing good in Rwanda and all over the world. It's just that we encourage our children to define themselves any way they choose.

    WAL does not push any agenda except for critical thinking and looking out for your neighbor.  We speak with our children about building a world where people look out for each other simply because it's the right thing to do and that in doing so it will build a healthy, thriving society.

    Without getting too political, after becoming the 21st country to legalize same-sex marriage, the new U.S. law is having a chilling effect on LGBT rights in much of Africa. Rwanda's neighboring countries, Uganda and Congo, have strict anti-gay laws. And though there is discrimination in the predominantly Christian Rwanda, it is one of the few African nations where homosexuality is not illegal -- and we would like to see it stay that way. By teaching tolerance and understanding to our children (and our support team) and letting them know about our gay donors who are partly responsible for their education and well-being, we have begun to see a change in attitudes amongst them. Not surprisingly, education continues to defeat bigotry.

      Where The Money Goes

      • $2,200 pays for Emmanuel's surgery on his legs in September.
      • $1,000 pays for 1 year of baby food and medical fees for Ester.
      • $1,300 pays for 1 year of a student's tuition, food, and clothes.
      • $600 pays for 1 month of salaries for our Rwanda team.
      • $150 pays for a student's medical insurance for 1 year.
      • $900 pays for a university students' post grad, 6 month internship (3 needed).
      • $50 pays for shoes for a student for 1 year.
      • $65 pays for a months' housing for a University student.
      • $300 pays for 1 month of food for the 97 children in DR Congo.

      *We are still looking for a large donor/sponsor to help build a center in the DR Congo to provide safety to the women and children in the war-torn area.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      The 2015 Annual Celebrity Poker Tournament will be announced shortly and will likely take place in Mid-October. Please let us know if you have any items or services to donate for the grand prize or for the silent auction or if you or your company would like to sponsor the event. We are always looking for volunteers to help us organize and put on the event.

      We have a CROWDRISE page (www.crowdrise.com/wearelimitless) that individuals can use to raise money for WAL by starting an event of your own, running a marathon or triathlon, throwing a dinner party, or any other inventive way you want to help WAL raise money.

      Shop at AMAZON SMILE. Amazon donates 0.5% of the purchase price to We Are Limitless Inc. Bookmark the link http://smile.amazon.com/ch/46-0778791 and support us every time you shop. An easy way for you to support our cause.

      Follow the links below to:

      • "Friend" us on Facebook
      • Follow us on Twitter -  @wearelimitless1
      • Donate on our website www.wearelimitless.org

      THANK YOU FOR TAKING THE TIME TO LEARN ABOUT WE ARE LIMITLESS

story: Troy James Nalls has been playing the drums since before he can remember. My wife and I bought his first drum set for his 3rd birthday. Seems like yesterday when he was beating on pots and pans. Fast forward to today. Our son is taking a MAJOR step in his dreams of going from cute kid drummer to professional musician. He was accepted into the Summer Music Enrichment Program at the University of Arts in Philadelphia. The tuition, room and board has been covered. This fundraiser is for friends and family to assist with incidentals, pocket change, and exploration of Philadelphia. Thanks for supporting our son through the years. His success story is your success as well as ours!

story:
Sharing Tails

From 2008-2011, Marsh & Associates, LLC presented an exciting, free, state-wide, and on-site, native Arizona fish public outreach program at public elementary schools with funding from US Bureau of Reclamation.  We traveled the state teaching kindergarten through second grade students about our native fish, reaching about 33,000 students and exceeding our goal of 30,000 students. After 2011, federal funds were no longer available to pay for the program. Marsh Education, a not-for-profit 501(c)3 branch of our parent company, Marsh & Associates, LLC was formed to garner support to continue the program.

Every dollar we receive from this campaign and fundraising will go to bringing our program back to Arizona public schools at little or no charge to to the school. As a 501(c)3, donations may be tax deductible. Please retain proof of your donation for your tax records.

Funding Needed

Reintroducing this program has been a goal since funding ceased. We have all of the course props, equipment, and some educational materials on hand. This has greatly reduced the funds needed for a successful first year. In order to deliver the amazing perks and fund a full school year of this program we need to raise $56,466. The math:
  • $42,500 for the first year of program costs. This includes the salary for our scientist and educator to provide the program, all of the materials needed  we don't already have on hand, an awesome fish replica for each child, and a copy of our children's book "Counting Fish!" by Carol Pacey for each school library we hold the program at.
  • $9,304 to purchase perks. If all of our perks sell out, these funds will cover our cost to order them.
  • $4,662 to Indiegogo. If we don't hit our goal, they keep a larger percentage of the funds raised. This number is reduced drastically if we hit our goal and the difference will be used to purchase additional supplies for the program.
If we exceed our goal, funds will be used to pay the minimum order expenses for more fish replicas (while we only need $6,765 in replicas to cover the rest of the first year, the minimum order is $20,000 which will cover multiple years of replicas). Once more fish replicas are ordered, remaining funds will be used to schedule more schools, replace aging equipment, and cover some administrative expenses our founders have been covering. Our first year budget will reach 76 schools and approximately 6,688 students. We would like to double that for year two. We have the capability to reach as many schools as we have funding for.

Perks Available

We have some fun perks available as a thank you for helping make this a reality!

 

Impact

Our objective for Sharing Tails is to create excitement about native Arizona fishes in children who potentially would become the future protectors and advocates for these unique animals. While we use no live fish nor do we take the kids outside as part of our program, we believe that our enthusiasm for both are translated throughout our program. Children are excited to speak during and after the presentation, to share about fish they know, native or not, and they are grateful for the experience with us as reflected in their thank you notes to the traveling scientist. 

Below is a link to a presentation created in 2011 that elaborates on the program details and impacts.

  http://www.lcrmscp.gov/crab/presentations/2011/...

Risks & Challenges

If we are unable to secure full funding the program will still launch, so there is no risk! Our educator extraordinaire and scientist has already begun to schedule schools for a modest fee beginning this current (2015-2016) school year. With partial funding we will be able to lower the fee charged to the schools booked after the campaign. Our goal is to provide this at no charge to all Arizona public schools, so we will work with them to help raise funds for the difference if necessary.

This campaign will only cover the first year, and our goal is to continue indefinitely. We are working hard to secure a new grant, find corporate sponsors, set up an online merchandise store, and brainstorm for more fundraising ideas to keep the program going long term. Initial funding is the stepping stone for providing more funding opportunities since many grants and sponsoring groups require the organization to have matching funds on hand. With a year of funding available we could potentially find funding for the second year right away!

Other Ways To Help

If you work for a corporation that sponsors local educational programs we would love the opportunity to earn their support. Please contact us at donations@marsheducation.org.
story_txt:
Sharing Tails From 2008-2011, Marsh & Associates, LLC presented an exciting, free, state-wide, and on-site, native Arizona fish public outreach program at public elementary schools with funding from US Bureau of Reclamation.  We traveled the state teaching kindergarten through second grade students about our native fish, reaching about 33,000 students and exceeding our goal of 30,000 students. After 2011, federal funds were no longer available to pay for the program. Marsh Education, a not-for-profit 501(c)3 branch of our parent company, Marsh & Associates, LLC was formed to garner support to continue the program.




Every dollar we receive from this campaign and fundraising will go to bringing our program back to Arizona public schools at little or no charge to to the school. As a 501(c)3, donations may be tax deductible. Please retain proof of your donation for your tax records.


Funding Needed
Reintroducing this program has been a goal since funding ceased. We have all of the course props, equipment, and some educational materials on hand. This has greatly reduced the funds needed for a successful first year. In order to deliver the amazing perks and fund a full school year of this program we need to raise $56,466. The math:

$42,500 for the first year of program costs. This includes the salary for our scientist and educator to provide the program, all of the materials needed  we don't already have on hand, an awesome fish replica for each child, and a copy of our children's book "Counting Fish!" by Carol Pacey for each school library we hold the program at.
$9,304 to purchase perks. If all of our perks sell out, these funds will cover our cost to order them.
$4,662 to Indiegogo. If we don't hit our goal, they keep a larger percentage of the funds raised. This number is reduced drastically if we hit our goal and the difference will be used to purchase additional supplies for the program.

If we exceed our goal, funds will be used to pay the minimum order expenses for more fish replicas (while we only need $6,765 in replicas to cover the rest of the first year, the minimum order is $20,000 which will cover multiple years of replicas). Once more fish replicas are ordered, remaining funds will be used to schedule more schools, replace aging equipment, and cover some administrative expenses our founders have been covering. Our first year budget will reach 76 schools and approximately 6,688 students. We would like to double that for year two. We have the capability to reach as many schools as we have funding for.


Perks Available
We have some fun perks available as a thank you for helping make this a reality!

 

    Impact Our objective for Sharing Tails is to create excitement about native Arizona fishes in children who potentially would become the future protectors and advocates for these unique animals. While we use no live fish nor do we take the kids outside as part of our program, we believe that our enthusiasm for both are translated throughout our program. Children are excited to speak during and after the presentation, to share about fish they know, native or not, and they are grateful for the experience with us as reflected in their thank you notes to the traveling scientist. 
Below is a link to a presentation created in 2011 that elaborates on the program details and impacts.
  http://www.lcrmscp.gov/crab/presentations/2011/...
    Risks & Challenges  If we are unable to secure full funding the program will still launch, so there is no risk! Our educator extraordinaire and scientist has already begun to schedule schools for a modest fee beginning this current (2015-2016) school year. With partial funding we will be able to lower the fee charged to the schools booked after the campaign. Our goal is to provide this at no charge to all Arizona public schools, so we will work with them to help raise funds for the difference if necessary.
This campaign will only cover the first year, and our goal is to continue indefinitely. We are working hard to secure a new grant, find corporate sponsors, set up an online merchandise store, and brainstorm for more fundraising ideas to keep the program going long term. Initial funding is the stepping stone for providing more funding opportunities since many grants and sponsoring groups require the organization to have matching funds on hand. With a year of funding available we could potentially find funding for the second year right away!

Other Ways To Help
If you work for a corporation that sponsors local educational programs we would love the opportunity to earn their support. Please contact us at donations@marsheducation.org.

story:
Who we are:

We are FAHITA, the local branch of the global network "Global Youth Innovation Network »in Madagascar. We are a network of more than 250 youth from 18 to 35 split in 9 regions. It has been three years now that we exist and that we cross the country to sharpen creativity, innovation and the willing of starting a business among youth in rural area.

                                    ---------------------

Qui sommes-nous? 

Notre réseau s'appelle FAHITA (Fikambanana Anovozana Haivao Iombonan'ny Tanora eny Ambanivohitra),  l'implantation à Madagascar du réseau mondial "Global Youth Innovation Network". Nous sommes un réseau de plus de 250 jeunes, de 18 à 35 ans, répartis dans 9 régions. Voilà 3 années que nous existons et que nous parcourons le pays pour stimuler la créativité, l'innovation et le désir d'entreprendre chez les jeunes en milieu rural. 


Our big challenge: find effective solutions to emerge from poverty.

Usual answers? Fund a well, build a school, give seeds and fertilizer, offer a micro-credit...

Our idea: share youth knowledge and innovations, learn practical know-how and back it up in a larger scale. 

                                    ---------------------

Notre grand challenge :  trouver les solutions pour sortir du cycle de pauvreté.

Les réponses habituelles ? Financer un puits, construire une école, donner des semences et de l'engrais, proposer du microcrédit ...

Notre solution : partager les savoirs et les expériences innovantes des jeunes et de leur communauté, apprendre des meilleures pratiques et les répliquer à plus grande échelle !


This is how we see development and that's the reason why we start up the "Takalo" (meaning exchange in malagasy language) program. We think that it is crucial for the development of Madagascar that youth innovative experiences should be shared as a knowledge source. These local innovations are a breeding ground of the dynamism required for the country to emerge form poverty.

Share and learn from youth innovations, this is the motto.

This year, we organize the “DIA” trip, a trail made to meet innovative youth and to learn from their experiences. The trip will last 8 days. We will board technicians, experts and decision-makers with us,to learn and back best practices up to a larger scale 

                                    ---------------------

Ceci est notre conviction, raison pour laquelle nous lançons "Takalo" (échange en malagasy). Nous croyons qu'il est crucial pour le développement de Madagascar que les expériences innovantes des jeunes soient partagées en tant que source de savoir. Ces innovations locales sont un véritable vivier d'énergie capable de sortir le pays de la pauvreté car elles permettre d'inspirer jeunes et moins jeunes à agir. 

Partager et apprendre des innovations des jeunes, voici donc les maîtres-mots.

Cette année nous organisons le voyage "Dia", un itinéraire pour rencontrer ces jeunes innovants et apprendre de leurs expériences. Le voyage se déroulera sur 8 jours et nous embarquons techniciens, experts et décideurs dans un bus pour apprendre et répliquer à plus grande échelle les meilleures pratiques.



Our call and your support

To broadcast this initiative, we want to realize an efficient and striking communication campaign. It will use of a plea to reveal how youth can be groundbreaking and so, to make their voices heard.

To produce this communication campaign, we want to board professional photographer and film maker with us, for our plea tool to be the most convincing.

Now you can step in: we need funds to realize this project.

This is our call, and here is how you can assist us.

Our goal is to collect 9 500 euros to cover the adventure on medias, pictures, videos, web articles and to give a fair compensation to our highly dedicated team.

On consideration, we will share best pictures and videos to you, followed with a technical and financial account.

                                      ---------------------

Notre appel et votre soutien

Pour diffuser cette initiative, nous prévoyons de réaliser une campagne de communication percutante et efficace. Celle-ci aura une fonction de plaidoyer afin de démontrer combien les jeunes sont innovants et leur permettre, ainsi, de faire entendre leurs voix.

Pour cette campagne de communication, nous souhaitons embarquer photographes et producteurs de films professionnels, afin de rendre notre outil de plaidoyer le plus convainquant possible.

C'est ici que vous intervenez: nous avons besoin de fonds pour réaliser ce projet. Ceci est notre appel et voici comment vous pouvez contribuer à notre projet!

Notre but, collecter 9 500 euros pour couvrir l'aventure en médias, photos, vidéos, articles web, ainsi que gratifier les bénévoles du projet.

En contrepartie, nous vous partagerons les meilleures photos et meilleures vidéos réalisées, suivis d'un rapport technique et financier du projet. 


Positive impact

Some youth dare do things differently and innovate, find solutions within their community. Sharing and communicating these innovations is a way to inspire, kindle the willing to take action and demonstrate that solutions exist to rise out poverty.

                                    ---------------------

L'impact

Des jeunes osent faire les choses autrement, innovent et cherchent des solutions dans leurs communautés. Partager et communiquer ces innovations est un moyen d'inspirer, de susciter l'envie d'agir et de démontrer que des solutions existent pour sortir de la pauvreté! 



You will make your input to broadcast innovations throughout videos and pictures of the youth.

You will help out with our media, web and social network exposure, and also in creating communication products. Finally, you will allow the association to give an in return to volunteers who dedicate themselves nights and days for the project. 

                                    ---------------------

Vous allez contribuer à diffuser ces innovations à travers des vidéos et photos (une photo égale à mille mots!) des jeunes, de leurs innovations et de leurs impacts dans leurs contextes. 

Vous allez contribuer à notre présence sur le web et les réseaux sociaux, à la réalisation de produits de communication destinés à la diffusion du projet dans les médias et enfin, vous allez permettre aux bénévoles qui se sont consacrés jours et nuits au projet d'obtenir une compensation à leur investissement.


With risks and challenges to tackle

Our main challenge is to propagate our project for the people to understand why investing on the knowledge sharing is more suitable than funding a school project or the building of infrastructures. To ensure this message is heard and followed, we need to communicate efficiently.

                                        ---------------------

Avec des risques et des défis à relever

Notre principal défi est de faire comprendre notre projet, pourquoi investir dans le partage des savoirs et non financer une école, une infrastructure, pourquoi? C'est là que nous devons bien évidemment communiquer efficacement.


The second challenge to take up is that we won't have fall out for the time being but we sow the seeds of developing by sharing. As a result, we need to follow the growth of these seeds inside communities.

                                   ---------------------

Le second défi est de ne pas avoir de résultats tangibles immédiatement, nous semons la graine : partager les savoirs pour le développement. Nous souhaitons suivre comment ces graines ont germé dans les communautés.


Other ways to participate: 

We welcome any kind of support with open arms. We would be very pleased if you could share with us your experiences for example, and we definitely need you to spread around our crowdfunding campaign for us on reaching our goal.

You can visit our website and follow us on Facebook or Twitter !  

                                    ---------------------

D'autres façons d'aider

Nous gardons les bras ouverts à toute forme d'aide et de soutien à notre projet. Vous pouvez partager votre expérience avec nous, partager notre appel et faire circuler l'information à votre entourage. Vous avez en tête une idée, une personne ou une organisation qui peut se lancer avec nous?

N'hésitez pas à visiter notre site internet, à suivre notre page Facebook et notre compte Twitter !

story:
Clique aqui para ler a versão em Português!


I am environmental journalist from Brazil. I am truly committed in doing my best to help saving the Amazon Rainforest. You´ll find more details about the 5 years I lived there in the video above. Nowadays, I am focusing my work in writing positive and inspiring news. Next month I´ll be launching a blog in partnership with Portal Virgula, in Brazil, called Unimundo21. I also started the Reconnection Amazon Rainforest Project, where I take people to the forest and do deep ecology with them, so they will be able to open their hearts to reconnect emotionally with it. Deep ecology is a philosophy inspired by Mahatma Gandhi that teaches us how to be in a much stronger connection within ourselves, nature and the world. I do this because I believe that the affection between people and the Amazon is very effective and a way of saving it from destruction.

The idea of applying for a Masters degree in Holistc Science at Schumacher College came as a suggestion from Satish Kumar. He is a 78 year old Indian activist, editor of Ressurgence magazine and founder of Schumacher College. He told me that the school could be able to give me some scholarship and that this studies would be really helpful to my work in the Amazon. So I applied. The Master's starts at September, 2015, and I will only be able to make it if you support me. It costs £ 22, 591. My savings + some donations I got + bursaries = £ 8500. That's why I am asking £ 14,000. 

Why it is so important for me that I do this Masters degree?

It will teach me new and very important skills, so I'll be able to work even better in behalf of the Amazon and it's people; it will open more doors for talks and classes to schools around the world; I´ll be able to share scientific information in a very nice way; I´ll become better in deep ecology; It will certainly be very important to my new way of doing journalism.  My dream is that the Reconnection Amazon Rainforest Project is all over the world. Imagine many people practicing deep ecology in the forest and reconnecting emotionally with it. I will work for that. 

*

Things that I've done for the Amazon, so you have an idea of my commitment:

I moved to the Amazon, worked with great NGO's, I wrote numerous reports, organized two TEDx events in the Amazonian region (the TEDxVer-o-Peso), I have been giving talks about the rainforest, started the Reconnection Amazon project, I am involved on a documentary called 'What is the Amazon forest?',  I am about to launch a video blog called 'Dangers of the Jungle', it's an educational project; I am interviewing great spiritual leaders and brilliant minds asking them the importance of creating affection towards the Amazon. I interviewed Sri Prem Baba, Satish Kumar, Charles Einsenstein and John Croft. Along the years I have been doing this and much more.

No matter which part of the world you are, the Amazon forest affects your life, my life, everyone’s life. I hope one day you can come to the forest, but if you can’t, I ask you to hold in your heart that, by being part of this project with me, you will be supporting the rainforest because, while I’m alive, I’ll always do my best to protect it. 

AMAZON RAINFOREST *

From the top, soil or water, the Amazon is an impact to the eyes. For its 6.9 million square kilometers in nine South American countries (Brazil, Bolivia, Peru, Colombia, Ecuador, Venezuela, Guyana, Suriname and French Guiana) spreads a biodiversity without parallel. It is there that lives half of the terrestrial species on the planet. In Brazil, it comprises about 60% of the country.

With global warming and climate change threatening to change patterns on a worldwide scale, it is time for us to take a better look at the environmental services provided by the rainforest before it is too late. In November, 2014, Prof. Antonio Nobre released a graphic scientific analysis on the future climate of the Amazon rainforest, stressing the importance of taking immediate action not only to preserve the remaining forest but even to replant degraded areas. He warns that failure to do so will have drastic long-term effects.

Also, the deforestation is increasing. 

According to Imazon, the most respected Institute in Brazil that tracks the destruction in the Brazilian Amazon, deforestation has increased 282% from February 2014 to the same month on 2015. In the last 40 years we have been destroyed 763,000 square kilometers of the rainforest, the equivalent to almost 22% of its original size (an area larger than Germany, Italy and Portugal combined!).


The combination of deforestation with global warming is drying the flying rivers and reducing the role of the Amazon, as The Guardian newspaper published, ‘as a giant water pump, releasing billions of litres of humidity from the trees into the air in the form of vapour’. It´s time to do everything we can to protect it. 


*with information from Greenpeace and The Flying Rivers Project

If you want to know me better...

My websites:

Reconexao Amazonia - http://www.reconexaoamazonia.com/

Coaching de palestras - http://www.coachingdepalestras.com/

My TEDxTalk, at TEDxRibeirao: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yjOTUbzdWI4

TEDxVer-o-Peso: http://tedxveropeso.com.br/

https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/TEDx_Ver-o-Peso

Some links of the news I published:

http://menos1lixo.virgula.uol.com.br/cronica-a-verdade-sobre-a-amazonia-so-leia-se-voce-tiver-coragem/

http://planetasustentavel.abril.com.br/noticia/atitude/conteudo_271156.shtml

http://bonsfluidos.uol.com.br/noticias/capa/saiba-como-atrair-a-prosperidade-e-a-identificar-crencas-que-impedem-voce-de-conquistar-seus-sonhos.phtml

http://amazonwatch.org/news/2011/0615-protest-the-belo-monte-dam

Interviews I gave to the Brazilian media:

  • Folga na Direcao: http://folganadirecao.com.br/caronas-que-inspiram/caronas-que-inspiram-karina-miotto/

  • Adoro! Farm:http://www.farmrio.com.br/adorofarm/tag/karina-miotto/

  • Etc e tal:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sNpZps2eX1k

  • Lu Lacerda:

  • http://lulacerda.ig.com.br/o-empresario-calainho-esta-mais-leve-saiba-o-porque/

Linked in profile: https://br.linkedin.com/pub/karina-miotto/19/160/771

Special thanks for all of your support since the first minute...

Charles Einsentein, speaker and author of Sacred Economics, among others, for believing in my dream and listening to my soul

Ikku Ma, teacher and oceanographer - for being together with faith and for your generosity

John Quigley, aerial artist - for being such a friend and for the numerous times we worked together in behalf of the rainforest

Matheus Jung, world traveler, engineer and videomaker - for your friendship and partnership on making the movie possible!

Stephan Harding, head of Holistic Science at Schumacher College - for believing in my work, my capacities and my love for the Amazon. For supporting me in so many ways…!

Sam Chevallier, environmental educator - for your friendship, for the good vibes, for the walks

Satish Kumar, founder of Schumacher College - for inviting me to take a risk and apply for the Masters degree in Holistic Science in the last minute! The one who started this whole new story in my life...

And everyone else that is supporting me! Special thanks also to Liz, Robert, Brian, John and Ikku that donated money to the project even before this campaign started. 
+ my family.
Thank you SO much to everyone that works in behalf of the Amazon Rainforest!
*

Português

Olá! Sou uma jornalista ambiental profundamente comprometida em fazer o meu melhor para ajudar a salvar a Amazônia. Você encontra mais detalhes sobre quem sou, minha trajetória de cinco anos na floresta e o que faço atualmente no vídeo acima (se as legendas em Português não aparecerem, você pode optar por ver o filme diretamente do Youtube. Clique em Youtube e depois em um ícone à direita para poder ler as legendas). Segue aqui tb o link do vídeo: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qcUAhmkT4Go

Atualmente, meu foco de trabalho está em fazer jornalismo de notícias positivas e você poderá ler as coisas que escrevo no blog Unimundo21, que será lançado em breve, fruto de uma parceria com o Portal Vírgula. Também tenho trabalhado para levar pessoas para a floresta amazônica para que elas sintam a floresta e, por meio dela, passem a se conhecer melhor. É uma viagem experiencial que promove autoconhecimento. Faço isso porque acredito que a reconexão amorosa com a Amazônia é fundamental para salvá-la. 

A ideia do mestrado na Schumacher College veio do fundador da escola, Satish Kumar. Ele tem 78 anos e também é editor da revista Ressurgence. Ele me sugeriu aplicar e disse que os estudos na Schumacher fortaleceriam muito minha atuação em prol da Amazônia. 

Eu apliquei, fui aceita. O mestrado custa £ 22,591. Minhas economias, a bolsa de estudos que ganharei da Schumacher + doações que recebi totalizam £ 8, 500. Por isso, preciso de £ 14,000 para conseguir estudar.

Você pode contribuir com este mestrado por meio de contribuição financeira ou de divulgação - tudo é válido!

1 libra = 5 reais. Você pode tanto escolher o valor das recompensas, começando por 10 libras (50 reais) ou então escolher o valor que quiser.

Se você não puder doar, você pode torcer, compartilhar com seus amigos, fazer 1 minuto de silêncio por dia pela floresta...de novo, tudo é válido.

Tenho até dia 26 de setembro para ter esse dinheiro e, assim, poder começar o mestrado em 2015.

E como este mestrado vai me apoiar em meu trabalho pela Amazônia?

Vou aprender novas ferramentas para ensinar a ciência de maneira lúdica e fácil de ser compreendida por pessoas de todas as idades, incluindo jovens e crianças; vou ampliar minha atuação como educadora e palestrante em escolas e universidades; vou aprimorar minhas técnicas para facilitar a reconexão das pessoas com a natureza; na Schumacher College com certeza vou encontrar muitas pautas incríveis para poder compartilhar com meus leitores; vou trabalhar para expandir o Reconexão Amazônia para outras partes do mundo. Quanto mais pessoas amarem e se reconetarem emocionalmente com a Amazônia, melhor.

Para você ter uma ideia do meu comprometimento com a Amazônia, por causa dela, eu...

Mudei de São Paulo para Manaus e Belém. Foram 5 anos morando na região; co-organizei dois eventos TEDx no Pará, o TEDxVer-o-Peso; dou palestras e aulas sobre a floresta para escolas e eventos; estou fazendo um documentário chamado ´O que é Amazônia´ e vou lançar um vídeo blog chamado Perigos na Selva, ambos com fins educacionais; tenho entrevistado líderes espirituais e mentes brilhantes sobre a importância da reconexão amorosa com a Amazônia. Já entrevistei Satish Kumar, Sri Prem Baba, Charles Einsestein, John Croft e esta lista ainda vai crescer.

Não importa em qual parte do mundo você está. A Amazônia afeta a vida de todos os seres do planeta. Enquanto eu viver nesta Mãe Terra, darei o meu melhor para protegê-la e despertar o amor das pessoas por ela.

Sobre a Amazônia

Do alto, do solo ou da água, a Amazônia é um impacto para os olhos. Por seus 6,9 milhões de quilômetros quadrados em nove países sul-americanos (Brasil, Bolívia, Peru, Colômbia, Equador, Venezuela, Guiana, Suriname e Guiana Francesa) espalha-se uma biodiversidade sem paralelos. A Amazônia ocupa 60% do nosso país.


Mudanças climáticas estão aí e esta é uma das razões para protegermos a Amazônia antes que seja tarde demais. A seca em São Paulo comprova que o desmatamento já está alterando gravemente os rios voadores, responsáveis por levar parte da chuva que cai sobre a cidade, entre outras regiões. Esta é só a ponta do iceberg. 

A destruição tem aumentado


Dada a enorme importância da floresta, o desmatamento infelizmente tem aumentado a passos largos e rápidos. Eu diria até ferozes. De acordo com o Imazon, uma das mais respeitadas organizações que monitoram a floresta, o desmatamento subiu horrendos 282% de fevereiro de 2014 para o mesmo mês em 2015. Em 40 anos, já foram destruídos 22% de floresta, uma área maior do que a Alemanha, Portugal e Itália juntos. Precisamos fazer todo o possível para proteger a Amazônia. 

Como lembra o cientista Antonio Nobre, muito sabiamente, "a Amazônia é insubstituível".

Te convido a entrar nessa junto comigo!

Para você me conhecer melhor...

Meus sites:

Reconexão Amazônia - http://www.reconexaoamazonia.com/#!inicio/ctys

Coaching de palestras - http://www.coachingdepalestras.com/

My TEDxTalk, at TEDxRibeirao: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yjOTUbzdWI4

TEDxVer-o-Peso: http://tedxveropeso.com.br/

https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/TEDx_Ver-o-Peso

Algumas reportagens que publiquei:

http://menos1lixo.virgula.uol.com.br/cronica-a-verdade-sobre-a-amazonia-so-leia-se-voce-tiver-coragem/

http://planetasustentavel.abril.com.br/noticia/atitude/conteudo_271156.shtml

http://bonsfluidos.uol.com.br/noticias/capa/saiba-como-atrair-a-prosperidade-e-a-identificar-crencas-que-impedem-voce-de-conquistar-seus-sonhos.phtml

http://amazonwatch.org/news/2011/0615-protest-the-belo-monte-dam

Interviews I gave to the Brazilian media:

  • Folga na Direcao: http://folganadirecao.com.br/caronas-que-inspiram/caronas-que-inspiram-karina-miotto/

  • Adoro! Farm:http://www.farmrio.com.br/adorofarm/tag/karina-miotto/

  • Etc e tal:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sNpZps2eX1k

  • Lu Lacerda:

  • http://lulacerda.ig.com.br/o-empresario-calainho-esta-mais-leve-saiba-o-porque/

Linked in profile: https://br.linkedin.com/pub/karina-miotto/19/160/771

Obrigada especial a todos que me apoiaram desde o primeiro minuto:

Charles Einsentein, palestrante e autor de vários livros, entre eles Sacred Economics, por acreditar no meu sonho e sacar o quanto as minhas células de fato trabalham pela floresta!

Ikku Ma, professor e oceonógrafo, por estar junto com fé e generosidade!

John Quigley, artista de banners humanos incríveis, por ser um grande amigo e por todas as vezes que trabalhamos juntos pela floresta!

Matheus Jung, viajante, engenheiro e viodeomaker, por sua amizade e enorme parceria para fazer o video!

Stephan Harding, diretor do mestrado em Ciências Holísticas, por acreditar em meu trabalho, minha capacidade e meu amor pela Amazônia! Valeu por tudo!

Sam Chevallier, educator ambiental, por sua amizade, trocas e caminhadas!

Satish Kumar, fundador da Schumacher College, por ter me convidado a aplicar para o mestrado no último minuto e, assim, ter me ajudado a escrever mais esta história...! 

A todos que tem me apoiado e, com muita gratidão, a Liz, Robert, Brian, John e Ikku que, juntos, fizeram as primeiras doações financeiras antes mesmo do crowdfunding começar.

+ minha família

Obrigada a todos que trabalham pela Amazônia!
story_txt:
Clique aqui para ler a versão em Português!
I am environmental journalist from Brazil. I am truly committed in doing my
best to help saving the Amazon Rainforest. You´ll find more details about the 5
years I lived there in the video above. Nowadays, I am focusing my work in
writing positive and inspiring news. Next month I´ll be launching a blog in partnership with Portal Virgula, in Brazil, called Unimundo21. I
also started the Reconnection Amazon Rainforest Project, where I take people
to the forest and do deep ecology with them, so they will be able to open their hearts to reconnect emotionally with
it. Deep ecology is a
philosophy inspired by Mahatma Gandhi that teaches us how to be in
a much stronger connection within ourselves, nature and the world. I do
this because I believe that the affection between people and the Amazon is very
effective and a way of saving it from destruction.The
idea of applying for a Masters degree in Holistc Science at Schumacher College
came as a suggestion from Satish Kumar. He
is a 78 year old Indian activist, editor of Ressurgence magazine and founder of
Schumacher College. He told
me that the school could be able to give me some scholarship and that this studies would be really helpful to my
work in the Amazon. So I applied. The Master's starts at September, 2015, and I will only be able to make
it if you support me. It
costs £ 22, 591. My savings + some donations I got + bursaries =
£ 8500. That's why I am asking £ 14,000. Why it is so important for
me that I do this Masters degree? It
will teach me new and very important skills, so I'll be able to work even
better in behalf of the Amazon and it's people; it will open more doors for talks and classes to schools around the
world; I´ll be able to share scientific information in
a very nice way; I´ll become better in deep ecology; It will certainly
be very important to my new way of doing journalism.  My dream is that the
Reconnection Amazon Rainforest Project is all over the world. Imagine many people
practicing deep ecology in the forest and reconnecting emotionally with it. I will work for that. *Things
that I've done for the Amazon, so you have an idea of my commitment: I
moved to the Amazon, worked with great
NGO's, I wrote numerous reports, organized two TEDx events in the Amazonian region (the TEDxVer-o-Peso), I have been giving
talks about the rainforest, started the Reconnection Amazon project, I am
involved on a documentary called 'What is the Amazon forest?',  I am about to launch a video blog
called 'Dangers of the Jungle', it's an educational project; I am
interviewing great spiritual leaders and brilliant minds asking them the
importance of creating affection towards the Amazon. I interviewed
Sri Prem Baba, Satish Kumar, Charles Einsenstein and John Croft. Along the years I have
been doing this and much more.No matter which part of the
world you are, the Amazon forest affects your life, my life, everyone’s life. I
hope one day you can come to the forest, but if you can’t, I ask you to hold in
your heart that, by being part of this project with me, you will be supporting the rainforest because,
while I’m alive, I’ll always do my best to protect it. AMAZON RAINFOREST *
From the top, soil or
water, the Amazon is an impact to the eyes. For its 6.9 million square
kilometers in nine South American countries (Brazil, Bolivia, Peru, Colombia,
Ecuador, Venezuela, Guyana, Suriname and French Guiana) spreads a biodiversity
without parallel. It is there that lives half of the terrestrial species on the
planet. In Brazil, it comprises about 60% of the country.


With global warming and
climate change threatening to change patterns on a worldwide scale, it is time
for us to take a better look at the environmental services provided by the
rainforest before it is too late. In November, 2014, Prof. Antonio Nobre
released a graphic scientific analysis on the future climate of the Amazon
rainforest, stressing the importance of taking immediate action not only to
preserve the remaining forest but even to replant degraded areas. He warns that
failure to do so will have drastic long-term effects.
Also, the deforestation is
increasing. 

According to Imazon, the
most respected Institute in Brazil that tracks the destruction in the Brazilian
Amazon, deforestation has increased 282% from February 2014 to the same month
on 2015. In the last 40 years we have been destroyed 763,000 square
kilometers of the rainforest, the equivalent to almost 22% of its original size
(an area larger than Germany, Italy and Portugal combined!).

The combination of deforestation with global warming is drying the flying rivers and reducing the role of the Amazon, as The Guardian newspaper published, ‘as a giant water pump, releasing billions of litres of humidity from the trees into the air in the form of vapour’. It´s time to do everything we can to protect it. 



*with information from Greenpeace and The Flying Rivers Project
If you want to know me better...
My websites: 
Reconexao Amazonia - http://www.reconexaoamazonia.com/
Coaching de palestras - http://www.coachingdepalestras.com/
My TEDxTalk, at TEDxRibeirao: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yjOTUbzdWI4
TEDxVer-o-Peso: http://tedxveropeso.com.br/
https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/TEDx_Ver-o-Peso
Some links of the news I published:
http://menos1lixo.virgula.uol.com.br/cronica-a-verdade-sobre-a-amazonia-so-leia-se-voce-tiver-coragem/
http://planetasustentavel.abril.com.br/noticia/atitude/conteudo_271156.shtml
http://bonsfluidos.uol.com.br/noticias/capa/saiba-como-atrair-a-prosperidade-e-a-identificar-crencas-que-impedem-voce-de-conquistar-seus-sonhos.phtml
http://amazonwatch.org/news/2011/0615-protest-the-belo-monte-dam

Adoro! Farm:http://www.farmrio.com.br/adorofarm/tag/karina-miotto/
Etc e tal:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sNpZps2eX1k
Lu Lacerda:
http://lulacerda.ig.com.br/o-empresario-calainho-esta-mais-leve-saiba-o-porque/

Linked in profile: https://br.linkedin.com/pub/karina-miotto/19/160/771
Special thanks for all of your support since the first minute...
Charles Einsentein, speaker and author of Sacred Economics, among others, for believing in my dream and listening to my soul
Ikku Ma, teacher and oceanographer - for being together with faith and for your generosity
John Quigley, aerial artist - for being such a friend and for the numerous times we worked together in behalf of the rainforest
Matheus Jung, world traveler, engineer and videomaker - for your friendship and partnership on making the movie possible!
Stephan Harding, head of Holistic Science at Schumacher College - for believing in my work, my capacities and my love for the Amazon. For supporting me in so many ways…! 
Sam Chevallier, environmental educator - for your friendship, for the good vibes, for the walks 
Satish Kumar, founder of Schumacher College - for inviting me to take a risk and apply for the Masters degree in Holistic Science in the last minute! The one who started this whole new story in my life...And everyone else that is supporting me! Special thanks also to Liz, Robert, Brian, John and Ikku that donated money to the project even before this campaign started. 
+ my family.

Thank you SO much to everyone that works in behalf of the Amazon Rainforest!

*

story:
AIM: To procure 4000 square yards of land to provide residential facilities for 200 underprivileged children from Uttarakhand (India).

OUR VISION: Purkal Youth Development Society (PYDS) was started by Mr. GK Swamy with the aim of enhancing the lives of the disadvantaged rural youth in the lower Himalayas by providing them access to holistic education. From its humble beginnings with 4 children in 1998, the organisation now caters to the needs of over 400 children from 35 villages surrounding Purkal, Uttarkhand (India). All the children are provided with world-class education, health care and proper nutritious meals throughout the day. All these facilities are completely free of any costs for all the children.

To further its mission of empowering the rural community through education, PYDS now seeks to provide residential facilities to its students. Our students come from economically disadvantaged households with illiterate family often not being able to make ends meet. Their home are dark and congested spaces that are neither conducive for studies nor help in the holistic development of the child.                 

In our accompanying video, watch Elin Kerketta from eighth grade talk about her dream to be a designer. She lives in a tin shack in the middle of the forest. Life in a single room without electricity is beset with difficulties. PYDS is helping children like her by providing them with a hostel where they will receive the care and guidance that will enable them to take baby steps towards a better future.

By providing the children with a residential facility, we wish to provide an environment that will foster better physical, mental and social development of the child. We intend to provide an enabling environment and nurture our students’ growth in a holistic manner, so that they may excel in their lives. These underprivileged children have amazing potential to succeed in life, but without proper care and mentoring their talents may go to waste.

WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU? As a small not-for-profit organisation, there is not much we can offer by way of tangible, materialistic gifts. But we hope to convey our gratitude to our donors through meaningful long-term rewards.

Each donor will receive a personalized thank-you note from our students. Apart from this, we have set rewards at different levels of donations. Our rewards are listed in the 'Perks' section.

YOUR DONATION WILL BE TAX DEDUCTIBLE (for Indian citizens). 

US Nationals can also enjoy Federal Tax Exemption by sending their cheques written in favor of "Youth Development Project Inc." to Mr. Brittan Pasloske at 8700 Crest View Road, Austin, TX  78737-1205. You may email him at bpasloske@gmail.com. 

This is our first campaign for the purchase of land for the construction of a hostel. Once we collect this amount, we will make the down payment and enter into an agreement for the purchase. We will need to raise more money to complete the deal. This will be done through subsequent campaigns.

We request all of you to donate to support our cause and spread the word!

AIM: To procure 4000 square
yards of land to provide residential facilities for 200 underprivileged
children from Uttarakhand (India). 
OUR VISION: Purkal Youth
Development Society (PYDS) was started by Mr. GK Swamy with the aim of

humble beginnings with 4 children in 1998, the organisation now caters to
the needs of over 400 children from 35 villages surrounding Purkal,
Uttarkhand (India). All the children are provided with world-class education, health
care and proper nutritious meals throughout the day. All these facilities are completely
free of any costs for all the children.To further its mission of empowering the rural community
through education, PYDS now seeks to provide residential facilities to
its students. Our students come from economically disadvantaged households
with illiterate family often not being able to make ends meet. Their home
are dark and congested spaces that are neither conducive for studies nor help
in the holistic development of the child.                 In our accompanying video, watch Elin Kerketta from eighth grade talk about her dream to be a designer. She lives in a tin shack in the middle of the forest. Life in a single room without electricity is beset with difficulties. PYDS is helping children like her by providing them with a hostel where they will receive the care and guidance that will enable them to take baby steps towards a better future.By
providing the children with a residential facility, we wish to provide an
environment that will foster better physical, mental and social development of
the child. We intend to provide an enabling environment and nurture our
students’ growth in a holistic manner, so that they may excel in their lives. These
underprivileged children have amazing potential to succeed in life, but without
proper care and mentoring their talents may go to waste.
WHAT
IS IN IT FOR YOU? As
a small not-for-profit organisation, there is not much we can offer by way of
tangible, materialistic gifts. But we hope to convey our gratitude to our
donors through meaningful long-term rewards.
Each donor will
receive a personalized thank-you note from our students. Apart from this, we
have set rewards at different levels of donations. Our rewards are listed
in the 'Perks' section.
YOUR DONATION WILL BE TAX DEDUCTIBLE (for Indian
citizens). 
US Nationals can also enjoy Federal Tax Exemption by
sending their cheques written in favor of "Youth Development Project
Inc." to Mr. Brittan
Pasloske at 8700 Crest View Road, Austin,
TX  78737-1205. You may email him at bpasloske@gmail.com. 
This is our first campaign for the purchase of land for the construction of a hostel. Once we collect this amount, we will make the down payment and enter into an agreement for the purchase. We will need to raise more money to complete the deal. This will be done through subsequent campaigns.We request all of you to donate to support our cause and spread the word!

story:
Les Jardins de la Réflexion

      Los Jardines del Pensamiento

    Thought Gardens

Rassemblons une communauté interculturelle de réflexion sur des questions contemporaines

''Qu'un péruvien réagisse à la réflexion d'un belge francophone sur la façon dont la conquête spatiale a transformé certaines façons d'appréhender la réalité, et qu'un néo-zélandais s'étonne de la manière dont les deux envisagent la question.

Tout cela sans qu'aucun des trois ne parle la langue des autres.

Ils ont en commun l'intérêt pour le thème et la volonté de nourrir leur réflexion en ouvrant le champ des points de vue.''

C'est tout le projet des Jardins de la réflexion.

LesJardins de la réflexion seront un site où des réflexions sur des questions contemporaines sont poursuivies entre personnes issues de différentes aires linguistiques, à commencer par les aires française, anglaise et espagnole.

L'interculturalité est au cœur des Jardins de la réflexion : L'interculturalité, ce n'est pas que tous s'expriment en une seule langue, mais que toutes les langues, avec leur génie propre, puissent communiquer entre elles. Internet parle une grande diversité de langues. Les Jardins favorisent la mise en relation d'internautes s'exprimant en différentes langues sans comprendre nécessairement celles de leurs interlocuteurs

Le principe :

Des dissertations (< 2500 mots) seront simultanément publiées dans ces langues, auxquelles des commentaires (<400 mots) et d'autres dissertations répondront, afin de faire avancer la réflexion. Les Jardins de la réflexion offrent à leurs membres contributeurs un travail éditorial comme la traduction dans toutes les langues en usage dans les jardins au moment de la publication.

Ces Jardins sont une agora  où débattre avec intelligence, raison, ouverture d'esprit et bienveillance, de grands sujets relatifs à l'Homme et à la planète. Pas un site où poster des ''lolcats'', un véritable lieu de production intellectuelle.

Pour qui sont les Jardins de la réflexion ?

Destinés aux ''honnêtes hommes'' à travers le monde,Les Jardins de la réflexion sont dédiés à ses membres, simples lecteurs ou contributeurs (auteurs de dissertations et de commentaires). Tous ont souscrit à une formules d'abonnement.

Ces abonnements ont pour vocation la pérennité, le rayonnement et le développement des Jardins de la réflexion en vue d'offrir un service toujours plus interculturel, universel et efficace.

Les abonnements ont aussi pour vocation de développer et faire vivre un réseau international autonome d'intellectuels hors institutions.

Votre aide?

Les Jardins de la réflexion sont un concept révolutionnaire de mise en relation à l'échelle de l'humanité pour réfléchir ensemble.

Qui d'autre que vous, donateurs, enthousiastes et généreux donnerait l'opportunité à un concept sans précédent de devenir une réalité ?

    Vos dons seront la preuve tangible de la pertinence d'un concept favorisant une plus large ouverture de la communication entre les hommes à l'échelle de la planète. Nous comptons donc pleinement sur votre discernement.

  • Tout est prêt : la maquette et les idées, les fichiers d'adresses et les dissertations inaugurales. Il ne reste qu'à passer à la mise en ligne. Votre aide permettra de faire fonctionner les Jardins pendant 18 mois, le temps d'atteindre l'autonomie financière avec un nombre suffisant d'abonnés.

A quoi votre aide est-elle destinée ?

La somme levée servira à financer pendant la période de montée en puissance:

  • les outils, les services pour la mise en œuvre de la stratégie éditoriale, les traductions

  • Le développement de la plate-forme internet, les achats d'outils et de services

  • Le développement de la visibilité des Jardins

Ensemble,donnons vie à ce rêve :

Dans dix ans, Les Jardins de la réflexion atteindront des internautes issus des 10 principales aires linguistiques, soit 85 % de tous les utilisateurs du web autour de la planète et devenir ainsi une communauté interculturelle de réflexion sur les questions contemporaines de référence.

En quelques indicateurs, Les Jardins de la réflexion dans 10 ans :

  • Les 10 principales langues d'utilisateurs du web en usage sur le site (Anglais, Chinois, Espagnol, Arabe, Portugais, Japonnais, Russe, Allemand, Français, Malais ou Coréen)

  • plus de 100 000 membres lecteurs et contributeurs

  • 100 nouveaux thèmes de réflexion ouverts par an

  • 10 000 000 d'inscrits

100 000 membres actifs, sur une planète de 7 milliards d'individus :

l'objectif est réaliste, nous le réaliserons grâce à vous !

Los Jardines del pensamiento

Una comunidad intercultural de reflexión sobre temas contemporáneos

«Que un peruano pueda responder a la reflexión de un belga francófono sobre la forma en que la conquista espacial ha transformado la forma de aprehender la realidad o que un neozelandés se sorprenda con la manera con la que ambos enfocan la cuestión.

Y todo esto sin que ninguno de los tres hable el idioma de los demás.

Lo que tienen en común es el interés por el tema y la voluntad de alimentar su reflexión abriéndose a nuevos puntos de vista».

Este es el proyecto Jardines del Pensamiento

Jardines del Pensamiento será una página web en la que se podrán presentar reflexiones sobre temas contemporáneos para comentarlos con personas pertenecientes a diferentes ámbitos lingüísticos, empezando por los hablantes de francés, inglés y español.

Jardines del Pensamiento está basado en la interculturalidad: La interculturalidad no consiste en que todos se expresen en un único idioma sino que todas las lenguas, manteniendo su propia esencia, puedan comunicarse entre ellas. Internet habla una gran diversidad de idiomas. Jardines favorece el contacto de internautas que se expresan en diferentes lenguas sin tener que comprender necesariamente la de sus interlocutores.

La base: Se publicaran disertaciones (< 2.500 palabras) en estos idiomas simultáneamente, a las que se podrá responder con comentarios (< 400 palabras) y otras disertaciones y así impulsar la reflexión. Jardines del Pensamiento ofrece a sus miembros colaboradores un trabajo editorial, como la traducción a todos los idiomas en uso en los Jardines en el momento de la publicación.

Estos Jardines serán un ágora en la que se podrá debatir con inteligencia, racionalidad, amplitud de miras y benevolencia grandes temas relativos al Ser Humano y al planeta. No una web a la que subir «lolcats» (combinación de la fotografía de un gato con un texto humorístico) sino un verdadero lugar de producción intelectual.

¿Para quién son los Jardines del Pensamiento?

Destinados a las personas de bien de todo el mundo, los Jardines del Pensamiento están dedicados a sus miembros, ya sean simples lectores o colaboradores (autores de disertaciones y comentarios). Todos estarán suscritos mediante un abono.

El objetivo de estos abonos es la perennidad, la proyección y el desarrollo de los Jardines del Pensamiento para poder ofrecer un servicio cada vez más intercultural, universal y eficaz.

Los abonos servirán también para desarrollar y dinamizar una red internacional autónoma de intelectuales creada al margen de las instituciones.

¿Cómo puede ayudar?

Los Jardines del Pensamiento es un concepto revolucionario pensado para poner en contacto a la humanidad, para poder llevar a cabo una reflexión conjunta.

¿Quién más, aparte de vosotros, mecenas, entusiastas y generosos daría una oportunidad a este concepto sin precedentes de convertirse en una realidad ?

  • Vuestras donaciones serán la prueba tangible de la pertinencia de un concepto creado para favorecer la apertura de la comunicación entre personas de todo el planeta. Contamos plenamente con vuestro discernimiento.

  • Está todo listo: la maqueta y las ideas, los listados de direcciones y las disertaciones inaugurales. Solo falta subirlo a la red. Con vuestra ayuda los Jardines podrá funcionar durante 18 meses, mientras consigue una autonomía financiera con un número suficiente de abonados.

¿A qué se destinarán vuestras aportaciones?

    1. El dinero reunido servirá para financiar el proyecto durante su periodo de consolidación:

  • Herramientas, servicios y prestaciones de política editorial, traducciones;

  • Desarrollo de la plataforma en Internet, adquisición de herramientas y servicios;

  • Desarrollo de la visibilidad de los Jardines.

Entre todos podemos dar vida a este sueño:

En diez años, los Jardines del Pensamiento llegará a internautas pertenecientes a los 10 principales ámbitos lingüísticos o, lo que es lo mismo, el 85% de todos los usuarios de Internet en todo el mundo, para convertirse en una comunidad intercultural de reflexión sobre los temas contemporáneos de referencia.

Algunos datos sobre los Jardines del Pensamiento y dónde estará dentro de 10 años:

  • Presencia de usuarios de Internet en los 10 idiomas principales de uso en la web (inglés, chino, español, árabe, portugués, japonés, ruso, alemán, francés, malayo o coreano);

  • Más de 100.000 miembros lectores y colaboradores;

  • 100 nuevos temas de reflexión al año;

  • 10.000.000 de inscritos

100.000 miembros activos en un planeta con 7.000 millones de individuos:

el objetivo es realista y contigo lo podemos conseguir

Thought Gardens


Bringing together an intercultural thought community to discuss contemporary issues


"So that a Peruvian may react to a comment by a French-speaking Belgian regarding how space exploration has transformed some aspects of how we view reality, and so that a New-Zealander can feel astonished at the way the two are contemplating the issue.

All of this without any of them speaking the language of the other. What they have in common is their interest in the topic and their desire to develop their own thinking by opening their minds up to different points of view."

This is the central idea behind the Thought Gardens.

The Thought Gardens will be a website where reflections on contemporary questions will be shared between people from different linguistic backgrounds, starting off with French, English and Spanish.

The core of the Thought Gardens is its intercultural aspect. Being intercultural does not mean that we all communicate in one language, but that speakers of all tongues, each with their own ingenuity, can communicate with each other.

A great number of languages are spoken online. The Gardens aim to help web-users connect with each other whilst using their own language and without having to understand the language of those they are speaking to.


The way it works:

  • Essays (< 2500 words) will be simultaneously published in all three languages, and other users will post

  • comments (< 400 words) and other essays in response, so as to build on the initial ideas with opinions from around the world.

The Thought Gardens will both edit and translate the work of its contributors into all of the languages used in the Gardens at the time of publication.

These Gardens are a veritable agora, a place where important subjects relating to mankind and the planet are debated with intelligence, reason, openness and civility.

Rather than another lolcats site, the Gardens are a true space for intellectual contribution.

Who are the Thought Gardens for?


The Thought Gardens are there for its members, either readers or contributors of essays and comments.

Each has signed up for a certain type of membership service. These subscriptions are put in place is to ensure the durability, influence and development of the Thought Gardens, so as to continue offering an ever-more intercultural, universal and efficient service.

The memberships are also there to legitimize and nourish an international network of autonomous intellectuals outside of academic institutions.

Your help

The Thought Gardens are a revolutionary concept aimed at connecting the whole of humanity so that we may share our thoughts.

Who else but you, generous and enthusiastic donors, are better placed to give this innovative concept a chance of becoming an online reality?

Your donations will be the tangible proof that there is need and desire to create a large platform to help men and women across the world communicate with one another.

We are wholly counting on your contributions.

Everything is ready: the design and ideas, the contact lists and inaugural essays.

All that's left is to launch the site. Your contributions will help to keep the Gardens alive for 18 months, the time needed to reach financial autonomy through a sufficient number of members.

What will your contributions be used for?

All the funds raised will be used to fund the following during the initial start-up phase:

the tools and services related to editing and translation development of the online platform, covering the cost of relevant tools and services broadening the Garden's visibility Together, let's make this dream a reality: In 10 years' time, the Thought Gardens will have the capacity to reach web-users in

  • 10 major languages, or

  • 85% of all web-users around the world, and to become an important intercultural community, sharing thoughts on major contemporary issues.

The Thought Gardens in 10 years' time:

  • Top ten online languages used on the site (English, Chinese, Spanish, Arabic, Portuguese, Japanese, Russian, German, French, Malaysian or Korean)

  • more than 100,000 members reading and

  • contributing 100 new thought topics every year

  • 10,000,000 people signed up 100,000 active members on a planet of 7 billion individuals:

It’s a realistic goal, and we can achieve it thanks to you!
