contributors of essays and comments. 

Each
has signed up for a certain type of membership service. These
subscriptions are put in place is to ensure the durability, influence
and development of the Thought Gardens, so as to continue offering an
ever-more intercultural, universal and efficient service. 

The
memberships are also there to legitimize and nourish an international
network of autonomous intellectuals outside of academic institutions.


Your help 

The
Thought Gardens are a revolutionary concept aimed at connecting the
whole of humanity so that we may share our thoughts. 

Who
else but you, generous and enthusiastic donors, are better placed to
give this innovative concept a chance of becoming an online reality? 

Your
donations will be the tangible proof that there is need and desire to
create a large platform to help men and women across the world
communicate with one another. 

We
are wholly counting on your contributions. 

Everything
is ready: the design and ideas, the contact lists and inaugural
essays. 

All
that's left is to launch the site. Your contributions will help to
keep the Gardens alive for 18 months, the time needed to reach
financial autonomy through a sufficient number of members. 

What will your contributions be used for? 

All
the funds raised will be used to fund the following during the
initial start-up phase: 

the
tools and services related to editing and translation development of
the online platform, covering the cost of relevant tools and services
broadening the Garden's visibility Together, let's make this dream a
reality: In 10 years' time, the Thought Gardens will have the
capacity to reach web-users in 



10
	major languages, or 
	


85%
	of all web-users around the world, and to become an important
	intercultural community, sharing thoughts on major contemporary
	issues. 
	


The
Thought Gardens in 10 years' time: 



Top
	ten online languages used on the site (English, Chinese, Spanish,
	Arabic, Portuguese, Japanese, Russian, German, French, Malaysian or
	Korean) 
	


more
	than 100,000 members reading and 
	


contributing
	100 new thought topics every year 
	


10,000,000
	people signed up 100,000 active members on a planet of 7 billion
	individuals: 
	


It’s
a realistic goal, and we can achieve it thanks to you!

story:
Hey there, this is Tim Gilberg — I'm the co-founder of Guitar Jamz along with Marty Schwartz, as well as Next Level Guitar with David Taub. I'm stepping out from "behind the scenes" to tell you about a special project you may want to help me with...

What is it?

Well, it's an amazing non-profit organization that puts guitars and other instruments into the hands of kids who attend schools that can't afford music programs.

Give Music. Because Music Gives Back.

Join 'Slash' (below) and Help Us Today.


“If I didn’t have music education in school, I probably would have ended up in jail or dead. Instead, I ended up in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame!”
Chad Smith, Red Hot Chili Peppers’ drummer

Musicians and Artists Who Support Little Kids Rock


More About Your Perks ...

$1 PERK: Digital Download Guitar Lesson Series



This is an 11-video lesson series that takes any beginning guitarist from holding a pick for the first time to playing songs in just two hours.  This is a 2-hour set of lessons that is part of a package that retails for $49.98.  But you get it immediately for your thoughtful donation.  These are the same teachings that have helped tens of thousands of beginning guitarists just like you pick up a guitar and quickly play songs seamlessly and easily, predictably and beautifully, without guesswork or struggle.  Put them to good use and rock on!!

$9 PERKS: You get the Digital Download Guitar Lesson Series listed in the above perk, PLUS THREE MORE ...


1.  Digital Diploma from the University of Awesomeness

You get a personalized digital diploma from the "University of Awesomeness" with your "Doctorate of Cool."  Suitable for framing of course!

2.  Your Picture on the Virtual Wall of Fame

You'll appear proudly on the Little Kids Rock Virtual Wall of Fame. Come join the crowd!

3.  Twenty-Seven Custom Guitar Emojis

These super-cool images can be used anywhere you want — on Facebook, on your smartphone, or wherever you want to spread the love.


$25 PERK: You get ALL of the above perks, PLUS ...

90-Day Backstage Lesson Pass

You get 90 days of free access to the Next Level Guitar membership site where you can watch 1,600+ video guitar lessons in all styles and genres: blues, rock, soloing, licks, music theory, acoustic, electric, metal, reggae, jazz, country and more.


$100 PERK: You get ALL of the above perks, PLUS ...

1 Year Backstage Lesson Pass

You get a FULL YEAR of free access to the Next Level Guitar membership site where you can watch 1,600+ video guitar lessons in all styles and genres: blues, rock, soloing, licks, music theory, acoustic, electric, metal, reggae, jazz, country and more.


$250 PERK: You get ALL of the above perks, PLUS ...

Lifetime Backstage Lesson Pass

You get free lifetime membership to the Next Level Guitar membership site where you can watch 1,600+ video guitar lessons in all styles and genres: blues, rock, soloing, licks, music theory, acoustic, electric, metal, reggae, jazz, country and more.

$799.00 PERK: You get ALL of the above perks, PLUS a brand new Fender American HSS Stratocaster guitar (only 1 available!)

Only one available!  This is a brand new black Stratocaster electric guitar made in the USA.  Solidbody Electric Guitar with Alder Body, Maple Neck, Rosewood Fingerboard, One Humbucking Pickup, and Two Single-coil Pickups. Beautifully crafted with a rosewood neck, it has a big ol' early '70s head stop and is signed by the whole crew at Next Level Guitar, including David Taub and Tim Gilberg.  Get on board and take home this classic!


$599.00 PERK: You get ALL of the above perks, PLUS an Epiphone Les Paul guitar signed by Marty 

(only 1 available!)


Only one available!  This is a brand new Epiphone Les Paul Stratocaster signed by Marty Schwartz.  A timeless classic, this electric guitar will make for a great-playing guitar or a keepsake you'll want to display forever!


$999.00 PERK: You get ALL of the above perks, PLUS a classic 2013 FSR American standard Stratocaster electric guitar signed by Brett (only 1 available!)


Only one available!  This is a pink super-cool Stratocaster electric guitar signed by Brett Papa.  It has already been set up to perfection and has a slanted Habnero classic pickup.  Play it with gusto and keep as a timeless keepsake forever!

Can’t Contribute Right Now?  You can still help!

We appreciate you taking the time to check out our page, we understand sometimes extra cash is not available, you can still help get kids rocking  by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or Pinterest.  ROCK ON!

What Does Little Kids Rock Do?

Little Kids Rock is dedicated to ensuring that all students have the opportunity to unlock their inner music-maker. That is Little Kids Rock’s mission, and since 2002, they have given more than 400,000 underserved schoolchildren across the U.S. access to fun, engaging, Modern Band music classes and brand new instruments at no cost to the students, teachers, or school districts.


Little Kids Rock trains public school teachers and donates all of the instruments, curricular resources and support they need to ensure that their kids receive the right to rock! What makes Little Kids Rock different is that they do more than just donate instruments like guitars, drums and keyboards; they build lasting music programs that focus on teaching kids to perform, improvise and compose the popular music genres that they already know and love, like rock, pop, blues, hip-hop, country, reggae and R&B.


How it Works


Frequently Asked Questions

Are you a non-profit?  Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?
Yes, littlekidsrock.org is registered as a public 501(c)(3) nonprofit,  Contributions to littlekidsrock.org are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

How can I get a tax deductible receipt?
When you contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution.  This email receipt can be used for tax deductible purposes. For all contributions over $250, you will receive an official receipt for tax-reporting purposes by email after the the campaign ends.

Stretch Goals

$10,000 - Will help Little Kids Rock run two teacher workshops, which will train and equip up to 60 public school teachers with all of the instruments, curricula and support they need to run Modern Band music programs at their schools!

$20,000 - Will help Little Kids Rock run four teacher workshops, which will train and equip up to 120 public school teachers with all of the instruments, curricula and support they need to run Modern Band music programs at their schools!

$50,000 - Will help Little Kids Rock run ten teacher workshops, which will train and equip up to 300 public school teachers with all of the instruments, curricula and support they need to run Modern Band music programs at their schools!

Can I donate from outside the USA?
Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. Unfortunately we can’t accept PayPal, so the way to donate internationally is with a credit card.

What payment methods do you accept?
Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

Large Contributions - How can I make a contribution over $10,000?
The nonprofit payment processor (FirstGiving) that is handling the transactions for this campaign is able to accept direct wire transfers for contributions of $10,000 or more.

story:
Here with your help we will build a little but much needed school


When it's complete, this project will accomplish several powerful objectives:

  • to improve the living and studying conditions of children training to be monks.
  • to lower the rate at which children drop out of school.
  • to help slowing emigration from the extremely poor Lamayuru area to the more developed capital of Ladakh.
  • to help preserve a millenary tradition that is at serious risk of disappearing.

Per gli amici italiani: purtroppo non possiamo creare pagine in lingue diverse, ma se volete contribuire a costruire questa piccola scuola sull'Himalaya, saremo felici di darvi tutte le informazioni. Scriveteci cliccando Contact in fucsia sotto la prima foto. Grazie!
 


For those unfamiliar with the region

The monastery of Lamayuru is one of the most ancient monasterys of Ladakh. Believed to be founded by the scholar Naropa in 1018 and located at a height of 3,510 meters (11,520 ft), it has hosted for almost a millennium a community of the Drikung Kagyu Buddhist order.

Notwithstanding the recent development of some domestic and foreign tourism, the area is still economically very weak. The population depends on livestock (yak, sheep and Pashmina goats) and on the cultivation of barley.

The extremely hard living conditions of the region are driving the young population to leave the valleys, draining the traditional way life and an exceptionally sophisticated and ancient culture.


The school

Since 1985, the monastery has hosted a state school where children receive modern and traditional education. Hindi, English and mathematics are taught along with Sanskrit and ceremonial matters. Most of the children (they currently number 20, aged 6 to 12), come from the remote and extremely poor villages of the surrounding valleys. The Lamayuru Gonpa School is like a second home to them and affords them what is almost certainly their only opportunity of a formal education. 



At the moment, the accommodation this school can offer is, however, precarious at best. Only one room is available to the children, and it has to be used both for teaching and as a hostel. Moreover, this single room lacks hygienic facilities and is part of a building that faces serious risk of collapse. Due to these precarious conditions, during the summer, lessons have to take place outdoors, while during the winter, when the temperature drops well below –20 degrees, the children are left without any serious protection from the cold.



Why Funds are Needed

The building of a new school is urgently needed, as it would permit a better education and better living conditions for these wonderful children.

Our aim is to replace the old building with a new one, with 4 double-use rooms (for teaching and accommodation) washing and toilet facilities.

Raising the number of teaching rooms from 1 to 4 would allow for a sub-division of the children by age group and subject taught, to the educational benefit of all , while the combined residential facilities would give the children a place in which to grow up safely and in a dignified way.

Moreover, a glazed veranda will cover the whole building. This is very important for us in order to deal with the extreme cold of the Himalayan winters, there being no heating facilities!



The project in more detail

The building will consist of 4 double use classrooms/bedrooms (red in the plan below), one office and one guest or store room (green), plus 3 modern toilets with washing facilities (blue).

We plan to lay down strong foundations and to leave room for the future addition of stairs, because we hope to build a second floor in years to come.



Plans have been drawn up by Thinley Zangpo, a Ladakhi civil engineer. He has been working for free (thank you Thinley!).

The material and the building techniques we are planning to employ will all be traditional, because this will lower the construction costs and add to the sustainability of the building.

The wall will be in sun dried brick masonry, the roofing in local type talbu laid over local type round ballies. The flooring of the building will be in wooden planks, finished with mud plaster. Part of the material (wood, cement for the foundations and the material for the veranda) will have to be brought in from Leh, as it is locally unavailable, but the labour, both for the building stage and the maintenance, will be local. As the monastery is located on a hill top and the school area is unreachable by means of mechanical transport, the material will have to be carried by hand.


Who are we

Lama Tashi Dorjai: I am a Ladaki monk and a school teacher. I was born in a tiny village not far from Lamayuru, and lived and studied at the old Lamayuru Gonpa School. That’s why I understand the children's needs and I am so fond of this project. I am also the Monastery Secretary and this allows me to manage the works for the new school.

Chiara Steindler: I am a researcher in International Relations and I live in Florence, Italy. You can google my name to learn more about my work. But, more importantly, I have been travelling a lot on the Himalayas, and when I reached Ladakh, I fell in love with the beauty of this land and the kindness of its people and decided to spend as much time here as possible. In fact, now I am here to help with whatever is needed for the new Lamayuru Gonpa School.

 


But many more people are helping us with our project, among them, John Hunt, CO of the Lotus Flower Trust, he has a huge experience in building schools in remote places and  has been advising us since the beginning;  Ilona Krizhanivska, she is a great photographer from Tajikistan (most of the pictures on this page are hers – that is, the nice ones); Michele Steindler, he is an electronic engineer and lives in Paris, France. Andrea Quercetelli, he is a business consultant from Florence, Italy. He helped us understand many things about the funding for the school.


Where the Money Will Go

Our budget is of $50.000, 10% has been added to cover platform fees, bank/credit card charges, perks and shipment costs for supporters.

Beyond that, all of the funds will be employed for the building of the school, with no administrative or other kind of overheads. The money you donate will go into the bank account of the Lamayuru Monastery and will be used under the supervision of Lama Tashi Dorjai, Secretary of the Monastery. 



That’s about it! 
We are ready to go and will start the works in August this year. Our deadline to have the building ready is October 2016. With each step reached, we'll bring you updates from the field. We don't want to pester you with unwanted mails (we all receive too many!) so we will include you in our mailing list only if you explicitly ask us to. But you will be always able to follow the progress on the Facebook page of the school.


And so we invite you to get involved.

We have a nice variety of perks ready for you, including the colourful good-luck prayer flags, original pictures of the photographer Ilona Krizhanivska, or the Katagh, the white scarf that is used to honour wise men and women.Additionally, for everyone making a donation of $25 or more, we'll include your name on a dedication plaque to be installed in the new school. Maybe it's just me, but I would like to have my name engraved on a school wall surrounded by the Himalayan mountains! But check out the right side of the page for the many ways we will say thank you for your contribution.

Apart from contributing with your credit card, you can also spread the news among your friends and relatives and on social media.

If you are not able to make a financial contribution don't worry at all, that's not the only way to help. If you have a particular skill related to the project or are an experienced teacher, you can join as a volunteer.

story:
Thanks to the few that helped me out with a little road cash in my early days. 

I wished this project could have been as well-funded and immersive as I once dreamed it to be, but two years later I can tell you I did actually visit several communes and communities. Learned a great deal and will try to update this page with my publications about it. 

Find me on Patreon now.

Learned a great deal and will try to update this page with my publications about it. Find me on Patreon now.

story:
“Thew  ord  sare n otsp aced cor rec  tl y”.


While most would do a double take on the above, there are some for whom this sentence structure is the norm. In case you were wondering, the correct version is “The words are not spaced correctly”.

This is just an example of the learning difficulties that dyslexic children face on a daily basis along with the social stigma attached to it.

What is dyslexia?


Dyslexia is a learning disability characterised by trouble reading despite a normal intelligence. Problems may include spelling words, reading quickly, pronouncing words when reading aloud, and understanding what was read.

However, having dyslexia does not mean that one’s ability to learn is below average. In fact, many people with dyslexia are smart and motivated to learn. But not being able to read well can make many areas of learning a problem. Hence, they need to receive help from professional therapists. 


About DAS

The DAS (Dyslexia Association of Singapore) is an organization that was founded in 1991 and aims to build a world class organisation dedicated to helping dyslexic people and those with specific learning differences in Singapore. 

DAS specialist psychologists conduct assessment and diagnosis for preschool students to adults. DAS Educational Therapists and Speech and Language Therapists provide support for over 3000 preschool, primary and secondary school students in 13 centres all over Singapore. 


How can we help?


Specialised Educational Services’ (SES) Group Speech and Language Therapy (SLT) Programme is offered in group settings where students are taught social skills. 
The speech and language therapists aim to build up the child’s fundamental speech and language skills to support his or her development and learning. Therapy is carried out in a child-friendly, lively and bright environment. Language is aided and enhanced through fun and functional activities.



What do we do with your donation?


The following is the funding amount required for students to access the programme.

S$85.60 (USD63.34) =1 hour of intervention per dyslexic child

1 term = 10 weeks= 10 hours= S$856.00 (USD 633.40) per child

1 year= 4 terms = 40 weeks= 40 hours= S$3424.00 (USD2533.60) per child


Our goal is to support 10 children for 1 year of intervention at DAS on 100% funding, which is S$34,240.00 (USD$25,336.00)!


There are thousands of dyslexics who need help just like Bryan and Joe  in Singapore that cannot receive Speech and Language Therapy due to financial difficulties. Thus, we appeal to you to offer a helping hand to us to make a difference in their lives and do what little we can to aid with their difficulties. 

We believe that dyslexia will never be an obstacle in one’s learning journey and it is with love and help that one can overcome all the difficulties on the way to success. It all starts with YOU and YOU can be the difference in their lives! 


Please give the gift of education to a child. Support 1 hour of intervention at the DAS!

story:
I have a crazy idea. I want everyone in the world to be a journalist. You see, journalism is having quite a moment. Everywhere you turn today, someone is creating headline news, using only their cellphone. There is the citizen journalist in Baltimore whose pictures appeared on the cover of TIME magazine. The live Tweets of Ferguson protestors airing on CNN. What will you do when news happens near you? Will you capture it? I hope to teach you how, with MOJOPro.

So…What’s a MOJOPro?

MOJOPro is the world’s first online academy dedicated to teaching mobile journalism to everyday people. I believe everyone has a story. If you have a cellphone, you can share it with the world. It’s not all point, shoot and post though! It takes skill to put together a compelling video or audio documentary that someone will want to view or listen to—all the way through. MOJOPro has a lesson for that. Also, did you know that there are apps and accessories that can make your footage look and sound better? MOJOPro has a lesson for that. Did you know that there are key ways to build relationships with professional journalists who can get your message to a broader audience? Yes, MOJOPro has a lesson for that too.

If you haven't guessed it, MOJO is short for mobile journalist and I have been grooming MOJOs all over the world for the last five years. My name is Allissa Richardson, and I am a mobile journalism professor at Bowie State University, just outside of Washington, DC. I have traveled the globe to teach youth how to shoot and edit video news stories using only an iPod or an iPhone. I have taught girls in South Africa how to report on community issues. I have taught ladies in Morocco to report on their lives as Arab women. I even launched two MOJO Labs at American colleges. The results have been pretty phenomenal. My MOJOs have gotten jobs at leading news organizations, like CNN, BBC and The New York Times. 


As for me, Apple, Inc. named me one of its Distinguished Educators. Also, Harvard University invited me to come to its campus last year, as a journalism fellow. As I was giving my farewell lecture to the students there, the idea for MOJOPro was solidified. I realized that MOJOPro could be my way of expanding my effort as a mobile journalism professor. I can only be in one place at any given time, but launching MOJOPro will allow me to deploy more than two dozen self-paced, online courses to anybody in the world, anytime! MOJOPro students will be able to earn badges, certificates and possible exposure to mainstream media outlets. This is where you can help. 

So...What do you need?

Glad you asked! The beta version of our MOJOPro website launches in September, and my team could use a little help polishing the e-commerce elements of the site before then. In addition to offering online courses, we got the ambitious idea to sell MOJO gear too, so we need a few more team members to help us add on these features. We also need funding for the first leg of our launch tour, which includes stops at the nation’s top journalism schools, so we can demo the MOJOPro platform to students and teachers. We need $10,000 to reach our goal. That buys us several more rounds of coding, editing and publicity planning with our gurus! You can support us at six different levels. Check out the sidebar to your right.

So...Why does this matter?

Your donation helps MOJOPro teach people all over the world how to produce high-quality journalism from their cellphones or tablets. I believe this is the one of the most important new skills to have today, to be a good citizen. Your eyewitness account could make headlines news one day! MOJOPro can teach you how. I hope you join the movement!

story:
¿Qué es Integrando a México?

Integrando a México es un curso de empoderamiento para 35 jóvenes mexicanos de 16 a 18 años de edad que busca ofrecerles una experiencia educativa única que les provea conocimientos y habilidades que los transformen en ciudadanos  y activistas sociales críticos, comprometidos y capaces de llevar a cabo acciones e iniciativas que busquen generar paz y justicia social para sus comunidades y el país entero.

Durante el verano venidero, el equipo de Integrando a México 2015, compuesto por ocho jóvenes de cinco estados diferentes de la República, reunirá a 35 jóvenes entusiastas, idealistas y sensibles de todo el país del 28 de junio al 26 de julio en la ciudad de San Miguel de Allende (Guanajuato) para vivir un curso que transforme sus vidas y contribuya al bienestar de sus comunidades.

El curso consta de seis secciones: Talleres de Agencia de Paz, Proyectos de Servicio Comunitario, Talleres de Problemas Sociales, Talleres de Acción Creativa, Talleres de Participación Ciudadana y Talleres de Gestión de Proyectos Sociales. Cada sección posee una serie de actividades dinámicas basadas en el diálogo, el análisis, la reflexión, la empatía, la solidaridad y la cooperación. A través de ellas, los participantes reciben conocimientos, herramientas y experiencias que los impulsan a trabajar activamente como ciudadanos y activistas sociales en pro del bienestar de sus comunidades, sus regiones y el país entero con la equidad, la justicia social y el respeto y la protección a los derechos humanos como ejes de su labor.

¿Qué necesitamos? ¿Qué obtienes?

La cuota de recuperación por participante del curso es de $5,000.00 MXN, lo cual incluye comida, hospedaje, transporte y materiales por las cuatro semanas. Por ello, con $35,000.00 MXN netos, habiendo descontado las comisiones para IndieGogo y PayPal, tendremos la capacidad de ofrecer al menos siete becas completas a posibles participantes. 


Impacto de Integrando a México

Integrando a México es una experiencia única en la cual los participantes desarrollan aprendizajes y habilidades que los impulsa a ser ciudadanos más analíticos y críticos sobre su entorno que participan activamente en organizaciones y proyectos sociales que abordan asuntos públicos y problemáticas sociales y ambientales de su comunidad y otras comunidades.

Durante las primeras cinco ediciones, 47 facilitadores de 24 países distintos han transformado a más de 170 jóvenes de 23 estados del país en ciudadanos y activistas sociales capaces de transformar su entorno y generar un México más incluyente, equitativo, pacífico y próspero. Con Integrando a México 2015, 35 participantes se unirán a esta red de ciudadanos y activistas jóvenes que buscan un mejor presente y futuro para México. 

Con tu contribución, tendrás un impacto significativo en la vida de sus participantes y la construcción de un mejor presente y futuro para sus comunidades. 


Riesgos y desafíos

En caso de no poder financiar las becas de los participantes, no podremos tener un proceso de selección 100% meritocrático, ya que la capacidad de pago del participante tendría que ser tomada en cuenta para su asistencia al curso. 
Nuestra tarea es dar nuestro mejor esfuerzo en esta campaña para recaudar el dinero suficiente y asegurar un proceso de selección equitativo para jóvenes comprometidos de todo el país.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si no puedes donar a nuestra causa, por favor apóyanos corriendo la voz sobre Integrando a México 2015 y compartiendo esta campaña con todos tus contactos en Facebook, Twitter y por correo. Este apoyo sería muy valioso para nosotros y te lo agradeceríamos mucho.

story:
Stogumber Code Club - We Need Your Help!

My name is James, I'm a web developer and I run the Code Club at a local school in rural Somerset.

Two years ago when we started our code club my company donated 5 Raspberry Pi computers.  It's been great fun learning Scratch and Python programming with them.

Since then our little club has grown and we have moved on to more than just programming.  We are now learning to solder and build simple circuits and robots.


We need supplies!

Last year the good people at Google donated some DIY Gamer Kits, these have been amazing but as our club has grown there are not enough kits to go around:

  • We want to raise £500 to help fund the club for years to come.
  • We would purchase 3 more DIY Gamer Kits (£65 each).
  • We would like to buy 10 Arduino Nano boards (Between £5 - £10 Each) 
  • We would use the remaining money to buy electronic components, solder and safety equipment as we need them.


The Impact

By donating to this project you will be enabling children in a small country primary school to get access to tools they would never normally have the opportunity to use.

Teaching children to program from a young age helps them to develop valuable problem solving skills and helps prepare them for a possible career in the IT industry.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate that's not a problem we are also on the look out for tools and materials we can use.  What we need:

  • Arduino boards
  • Soldering Irons
  • Solder
  • LEDs
  • Resistors
  • Transistors
  • Safety Glasses
  • And much more!

If you could help by donating some equipment please get in contact with us!

story:
Beyond English teaching fellows work in a social enterprise that uses English as a tool to empower global citizens while providing equal access to educational opportunities in Santiago. We provide high quality English classes in Chilean schools to work towards Educational Inclusion. We focus our projects on intercultural exchange, critical thinking education, and global citizenship values.

Each of us seek to impact the communities in which we work. That's why we love to develop community projects that are related to our passions,  and we collaborate with local educational organizations to make the projects a reality.

We want to expand our impact to larger portion of our communities. That's why we need your help! We need to create a fund that will allow us to create greater educational activities for our students and their families.

Your contribution will help Beyond English teaching fellows create meaningful projects that aim to strengthen the communities we work in.

Right now, we have two fun projects related to healthy living. The first one, held at Colegio Golda Meir in Lo Prado, is about making smart choices when eating and cooking. Activities include a conversation about the psychological influence that our food choices have on our emotions and a Master Chef-type competition for the whole family. Our second project, located at Colegio Padre Jose Kentenich in Puente Alto, focuses on the importance of physical activities through a Sports Fair and motivational talks from athletes. We plan to hold these events at the end of May 2015!! 

Your help is very important to make this happen! We need a pool of resources to finance the different initiatives that our fellows propose. Help us to promote healthy living and intercultural exchange through these activities!!!

What we need and what you get

We need $1,500 USD to finance our two events in MAY 2015, plus up to six more projects during the next semester. We encourage your generosity! ;)

The money we collect will be used to:

- Buy materials (such as food and kitchen supplies for the master chef competition)

- Buy awesome prizes for the winners of the competitions (food processors, healthy food vouchers & sporting equipment) 

- For our community project initiatives during the next semester

Please check out our perks! They'll make you feel like you're here with us and make you part of our community of passionate and curious learners. 

If we surpass our goal, the funds will be allocated to our future projects. All to benefit our communities and our teaching fellows who have the privilege of working with them!

Impact

Your contributions will be used to help us make our passions a reality and to adapt them to the needs and interests of the people we work with!

In the past we've completed the following community projects, among others:

-Ski Trip: Children went to a resort and had a ski lesson. They learned a new activity in a challenging environment, all while having fun!  

-Architectura 101: A summer camp where participants learned about architecture and recycling. They built a bench from recycled materials at their school at the end of the camp.

-Los Animales y Yo: An event to teach kids the importance of animal ownership and responsibility. Participants discussed the situation of animals in Chile, went to a cat shelter and then the zoo.

-Taller de Mujeres: Several women came together once a week with our fellows to explore different art forms - belly dancing, mosaics, etc. - and to make connections with people from different walks of life.

-Amigos de Murales: A three day project where participants learned about street art. Check out the mural our amigos painted in our photos!

In each of these projects, everybody left with more than just the main theme - we learned the importance of respect, curiosity and resilience. We hope to continue providing these experiences for both the kids we work with and BE fellows - to expand their worldview and shape global citizens.  

Risk and challenges

If we don't achieve our goal, the quality and scope of the events we do will definitely decrease, but our enthusiasm will still be high. We aim to give the best experiences possible to our students and fellows.

Other ways you can help us

If you can't help us by donating right now you can share this campaign with people who would be interested in supporting us!

Thank you very much!!!

-Taller de Mujeres: Several women came together once a week with our fellows to explore different art forms - belly dancing, mosaics, etc. - and to make connections with people from different walks of life.
-Amigos de Murales: A three day project where participants learned about street art. Check out the mural our amigos painted in our photos!
In each of these projects, everybody left with more than just the main theme - we learned the importance of respect, curiosity and resilience. We hope to continue providing these experiences for both the kids we work with and BE fellows - to expand their worldview and shape global citizens.  
    Risk and challenges

If we don't achieve our goal, the quality and scope of the events we do will definitely decrease, but our enthusiasm will still be high. We aim to give the best experiences possible to our students and fellows.

    Other ways you can help us If you can't help us by donating right now you can share this campaign with people who would be interested in supporting us!
Thank you very much!!!

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Hallo ihr Lieben,

mein Name ist Annika Cost, ich bin 22 Jahre alt und mache gerade meinen Bachelor in Physiotherapie an der Hochschule Fresenius in Frankfurt.

Mein großer Traum ist es, danach für einen Masterstudiengang 2 Jahre nach Australien zu gehen. Um mir diesen Wunsch zu erfüllen habe ich neben meinem Studium zwei Jobs. Ich massiere in einem Hotelspa und gebe viel  Nachhilfe, sowohl über ein Unternehmen als auch privat. Leider ist mein Ziel trotzdem in sehr weiter Ferne, weil die Studiengebühren in Australien sehr hoch sind. Ich hoffe ich werde es schaffen meinen Lebensunterhalt zusammen zu sparen, aber dann bleiben immer noch 50.000€ Studiengebühren übrig, von denen ich 25.000€ über diese Kampagne zusammen bekommen will. Für das restliche Geld werde ich mich um verschiedene Stipendien bewerben. Viele werden sich jetzt fragen warum dann gerade Australien?! Australien oder genauer gesagt „The University of South Australia“ in Adelaide, weil es dort im Fachbereich Physiotherapie einen der besten Masterstudiengänge weltweit gibt und ich der festen Überzeugung bin, dass Australien mir die besten Voraussetzungen bietet um später mal eine gute, erfolgreiche Therapeutin zu sein. Außerdem werden meine zukünftigen Patienten sehr von dieser Ausbildung und meinen Erfahrungen profitieren. Auch, weil mich dieses Abenteuer persönlich sehr viel weiter bringen wird. Vor allem in meinem Beruf halte ich den interkulturellen Austausch für besonders wichtig, da man immer für verschiedene Behandlungsansätze offen sein sollte um eine qualitativ hochwertige Therapie zu gewährleisten. Dieses Projekt ist dafür hervorragend geeignet, weil Australien in der Physiotherapie einer der großen Vorreiter ist und auch im Bereich Forschung schon große Erfolge erzielt hat.

Ich denke, was ich in den zwei Jahren lernen und an Erfahrungen machen kann ist unbeschreiblich und ich würde mich wahnsinnig freuen, wenn ihr mich mit einem kleinen Beitrag die Chance dazu gebt.


Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Selbstverständlich möchte ich gerne so viel wie möglich an alle zurückgeben die bereit sind mich auf meinem Weg zu meinem großen Traum zu unterstützen. Deshalb habe ich mit meinem Chef im Emotionspa gesprochen und zusammen haben wir uns tolle Angebote für euch ausgedacht, damit ihr mich mal persönlich kennen lernen könnt und gleichzeitig eine tolle, entspannte Zeit verbringt. Was genau bei unseren Überlegungen herausgekommen ist, könnt ihr weiter unten unter den einzelnen Perks nachlesen.


Risiken & Herausforderungen


Ich weiß, dass es um sehr viel Geld geht und das Risiko besteht, dass ich es nicht schaffen werde alles zusammen zu bekommen. Um an das restliche Geld zu kommen werde ich mich wie oben beschrieben für verschiedene Stipendien bewerben. Außerdem plane ich selbstverständlich auch in Australien weiterhin neben dem Studium zu arbeiten, was dank einer automatischen Arbeitserlaubnis zum Studentenvisum kein Problem darstellen sollte. Wenn es mir trotzdem nicht möglich sein sollte mein Ziel zu erreichen, wird alles Geld was ich über diese Kampagne erhalte trotzdem in meinen Master fließen, der dann wahrscheinlich in Belgien an der Universität Leuven stattfinden wird. Auch für diesen Master benötige ich Geld für Lebensunterhalt, Materialien und die Studiengebühren. Dafür würde ich das gesammelte Geld einsetzen, falls es nicht für Australien reicht. Trotz des enorm hohen Betrages möchte ich alles versuchen um mir meinen Traum und eine bestmögliche Ausbildung zu erfüllen und hoffe, dass ihr mich bei diesem Vorhaben unterstützt.


Andere Wege wie man helfen kann

Alle die mich auf nicht-finanzielle Art unterstützen wollen, helfen mir unglaublich indem sie über mein Projekt reden und es auf sozialen Netzwerken über das Indigogo Tool, oder auf jede anderen erdenkliche Art und Weise verbreiten.


Tausend, tausend Dank an alle die mir bei diesem Projekt helfen, egal in welcher Form!

story:
Perhaps nowhere is the search for knowledge of the afterlife--and the reaches of the human mind--so driven as in Chicago.  A place of mass tragedy, tremendous emotion, and huge personalities inspired by the best and worst intentions, the city of Al Capone, Jane Addams, H. H. Holmes,  the White City, the first skyscraper, the worst building fire, the deepest depravity of organized crime, the most pivotal mass destruction of a city, the deadliest inland marine disaster :  Today Chicago is a point of pilgrimage for untold numbers of paranormal investigators from around the world.

For 8 years, the Chicago Ghost Conference has been the destination for many of these travelers to come together to meet others who are interested in humanity's greatest questions: Does the soul survive? What can our minds achieve outside of our bodies? And where is life really going? 

We are paranormal researchers: ghost hunters, scientists, mediums, clairvoyants, historians and psychics.  We study the influence of the mind, build radios to talk to the dead, promote the supernatural folklore of cities big and small and research the complex histories of families and properties to find their most tragic secrets--and their meanings for us today.

Each year we have drawn a wonderful group of people from our own circles, but this year we want to extend our reach to draw the many searchers who are out there but don't yet know of this remarkable opportunity to share their questions, ideas and experiences.  

Your sponsorship will help us purchase extended print advertising, create a local television commercial, and purchase radio advertising with local broadcast stations, all with the goal of offering what we have to those outside of our own community and social media, in the hopes of sharing the tremendous experience of paranormal research.
 

If you can't contribute as a sponsor please consider contributing any amount you are able to.  Or spread the word to whoever you can!  That's what our campaign is all about!

 

This event has always been presented by Chicago Hauntings and Ursula Bielski.  Ursula has been a figure in paranormal research in Chicago for 27 years, and Chicago Hauntings a recognized Chicago organization for 13.  Ursula has done work with PBS Chicago, every major cable documentary history and travel station and countless network affiliates.  She holds an M.A. in American Cultural History from Northeastern Illinois University.  You can find her bio here: www.chicagohauntings.com/bio.html

Our websites: www.chicagohauntings.com and www.chicagoghosts.com.

story:
Hello Indiegogoers

Thank you for exploring my campaign, the reason I am making this campaign is because I need some help raising money to support myself this summer while I work my two college internships. Both are at non-profit organizations that are involved with the performing arts, social activism and their local communities. The name of these organizations are Z Space and La Pena and they are located in San Francisco and Berkeley. Z Space is a community theatre venue that hosts shows by independent traveling artists who want to use theatre as a way to inspire more young artists and their communities to keep the arts alive and the second internship is at La Pena, a 40 year old multicultural community center that was established as a hub for young artists and social activists to create art as a way to encourage social activism and social justice, their mission is to promote peace social justice and multicultural understanding through arts education and community action. Both venues are pillars in their communities and for me to have these opportunities is truly an opportunity of a lifetime. 

 My mom is a single Puerto-Rican mother who has been working her ass off for me since I was an infant, she has been my primary supporter during my college years and I can see that despite how far we've come it's becoming tough for her to help me out as much during my college years, especially since she is also the primary supporter for several of our family members. My dad  is very much in my life and I love him dearly  but he has been going through some medical issues that have limited his ability to help me out financially, both of my parents have helped me out as much as they can and the though of having to ask them for more at such a critical point of my academic and professional career makes me feel incredibly uneasy.  I would find work but both internships combined have me working 6 days a week not to mention the fact that Im using my bicycle and public transportation to get from city to city and do NOT feel safe riding around in the late evening to my place in Oakland from some meaningless part time job especially while I am already working two internship jobs.

  It took me so long to work up the courage to create this campaign and to ask complete strangers for donations, I will admit I considered it a desperate move but sooner or later I had to give that up,  give it a shot and just say whats on my mind and in my heart and hope that someone is moved by my story and is compelled to help me out. My family is doing all they can to help but its really tough on them especially since the college I go to is a private University that I have only been able to afford because I am there on a Speech and Debate scholarship; the last thing I want is for me and my college experience to be a burden on them or to be limited because of our inability to afford these basic experiences and expenses.

 Everyone around me says that I should be proud to be the first woman in my family to graduate from college,  but I have to admit its been rather tough on me mentally and emotionally because not very many people in my family can relate to this lifestyle; the emotional and financial concerns that come along with the experience are truly different from anything they can fathom. My mom has some college experience under her belt but had me at such a young age that she was never able to finish, deep down I know that I am not only doing this for myself I am also doing this for her and for all of them. I know that my family and younger cousins admire me and look up to me for doing this and I want to succeed in this experience so that I have something to share with them to inspire them to learn and grow as well. I want to confidently tell them that Yes, there are people out there who will help you and that you don't have to go through financial issues alone. Despite these tough times I love every moment of  this experience and would not trade this experience in for anything. I know it is going to help me inspire my family, my community an the world and for me that is worth every penny.

story:
Who We Are

BRIDGES: Harmony Through Music is an El Sistema inspired, private non-profit organization that launched in 2013 at Cunningham Park Elementary in Vienna, VA. Our mission is to develop the social and academic skills of under-served children and strengthen our community through the pursuit of musical excellence  in an intensive after-school setting.

BRIDGES meets three times a week over the course of 30 weeks during which students receive intensive choral and orchestral instruction from highly qualified teaching artists. In addition, students receive a healthy snack and homework help from volunteer tutors during each session.

Please help to sustain and grow our program as we look forward to YEAR #3!
 

What We Need

Our program costs include sheet music, t-shirts, instrument maintenance, transportation for program trips, and compensation for our highly dedicated teaching artists and staff. All the funding we receive will go directly to paying these costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

If contributing to campaigns like ours is just not your thing, the good news is that there are a lot of other ways to help out!

  • Spread the word: Maybe we're not for you, but someone you know might totally dig what we do so please share!
  • Make an individual contribution: If you're the lone wolf type you can send us a check made out to "BRIDGES" via snail-mail to 8509 Marquette St. Vienna, VA 22180
  • Make a non-monetary donation: If you have something we can use, we'll take it. If you want to volunteer your time, we'll greet you with a smile. If you want to host a fundraiser for us, we'll be there. If you think we would make an awesome community partner for your business or organization, we'll meet you for lunch and maybe even pay! But seriously, if you're interested in any of the above, please email us at:  bridgesharmonythroughmusic@gmail.com
  • Monetary donations are fully tax deductible. Itemized donations are tax deductible as corresponds to IRS guidelines

story:
Fundraising to help the children of Leh

Hi, I'm Sophie. I am 16 years old and I'm studying for my A levels at Gumley House school in Isleworth.  In July, I will be travelling with a organised charity to a remote village called Leh, high up in the Himalayas of india.   It is on a plateau around 3500 meters above sea level!! 

Several years ago Leh was devastated by flash floods. Many homes and buildings were swept away.


Our aim is to raise money to help these remote communities rebuild their lives. These poor, remote communities have little help from many of the larger charities due to their off-the-beaten track location. The charity we are working with targets these hard to reach communities to ensure, they too, get the support they need. 

Our mission is to help with education. We will be working with a team of volunteers and skilled workmen to build a school for the children of Leh. Whilst I am there, I will also be helping to teach the children English and maths, which I am really looking forward to doing.


Please help me raise funds for this worthy cause,  I need to raise a further £2,000. With your help I can get closer to my target. 

Your money  can help us make a difference to the children and families in these remote villages. 

Please donate whatever you can.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read my message.

Sophie x

Registered Charity 1149283

story:
The Earthquake

On April 25, 2015, a powerful earthquake hit Nepal. The disaster killed over 5,000 people and has left thousands of others without resources and susceptible to the harrowing effects of a region without stable infrastructure after a natural disaster of this magnitude.

Nathan Demers and his family live in Pokhara, Nepal, one of the mountainous regions hit by the earthquake. Nathan is an experienced emergency relief organizer and he and his wife, Ganga, have been working with other members of their community to bring relief to the hardest-hit, most remote regions of Nepal. 

He and others have travelled to the regions between Gorkha and Everest to assess the needs of devastated mountain communities. Please consider contributing to their campaign so that they may continue to bring supplies to the people of Nepal.  

What We Need 

We need funds to support the purchasing and distribution of supplies for temporary shelter, medical relief, and rebuilding. The money you donate will be spent directly on:

  • Gas for vehicles to access remote regions of Nepal.
  • Tarps for temporary structures. 
  • Clean drinking water.
  • Medical supplies, including antibiotics.
  • Supplies for construction (mortar, tools, piping, etc.)

The Impact

Survivors of the initial earthquake and the following aftershocks are not free from residual struggles. Monsoon season is starting and people are without shelter. Infrastructure is demolished and sanitation is minimized. The supplies that we are able to purchase with your donations will help us support communities to:  

  • Rebuild their homes. 
  • Repair and improve public infrastructure.
  • Survive in temporarily constructed shelters.
  • Access fresh water and food. 
  • Keep their families dry during monsoon season. 
  • Prevent and manage public health disease outbreaks. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people don't have the means to contribute financially at this time. That's ok. You can still help. 

Please share this page on your social media site to help get the word out. 

Thank you!

Clean drinking water.
Medical supplies, including antibiotics.
Supplies for construction (mortar, tools, piping, etc.)    The Impact Survivors of the initial earthquake and the following aftershocks are not free from residual struggles. Monsoon season is starting and people are without shelter. Infrastructure is demolished and sanitation is minimized. The supplies that we are able to purchase with your donations will help us support communities to:    Rebuild their homes. 
Repair and improve public infrastructure.
Survive in temporarily constructed shelters.
Access fresh water and food. 
Keep their families dry during monsoon season. 
Prevent and manage public health disease outbreaks.     
Other Ways You Can Help

 We understand that some people don't have the means to contribute financially at this time. That's ok. You can still help. 
Please share this page on your social media site to help get the word out. 
Thank you!

story:
Local youth need our help

Every child should have the chance to go to camp, where they can learn new skills, spend time with peers and build confidence. But not all kids in our community will have access to the opportunity. That’s why, in 2014, a group of passionate community builders, led by Waterloo Region native Michael Hecktus came together to help underprivileged and at risk youth, so they could have an opportunity to attend a full week of camp at Chicopee Ski & Summer Resort.

How can you help?

If 40 people step up to sponsor a youth for $250, that means we can send 40 kids to camp this year!

Our committee is also working hard to find community partners AND produce a fundraising event (School's Out KW!) that will help ensure we can raise our ULTIMATE GOAL- to fund this program for (at least) 5 years: sending 200 kids to camp.

For sponsoring a youth you'll get 4 tickets to come celebrate with us at School's Out KW! June 27 at Chicopee Ski & Summer Resort with food trucks, live bands, family activities and more!

All funds from this campaign will go directly to sending kids to camp at Chicopee Ski & Summer Resort this year.

The Impact

Studies have shown that the outdoor activity and social interaction at camp improves well-being, and can lead to establishing healthy lifestyle patterns. For underprivileged and at risk youth camp is also an opportunity to

  • get respite from a potentially negative environment and risky situations
  • gain exposure to an alternative, healthier way of life 
  • try new things and build new skills
  • develop leadership skills
  • be part of a welcoming, inclusive environment and make new friends

Providing this simple resource can make a huge difference, and give a child core skills they will take with them throughout life.

Serving At-Risk Youth at Camp: Understanding This Population and Meeting Their Needs

The School's Out KW! Committee is working closely with schools in Waterloo Region to understand the need of students and which youth are in greatest need. With the support of the YMCA, we are building a program that fully subsidizes the cost of camp for these youth.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Every person you tell by word of mouth and on social media helps. 

Grab tickets to School's Out KW!

story:
Short Summary

Nepal has been devastated by a 7.9 magnitude earthquake and has lost homes, heritage sites and much more.  There are in excess of 6000 dead and 10000+ wounded.  These numbers grow every day. 

It is essential to get the wounded healed to free up resources and back into rebuilding Nepal.

GEITSO has a Medical device that can help heal the wounded in Nepal.  It is essential to disinfect, clean, and remove the Bio-Burden and Bacteria Overload which will help heal wounds, faster and better.  It is critical, in a patient overload environment, as in this disaster, to keep infection from spreading.

Nepalese are peace loving and have much to offer the world.  In their time of need, it is our duty to help them in whatever way we can. 

Our device will kill the bacteria overload (>95%) and heal the wounded, including diabetics, those with broken immune systems, and also non-healing or chronic wounds. Our System is used in leading hospitals around the world like Mayo, and Fortis-CDOC in New Delhi.

Your contribution will help HEAL the wounded of Nepal and also REBUILD Nepal. 

Please contribute in whatever capacity you are able to.  Every little bit counts. 

Thank you for your Generosity!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $50K to get started.   We need to be there for at least the next 4-5 months and will need $50K every month.  The more patients we attend to we will need more.  All of the funding will go to treat the wounded in Nepal. 
  • We will post progress and provide you a window to see where your contributions are applied. We assure you the satisfaction of seeing your $’s HEAL every day! 
  • If we are not able to reach out with the funds raised we will redeploy the same to reputable Medical/Hospital Foundation that can benefit those in Nepal.


The Impact

Your contribution will HELP HEAL, REBUILD, and REHABILITATE the people of Nepal.  Doctors in Nepal need our help.  We cannot do it without you.


Risks & Challenges

The challenge is to disinfect and treat the wounded as quickly as possible.  We have addressed this by speaking to and getting the help of the doctors in Nepal to complement our efforts.  We have spoken to doctors at the hospital(s) there and they are asking for our system.  Additionally, we have all the help in Nepal to effectively clear our goods so help can reach the needy ASAP. 

We have spoken to other NGO, Hospital Foundation(s), and also Doctors in India and all are eager to collaborate and help.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute please reach out and share with your extended network so we can get this funded at the earliest. Please use the Indiegogo share tools, Facebook and any other media you are socially active on. 

Thank you for all your help and empathy for this tragedy.

story:
Jack the Bike Man, Inc. is a South Florida not for profit children's bicycle charity founded by Samuel H. “Jack” Hairston III.  For over ten years now he and his volunteers have fixed bikes and handed them out to needy children in the area,  especially around the holidays when Jack has his biggest bike give away of the year. Last year Jack The Bike Man gave away 1000 bikes during his annual Christmas Giveaway.

Volunteers waiting to distribute bikes at the Christmas Giveaway

... and the hundreds of kids eager to receive them.

Over 1000 new and refurbished bikes awaiting their new owners.

Getting fitted for their free helmet.

"Let's find a bike that's just right for you."

And away they go!

All of this is possible only with the help of volunteers and contributions. The popularity of his organization has grown and with it the costs. It has become a full-time year long job for Jack who lives only on his Social Security. He drives all over town collecting bikes or donations of parts. He could sure use your help. Contributions of money, time, and of course bikes are needed to keep “Jack the Bike Man” rolling.

What We Need & What You Get

We at Jack The Bike Man are asking for your financial help to place a bike in the hands of a needy child at this year's Holiday Giveaway, which for many children, will be the only gift they receive. We estimate that it costs Jack The Bike Man about $100 for each bike he gives away. This takes into account parts, labor, overhead and rent for our large warehouse as well as the included brand new bike helmet given with each children's bike. This year we would like to include a locking chain with each bike. No contribution is too small and as you can see on the right side of this page, we've got some great Perks to give away. So please, help today by making a contribution or spreading the word about our campaign!


Every little bit counts for something on a bike:

All proceeds will be put to use supporting this beloved charity.


Mission Statement

The Mission of "Jack the Bike Man" is to provide education, guidance and training to at-risk children  and their parents with bike training programs and other projects.

Vision Statement

Jack the Bike Man, Inc.'s vision is to provide social conduct guidance and emotional support through bicycle education programs provided by staff and volunteers. It is our vision to teach responsibility, family values, honesty, trust and self esteem. This will aid local youth in becoming productive members of our society, less inclined to become involved with gang activities.

After-School/Summer Program

Jack the Bike Man, Inc. is working to change the lives of local area youth through bicycle education. Each month Jack the Bike Man will provide after-school training to 3-4 students twice a week. The program consists of 4 main components: bicycle repair and safety, informal mentorship, physical education, and community service. Each student will receive a bicycle, tools, a helmet, and bike lights. Each graduate of the program is encouraged to return as a volunteer in all future after-school programs. Our goal is to improve struggling students' overall quality of life by providing guidance and support to succeed in school and in life.

Teen Programs

Teens wanting a bicycle are welcome to volunteer at Jack the Bike Man in exchange for a bicycle. All volunteers are to repair 3 bicycles, one bike for Jack the Bike Man to use in our programs of helping youth., one to give to a friend without a bike or means to purchase one, and the last one that they fix, the volunteer may keep themselves.

Adult Programs

Jack the Bike Man seeks to expand it's reach to Palm Beach County homeless families and to adults in recovery so that they may also learn basic bicycle mechanics while earning a bicycle for themselves.  Now it will be much easier to get to job interviews. This way if their bicycle is in need of repair, they will have the basic knowledge to do so as well as knowing that they can come back to us for repairs.

Bike Shop

As part of our fundraising for the Children's Charity, we sell new and used restored bikes starting at $130. We rent bicycles for $30 a day with a required deposit of the same amount as the value of the bicycle. In our shop we sell bicycle parts and supplies as well as provide bicycle repairs by our trained mechanics.

Bike Collection

Neighborhood associations, Home Owners Associations, and gated communities can collect bikes in their neighborhood and arrangements can be made with Jack the Bike Man to have all the bikes at a specific location where the bikes can be picked up by a Jack the Bike Man volunteer. Some communities have matching grant programs for improving and beautifying the communities. All of the volunteer hours donated in collecting the bikes can go towards those grants.

Other ways to help...

There are many volunteer opportunities available; pick up bicycles, repair bicycles, office work, building maintenance, fund raising committee, event committee, Special outreach committee, board of directors, Program sponsorship, event sponsorship, working on youth programs, teach repair and maintenance of bicycles.


Video produced by Road Holland when Jack The Bike Man was at a smaller location.

story:
AUGUST 24-28, SAN FRANCISCO, CA.

Designed for Photographers, this workshop will introduce you to the world of filmmaking.

Photography skills include composition and lighting, so for photographers some elements of filmmaking will come easily, but it's not as simple as switching your DSLR to Video Mode...

My own journey into filmmaking was from a world of corporate photography, and the learning curve was steep. Moments are no longer measured in fractions of a second, but rather in minutes, from multiple angles, with a demand for good sound and the threat of changing light.

Come spend a week in the beautiful Presidio in San Francisco, shooting, learning, trying gear and immersing yourself in a whole new world!

We'll cover how to shoot family moments, interviews, events and both scripted and unscripted videos. You'll try single- and multiple-camera set-ups, and learn about how gear can add to your storytelling - microphones, constant lights, jibs, dollies, cranes, quadcopters, monitors and more.

There'll also be an opportunity for you to experience what it's like to be on set working with a crew, cast and an exuberant and demanding Director...

And finally, you'll marvel at the wonderment of story boards, how easy they are to create, and how vital they are when filming!

Workshop Schedule:

  • Sunday 23rd August 5pm Casual Drinks / Meetup
  • Monday 24th August 9am-12pm Morning session, Afternoon Hands-on / one-on-ones
  • Tuesday 25th August 9-10am, downloads and Q&A, 10am-12pm Morning session, Afternoon Hands-on / one-on-ones
  • Wednesday 26th August 9-10am, downloads and Q&A, 10am-12pm Morning session, Afternoon Hands-on / one-on-ones
  • Thursday 27th August 9-10am, downloads and Q&A, 9:30am-12pm Editing session, Afternoon Hands-on / one-on-ones
  • Friday 27th August 9:30-12 Wrap up, Afternoon Movie, Wrap Party (Optional Extra)

* Additional Evening Activities will be available to workshop attendees.
** Catered Morning Tea and Lunches will be provided Monday through Friday.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Q&A

1, Who is Ollie Dale?

I am a Professional Photographer and Filmmaker from New Zealand.

I have won many awards at the annual NZIPP Professional Photography Awards, and won the filmmaking category (Fusion) 3 years in a row (2012, 13 and 14)

I have worked with big brands like Saatchi & Saatchi, and small brands like Microsoft, and many brands in between. I've learned that story-telling is the key to a great video, and a combination of photography, technical aptitude and rhythm is what adds to a story to make something worth watching.

I am also a Master in The Arcanum, Trey Ratcliff's online learning experience for photography (and soon, Filmmaking!)

2. What do I bring?

Bring your own cameras/computer gear - there will be opportunities to try other combinations, and to see the benefits of certain equipment, but ultimately this workshop is about you learning to achieve great things with the gear you already have.

3. Do I need any previous experience with video?

No! Anyone can attend - you will have chances to work in pairs or small groups of people of similar experience levels as yourself, as well as scheduled one-on-one time with me, so all skill levels are welcome!

4. Is this just for locals?

Anyone is welcome to come - if you're from outside San Francisco you'll need to arrange your own accommodation, but you're a grown-up now; you can do eeeet!

5. I'm a vegan, will that be catered for in your lunches?

Sigh...

story:
Homeschooling und Freilernen ist in Deutschland verboten. Das ist in Europa mit Schweden das Einzigstes Land wo es nicht erlaubt ist.

Wir haben einen (relativ) legalen Weg gefunden, wie es auch in Deutschland realisierbar wird im Einklang mit den Gesetzen.

Sodass Freilernfamilien nicht flüchten müssen in andere Länder, wo es erlaubt ist.

Daher wollen wir Freilern/Homescooling,- Familien hier die Möglichkeit geben auf einen Hof zu Leben, wo es die Möglichkeit gibt in vielen Bereichen spielerisch zu lernen.


Das Grundstück besteht aus:

1 großer Garten  mit Kräuterspirale, einem Barfußweg und Gemüsebeeten, hauseigenen Hühnern mit Hühnerstall


- Wohnhaus mit Sauna

- Ferienhaus (ausgezeichnet von Staatsministerium für Umwelt und Landwirtschaft)


- Holzwerkstatt in der Scheune zum Herstellen von Holzgegenständen wie    Holzspielzeug, Holzgeschirr

- Solarthermieanalge auf dem Dach sowie Kachelofen, Kaminöfen zur Beheizung
- eigener Trinkwasserbrunnen 15 m tief

- eine Streuobstwiese mit alten, seltenen Apfelbestand,

- einen kleinen Schuppen  sowie ein kleiner Kinderspielplatz mit Schaukel, einer Hängematte und Sandkasten.

- Weiterhin gibt es 3 ha Land (Felder, Wiesen, Wäldchen)


Daher eignet sich das Grundstück und der 3 Seitenhof ideal zur Selbstversorgung.

- umgeben von Talsperren, Wäldern und Wiesen und kleinen Bächen



Das alles wird für einen extrem günstigen Preis zu verkaufen angeboten.


Dazu benötigen wir 10.000€ für  Notar und Grundbucheintragskosten und andere formale Kosten.


Die Kosten für den Kauf werden wir über ein Kreditdarlehn finanzieren.

hauseigenen Hühnern mit Hühnerstall - Wohnhaus mit Sauna- Ferienhaus
 (ausgezeichnet von Staatsministerium für Umwelt und Landwirtschaft) - Holzwerkstatt in der Scheune zum Herstellen von Holzgegenständen wie    Holzspielzeug, Holzgeschirr- Solarthermieanalge auf dem Dach sowie Kachelofen, Kaminöfen zur Beheizung- eigener Trinkwasserbrunnen 15 m tief- eine Streuobstwiese mit alten, seltenen Apfelbestand, - einen kleinen Schuppen  sowie ein 
kleiner Kinderspielplatz mit Schaukel, einer Hängematte und Sandkasten. - Weiterhin gibt es 3 ha Land (Felder, Wiesen, Wäldchen)Daher eignet sich das Grundstück und der 3 Seitenhof ideal zur Selbstversorgung.- umgeben von Talsperren, Wäldern und Wiesen und kleinen BächenDas alles wird für einen extrem günstigen Preis zu verkaufen angeboten.Dazu benötigen wir 10.000€ für  Notar und Grundbucheintragskosten und andere formale Kosten.Die Kosten für den Kauf werden wir über ein Kreditdarlehn finanzieren.

story:
Hello, and thanks for viewing my campaign! I have to tell you that I've never asked for money, to tell you the truth this feels weird to me, but someone told me "The world is full of good people, ready to help", and that I should give it a try and reach out to the world.

My name is Miguel Malo, I am a Mexican citizen born in Monterrey, Mexico. I've been homeschooled since kinder garden in an American School System (ABeka Academy), my father is a professional photographer here in Mexico (http://www.mmalo.com/) and at times, I help my dad with photography jobs. I'm currently in 12th grade and I am in need of a laptop with specific features and special software programming, I am enrolled in a Harvard course called CS50 (https://www.edx.org/course/introduction-compute...) on computer programming, and it starts this fall and I don't have the supplies yet!!! A month ago, I heard about Indiegogo, so  I’m creating this campaign with the hope of raising the money I need, for the course requirements, (computer, and books). So I am asking you to contribute with whatever you can, and even if you don't know me, I know you can make a difference with the change you have in your pocket, that might seem small to you but that is huge for me. Don't think a few coins won't make a difference! because when you give, no matter how small the effort,  you draw a smile of joy in my face. I promise that with your great help I will study hard, and passionately. I believe you will be of huge help! and that in a few days we can reach the main goal! I will not forget that you made a difference in my life, that you help me push on and you believed in me. So please take action in this campaign! and thanks again,for taking the time to read my campaign.

story:
About Us


We Are a Mission Church and Automatically IRS Exempt and Listed on GuideStar
EIN# 87-0431443
All Donations are Tax Exempt to the Fullest Extent Allowed By Law.

✞ "The Salt Lake City Mission now in our 22nd year serves the homeless community by providing emergency services and long-term recovery programs, the Mission helps to meet the physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual needs of individuals in the greater Salt Lake area. Through daily outreaches providing food, clothing, hygiene items, counseling, life skills, education, ministry and most importantly "A WAY OUT!"" - Pastor Wilson

___________________


THE NEEDS



A new school year is right around the corner...

Your kids might be ready, but there are thousands of Utah children who are not.

Please help children in need prepare for the upcoming school year with the Salt Lake City Mission's Back to School

Drive!



Salt Lake City Mission is gearing up for our Back to School Giveaway, which will be held on August 15,2015 at the Christian Life Center. We are putting together 500 backpacks, filled to the brim with school supplies, as well as clothing for every child present. There will be fun and games for everyone as well as a delicious meal.

Christian Life Center, 1055 North Redwood Road, Salt Lake City, Utah 84116


We need your support right now to make the back to school giveaway as successful as possible. We currently have enough supplies for 50 backpacks, worth about $4,500.


Our goal is to raise $35,000 worth of supplies plus clothing. We are looking for volunteers during the event, plenty of school supplies, and new or used children's clothing. We also need a food sponsor for the day of the event.


We always want to hear from you! Send us an email and let us know how you are doing any prayer request and how we can help you.


Please get involved today by Donating as much as you can Today and or Starting a Back To School Supply Drive for the children that need it the most or by contacting Salt Lake City Mission through email, phone, or visit us directly. 


Thank you for your support! We'll hope to see you on August 15th!


   

Salt Lake City Mission

| 801.355.6310 | info@saltlakecitymission.org |

| www.saltlakecitymission.org |

story:
Our Purpose

  • The Rho Rho Chapter invites you to participate in our Go Red for Rho Rho CycleThon that will raise money for the Sickle Cell Association of Richmond-OSCAR.
  • September is Sickle Cell Awareness month and 1 in every 10 African-Americans has sickle cell trait, and 1 in 500 has sickle cell disease.
About Sickle Cell Richmond-OSCAR

Sickle Cell Association of Richmond – OSCAR is a non-profit 501 (c) (3) community-based program providing services free of charge to Sickle Cell patients and their families.  The organization:

  • Sponsors educational seminars for churches, schools, social and civic groups medical professionals and hospitals..
  • Sponsors a support group for individuals and their families who are affected by Sickle Cell Disease.  Educational topics related Sickle Cell Disease and social events are offered.
  • Provides financial assistance to clients.
  • Assists families in their efforts to locate and access other community resources.
How You Can Help
  • Make a donation to sponsor a member of your organization to ride on Sept. 26th. The group with the greatest attendance on Saturday will have a donation made on their behalf to the Sickle Cell Association - the longer you ride, the larger the donation!
  • Get your friends and family to also help us in our efforts by sharing this on your social media pages.  Help us as we help those families affected by sickle cell!

Our Purpose

The Rho Rho Chapter invites you to participate in our Go Red for Rho Rho CycleThon that will raise money for the Sickle Cell Association of Richmond-OSCAR.

About Sickle Cell Richmond-OSCAR
Sickle Cell Association of Richmond – OSCAR is a non-profit 501 (c) (3) community-based program providing services free of charge to Sickle Cell patients and their families.  The organization:

Sponsors educational seminars for churches, schools, social and civic groups medical professionals and hospitals..
Sponsors a support group for individuals and their families who are affected by Sickle Cell Disease.  Educational topics related Sickle Cell Disease and social events are offered.
Provides financial assistance to clients.
Assists families in their efforts to locate and access other community resources.

How You Can Help    Make a donation to sponsor a member of your organization to ride on Sept. 26th. The group with the greatest attendance on Saturday will have a donation made on their behalf to the Sickle Cell Association - the longer you ride, the larger the donation!
Get your friends and family to also help us in our efforts by sharing this on your social media pages.  Help us as we help those families affected by sickle cell!

story:
Who We Are

Corcovado School is a small non-profit elementary school in rural Costa Rica, on the Osa Peninsula. We focus on giving children low-income families greater opportunities for the future through:

  • Bilingual Education (50% English and 50% Spanish).
  • Environmental Education- creating future conservation leaders in the Osa.
  • Multi-cultural awareness and exchange through international volunteering.
  • Community involvement and leadership.
  • Critical thinking and creativity- through a well rounded curriculum and hands-on learning.
Our school is run as a non-profit organization, we receive no assistance from the government and the vast majority of our parents have very limited incomes and cannot afford to contribute to the school. 

In short, We need your help to keep our doors open next year!

This campaign will not only help 60 children to continue their education, but will help us to expand our community projects in order to make our school more sustainable.

ANYTHING YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE WILL HELP SAVE OUR SCHOOL!

The Impact

In Costa Rica's Osa Peninsula, the average household income is just $500 per month. Most families continue to live off the land and many live off the grid. Very few families speak English at home.

Employment opportunities, especially for young people, are often limited to seasonal tourism or working the family farm. In order to give the next generation the ability to thrive in the global marketplace- we need to teach important skills such as languages, computing, environmental and multi-cultural awareness.

Currently, government funded schools in the Osa Peninsula focus on rote learning;
many are understaffed to the point that students only go to school for half a day; and most use photocopied pages of outdated textbooks as their only teaching tools.

Help the children of Puerto Jiménez to get a better education and more opportunities for the future!


Where the Money Goes

Your contribution will go towards the vital costs of running our school including:

  • Teaching Staff
  • Rent and Bills
  • Textbooks
  • Art and Craft Supplies
  • Music Supplies
  • Printing and Office Supplies

The more money we raise, the more we can improve our school and make ourselves financially stable in the future. Here are just a few things on our wishlist:

  • Computer and Science Lab
  • Community Vegetable Garden
  • Expansion of our Volunteering and Sponsorship Program
  • School Day Camps Program
  • Annual Fundraising Dinner
  • Annual Environmental Festival


Other Ways You Can Help


Don't worry if you cannot afford to contribute money! All we ask is that you share our campaign with your friends and family, by clicking on the share buttons!

No time to write a tweet? Just click the button below and a ready-to-go tweet will be posted on your profile!



You can also help by volunteering at the school- visit our Volunteering Page to find out more.
