story:
**Online campaign is closed, however, you can still donate to project by sending a cheque payable to 'St. Monica School'

Mail to:

St. Monica School

6440 rue de Terrebonne

Montreal, Quebec, H4B 1B1

CANADA


We love our bread, we love our butter, but most of all, we love each other!

The history of the St. Monica School Breakfast Program can be summed up in the words of little Madeline, “We love our bread, we love our butter, but most of all, we love each other”.   The beauty of the breakfast program comes in many forms, and in the foreground are the children.  It starts by allowing students to begin the day with a full belly, allowing them to focus on learning.  It allows students to enjoy a meal with their friends and peers.  It allows parents and neighbours to participate in the community as they serve breakfast to the children.  There is no stigmatization of children who need this program because the program charmingly welcomes all students.    

The Breakfast Club was initiated ten years ago by Ms. Avice Joseph upon her retirement as a teacher at St. Monica.  And so the St. Monica breakfast program was born through the tenacity and leadership of a retired teacher and the generous support from school breakfast organizations such as Share the Warmth.   The Breakfast Program has a meager budget and the bulk of the food comes from well-established organizations.  Now and then, the school would acquire a bag of fruit donated by a parent or a local grocer and extra bagels from someone working at a bread factory.  To complete the program, Ms. Joseph has had to be resourceful.


The New Cooking Classroom

At St. Monica, we have the bread and butter, and we have each other.  Now what we need most of all, are community partners.  We invite you to help us realize a dream facility to better host our enduring and endearing Breakfast Program. We are asking for your financial support to purchase and install a counter, double-sink, ovens, refrigerators, dishwasher, cupboards, lighting, tables, chairs, computer station, couches, compost center and wall decal.  The complete vision of our new Cooking Classroom is detailed in the following 'St. Monica School Cooking Classroom Dream Plan' and Concept Board.

Our hope is to have an adequate and inviting place where volunteers can serve breakfast to students of St. Monica.  In addition, this room would host culinary workshops and lessons provided by staff during school.  Students and parents can attend after-school culinary classes and experience diverse foods by teachers from our very own multi-ethnic, multi-linguist, multi-generational community!  We can use the fresh organic produce from our very own 200 meter-squared vegetable garden located in front of the school.  The cornucopia of benefits for this new facility is abundant.

Donations would go towards:

Tables & Furniture $10,800
Lighting $6,100
Kitchen Appliances: $9,500
Renovation to code: $10,000
Kitchen Cabinets & Counter: $10,340
Labour: $21,500
Promotion: $500

The school has already raised $20,000 from a combination of donations from school and daycare budget and from the success of last years' Movie Nights and Spaghetti dinner.  

We are hoping for local businesses or financial institutions to help us raise another 1/3 of our projected budget.  When the good news comes, you'll be the first to know!

Most importantly, we need your help with this campaign to raise the last 1/3 of our projected costs.  If you are planning to donate to a local charity this year, please consider donating to 'Ms. Joseph's Nutty Idea' cooking classroom.


Keep an eye for our Perks!

We've got some special perks for your support!  You can receive one-of-a-kind gifts and care packages created by the students of St. Monica or select perks from Montreal's wider community of businesses and individuals.

  • Kid tested favourite recipes handwritten on recipe cards
  • Organic seeds saved from St. Monica's very own garden

The Impact

In March 2014, the NDG Food Depot held a community symposium on food security.  In contrast to our neighbourhood of abundance, they highlighted and sought out solutions to the food deserts in our community where fresh foods are difficult to come across due to physical barriers and/or socio-economic barriers.   Our students come from families living in these food deserts of Westhaven Village, Walkley, Benny Farm and St. Raymond’s Parish.  A direct and efficient solution to healthier eating and food security is through educating our children.  A cooking classroom would allow children to discover the joy and love of fresh foods and to be mindful of their health.  We can give our children a chance to learn and bring awareness to themselves and change the grocery choices of their parents!  

Our students would be over-joyed to have the chance to cook and learn hands-on ways in which to prepare nutritious meals.  The teachers would have better tools to teach and engage their students.  The Breakfast Program students and volunteers would spend their mornings in a beautiful and hopeful environment.

Good things are happening at St. Monica... have you seen our school lately!? We have successfully implemented numerous changes, an awesome playground in the junior yard, $48,000 grant from the !ndigo Love of Reading Foundation, 200 square-foot organic garden, & indoor plant growing stations to name just a few...


Risks & Challenges

Your support now is critical to start-up the construction.  Our project will be completed in two phases.  After reaching the first half of our fundraising goals, we will commence construction, putting in place the essentials such as counters and appliances needed in order for the cooking classroom to be used immediately for the students of St. Monica. 

The first part of construction is set for summer 2016 which includes renovations to bring plumbing and ventilation up to code for appliances, purchase and installation of cabinets, sink, oven & fridge, table & chairs.  As more funding is secured, we will build the next stages, island counter, second oven, more cabinets along second wall.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Let us know what you think about the campaign and project by posting your comments here - we like constructive feedback!  

Help us get the word out and make some noise about this nutty idea, use the Indiegogo share tools to your friends and wider community - personalize it with a comment so that your friends know this is the real deal! 

**Please clearly indicate the name of our project, 'Ms. Joseph's Nutty Idea' in the comments section of donation online form.  Tax receipt will be issued for all donation $10 or more.

story:
Liebe/r UnterstützerIn von Parteispenden.at!

Leider scheint Indiegogo bei manchen technische Probleme zu verursachen.

Wenn du willst, kannst du uns auch sehr gerne per Überweisung unterstützen:

    Forum Informationsfreiheit
    BIC: GIBAATWWXXX
    IBAN: AT692011182434942000
    Bitte gegebenenfalls “Parteispenden” als Überweisungszweck angeben.

Vielen Dank für deinen Beitrag zu einer offeneren Demokratie!

Mathias Huter, Sara Hassan, Nelson Carr

Parteispenden.at

Woher kommen die elf Millionen Euro, die die ÖVP im letzten Nationalratswahlkampf ausgegeben hat? Welche Firmen gehören der SPÖ? Wie transparent sind eigentlich FPÖ, Grüne, Team Stronach und Neos, wenn es um ihre Finanzen geht? Und wie viel Steuergeld haben BZÖ und KPÖ nach den letzten Nationalratswahlen bekommen? Antworten auf Fragen wie diese können interessierte BürgerInnen kaum finden. Wir möchten das ändern.

Für eine Politik mit offenen Karten

Wir sind vom Forum Informationsfreiheit (FOI) und engagieren uns seit zwei Jahren für die Abschaffung des Amtsgeheimnisses, die Einführung eines Informationsfreiheitsgesetzes und für mehr Transparenz in Österreichs Verwaltung  – dafür haben wir kürzlich vom Parlament den Demokratiepreis erhalten.

Österreichs BürgerInnen sollen wissen dürfen, wie dieses Land verwaltet wird – und woher die Mittel jener kommen, die bei Wahlen kandidieren und uns in Gemeinderäten, Landtagen, und in den Parlamenten in Wien und Brüssel repräsentieren.

Transparenz auf Österreichisch

Dieser Tage müssen Parteien erstmals ihre Finanzen und Spenden über EUR 3.500 offenlegen, ebenso welche Firmen sie besitzen. Das klingt auf den ersten Blick ganz gut. Aber so einfach ist es leider nicht:

  • Die Finanz-Informationen der Parteien werden in verschiedensten Formaten veröffentlicht, oft als ausgedruckte und dann gescannte Dokumente, die als PDF Dateien auf der Website des Rechnungshofs und den Partei-Webseiten stehen und über Suchmaschinen kaum gefunden werden können.

  • Die Veröffentlichung erfolgt verzögert: so werden wir erst demnächst erfahren, wer die SpenderInnen im Nationalratswahlkampf 2013 waren – eineinhalb Jahre nach der Wahl.

  • Die nun erstmals angewendeten Transparenz-Regeln dürften einige Schlupflöcher beinhalten, die manche Parteien nutzen könnten, um ihre SpenderInnen weiterhin nicht offenzulegen. Wir werden die Gesetzeslage analysieren und Verbesserungsmöglichkeiten aufzeigen.

  • Es gibt keine staatliche Stelle, die die Richtigkeit der Angaben prüfen darf – der Rechnungshof bekommt zwar die Dokumente von den Parteien, darf aber selbst nicht nachforschen.

Hier möchten wir mit unserer neuen Initiative ansetzen.


Echte Offenheit

Wir starten eine neue Plattform, auf der alle verfügbaren Daten rund um die Finanzen von Parteien zu finden sein werden: Parteispenden.at.  Dort wollen wir Informationen so aufbereiten, dass BürgerInnen sich schnell und einfach selbst ein Bild machen können – mit Hilfe von Visualisierungen, Recherchen, Analysen und strukturierten Datensätzen.

Einige der Aspekte, die wir uns genauer anschauen möchten:

  • Parteinahe Firmen, Organisationen und Medien: Welche öffentlichen Gelder fließen so an politische Gruppierungen?

  • Öffentliche Mittel: Welche Förderungen erhalten Parteien auf nationaler, regionaler und lokaler Ebene?

  • Parteispenden: Welche Unternehmen, Organisationen und Personen geben substantielle Spenden an welche Parteien?

  • Etwaige Verschleierungstaktiken: Welche Schlupflöcher gibt es in den Veröffentlichungspflichten, wie könnte man sie stopfen, und welche Strategien werden von wem verwendet, um SpenderInnen weiterhin geheim zu halten?

  • Transparenz-Vorreiter: Welche Parteien bemühen sich gegenüber BürgerInnen wirklich um Offenheit – etwa, in dem sie erhaltene Spenden zeitnah freiwillig offenlegen?



Informierte WählerInnen

Weil wir unsere Plattform für BürgerInnen machen wollen, möchten wir auch auf Aspekte eingehen, die euch interessieren: Ihr könnt uns gezielt Impulse, Ideen und Hinweise geben und auch Sponsoren-Pate für ein Recherche-Thema werden.

2015 werden in Wien, Oberösterreich, der Steiermark und im Burgenland die Landtage neu gewählt. Während dieser Wahlkämpfe möchten wir Parteien zu einem Transparenz-Wettbewerb einladen und eine öffentliche Diskussion anstoßen. Auch möchten wir Probleme und Schwachstellen in der derzeitigen Rechtslage dokumentieren, und uns aktiv für eine Verbesserung des Gesetzes einsetzen.

Investition in die Demokratie

Durch mehr Offenheit und nachvollziehbare Finanzflüsse zu den Parteien möchten wir das Vertrauen in die Demokratie stärken.

Um dieses Projekt voll verwirklichen zu können, brauchen wir Unterstützung. Unser Ziel: € 20.000.

  • Bis € 5.000... können wir Parteispenden.at starten, die wichtigsten Datensätze sammeln, befreien und online stellen, sowie gelegentliche Blogs und Analysen erstellen, die man auch per Email-Newsletter erhalten kann.
  • Ab ca. € 5.000... wird es uns möglich, z.B. Firmenstrukturen von GroßspendernInnen nachzuspüren um so deren Rolle in einen Kontext zu setzen. Auch können wir anspruchsvollere Visualisierungen der Daten erstellen und die österreichischen Regelungen in Sachen Parteienfinanzierung mit guten Modellen anderer Länder vergleichen.
  • Ab ca. € 10.000... können wir regelmäßige, zeitnahe und tiefergehende Analysen sicherstellen, uns in öffentliche Diskussionen einbringen, aktiv Medienarbeit leisten und uns aktiv für bessere gesetzliche Regelungen einsetzen.
  • Ab ca. € 15.000... können wir auch öffentliche Diskussionen veranstalten und Transparenz-Bewertungen der antretenden Parteien in Landtagswahlkämpfen durchführen.
  • Ab € 20.000... wird auch die mittelfristige Nachhaltigkeit der Webseite gesichert und es wird uns möglich, in einen anspruchsvolleren Internetauftritt zu investieren.

Kurz: Je mehr Unterstützung wir sammeln können, desto intensiver können wir uns in dieses Projekt stürzen, das wir langfristig betreiben möchten. Mit deiner Investition können wir zusammen die österreichische Demokratie aufpolieren.

Unser Team

Mathias Huter @MathiasHuter
Projektleiter
ist Antikorruptionsaktivist und hat die vergangenen fünf Jahre in Tiflis für Transparency International Georgia gearbeitet. Er engagiert sich beim Forum Informationsfreiheit (FOI) und ist als selbstständiger Consultant für verschiedene internationale Nichtregierungsorganisationen tätig.


Sara Hassan @sarahas_san
Campaigning, Social Media, Analyse
ist Journalistin, Aktivistin beim Forum Informationsfreiheit (FOI)  und interessiert sich für Transparenz, weil sie es nicht aushält, etwas nicht zu wissen, und demokratische Prozesse mitgestalten will.


Nelson Carr @nelsoncarrr
Kampagnenführung, technische Umsetzung, Recherche
setzt sich mit dem Forum Informationsfreiheit (FOI) für Transparenz ein, weil mit ihr erst demokratische Kontrolle von Verwaltung und Parteien ermöglicht wird – und weil er gewohnt ist, im Internet alles zu finden.


Hubert Sickinger @HubertSickinger
ist ein führender Parteienforscher, vielzitierter Experte und Autor mehrerer Bücher zu diesem Thema. Er steht Parteispenden.at mit seiner Expertise zur Seite. Er ist Beiratsvorsitzender des Forum Informationsfreiheit (FOI).

---

Wir werden natürlich auch selbst unsere Finanzen offenlegen. Wir behalten uns vor, Spenden zurückzuweisen oder einem karitativen Zweck zuzuführen, deren Annahme die wahrgenommene Unabhängigkeit und Integrität dieses Projekts gefährden könnte.
story_txt:
Liebe/r UnterstützerIn von Parteispenden.at!Leider scheint Indiegogo bei manchen technische Probleme zu verursachen.Wenn du willst, kannst du uns auch sehr gerne per Überweisung unterstützen:Forum InformationsfreiheitBIC: GIBAATWWXXXIBAN: AT692011182434942000Bitte gegebenenfalls “Parteispenden” als Überweisungszweck angeben.Vielen Dank für deinen Beitrag zu einer offeneren Demokratie!Mathias Huter, Sara Hassan, Nelson Carr
Parteispenden.at
Woher kommen die elf Millionen Euro, die die ÖVP im letzten Nationalratswahlkampf ausgegeben hat? Welche Firmen gehören der SPÖ? Wie transparent sind eigentlich FPÖ, Grüne, Team Stronach und Neos, wenn es um ihre Finanzen geht? Und wie viel Steuergeld haben BZÖ und KPÖ nach den letzten Nationalratswahlen bekommen? Antworten auf Fragen wie diese können interessierte BürgerInnen kaum finden. Wir möchten das ändern.Für eine Politik mit offenen KartenWir sind vom Forum Informationsfreiheit (FOI) und engagieren uns seit zwei Jahren für die Abschaffung des Amtsgeheimnisses, die Einführung eines Informationsfreiheitsgesetzes und für mehr Transparenz in Österreichs Verwaltung  – dafür haben wir kürzlich vom Parlament den Demokratiepreis erhalten.Österreichs BürgerInnen sollen wissen dürfen, wie dieses Land verwaltet wird – und woher die Mittel jener kommen, die bei Wahlen kandidieren und uns in Gemeinderäten, Landtagen, und in den Parlamenten in Wien und Brüssel repräsentieren.Transparenz auf ÖsterreichischDieser Tage müssen Parteien erstmals ihre Finanzen und Spenden über EUR 3.500 offenlegen, ebenso welche Firmen sie besitzen. story: We all have dreams and a lot of us never get a chance to achieve them. Help me realize my dream of becoming a private pilot. My name is Brad Demucha and with your help, I can do this. I know that you don't know me, and if you don't want to donate I get it but if we could all just help each other a little bit, we could ALL reach our dreams.
story_txt: We all have dreams and a lot of us never get a chance to achieve them. Help me realize my dream of becoming a private pilot. My name is Brad Demucha and with your help, I can do this. I know that you don't know me, and if you don't want to donate I get it but if we could all just help each other a little bit, we could ALL reach our dreams.

story:
About me (Summary)

Hi, my name is Kenneth Realpe. I am 18 years old. I live in the house of my grandfathers with my mother Helena and my brother Steven,since 5 years ago I had studied Film´s Writting in format standard and Visual effects,thanks of this i have gotten half of  scholarship from Vancouver Film School (VFS) in Canada.

since I have memory my mother always had been worried for my education and my brother education,my mom and my father are separated since i was a child,My brother has a delayed mild brain, so he will be part of my responsibility in a future and also my mom too .

From an early age I had liked the art, films and the way in which writers express their experiences through of their screenplays.

I had started in the of the 3D world when I was 14 years old. One day my uncle showed me a program called Blender,in this software,he develops his advices and structures. I liked it a lot because of the color on the 3D models. I could develop my first 3D object,I developed a ball, then I had started to study the whole program and it conceptual parameters.

At the age of 15 i discovered my other passion: to write films scripts. This came to me due to a school paper I did when I was studying in high school. My teachers were prepared to evaluate my skills at writing so I spent all a night trying to imagine a story, and i showed my writting to the teachers  and they liked a lot, so they motivated me to go on writing.

 When I was 16 I had to split my time between high school,the study scripts of film and the softwares of visual effects as ¨blender¨,autodesk 3D Studio max,boujou,photoshop,It was harder to me study film scripts because I had to study the standard Hollywood format. On the other hand, the visual effects study was not so complicated to me because I had already been studying and practicing it for two years.

Now I am 18, one day some months ago,I was watching ads from internet about a scholarship for students who were related to cinematic art. So I sent my portfolio to VFS with some of my works such as scripts short and renders. They contacted me at email,telling me to I was elected for a scholarship,I had to Postponing it until 2015 because of my early age and the lack of money to the tuition of vfs University.

I have increased my skills of art from my great grandfather. He was a Painter and a poet and as well as my mother. She is a sculptress of art classic.

a couple months ago a VFS representative called to my house,I told her about my truth. I told her I had not enought money to go to Vancouver; I did not have the enought money for tuition of the scholarship. She give  me  the opportunity to postpone the scholarship until 2015.

If I don't reach my entire goal, the money will still go toward my tuition universitary,Either way,I will fight until raise the money!!!!

My Goal:

  • Get to 32,000 USD and pay up my matriculation in the university of vancouver film school.
  • Study and graduate in vancouver film school.
  • travel to California,Los Ángeles where I can promote and commercialize my screenplays to studies as for example :Warner Brothers, Dreamworks,MGM,Amazon Studios,Paramount.
  • help to others people in this website too .

In Spanish:

Hola, mi nombre es kenneth realpe tengo 18 años recientemente, vivo en casa de mis abuelos y desde hace 5 años me dedicado a estudiar efectos visuales y escritura cinematográfica,gracias a esto logre conseguir media beca en Vancouver Film School (VFS)

desde que tengo memoria de mi madre siempre a luchado por mi educación y la de mi hermano, mi padre y ella se separaron, Mi hermano tiene un leve retraso cerebral, por lo que será parte de mi responsabilidad en un futuro y también mi mamá.

Desde muy temprana edad me ha gustado el arte, el cine y la manera en que los escritores expresan sus experiencias a través de sus guiones.

Empecé en el mundo del 3D cuando tenía 14 años de edad. Un día, mi tío me mostró un programa llamado Blender, en este software, desarrolla sus anuncios y estructuras. Me gustó mucho por el color en los modelos 3D. Pude desarrollar mi primer objeto 3D, desarrollé una pelota, luego empecé a estudiar todo el programa y sus parámetros conceptuales.

A la edad de 15 descubrí mi otra pasión: escribir guiones de cine. Este vino a mí debido a un periódico de la escuela que hice cuando estudiaba la secundaria. Mis maestros fueron a evaluar mis habilidades en la escritura así que pasé toda la noche tratando de imaginar una historia, a los profesores les gustó mucho, así que me motivaron a seguir escribiendo.

Cuando tenía 16 años tuve que dividir mi tiempo entre la escuela secundaria, los guiones de estudio de cine y los programas de efectos visuales como blender, Autodesk 3D Studio Max, boujou, photoshop, que era más difícil para mí para estudiar guiones de cine porque tenía que estudiar el formato estándar de Hollywood. Por otro lado, el estudio de efectos visuales no era tan complicado para mí, porque yo ya había estado estudiando y practicando durante tres años.

Ahora tengo 18, un día, hace algunos meses, estaba viendo los anuncios de la Internet acerca de una beca para los estudiantes que estaban relacionados con el arte cinematográfico. Así que envié mi portafolio para VFS con algunos de mis trabajos como guiones cortos y renders. Ellos me contactaron por correo electrónico, diciendo que fui elegido para la beca, tuve que posponerlo hasta el 2015 debido a mi edad temprana y la falta de dinero para pagar la matrícula de la universidad de VFS.

Heredé mis habilidades de arte de mi bisabuelo. Él era un pintor y poeta y también mi madre. Ella es una escultora de arte clásico.

Hace meses un representante de VFS llamó a mi casa, hablé con ella sobre mi verdad. Le dije que no tenía el dinero para ir a Vancouver; Yo no tengo todo el dinero para la matrícula de la beca. Ella me aconsejó posponer la beca.

Si no llego a toda mi meta, el dinero todavía se destinará a mi matrícula universitaria,cualquier manera, voy a luchar hasta conseguir el dinero !!!!

Mi meta:

  • Llegar a los 32,000 USD y pagar mi matricula en la universidad del VFS
  • Estudiar Durante 4 años en vancouver film school
  • Viajar luego a California,Los angeles donde puedo promover y comercializar guiones a estudios como por ejemplo: Warner Brothers,Dreamworks,MGM,Amazon Studios,Paramount. 
  • Ayudar a otras personas por esta website.

Portfolio - Trabajos:

My screenplay of horror and thriller (Voices of the Abyss) Writter by my,in progress

VFX:

Transformer - Metal Destroyer

Sara

My Portfolio

VFS Wikipedia

VFS University

Kenneth Realpe.

Contact me:

kenneth_realpe@hotmail.com

or 

kentrealpe@gmail.com

Thank!!! :)

story:
NativeEye 2016: The Presidential Race through the Lens of Native America

Overview

Covering stories about the 2016 presidential race is the focus for college students accepted into the 2015-2016 class of the Native American Journalism Fellowship (NAJF).

This groundbreaking project combines mentoring, training, hands-on experience in multimedia reporting, and online coursework through the University of Montana School of Journalism.

NativeEye 2016 is administered by the Native American Journalists Association (NAJA), and is made possible through partnerships with the University of Montana and the Newseum Institute. Although most of the one-year project will be conducted through online and digital communication, a crucial component of the yearlong project involves hands-on training through an on-site newsroom immersion experience during the week of NAJA’s annual National Native Media Conference, held this year in the Washington D.C.-area in July.

Need for funding

NAJA needs to raise $15,000 to provide 10 college students with travel, lodging, food, onsite transportation to cover stories, and other expenses related to their educational training.

This funding would not only cover their expenses from Sunday, July 5 through Saturday, July 11, but would also provide the necessary tools (and, hopefully, the confidence) they need to cover critical political stories.

Project goals

A new cohort of young Native American journalists will gain experience in covering national elections while leveraging digital technology, which will give these fellows an edge when they enter the workforce. In addition, through the coverage offered through NativeEye 2016, Native American voters will be engaged and informed about the presidential candidates and will learn how the candidates’ proposed policies might impact them and their communities. 

How NativeEye 2016 works

NativeEye 2016 is a project that brings together college students and experienced journalists to create content about the 2016 presidential race. The stories will be published on a web portal beginning in the fall of 2015. The portal is being designed not only to inform voters about issues important to Native Americans, but also to provide voters with information about how each presidential candidate’s proposed policies and platform would affect American Indian and Alaska Native communities across the country.

NAJA envisions that the NativeEye web portal would be a destination website for voters to interact with each other through chats, as well as a place for them to view videos and other multimedia content about the presidential race.

The 10 Native American college students will produce their work through an upper-level online journalism course offered by the University of Montana, where they will gain three hours of college credit toward a degree.

Students will be matched with mentors – professional journalists with experience in covering elections – who help guide the fellows in their stories about the presidential race.

Support diversity in civic engagement

The United States continues to grow more racially and ethnically diverse, yet the way presidential candidates speak to voters has changed little since its birth as a nation. To those seeking the highest office, the main audience is white America.

Mainstream media cover presidential races largely through that same lens, even though the electorate increasingly is becoming more diverse. The U.S. Census Bureau reported that over the last five presidential elections, the share of voters who were racial or ethnic minorities rose from just over one in six in 1996 to more than one in four in 2012.

Native Americans and their issues are rarely part of the national discussion during a presidential race, yet in the 2008 election, several states were impacted with the increased participation of Native voters. The continued lack of attention to this segment of the population underscores the need for a place for Native American voters to access information about the presidential candidates – through the lens of their own tribal issues – so they may make an informed choice on Election Day. 

Goals of the Native American Journalism Fellowship (NAJF)

- Create rich experience for Native American students that inspires them to pursue a career in journalism

- Offer training that prepares students for the newsroom

- Prepare participants for job offers (program graduates)

- Execute a successful project that turns into a model for an ongoing program

- Produce active NAJA professional members who contribute to the organization and become mentors to other aspiring journalists

story:
Short Summary

The Cartoon Guy Show is an educational art show for children Kindergarten through 5th grade.  In the show we teach our students how to create and design their own cartoons and works of art using Language Arts, Math, History, Science and much more.  We teach using a method we like to  call "Laugh-a-cation" which means to educate through laughter.  The show's lessons are based off of state educational standards.  We believe that our students can get a better grasp on their other subjects in school by using art.

  • Ever since Justin Barnes was a child he has had a fascination with cartoons and movies. In high school he had the opportunity to work with a very talented artist, Gary Barker at Paws Inc. where Garfield the cat is created. Through Mr. Barker, Justin learned several new techniques in art. Shortly after high school, Justin taught his first, "How to Create Your Own Cartoons!" workshop at the Greenwood Public Library. That right there was all he needed to know what he wanted to do with the rest of his life. Shortly after that in 2002, he created his own company called Cartoon Express, which taught many children around surrounding states. Since then he has taught over 10,000 children how to create and design their own cartoons, comics and much more. While teaching the students the dubbed him a nick name that would stick with him the rest of his life, "The Cartoon Guy!"
  • Our goal is to improve on the overall quality of the Cartoon Guy Show in order to help raise the bar of our children's education.
  • In helping with The Cartoon Guy Show, you will be helping us find new and fun ways to inspire children to want to learn and to expand their minds and imaginations.


What We Need & What You Get

Here is the Breakdown for you:

  • We are currently trying to raise at least $30,000 to help get a studio space and sets for The Cartoon Guy Show. We, as of now, have been filming in an art class room in Southport Indiana. It is a good space, but sadly we are limited to what we can do and build. Plus in the summer time, which is the best time for us to film, the A/C gets turned off and you can only imagine how toasty it gets in there!
  • There are a lot of great perks for helping. Everything ranging from hand drawn pictures from us, signed autographs, DVD copies, your name being mentioned in the show, and the biggest one, Helping improve our children's education.
  • The majority of all the funding will go into finding a proper studio space plus helping with sets and location shooting.

The Impact

  • The Cartoon Guy Show has been seen by many children and parents and everyone that has seen it has said it has taught them new things and new outlooks on art education.
  • The first 3 episodes have already aired on WFYI PBS in Indianapolis and the staff of WFYI have loved the show and even they have expressed interest in taking the show further than our state, which means.....NATIONAL!
  • Just remember, Art Class is not a "Babysitter Class" it is a way for children of all ages to be creative and to learn problem solving skills. Art has been one the greatest things we as humans have ever done. With art there would be no houses, cars, computers, or anything. Look around you and just know, an artist created that!

Other Ways You Can Help

We at The Cartoon Guy Show know that money can be really tight, but there are many ways you can help the show out.
-Share the show with your local schools, art teachers, family members and who ever you wish. Let us all work together to make our children's futures a bright and creative!
-Justin Barnes AKA The Cartoon Guy

story:
On the 16th of December 2014, the Pakistani Taliban attacked a school in the city of Peshawar, killing 141 people. The majority of these were children but the school's principal and teachers were also amongst those dead. Over 100 people were also injured during what is considered as the Taliban's deadliest attack in Pakistan.


Pakistan is a country already struggling to cope with armed violence and poverty; amongst other problems (see figures below). This unforgivable act has caused further deaths, injuries and emotional trauma.


ACTION ON ARMED VIOLENCE (AOAV) strongly condemns this horrible act:

We believe that there is no justification for such actions. We are also urging relevant agencies to provide treatment and care for the injured. The families of the dead clearly need support – often psychological in nature, but financial too – at such a painful time.

Prior to this horrific incident, we had already been planning to promote a psychosocial support intervention for survivors of armed conflict in Peshawar, Punjab and Sindh in partnership with local NGOs and government agency partners. This incident has spurred us to work harder to be able to deploy psychosocial and/or material support to those affected in Peshawar.

Action on Armed Violence is launching this fundraising appeal to provide Trauma Support 4 Peshawar Terror Attack Survivors.


Our Work and Track Record

  • Central mission: to reduce harm and to rebuild lives affected by armed violence. 
  • We do this by carrying out field work, research and advocacy to reduce the incidence and impact of global armed violence. 
  • Why: Because the number of fatalities from armed violence is estimated to be over half a million every year and something needs to be done about it.

What we are doing this year: We will be working with victims of armed violence offering psychosocial assistance and providing opportunities to help victims earn a living, working to reduce conflict at local levels.  

AOAV is one of the very few charities working to help war survivors achieve better mental health. We work to build communities affected by armed violence, working with governments, and measuring and monitoring the incidences and impact of armed violence around the world.


-> How are we going to help victims of armed violence in PAKISTAN and how?

AOAV is helping 500 armed violence survivors in Peshawar, Pakistan. Approximately 60% of these beneficiaries are female and young persons. The beneficiaries will be trained on psychosocial support provision to enable them to understand their own experiences and provide peer-based support to other survivors in their school and community.  AOAV has utilised a similar training programme for survivors in Burundi but will adapt it to suit the Pakistani context in partnership with the Sustainable Peace and Development Organisation (SPADO) and the Department of health, Special Education and Social Welfare agencies in Pakistan.

What do we need the funds for?

We need funds for the following: 

1) production of training module, 

2) transport fortraining participants for non-residential training to cut on cost, 

3) food for participants during the training

4) cost for training facility, 

5) monitoring of peer support volunteers for 6 months. 



Main Activities:

1.  Self-Help Group formation- SHGs are groups of 40-90 female and young person survivors, who are brought together mainly for collective support. Underpinning the SHGs is the need to have access to the services that will enable survivors to achieve recovery. 

2.  Provision of 5 day training on psychosocial support delivery. A five day training programme facilitated by staff from partner organizations will be conducted. Courses will include: understanding traumatic stress and its impacts, conducting structured interviews to detect the impact of trauma, being able to provide mentoring/support to people affected by trauma, interview skills (e.g. active listening) and a range of simple self-help techniques (e.g. problem solving, motivational interviewing etc).

3.  Peer Support provision- After forming Self Help Groups (SHGs) and the completion of training, peer support will then commence. Through the SHG also survivors will be link to other services provided by the government.

4.  Access to other services- We know from AOAV experience, statistics and academic studies that recovery is achieved faster if survivors have access to other services and opportunities. Therefore, it is critical that survivors are linked to other relevant services such as health care and social services to enable them to achieve better recovery.


-> WHY IS MENTAL HEALTH IN ARMED VIOLENCE SUCH A BIG ISSUE?

Mental health problems are a leading cause of disability globally. They account for 13% of the world’s total burden of diseases. They affect 10% of people across the course of their lives, and make up over a quarter of the years lived by people in disability globally. Almost three-quarters of people with mental health problems, and suffering from depression, substance addiction, schizophrenia, learning disabilities, PTSD and other common mental conditions, live in low- and middle-income countries. Every year, $2.5 trillion are lost to mental health problems. Ironically, the amount invested to address the issue is only less than 2% of the health spending in most low- and lower middle-income countries.

Mental health problems are caused by a number of factors, including exposure to armed violence. While there is universal consensus on the harmful effects of armed violence on life and property, its impact on mental health has largely been ignored, even in the face of overwhelming evidence of the causal link between the two. Despite strong economic, social, humanitarian and epidemiological arguments for tackling mental health as a consequence of armed conflict, the condition remains disproportionately poorly funded around the world. Unaddressed, mental health poses a massive development problem and will become a greater barrier to the achievement of the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs).

AOAV Article: Explosive weapon harm: mental health and psychological impacts


-> In PAKISTAN...


Where is this intervention is going to be implemented?  Estimates show that 1 out of every 5 families are struggling with mental health problems. Services are often limited and those that exist are mostly urban based. To complicate matters, the stigma associated with mental health further prevents those suffering from accessing the necessary services that are available to achieve better mental health. Statistically, one has more chance of being shot or run over by a vehicle in Pakistan, than seeing a mental health professional.


Pakistan and Armed Violence

Pakistan has had a long history of conflict that has displaced people, exposed them to violence and triggered mental health problems. Since 2001, over 55,000 people have been killed, hundreds of thousands injured, and more than 3 million displaced by armed hostilities between militants and Pakistani forces. This is the largest of such displacement since the partition of 1947. Ethnic and political conflicts have also contributed to further insecurity, morbidity and destruction.

Armed violence is the fourth leading cause of mortality among 15 to 44-year-olds. It causes significant psychological and emotional suffering for survivors and their families. It undermines their mental health and well-being. Rates of depression and post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) are evidently higher in conflict-affected countries. As a poor country with over 180 million people and a massive mental health burden associated with decades of armed violence; Pakistan allocates only 0.40% of its health budget to mental health. Given the numerous problems the country is facing, mental health is not a top priority.

For many survivors, escaping hostilities is often just the beginning of a long struggle to: make sense of their experience, recover from trauma and get on with their lives. In a country with abject poverty and underdevelopment, without accessible psychosocial support, they will have a very hard road to mental health and economic recovery.


PLEASE DONATE AND HELP US MAKE THIS WORLD A SAFER PLACE FOR PEOPLE TO LIVE IN! A little goes a long way!


Thank you.

story:
Moving to educate Gambian journalists

Currently we are teaching assistants in the diploma programmes the Gambia Press Union is running and the feedback we get from lecturers and students are positive. We are learning so much from these lecturers and by the time we complete our degree programme we will be ready to make an impact in the country’s media field.

We need your help to pay for those degrees!

Through TANGO (The Association of NGOs) we are already teaching NGOs' and radio stations around the country how to get their messages across in an accurate and meaningful way. Also, we are assisting Danish media trainers that arrive through the project "Gambia Communicates".

We are on the move and trying to make things happen: Help us succeed!

Your Impact
With the right education, fewer journalists will not run into conflicts because of misquoting or misrepresenting a source. Without a doubt every journalist in the World feels sad when journalists are detained in The Gambia, so help us change things.

Even 5 dollars will help The Gambia. Your investment, however small, in our education, will give us the tools to provide better teaching and to reach more people. We want to help the Gambia Press Union and the journalism fraternity in The Gambia.

Training is safety
The three of us have all worked for over five years as journalists and never run into trouble with the state. It is not because we are lucky, but because we have training.

The government made stringent media laws because they claim journalism in The Gambia is practiced by untrained people. People who left school and walked straight to the newsroom so, they blame them for false reporting and thus created strict laws.

But when we and the GPU school can educate journalists committing little or no error for the state to arrest, the state might change by putting up flexible and friendly media laws.

Change the status quo
We are former students of the Gambia Press Union School of Journalism who acquired a Diploma in Journalism and due to our outstanding performance we were recruited to teach in the subsequent diploma programmes. But we all realized that to be able to have an impact and deliver well, we need to acquire a Bachelors Degree. So we all enrolled for BA to better equip ourselves.

Contributing to this course means changing the status quo of journalism in The Gambia because we are convinced that once we have a pool of educated journalist who uphold ethical standards the number of journalists running into trouble will drop significantly.

What We Need
Each of us need about $3,000 for tuition for the remaining three years. We have managed to pay for the first year through the support of the NGO, Gambia Media Support, and The Gambia Press Union. Your donation will be going into the payment of tuition fees and not books and other needs. Despite targeting $9,000, we will use whatever you donate to settle for the coming years once the campaign is over. We hope you donate!

Other Ways You Can Help
For you who read this message and felt you want to contribute but not in cash, you can pass the message on to someone you know. Passing on the message itself is contributing. Make your own noise about our campaign and you can consider yourself among the change makers of journalism in The Gambia. All you need to do is go to Indiegogo and you will see the share button, then you can share it to your group of friends.
story_txt:
Moving to educate Gambian journalists
Currently we are teaching assistants in the diploma programmes the Gambia
Press Union is running and the feedback we get from lecturers and students are
positive. We are learning so much from these lecturers and by the time we
complete our degree programme we will be ready to make an impact in the
country’s media field. 
We need your help to pay for those degrees!
Through TANGO (The Association of NGOs) we are already teaching NGOs' and radio
stations around the country how to get their messages across in an accurate and
meaningful way. Also, we are assisting Danish media trainers that arrive
through the project "Gambia Communicates". 
We are on the move and trying to make things happen: Help us succeed!
Your Impact
With the right education, fewer journalists will not run into conflicts
because of misquoting or misrepresenting a source. Without a doubt every
journalist in the World feels sad when journalists are detained in The Gambia,
so help us change things.Even 5 dollars will help The Gambia. Your investment, however small, in our
education, will give us the tools to provide better teaching and to reach more
people. We want to help the Gambia Press Union and the journalism fraternity in
The Gambia. 
Training is safety
The three of us have all worked for over five years as journalists and never
run into trouble with the state. It is not because we are lucky, but because we
have training.
The government made stringent media laws because they claim journalism in
The Gambia is practiced by untrained people. People who left school and walked
straight to the newsroom so, they blame them for false reporting and thus
created strict laws.
But when we and the GPU school can educate journalists committing little or
no error for the state to arrest, the state might change by putting up flexible
and friendly media laws.Change the status quoWe are former students of the Gambia Press Union School of Journalism who
acquired a Diploma in Journalism and due to our outstanding performance we were
recruited to teach in the subsequent diploma programmes. But we all realized
that to be able to have an impact and deliver well, we need to acquire a
Bachelors Degree. So we all enrolled for BA to better equip ourselves.
Contributing to this course means changing the status quo of journalism in
The Gambia because we are convinced that once we have a pool of educated
journalist who uphold ethical standards the number of journalists running into
trouble will drop significantly.
What We Need
Each of us need about $3,000 for tuition for the remaining three years. We have
managed to pay for the first year through the support of the NGO, Gambia Media
Support, and The Gambia Press Union. Your donation will be going into the
payment of tuition fees and not books and other needs. Despite targeting
$9,000, we will use whatever you donate to settle for the coming years once the
campaign is over. We hope you donate!
Other Ways You Can Help
For you who read this message and felt you want to contribute but not in cash,
you can pass the message on to someone you know. Passing on the message itself
is contributing. Make your own noise about our campaign and you can consider
yourself among the change makers of journalism in The Gambia. All you need to
do is go to Indiegogo and you will see the share button, then you can share it to
your group of friends.

story:
Hello, this is Klara Ravat, the co-founder and director of the Smell Lab Studio in Berlin!

 

About Smell Lab, Berlin:

 

The Smell Lab, Berlin, is a platform for olfactory art and inter-disciplinary practices that relate to scent as a medium for expression and communication, Smell Lab's main mission is to co-produce, host, educate, innovate and support artistic practices that involve the sense of smell and olfaction.

https://www.smell-lab.org/

 

Why am I raising funds?

 

Come join me, let's open the doors of the new Smell Open Lab! My unique and sweet Smell Lab studio is located in the beautiful neighborhood of Prenzlauer Berg, in Berlin, Germany. I am raising funds to cover my move to this well-located new public-oriented Smell Lab studio and for the renovation costs to make an open, safe, welcoming and beautiful creative space where any of you can come and make their own scent work making use of our scent organ and premises.

Join the Smell Lab tribe! 

 

Wait, but what's going on at the Smell Lab?

 

1. Smell Open Lab:

Berlin is a major expression of freedom and creativity in Europe. Many artists and creative professionals move to the crazy metropolis every year. But we all know, Berlin is changing and the rental prices are rising, making it difficult for creative entrepreneurs to settle in the city and expand.

The Smell Open Lab wants to create a safe and relaxed space for creative-minded humans who want to create with scent, share inspirations and ideas and mingle. With your help, we can bring all these people together and create a warm place to foster creativity.

 

2. Help our library of scents to grow:

The Smell Lab has already a collection of about 120 perfumery ingredients (essential oils, aroma molecules, and fragrance oils) at your disposition. However, we need a wider variety of ingredients, I want to provide you with the largest possible choice you've ever imagined! In order to achieve this, we need to source and increase our collection.

 

3. Expanding our community 

Shout out loud! Help us covering some marketing & advertising costs. In a digital era, we need to spread our small tentacles online, I want to reach more people and make our small family grow!

 

4.  Growing the team

I am looking for a magical superhero who can help us grow and support the Smell Lab by running some of the activities and administrative tasks.

 

5. What is coming up:

  • INDIE Perfumer meet up
  • Perfume accords workshop
  • Perfume Blending Workshops
  • Sniff meet up
  • Open Lab Sessions
  • Perfumer in Residency South Morocco
  • 4th Experimental Scent Summit in LA
  • Our first research group
  • More tba...

 

Funding Goals:

 

Target 7.650 EUR

  • 2.100 EUR will help cover part of the workshop space costs for the first running months.
  • 1,500 EUR will help to double our scent organ (at the moment we have about 120 ingredients available in our collection).
  • 1.200 EUR I will invest in lab materials, for example, perfumer alcohol, bottles, vials, new scales for the workshops, pipettes and more! I want to be ready to have all you need!
  • 400 EUR will help buy and mount two new mobile stainless steel tall tables (at the moment I have one).
  • 1.250 EUR will get the Smell Lab going with promotional costs (like marketing and advertising). We need to reach more people so we can continue growing!
  • 1.200 EUR will help me find a magic person to support the Smell Lab while I can manage our external collaborations around the world!

 

Why supporting the Smell Lab?

 

  • With your help, we can build an accessible scent lab were we promise we won't hold any secrets. Who said you couldn't learn by yourself (and with our support) about creativity and perfumery?
  • The Smell Lab is not only an educational and art project, but it's also about empowering people. We like to think "If I can, why wouldn't you?".
  • In the past four years the Smell Lab (Klara Ravat, and her different collaborators) have hosted a bunch of free public presentations, talked about scent extraction methods, invited artists and designers to speak to an audience, created scented games together, we smell-dated, installed a bunch of temporary working stations in different cities, taught at universities, hosted workshops...

It is definitively worth supporting the Smell Lab Studio, together we are invincible!

 

No Money? It's OK.

Because I am aware many of you out there are in a similar position, here other ways you could help:

  • Share the campaign with your friends. Every shared post or mouth to mouth comment matters! Here the link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/smell-lab-berlin/
  • Go to Facebook and like the page: https://www.facebook.com/smell.lab
  • Instagram about Smell Lab: @smell.lab
  • Do you have materials or books you think we could use at the lab? Email me to hello@smell-lab.org

 

Smell Lab Perks

(I will add some surprises over the campaign!)

- Cutest Enamel pin ever!

 

- Smell Smell Smell Smell our tote bag, available in two colors: back or red!

 

- Sexiest flowy t-shirt, available in several colors.

 

- Check on your right side and discover all we can offer.

 

I am so looking forward to receiving you at our new studio, and develop many scented projects together!!

With warm regards,

 

Klara Ravat

Smell Lab Studio founder and director

Winsstr. 42, 10405 Berlin, Germany

hello@smell-lab.org

https://www.smell-lab.org/

story:
• ENGLISH VERSION
  • VERSIONE ITALIANA

L'OBIETTIVO DEL CROWDFUNDING?

L'articolo 132 della Costituzione Italiana consente la creazione di una autonomia per Milano. 

Milano città stato mira a diventare la prima città d'Italia autonoma, modello di efficienza e cultura di vita, come già sono Berlino, Madrid, Amburgo, i cantoni svizzeri, Singapore e Hong Kong, esempio di come una città stato possa essere da stimolo per la nazione di cui fa parte.

Fine di questa campagna è di promuovere un sondaggio sui cittadini e raccogliere firme per arrivare a un referendum per fare scegliere se dire SI o dire NO a Milano Città Stato.

Leggi il manifesto di Milano Città Stato: http://www.milanocittastato.it/manifesto/

CHI SIAMO? 

Milano città stato è un progetto trasversale alla politica che ha l'obiettivo di coinvolgere i cittadini nella costruzione della città ideale.

È un progetto concepito in Vivaio, associazione che ha lo scopo di rendere Milano grande nel mondo. Info: www.associazionevivaio.it. 

    Clicca per il video di Vivaio per Milano in: 

  • ITALIANO
  • INGLESE
  • TEDESCO
  • RUSSO
  • FRANCESE
  • PORTOGHESE
  • SPAGNOLO

Il progetto è ora sviluppato dall'associazione Milano, ente senza fine di lucro che ha lo scopo di realizzare iniziative che possano far competere Milano e il territorio circostante con le grandi metropoli europee, anche attraverso il conseguimento di una sua maggiore autonomia dal governo centrale

DI COSA ABBIAMO BISOGNO PERLA CAMPAGNA DI MILANO CITTÀ STATO?

Tutti i contributi raccolti verranno destinati alla campagna di comunicazione di Milano Città Stato e il loro impiego sarà pubblicato sul sito www.milanocittastato.it

In particolare si prevedono le seguenti attività:

Se si raggiungeranno da 15.000 euro a 100.000 euro si attiveranno iniziative di comunicazione e pubblicitarie per promuovere e diffondere il progetto di Milano Città Stato, tra cui il potenziamento del sito www.milanocittastato.it.

Se si raggiungeranno 100.000 euro si organizzeranno le MILANARIE con 25 banchetti durante le elezioni amministrative di Milano, per far votare i cittadini SI o NO a Milano Città Stato

Se si raggiungeranno 200.000 euro, nelle MILANARIE verranno posti 50 banchetti e si realizzerà una campagna affissioni e una campagna media per promuovere l'evento

Se si raggiungeranno 300.000 euro, nelle MILANARIE verranno posti 75 banchetti e si realizzerà una campagna affissioni e una campagna media per promuovere l'evento 

Se si raggiungeranno 400.000 euro, nelle MILANARIE verranno posti 100 banchetti e si realizzerà una campagna affissioni e una campagna media per promuovere l'evento 

Il 50% di quanto raccolto sopra i 400.000 euro  verrà destinato a finanziare a fondo perduto progetti per Milano. L'altro 50% verrà utilizzato a supporto del progetto di Milano Città Stato. 

CHI SONO I CITTADINI DI MILANO CITTÀ STATO? Milano città stato è un modello di città universale ed è aperta a tutti quelli che vogliono il bene di Milano. Indipendentemente da dove si trovano.

QUAL È IL SOGNO DI MILANO CITTÀ STATO? Dare la possibilità a ognuno di esprimersi secondo le sue inclinazioni, facendo al contempo crescere la comunità di cui fa parte. Credere nella realizzazione degli individui come valore fondante di una società significa considerare il benessere degli altri come una parte fondamentale della propria realizzazione. Nessun individuo può sentirsi realmente realizzato se non prova piacere a migliorare la comunità di cui fa parte.

QUINDI È UN PROGETTO POLITICO? Sì, ma senza limitazioni di partito o schieramenti tradizionali. 

QUALI SONO I PROGETTI DI MILANO CITTÀ STATO.

Tra i progetti prioritari di Milano città stato ci sono:

#1. Milano free zone

Le “zone economiche speciali” si stanno diffondendo in tutto il mondo: sono circa 3mila sparse in 135 Paesi. La caratteristica delle free zone è di avere proprie leggi fiscali, societarie e del lavoro, con una burocrazia semplificata. Nelle free zone più che sulle tasse si paga un prezzo annuale di permesso per operare. Questo semplifica la gestione amministrativa di ogni attività e consente di concentrarsi interamente sul proprio business. Si può immaginare inizialmente di applicare il modello di free zone per ogni nuova azienda che nasce o che arriva sul territorio, con burocrazia agevolata (possibilità di fondarla in 10 minuti), con un pagamento fisso che sostituisce ogni imposta, per un periodo di almeno tre anni. Se la sperimentazione sulle nuove aziende mostra vantaggi economici e fiscali anche per l’amministrazione, si procederà all’estensione di questo regime a ogni operatore economico.

#2. Feedback dei cittadini sulla pubblica amministrazione

La tecnologia oggi consente di poter esprimere il giudizio in tempo reale su ogni servizio fornito. Oggi si possono esprimere giudizi su tutto: sugli alberghi, sui ristoranti, sui professionisti e perfino sugli amici. Su tutto, tranne che sull’unica cosa che tutti noi paghiamo: la pubblica amministrazione.

Ogni cittadino deve avere la possibilità di esprimere il proprio feedback su ogni servizio fornito dall’amministrazione. Dal sindaco e gli assessori fino a scendere a chi fornisce attività allo sportello, tutti devono poter essere oggetto di valutazione da parte del cittadino, perché lui è chi li paga e perché è suo il patrimonio che loro amministrano.

Fine non è punire chi lavora male ma mettere in luce chi dà soddisfazione ai cittadini e fornire un apprezzamento o dei consigli utili per rendere più efficiente il suo lavoro.

#3. Milano capitale mondiale nella produzione di nuova cultura

In un Paese che si limita, con fatica, a conservare la cultura del passato, Milano dovrebbe porsi come capitale nella produzione di nuova cultura, tornando all’altezza della sua grande storia.

Per farlo bisognerebbe mettere in rete i centri che favoriscono la produzione di cultura, si dovrebbe far emergere talenti e metterli in condizione di poter trasmettere le loro opere al pubblico. Si dovrebbero mettere in rete filantropi e investitori del settore per agevolare la messa in luce di chi ha le carte per affermarsi su mercati più ampi, bisogna rafforzare laboratori, botteghe e centri di formazione.

Bisogna coinvolgere le imprese e una volta creata questa rete di formazione, comunicazione e collaborazione, si deve cercare di far venire a Milano artisti di altre città, italiane e straniere, per alimentare la produzione locale.

#4. Istruzione acceleratore dell’individuo

Il percorso di istruzione dovrà avere lo scopo di favorire creatività e consapevolezza degli studenti nelle loro capacità distintive. Piuttosto che produrre laureati specializzati in un apprendimento passivo di poche materie, si dovrà cercare di avere persone capaci, con una personalità sviluppata a 360 gradi.

La personalità dovrà essere ricca di esperienze e dovrà anche essere completata riprendendo una grande tradizione italiana che è stata una delle chiavi del successo del periodo rinascimentale: l’arte manuale.

Durante gli studi ci sarà un anno di sperimentazione in cui ogni studente proverà tanti tipi di lavori di ogni tipo per mettere in luce le sue capacità e per capire a cosa è più orientato, a fianco all'apprendimento passivo ci sarà grande spazio all'elaborazione di idee e progetti propri.

Si darà completezza alla formazione in ogni ambito della personalità, si stimolerà lo studente a essere protagonista in società, soggetto di contributo attivo alla comunità e ogni studente potrà scegliere liberamente il suo percorso.

In tutti i corsi di studi si cercherà di allenare lo studente come homo economicus, ossia come soggetto capace e predisposto a produrre più ricchezza di quella che consuma, e deve essere fortemente incentivata la sperimentazione di attività in proprio, ad esempio predisponendo una zona franca, tipo i primi 3 anni post laurea, in cui eventuali fallimenti non produrranno effetti sul curriculum della persona. 

Tre anni dopo la laurea significa estendere il periodo della formazione dell’individuo oltre il termine dei suoi studi. Anzi, a Milano città stato ci sarà un sistema di formazione permanente disponibile per tutti i cittadini e che renderà più ricco il percorso di carriera di ognuno. In particolare il sistema di formazione permanente entrerà in azione per aiutare chi è in difficoltà a stare sul mercato.

#5. Dal Welfare al Restart

Il concetto di restart mette al centro la persona con il fine di aiutarla a fare emergere le sue potenzialità e a riportarla sulla strada dell’autonomia, intesa come capacità di provvedere a se stessa.

Il restart si applica a chi ha perso il lavoro, a persone in difficoltà economica e si estende anche a chi è fallito o ha dovuto chiudere partita iva o azienda, trattando imprenditori e liberi professionisti allo stesso modo di lavoratori che perdono il lavoro: a Milano città Stato si tutela la persona non il posto di lavoro.

#6. Milano città leader nella lotta contro l’inquinamento

Milano è una delle città più inquinate d’Europa. Invece di subire passivamente il problema cercando unicamente di ridurre l’emissione di agenti inquinanti, Milano deve diventare la città d’avanguardia nella eliminazione dell’inquinamento.

La soluzione potrebbe essere quella di trovare sul territorio start up, aziende, ricercatori, investitori più coinvolti con la sezione della green economy più legata al tema dell’inquinamento, dopo di che dovrebbe metterli assieme, creare alleanze con le altre città per ricevere da loro le migliori intelligenze e competenze interessate all’inquinamento atmosferico, che sarebbero interessati a venire a Milano perché a Milano esiste il massimo problema e la maggiore attenzione per cercare di risolverlo.

L’inquinamento stesso può diventare fattore di attrazione di un sistema in grado di far diventare Milano una capitale mondiale e, una volta creato questo sistema, si può generare un indotto fatto di ricchezza, di lavoro, di talenti che proliferano sul territorio. Realizzando un circolo virtuoso che possa consolidare questa leadership.

#7. La prima città universale

Milano città stato non è la città dove hai la residenza ma è la comunità a cui contribuisci. Milano città stato aprirà la sua cittadinanza a tutte le persone che contribuiranno in misura significativa alla costruzione della città ideale. Questo si può fare perché si ha la separazione dell’amministrazione, intesa come erogazione di servizi, dalla politica della città. Chi fa qualcosa di concreto per la città, diventa cittadino universale di Milano godendo di alcuni dei diritti di cittadinanza anche se vive in luoghi distanti nel mondo.


CONDIVIDI LA CAMPAGNA SUI SOCIAL

WWW.MILANOCITTASTATO.IT

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/MILANOCITTASTATO

TWITTER: @micittastato

#Xmilanocittastato


ENGLISH VERSION

WHAT IS MILAN CITY STATE?

What would your ideal city be like? This is the project in which you can build it!  Help us to develop a program that aims to involve citizens in the construction of their ideal city.

The Italian Constitution  -art.132- allows the creation of an autonomy region for the town of Milan. 

Milan city-state will be the first city in Italy to become a model of a goodliving culture, like the cities of Berlin, Madrid , Hamburg, Swiss cantons, Singapore and Hong Kong - an example of how a city can be a stimulus for the nation to which it belongs.

The aim of this project is to promote a survey between all the citizens and gather all the signatures to claim a referendum. 


WHO ARE WE? Milan City State is a program that aims to involve citizens in the construction of their ideal city. It is a project designed by Vivaio, a non-profit association that aims to foster the creation and development of projects that can make Milan a leading global city.

If you click here you can watch the video of "Vivaio for Milano" in different languages: 
  • ITALIAN
  • ENGLISH
  • GERMAN
  • RUSSIAN
  • FRENCH
  • PORTUGUESE
  • SPANISH

A spin off of Vivaio is Associazione MIlano, a not for profit organization with the aim to develop the project of Milan City State

HOW WILL THE DONATIONS BE ALLOCATED?

All contributions collected will be donated to the campaign for Milan City State and their use will be published on www.milanocittastato.it

From 15.000 Euros to 100.000 Euros:  activities with the aim of spreading knowledge about the Milan City State project, and the magazine www.milanocittastato.it 

If we raise 100.000 Euros: we'll organize the "MILANARIE", with 25 ballot boxes to vote YES or NO to Milan City State during administrative elections for the mayor of Milan (and with special activities to promote this referendum)

If we raise 200.000 Euros: we'll organize the "MILANARIE", with 50 ballot boxes to vote YES or NO to Milan City State during administrative elections for the mayor of Milan (and with special activities to promote this referendum)

If we raise 300.000 Euros: we'll organize the "MILANARIE", with 75 ballot boxes to vote YES or NO to Milan City State during administrative elections for the mayor of Milan (and with special activities to promote this referendum)

If we raise 400.000 Euros: we'll organize the "MILANARIE", with 100 ballot boxes to vote YES or NO to Milan City State during administrative elections for the mayor of Milan (and with special activities to promote this referendum)

We'll devolve the 50% above the sum of 400.000 Euros  to finance projects for Milan. The other 50% will be use to support the project of Milan City State. 


WHO ARE THE CITIZENS OF MILAN CITY STATE? 

Milan City State is open to all those who want the good of Milan. Regardless of where they are.

WHAT IS THE DREAM OF MILAN CITY STATE?

To give everybody the opportunity to express themselves according to their talents while helping grow the community in which they belong.

We believe that the key issue in every society should be promoting the growth and fulfillment of its members. 

Believing in the realization of the individuals as a fundamental value of a society means considering the welfare of others to be part of their self-growth.

THEN IT’S A POLITICAL PROJECT?

Yes, but without any limitation of political parties.

WHAT ARE THE PROJECTS OF MILAN CITY STATE?

The priority projects of Milan City States are:

#1 . MILAN FREE ZONE

Applying a free zone model for each new company, with simplified bureaucracy and a single fixed tax.

#2. FEEDBACK BY CITIZENS ABOUT THE PUBLIC SERVICE

Every citizen will have the opportunity to express their rating on each service provided by the administration, with a website created along the lines of TripAdvisor.

#3 MILAN AS THE WORLD CAPITAL FOR THE PRODUCTION OF NEW CULTURE

Milan will propose itself as a  capital for the production of new culture, building a network of creatives in the city and attracting  artists from other cities.

#4.UNIVERSITY AS  A HUMAN ACCELERATOR

The universities will aim to foster creativity and an awareness of the distinctive skills of their students.

#5.FROM WELFARE TO RESTART

The concept of restarting is focused on people in difficulties, with the aim of helping them to regain autonomy and to develop their potential.

#6.MILAN AS THE LEADING CITY AGAINST POLLUTION

Milan will attract the best experts in the world to help it become the leading city in the elimination of pollution.

#7. THE FIRST UNIVERSAL CITY

Everyone who does something for the city should become a universal citizen of Milan, enjoying certain rights of citizenship even if he or she lives in other parts of the world.


WHEN WILL THE CITY STATE OF MILAN BE BORN?

Milan city-state will be the first city in Italy to become a model of a goodliving culture, like the cities of Berlin, Madrid, Hamburg, Swiss cantons, Singapore and Hong Kong - an example of how a city can be a stimulus for the nation to which it belongs.

The aim of this project is to promote a survey between all the citizens and gather all the signatures to claim a referendum. 


HOW WILL MILAN CITY STATE GROW? 

Through working groups open to citizens with the aim of devising strategies and proposals. The digital magazine www.milanocittastato.it launched in January 2016. There will be periodic meetings and the "MILANARIE", an advisory referendum which will take place during the election for the mayor of Milan.


WHO CAN PARTICIPATE IN MILAN CITY STATE AND IN CROWDFUNDING?Everybody.

We talk to people around the world who wish to join us in the construction of a model of an ideal society centred on the citizen.
story_txt:
ENGLISH VERSION
VERSIONE ITALIANA

L'OBIETTIVO DEL CROWDFUNDING?L'articolo 132 della Costituzione Italiana consente
la creazione di una autonomia per Milano. Milano città stato mira a diventare la prima città d'Italia autonoma, modello di efficienza e cultura di vita, come già sono Berlino, Madrid, Amburgo, i cantoni svizzeri, Singapore e Hong Kong, esempio di come una città stato possa essere da stimolo per la nazione di cui fa parte.
Fine di questa campagna è di promuovere un
sondaggio sui cittadini e raccogliere firme per arrivare a un referendum per fare scegliere se dire SI o dire NO a Milano Città Stato.Leggi il manifesto di Milano Città Stato: http://www.milanocittastato.it/manifesto/CHI SIAMO? Milano città stato è un progetto trasversale alla politica che ha l'obiettivo di coinvolgere i cittadini nella costruzione della città ideale.È un progetto concepito in Vivaio, associazione che ha lo scopo di rendere Milano grande nel mondo. Info: www.associazionevivaio.it. 
Clicca per il video di Vivaio per Milano in: 

ITALIANO


INGLESE


TEDESCO


RUSSO


FRANCESE


PORTOGHESE


SPAGNOLO

Il progetto è ora sviluppato dall'associazione Milano, ente senza fine di lucro che ha lo scopo di realizzare iniziative che
possano far competere Milano e il territorio circostante con le grandi
metropoli europee, anche attraverso il conseguimento di una sua maggiore
autonomia dal governo centraleDI COSA ABBIAMO BISOGNO PERLA CAMPAGNA DI MILANO CITTÀ STATO?Tutti i contributi raccolti verranno destinati alla campagna di comunicazione di Milano Città Stato e il loro impiego sarà pubblicato sul sito www.milanocittastato.itIn particolare si prevedono le seguenti attività:Se si raggiungeranno da 15.000 euro a 100.000 euro si attiveranno iniziative di comunicazione e pubblicitarie per promuovere e diffondere il progetto di Milano Città Stato, tra cui il potenziamento del sito www.milanocittastato.it.Se si raggiungeranno 100.000 euro si organizzeranno le MILANARIE con 25 banchetti durante le elezioni amministrative di Milano, per far votare i cittadini SI o NO a Milano Città StatoSe si raggiungeranno 200.000 euro, nelle MILANARIE verranno posti 50 banchetti e si realizzerà una campagna affissioni e una campagna media per promuovere l'eventoSe si raggiungeranno 300.000 euro, nelle MILANARIE verranno posti 75 banchetti e si realizzerà una campagna affissioni e una campagna media per promuovere l'evento Se si raggiungeranno 400.000 euro, nelle MILANARIE verranno posti 100 banchetti e si realizzerà una campagna affissioni e una campagna media per promuovere l'evento Il 50% di quanto raccolto sopra i 400.000 euro  verrà destinato a finanziare a fondo perduto progetti per Milano. L'altro 50% verrà utilizzato a supporto del progetto di Milano Città Stato. CHI SONO I CITTADINI DI MILANO CITTÀ STATO? Milano città stato è un modello di città universale ed è aperta a tutti quelli che vogliono il bene di Milano. Indipendentemente da dove si trovano.QUAL È IL SOGNO DI MILANO CITTÀ STATO? Dare la possibilità a ognuno di esprimersi secondo le sue inclinazioni, facendo al contempo crescere la comunità di cui fa parte. Credere nella realizzazione degli individui come valore fondante di una società significa considerare il benessere degli altri come una parte fondamentale della propria realizzazione. Nessun individuo può sentirsi realmente realizzato se non prova piacere a migliorare la comunità di cui fa parte.QUINDI È UN PROGETTO POLITICO? Sì, ma senza limitazioni di partito o schieramenti tradizionali. 
QUALI SONO I PROGETTI
DI MILANO CITTÀ STATO.
Tra i progetti prioritari di Milano città stato ci sono:
#1. Milano free zone
Le “zone economiche speciali” si stanno
diffondendo in tutto il mondo: sono circa 3mila sparse in 135 Paesi. La
caratteristica delle free zone è di avere proprie leggi fiscali, societarie e del lavoro, con una burocrazia semplificata.
Nelle free zone più che sulle tasse si paga un prezzo annuale di permesso per
operare. Questo semplifica la gestione amministrativa di ogni attività e
consente di concentrarsi interamente sul proprio business. Si può immaginare
inizialmente di applicare il modello di free zone per ogni nuova azienda che
nasce o che arriva sul territorio, con
burocrazia agevolata (possibilità di fondarla in 10 minuti), con un pagamento
fisso che sostituisce ogni imposta, per un periodo di almeno tre anni. Se
la sperimentazione sulle nuove aziende mostra vantaggi economici e fiscali
anche per l’amministrazione, si procederà all’estensione di questo regime a
ogni operatore economico. 
#2. Feedback dei cittadini sulla pubblica amministrazione
La
tecnologia oggi consente di poter esprimere il giudizio in tempo reale su ogni
servizio fornito. Oggi si possono esprimere giudizi su tutto: sugli alberghi,
sui ristoranti, sui professionisti e perfino sugli amici. Su tutto, tranne che
sull’unica cosa che tutti noi paghiamo: la pubblica amministrazione. 
Ogni
cittadino deve avere la possibilità di esprimere il proprio feedback su ogni
servizio fornito dall’amministrazione. Dal sindaco e gli assessori fino a
scendere a chi fornisce attività allo sportello, tutti devono poter essere oggetto di valutazione da parte del cittadino,
perché lui è chi li paga e perché è suo il patrimonio che loro amministrano. 
Fine
non è punire chi lavora male ma mettere in luce chi dà soddisfazione ai
cittadini e fornire un apprezzamento o dei consigli utili per rendere più
efficiente il suo lavoro. 
#3. Milano capitale mondiale nella produzione di nuova cultura
In
un Paese che si limita, con fatica, a conservare la cultura del passato, Milano dovrebbe porsi come capitale nella
produzione di nuova cultura, tornando all’altezza della sua grande storia. 
Per
farlo bisognerebbe mettere in rete i centri che favoriscono la produzione di
cultura, si dovrebbe far emergere talenti e metterli in condizione di poter
trasmettere le loro opere al pubblico. Si dovrebbero mettere in rete filantropi
e investitori del settore per agevolare
la messa in luce di chi ha le carte per affermarsi su mercati più ampi,
bisogna rafforzare laboratori, botteghe e centri di formazione. 
Bisogna
coinvolgere le imprese e una volta creata questa rete di formazione,
comunicazione e collaborazione, si deve
cercare di far venire a Milano artisti di altre città, italiane e straniere,
per alimentare la produzione locale. 
#4.
Istruzione acceleratore dell’individuo
Il
percorso di istruzione dovrà avere lo scopo di favorire creatività e
consapevolezza degli studenti nelle loro capacità distintive. Piuttosto che
produrre laureati specializzati in un apprendimento passivo di poche materie,
si dovrà cercare di avere persone capaci, con una personalità sviluppata a 360
gradi. 
La personalità dovrà essere ricca di
esperienze e dovrà anche essere completata riprendendo una grande tradizione
italiana che è stata una delle chiavi del successo del periodo rinascimentale:
l’arte manuale. 
Durante
gli studi ci sarà un anno di sperimentazione in cui ogni studente proverà
tanti tipi di lavori di ogni tipo per mettere in luce le sue capacità e per
capire a cosa è più orientato, a fianco all'apprendimento passivo ci sarà
grande spazio all'elaborazione di idee e progetti propri. 
Si darà completezza alla formazione in
ogni ambito della personalità, si
stimolerà lo studente a essere protagonista in società, soggetto di
contributo attivo alla comunità e ogni studente potrà scegliere liberamente il
suo percorso. 
In tutti i corsi di studi si cercherà
di allenare lo studente come homo
economicus, ossia come soggetto capace e predisposto a produrre più
ricchezza di quella che consuma, e deve
essere fortemente incentivata la sperimentazione di attività in proprio, ad
esempio predisponendo una zona franca, tipo i primi 3 anni post laurea, in cui
eventuali fallimenti non produrranno effetti sul curriculum della
persona. 
Tre anni dopo la laurea significa
estendere il periodo della formazione dell’individuo oltre il termine dei suoi
studi. Anzi, a Milano città stato ci sarà un
sistema di formazione permanente disponibile per tutti i cittadini e che
renderà più ricco il percorso di carriera di ognuno. In particolare il sistema
di formazione permanente entrerà in azione per aiutare chi è in difficoltà a
stare sul mercato. 
#5. Dal Welfare
al Restart
Il concetto di restart mette al centro
la persona con il fine di aiutarla a
fare emergere le sue potenzialità e a riportarla sulla strada dell’autonomia,
intesa come capacità di provvedere a se stessa. 
Il restart si applica a chi ha perso il
lavoro, a persone in difficoltà economica e si estende anche a chi è fallito o
ha dovuto chiudere partita iva o azienda, trattando imprenditori e liberi
professionisti allo stesso modo di lavoratori che perdono il lavoro: a Milano città Stato si tutela la persona
non il posto di lavoro.
#6.
Milano città leader nella lotta contro l’inquinamento
Milano
è una delle città più inquinate d’Europa. Invece di subire passivamente il
problema cercando unicamente di ridurre l’emissione di agenti inquinanti,
Milano deve diventare la città d’avanguardia nella eliminazione
dell’inquinamento. 
La soluzione potrebbe essere quella di
trovare sul territorio start up, aziende, ricercatori, investitori più
coinvolti con la sezione della green economy più legata al tema dell’inquinamento,
dopo di che dovrebbe metterli assieme, creare
alleanze con le altre città per ricevere da loro le migliori intelligenze e
competenze interessate all’inquinamento atmosferico, che sarebbero
interessati a venire a Milano perché a Milano esiste il massimo problema e la
maggiore attenzione per cercare di risolverlo. 
L’inquinamento
stesso può diventare fattore di attrazione di un sistema in grado di far
diventare Milano una capitale mondiale e, una volta creato questo sistema, si
può generare un indotto fatto di ricchezza, di lavoro, di talenti che
proliferano sul territorio. Realizzando un circolo virtuoso che possa
consolidare questa leadership. 
#7. La prima
città universale
Milano
città stato non è la città dove hai la residenza ma è la comunità a cui
contribuisci. Milano città stato aprirà la sua cittadinanza a tutte le persone
che contribuiranno in misura significativa alla costruzione della città ideale.
Questo si può fare perché si ha la separazione dell’amministrazione, intesa
come erogazione di servizi, dalla politica della città. Chi fa qualcosa di concreto per la città, diventa cittadino universale
di Milano godendo di alcuni dei diritti di cittadinanza anche se vive in luoghi
distanti nel mondo.CONDIVIDI LA CAMPAGNA SUI
SOCIAL
