@micittastato 

#XmilanocittastatoENGLISH VERSIONWHAT IS MILAN CITY STATE?

What would your ideal city be like? This is the project in which you can build it!  Help us to develop a program that aims to involve
citizens in the construction of their ideal city. 
The Italian Constitution  -art.132- allows the creation of an autonomy region for the town of Milan. Milan city-state will be the first city in Italy to become a model of a goodliving culture, like the cities of Berlin, Madrid , Hamburg, Swiss cantons, Singapore and Hong Kong - an example of how a city can be a stimulus for the nation to which it belongs.The aim of this project is to promote a survey between all the citizens and gather all the signatures to claim a referendum. 
WHO ARE WE? Milan City
State is a program that aims to involve citizens in the construction of their ideal city. It is a project designed by Vivaio, a non-profit association that aims to foster the creation and development of projects that can make Milan a leading global city.
If you click here you can watch the video of "Vivaio for Milano" in different languages: 

ITALIAN
ENGLISH
GERMAN
RUSSIAN
FRENCH
PORTUGUESE
SPANISH

A spin off of Vivaio is Associazione MIlano, a not for profit organization with the aim to develop the project of Milan City State
HOW WILL THE DONATIONS BE ALLOCATED?
All contributions collected will be donated to the campaign for Milan City State and their use will be published on www.milanocittastato.it
From 15.000 Euros to 100.000 Euros:  activities with the aim of spreading knowledge about the Milan City State project, and the magazine www.milanocittastato.it 
If we raise 100.000 Euros: we'll organize the "MILANARIE", with 25 ballot boxes to vote YES or NO to Milan City State during administrative elections for the mayor of Milan (and with special activities to promote this referendum)
If we raise 200.000 Euros: we'll organize the "MILANARIE", with 50 ballot boxes to vote YES or NO to Milan City State during administrative elections for the mayor of Milan (and with special activities to promote this referendum)
If we raise 300.000 Euros: we'll organize the "MILANARIE", with 75 ballot boxes to vote YES or NO to Milan City State during administrative elections for the mayor of Milan (and with special activities to promote this referendum)
If we raise 400.000 Euros: we'll organize the "MILANARIE", with 100 ballot boxes to vote YES or NO to Milan City State during administrative elections for the mayor of Milan (and with special activities to promote this referendum)
We'll devolve the 50% above the sum of 400.000 Euros  to finance projects for Milan. The other 50% will be use to support the project of Milan City State. 

WHO ARE
THE CITIZENS OF MILAN CITY STATE? 
Milan City State is open to all those who want the good of Milan.
Regardless of where they are.
WHAT IS THE DREAM OF MILAN CITY STATE?
To give everybody the opportunity to express themselves
according to their talents while helping grow the community in which they belong. 
We believe that the key issue in every society should
be promoting the growth and fulfillment of its members. 
Believing in the
realization of the individuals as a fundamental value of a society means considering the
welfare of others to be part of their self-growth.

THEN IT’S A POLITICAL PROJECT?
Yes, but without any limitation of political
parties.


WHAT ARE THE PROJECTS OF MILAN CITY STATE?
The
priority projects of Milan City States are:
#1 . MILAN FREE ZONE
Applying a free zone model for each new company, with
simplified bureaucracy and a single fixed tax.
#2. FEEDBACK BY CITIZENS ABOUT
THE PUBLIC SERVICE
Every
citizen will have the opportunity to express their rating on
each service provided by the administration, with a website created
along the lines of TripAdvisor.
#3 MILAN AS THE WORLD CAPITAL
FOR THE PRODUCTION OF NEW CULTURE
Milan will propose itself as a  capital for the production of new culture,
building a network of creatives in the
city and attracting  artists from other
cities.
#4.UNIVERSITY AS  A HUMAN ACCELERATOR
The universities will aim to foster creativity and an awareness of the distinctive skills of their students. 
#5.FROM WELFARE TO RESTART
The concept of restarting is focused on people
in difficulties, with the aim of helping them to
regain autonomy and to develop their potential.
#6.MILAN AS THE
LEADING CITY AGAINST POLLUTION
Milan will attract the best experts in the world to help it become the leading city in the
elimination of pollution.
#7.
THE FIRST UNIVERSAL CITY
Everyone who does something for the city should
become a universal citizen of Milan, enjoying certain rights
of citizenship even if he or she lives in other parts of the world.

WHEN
WILL THE CITY STATE OF MILAN BE BORN?

of a goodliving culture, like
the cities of Berlin, Madrid,
Hamburg, Swiss cantons, Singapore and Hong Kong - an
example of how a city can be a stimulus for the nation to which it belongs.
The aim of this project is to promote a survey between all the citizens and gather all the signatures to claim a referendum.

CITY STATE GROW? 
Through working groups
open to citizens with the aim of devising
strategies and proposals. The digital magazine www.milanocittastato.it
launched in January 2016.

story:
There is nothing like a good story. They transport us, delight us, fill us with wonder. When they are really good stories, they transform us. At StoryDoor, this is our passion. Through a team of top-notch writers and artists and musicians and actors, we endeavor to produce unforgettable stories. Ones that will stay with you. But the coolest part of all is that most of our stories will be interactive. Meaning the reader helps guide the story, walking alongside the hero as they brave peril and fight foes. We believe this enhanced story experience will help recapture the imaginations of kids. 

 

An entire section of the StoryDoor platform will be dedicated to cutting-edge, entertaining educational material. We know knowledge is power, but why not make it fun in the process? From science and history to math and reading, we hope to provide a veritable feast for the brain! And one that feels more like fun than mere book learning. 

 

 

We are so excited about our efforts to create a full series of devotional materials designed to teach kids about the Bible and the Christian life. With fully developed sound design and graphics, we will make learning about the Kingdom of God an adventure, and not just your typical Sunday school experience. Kids will journey with different heroes through the pillars of faith and will learn how to walk closely with God, and have fun in the process!

story:
Introducing the Dojo App & Debit Card

It’s becoming a cashless world out there, and yesterday's money lessons won't stop kids from swiping, tapping and clicking themselves into debt. Dojo gives families the tools to teach modern financial independence at the touch of a button: your kids get a head-start in life by learning to save, spend and grow their money responsibly, all within the convenience of a secure, safe, and easy-to-use app and debit card which you control.  Here at Dojo, we think that’s pretty cool.

 

 

 

 

 

Why is a Dojo Card better than a youth bank account?

We’re glad you asked.  Dojo is safe and secure, and unlike the other guys, it adds on spending controls and card lock security.  Dojo also lets you automate allowance and chores, tracks and visualizes your kids spending so that you can have meaningful money conversations when they’re most effective.  Plus, with the ability to set savings goals, your kids can see where their money goes – and grows!  Now that’s smart.

 

How does Dojo stack up?

 

Our Perks

Anyone who contributes to our campaign will be helping to make the next generation of kids better at managing money than the last. As an incentive to participate in the funding, Dojo is offering funders significant discounts on the use of the app for up to a year.

 

How are we going to use the money?

All funds raised will be directed into moving the app toward going live.  Corporate costs and overheads are covered by funding we already have in place, and so we are able to direct all the funds raised straight into making the Dojo app and debit card happen.

 

*Net of card pre-loads*

 

When can we start using Dojo?

The app is already well into development, and we’ve finished alpha testing and our first beta will start going out very soon.  This funding is going to get us across the finish line, and we plan to start shipping cards out in Q2/Q3 of 2017.

 

 

The Dojo Story

About Us

We are HQ’d in beautiful Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. The Dojo co-founders Chad and Jay have a wealth of experience running their own successful businesses prior to starting Dojo.   The other team members have  experience in tech, digital marketing and business, and are always talking about new ideas and collaborating to ensure our users will get the best Dojo experience.

Where did the idea for Dojo come from?

Our two co-founders Chad and Jay are both parents whith kids who happen to be at the same school in the same grade. They became friends, and were chatting that they saw a need in the market to teach kids about money. They realized that when they were growing up they had to teach themselves about money, just like most of us did. And sometimes, the money lessons were tough. It wasn’t until both ran their own businesses that they learned about how to manage money. Because of this, they knew there had to be a better way, especially with cash slowly going away and regular debit cards just not cutting it.  It was this realization that led them to found Dojo.

 

The Dojo Team

story:
Summary 

The Need

 

Students in higher education need to be better connected, to encourage the free flow of ideas and knowledge among students. We at Peersview have taken up this challenge to break the geographical barriers limiting collaboration and networking opportunities for students. 

 

                      Understanding the Digital Campus 

Peersview also provides the opportunity for every college and university to connect their students via a  private digital campus. The Digital campus is a portal where the current students of an academic institution can collaborate with fellow students in their Classes or in other Campuses and Departments.

Note: Students can only join or create a digital campus with their assigned edu-email.

 

  • A central hub that connects all the students within a university or college

 

 

 

  • Fresher Connect: We know how important first-year connections are in a college career, The Freshers channel is designed to help new students to reach and engage with each other with ease. Also Prospective students can create a freshers channel to engage each other.

 

 

 

  • Class groups: Collaboration with classmates is quintessential for academic success. With the Digital Campus students can create or join class groups to interact and collaborate on the Go. 

 

 

  • A Market place for advertising within the school’s community

 

 

 

                            Meet Our Team:  

  • Gabriel Amodu, Co-founder and CEO

Gabriel is a passionate individual dedicated to developing a global community for students in higher education.  He holds a BSc in Business Economics and a Distinction in MSc Information systems: Organization and management. Gabriel specializes in Optimizing products to meet critical business and user needs. He has developed robust experience in product and process design.

  • Nikola Leger, COO

 Nikola covers our Business development and sales. He is currently part of the team as a consultant, and he works remotely from Montreal, Canada. Nikola has demonstrated history for driving Sales, revenue and margin growth within the Ed-tech industry. He excels at leading high performing teams to meet aggressive deliverables. Over 20 years he has built a verse network within the  Ed-tech industry.

  • Jo Ries Canino: Lead Engineer

Jo is our Technical lead. he is our lead developer. His main role includes management of our team of developers, overall technological efficiency, software development, and information control. Jo holds a B.sc in Computer Science.

Jo has been senior Mean Stack Developer and system engineer on web and mobile development for over 10years. Jo thrives in a technical and leadership roles.

  • Heena Travedi: Engineer

User Experience & Product Designer

  In addition to our core team, we've assembled an incredible group of industry experts who serve as our advisory team; they are collaborating with us to create the best service possible.

  1. Professor Trevor Harper, University of Manchester, UK
  2. Professor Laurens G. Debo,  Dartmouth University U.S.A
  3. Dr Peter Levine, Tufts University U.S.A
  4. Ms. Laila Wahedi, George Town University U.S.A
  5. Jim Emery, Glasgow Caledonian University.

 

 

Where we are in Development

  • .Developed and launched the MVP for the web platform.
  • Upgrading and iterating on the user experience for the web platform
  • Completing Development of the Digital campus
  • Designing the User interface for the mobile application

 

We will soon begin the process of:

  • Developing the mobile App for the  platform
  • Develop an admin dashboard for the Digital campus, to help school administrators understand and manage their student experiences.
  • Hiring student writers to create content covering all aspects of university life.
  • Create more pathways for linking students to the platform.

Our primary goal is to establish the platform as the go-to social network for students in universities within the U.S.A, Canada and the U.K. And in the long-run eventually grow our community globally.

                              The timeline 

|- 21th of January 2019 - Launched the Peersview platform

|
|- 26th of March 2019 - Beginning of  first round of crowd-funding.
|
|- 6th of May 2019 - Launch Indiegogo InDemand campaign for crowd-funding
|
|- 5th of June 2019 - Initial round of funding becomes available. Work, code and test. Constant communication and updates with supporters on progress, ideas for features and sneak-peeks.
 

 

 

Why we need your support

We have been working on Peersview for 2 years and we've come a long way. But now we need your help. By contributing to this project, you help us embed knowledge sharing into higher education for good! Our campaign to raise $100,000 will allow Peersview to grow its community of students.

Let's make our higher education communities closer and more connected.

 

So why should you support us?

  • Peersview is the best exclusive social network for college and university students.
  • We are creating a global ecosystem for the next generation of students.
  • Our student community needs to continue growing; therefore we need funding to invest in targeted marketing. The larger the community becomes, the better the user experience Peersview can deliver.
  • We want to continue improving on our strengths in helping students collaborate and crowd-source information more efficiently. 
  • We provide the best communication and collaboration tools suitable for Distant leaning students.
  • We need to hire people within academia that can help with the quality of content on the platform.
  • We need to provide financial incentives to encourage contributions in the Peersview community.

If we do not reach the entire goal, the funds raised will still be used very efficiently towards marketing to grow our community.

We are gaining momentum, in only 2 months after launch, and zero advertising budget we have been able to attract a significant userbase onto the platform.

 

                       Risks & Challenges

  • The initial growth can be slow especially without adequate funding; as the size of the community would play a big role in the experience students would derive from our platform.
  • With heavy targeted marketing, we hope to maximize our growth in community size, in a shorter period of time. And the critical student mass necessary to make the platform attractive for companies to advertise. 
  • One major risk with online social platforms is bullying, we have adequate measures in place to ensure we have control over the languages used within the community.

 

                      Other Ways You Can Help

  • There are more ways to help than just money. If you are interested in becoming a campus ambassador, feel free to contact us.
  • Please help share this campaign with your friends and family!

story:
We had to change the campaign because of the feedback we got from the people

We hope it is clearer now

 

We need your support to help 200 children in the psychiatric hospital for children from Sibiu and also around 20 children and teens diagnosed with cancer.

Your help is very important

Even a like or a share can mean the life of a child is improved :)

We believe it's all worth it!

We represent the legal NGO called "Asociatia Micile Emotii Mari" and last year we helped more than 500 children in difficult situations - please see more on our activity report on our site :)

We rely on validated research and and work with experienced psychologists, to ensure we provide a real help for the children and teenagers.

The psychologist from the psychiatric hospital for children from Sibiu is supervising our work.

You can find all the research and more about our team on our website.

We will post movies weekly, even daily whenever we can :)

Let's help more children and teens and may this is the way we help ourselves too :)

 

Who we are

Hi! We’re Dragoș Iulian Matei and Bianca Niță, authors of a highly-acclaimed bestselling book about emotions and content creators.

In the last 6 years, we offered thousands of children from hospitals, foster homes, poor environments, children with disabilities and children from different families – the chance to practice emotional resilience, stress and pain management.

All these skills were trained like valuable inner super-powers with our therapeutic book, fun movies, live shows, games and apps.

“I love to see children learn about emotions from their animated  movies, songs and apps” – Ligia Marginean, psychologist at the Neurology Hospital for Children in Sibiu

 

“I was not convinced at the beginning but then I saw it myself. Their creations are very important to help children deal with the post-operatory stress and increase the bond between children and significant adults” – Luca Silvia, Chief psychiatrist at the Neurology Hospital for Children in Sibiu

“When the results are so visible, it is clearly that the emotional development program has been thoroughly conceived and implemented!” – Livia Caciuloiu-Minea, Psychologist

"With their content and shows, the emotional and social learning is playful, created within very beautiful stories and metaphors, just as children learn best"  – Lakshmi Barbus, Psychotherapist

 

Why this campaign matters to us

Many children, parents, psychologists and even medical stuff told us they observed great improvements after experiencing our songs, live shows, apps, books, video or audio content. 

We were amazed when a child diagnosed with cancer and his mother told us our live show helped him walk faster and even learn to skate – “an incredible achievement after going through 6 brain surgeries​!” said the mother .

 

Why your help is so important

Pain management is very important for children and teens

Not only that children get to smile a little bit, which is important,

but it can make a difference in recovery and less side-effects from medication

 

What We Need

With the money we create and update the apps

Pay the psychologists and the testing with the children

And work with 200 children so they can learn these amazingly important skills

 

What You Get

We sprinkled our magic in unique perks we hope you’ll enjoy each month, starting with February 2019.

 

Risks & Challenges

We help children for over 6 years now, in the last year and a half we are doing it on our NGO.

We spend lots of of time and money in this project, having a huge motivation.

Results are better and better and we can help more and more children and teens each year

So we believe the risks are very low - you can also see our lovely activity report on our website :)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in helping out in other ways, you can:

  • Share this page on your Facebook, Twitter or Google+
  • Convince an influencer to share our campaign
  • Apply to volunteering with our NGO on our website

You can also use the Indiegogo share tools :) Thank you for being a part of this :)

story:
Why Seneca Treehouse?

It can be challenging to see how we can fix the world's problems, and it can be even more challenging to implement the solutions on a large scale. 

"The Seneca Treehouse is a launch pad",  stated JP, a previous student resident at the project. 

We take in people who have passion and perseverance to be game changers in their communities and equip them with the tools & techniques to do so.  

We provide housing, paid internships, and training focused on a whole systems approach to sustainable development.  

2019 Curriculum & Some of THE PERKS!

  1. Permaculture design certification 
  2. Construction training: carpentry, lumber milling, welding, metal working, plumbing, electrical, natural building, renewable energy, passive solar design, etc
  3. Family summer camp: foraging, fire making, natural building, baking, milling, animal husbandry & more

Once Seneca Treehouse Is Complete, we will focus on unfolding the one year curriculum for Treehouse Trade School including classes like Clothing Creation, Manifest Your Dreams, and Using Tech to undo the Wreck.   

OK so WHY airbnb? 

There once was a gal named Carly who lived in the house in the tree. 

She loved that tree house dearly, and put it on airbnb!

We had the pleasure of living with Carly Basinger while she studied at Clemson University.  Carly lived in the Treehouse for 3 years, and had a brilliant idea to put it on airbnb.  We didn't realize the potential until about 3 years later.  Airbnb is a great opportunity for income AND introducing sustainability to folks who are on vacation and usually in an open state of mind.  This is also a great opportunity for people to stay here and experience sustainable living in comfort without jumping right into an internship or a class.  During a training course, we block off the rooms and make them available for students. 

Carly is now in Cape Vincent NY, and manages Riverside Farm, her family business.  

About the founder: Scott Allen Bunn

I have been  building houses since I was 11 years old. While attending Clemson University, I started my own fabrication business. My story really begins after I built my own house with some friends during my senior year. We built with a plan to sell the home two years later!  

2 years later - The 2008 Economic Crash 

This was my wake up call... I began learning about the economy, with the intention to create resilience in case it happened again. What I learned was alarming, and disturbing. I spent about a year ANGRY, before I started to see the solutions. Now, after studying permaculture and 10 years of community development experience, I see solutions everywhere!  

In 2010, I began turning my home into the Seneca Treehouse Project. As the earlier Mentioned Launchpad, STP has led to the creation of Treehouse Internatural Inc, a Benefit Corporation with a mission to help each other live in harmony with the planet.  

Treehouse Internatural Inc is made up of 3 smaller companies. 

1. Seneca Treehouse Project, llc

2. Amity Builders, llc

3. Treehouse Tools & Training, llc (DBA -Treehouse Trade School)

Use of Funding - $5000 goal

The funds will be used, in part, as a base to secure financing for the remaining construction, AND build the actual foundation for the community center at the Seneca Treehouse Project.  This building is the main gathering spot including a kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area.  It will have 12 inches of soil on the roof, so that we can grow food in the same square footage as the sheltered living space.

Here is the breakdown of costs:

$1800 engineering for footing and Posts

$2800 budget for concrete & steel

$400 mortar and sand to lay the bricks that we already have, which are reclaimed from Clemson University. Thank you for those of you who helped me chip mortar, sort, and stack those brick! 

When complete, the project will have 16 spaces available to visit and experience sustainable living.  These spaces will be used for our students during training sessions and events. We estimate a minimum of 5000 visitors to the site annually through tours, workshops, and airbnb experiences with a goal to Inspire & empower people to live in harmony with our planet. 

1 and 5 year Goals

Our One year Goal for 2019 is to Finish building the Seneca Treehouse Project and teach 50 Students in our Learn to Build, Design to Live, and Family Summer Camp programs.  Once STP is done, we will be open full time for tours, workshops, and airbnb. This is when Treehouse Trade School really begins to unfold! 

Our 5 Year Goal: Full time operation of Treehouse Trade School, teaching hands on, applied learning & training soldiers for sustainability aka Tree Scouts!  

What We Need & What You Get

Whether it's a vacation, e-book, workshop, inspiring t shirt, or the opportunity to advertise & visit for life, We have designed our perks to benefit you!

We need volunteers, students, airbnb visitors, and funding. 

Airbnb is a major contribution! That means, you can help us by coming here to, relax, enjoy the lake, crack the whip & watch us work .  

The more volunteers, students, and visitors we get, the less bank funding we need. Currently, we need approximately $169,000 for materials and labor to build out the remaining structures at the Seneca Treehouse. 

Offering between 18% and 50% discounts for all of our perks!

For more information on our Workshops, Check out: https://www.senecatreehouse.org/

For more information on Airbnb, go to: https://www.airbnb.com/users/26188062/listings

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is if I get hurt or disabled. As long as I am able, I will be building a school for sustainability. Time is of the essence, which Is why I am asking for your help. If we do not receive funding, we will not be able to finish this year! Please help us reach this goal! 

Weather is always a contributing factor when doing construction. Luckily, we have an indoor fabrication shop, and as long as we get a structure dried in or have a project for the shop, we can continue with work even while the weather outside is frightening.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on social media!  Comment, and let us know how else we can help you, and how we can continue to improve our content! 

Instagram: Internatural Solutions @scottallenbunn

Instagram : Seneca Treehouse Project: @senecatreehouse

Youtube - https://www.youtube.com/SenecaTreehouse 

Snapchat - SenecaTreehouse

Twitter https://twitter.com/SenecaTreehouse

Help us spread the word! Share it on Social Media and make use of those Indiegogo Share Tools! 

Thank you SO MUCH for reading, helping, and sharing!

I hope to see you in 2019! 

Scott Allen Bunn

story:
What makes History Adventures a uniquely impactful learning experience?

Three key ideas: 

  • A Fresh Approach to Learning About our Past:  Introducing  a profoundly innovative approach to history curriculum, interdisciplinary, and epic in scope
    •  Inspired by the ground-breaking work of the International Big History Association
  • Mobile Entertainment Design: History Adventures uses the latest mobile entertainment design technology--combining motion comics with interaction design
    • Including motion fx, cinematics, animation, sound fx, and original music
  • The Power of Story: Our innovative approach of narrativizing the life stories of peoples who lived in past centuries--in different epochs and locations around the globe--does not bore students with lists of random, irrelevant facts and dates, but rather:
    • Students will experience the very real moments these very real people lived through, as if they were there. And via the empathy inspired by good storytelling, students will feel the life or death stakes of decisions made in the moment, (whose often dire consequences, only now--centuries later--appear as cold, dead facts!).

History Adventures brings the past to life!

The famed historian, Yuval Noah Harari, claims the glue that binds societies together is not genes, but rather, stories.  Through the power of story, one's imagination opens out to the world, giving meaning to the things we see, places we travel, people we love--stories even give shape to our darkest fears. 

Partially inspired by Robert Garland’s "The Other Side of History: Daily Life in the Ancient World": History Adventures will focus on narrativized key moments in the life stories of peoples who lived in past centuries, in different epochs and locations around the globe. 

The narrative structure of History Adventures will be like zooming in through a portal in time, to observe--and feel the drama and excitement--of little slices of lived human experience, from so long ago. These narratives are punctuated with explanations of where or how certain objects or ideas in the modern world originated--revealing complexity, interconnections, and richer context for understanding our own moment in time. 

Ordinary People doing Extraordinary Things

Importantly, none of the characters will be famous. At least not world famous, and larger than life, such as Alexander, Cleopatra, or Napoleon. Instead they will be normal people, living extraordinary lives. You will experience the thrill and danger of being a Polynesian deep sea explorer and settler--becoming the first human to set foot on Fiji, some 3,000 years ago.

You will experience vivid glimpses into the lifeways of people from all over the world, and all throughout time:

  • a morose Samurai with a broken heart
  • a Spanish conquistador in 16th century Peru suffering hallucinations from tropical fever
  • an Ancient Sumerian scribe, unwittingly driving forward, the development of systematic writing, the greatest threshold in human collective learning up to that point
  • a doctor in Ancient Greece pioneering modern medical inquiry
  • or, you could be a wayward 17 year old Roman citizen, living at the height of Roman power; finding yourself drifting, lethally, into the city's criminal underworld, only to discover a way out--signing up for a 25 year term of service as a Roman Legionary in the world's first professional army. 

And this, of course, is where our story begins, with Duro's travails in Ancient Rome, entitled, "Chapter III: Conscribo."  The 16 page fully animated demo is available now, for free, on iTunes.

This will be the first in a serialized--and infinitely expanding--network of stories from history. Collectively, as more and more stories are added to this narrative-based scaleable platform, (magic book?), the human experience will be revealed in richer detail than ever before in the digital pages of History Adventures. 

About the Founder: Spencer Striker, PhD 

My passion for combining history education with digital media technology goes back twenty years, to when I completed undergrad degrees in both History and Film Production at the University of Texas. I later cut my teeth in online media entrepreneurship by starting a web video company, called GameZombie TV, a four-time Webby Award winning game media studio that ran successfully from 2007-2012, Pursuing my passion for education entrepreneurship, I went on to become a co-founder of the Media Arts & Game Development program at the University of Wisconsin at Whitewater. During this same action-packed time, I earned a PhD in Digital Media from the number one Education Department in the world, the University of Wisconsin at Madison, where I studied under some of the leading experts on Digital Media & Learning, (including Kurt Squire and Constance Steinkuehler). My doctoral work at UW-Madison laid the groundwork for my History Adventures interactive digital learning concept.



In 2013, I became founding creative director for a digital media and learning startup based in Mountain View, CA - called Galxyz, Inc. - which secured $3m in Series A funding from Relay Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, and Laurene Powell Jobs’ Emerson Collective; (Galxyz can be found in the iTunes App Store). I spearheaded Galxyz’ product and creative from concept to full-fledged startup--overseeing product design; building an international team of cross-functional mobile app professionals; and creatively directing a scalable, narrative-themed mobile, digital learning product. 

Since coming to Dubai--and joining the American University in Dubai’s Digital Media faculty--my goal has been to launch a successful digital learning startup in what I consider to be one of the most innovative cities of the 21st century. Beginning day one in Dubai, I began conceptualizing the prototype for History Adventures--but more importantly, assembling a world-class, international team of experts that I knew could get the job done. 

The History Adventures Team

Spencer Striker, PhD - Writer, Producer, Design Director
lurii Matviienko - InDesign Animation, Style Designer, & Compiler
Rastko Vukovic - Visual & Motion FX
Mike Borromeo - 2D Illustration
Sebastian Renato Szabo - Animated Infographics
Ritesh Khare & Co - 3D Animation
Joosep Tiismus - Video Editing, Post-Production, Sound & VFX
Joan Francesc Oliveras Pallerols - Cover Illustration
Douglass Lane - Voice of Narrator
Doug Barron - Voices of the Recruiter Centurion, Disciplining Centurion, Ancient Roman Gangsters
Alex Mai- Voices of Duro, Varro, and the chastised Legionary Recruit
AudioBlocks - Music & Sound FX
Historical Consultant - Craig Benjamin, PhD
Historical Consultant - Jonathan Markley, PhD
Digital Literacy Consultant - Dawnene Hassett, PhD


Production Timeline - from idea to Live Demo!

And here's a quick sketch of the timeline and hard work it took us to get to this point, where we're ready to scale History Adventures to the next level!

  • June 2016: Awarded Summer Research Institute Fellowship to the Harris Manchester College at Oxford; conducted design and curriculum research
  • July 2016: Digital Learning design research presentation delivered at the International Big History Association Conference in Amsterdam
  • April 2, 2017: Dr. Jonathan Markley, leading Big Historian, comes to AUD campus and speaks on topic of Innovating Visual Educational Multimedia. Consults on History Adventures.
  • May 17, 2017: Out of over 700 entries, the digital learning concept wins 5th place in the Dubai Smartpreneur 2.0 Competition, as part of the Dubai Chamber Smart City Initiative.
  • Nov 7-9, 2017: History Adventures receives competitive invitation to exhibit a live demo on the showroom floor of Web Summit 2017, the largest technology conference in the world.
  • March 28, 2018:  Official selection to 2018 Step Conference in Dubai.
  • Dec 12, 2018: History Adventures, Ch. III Conscribo, goes live on iTunes in 52 countries!
  • Feb 13, 2019: hands-on demo of v2.0, as official selection to the 2019 Step Conference.
  • Feb 22, 2019: First demo of History Adventures for Asian audience at Slush Tokyo, Japan
  • March 19, 2019: History Adventures Indiegogo official crowdfund launch!!

So... why are we asking for $50k?

It's because the product is ready for the next level. While bootstrapping and self-funding, History Adventures to date: we've proven out an efficient, scaleable production methodology. We've even pulled off tricks with regard to 2D and 3D interactive animation running stably on a mobile device that few teams could replicate. The professional historians on our team are incredibly enthusiastic about the potential for the product to bring the stodgy old ways of teaching history into the 21st Century. And most importantly, the students that have play-tested the demo enjoyed the experience as they would an animated, entertainment app--while their post-test answers to relevant history questions showed improved retention. So why is that? 

It's the combination of the three factors: a revitalized Big History curricular approach; the design aesthetics of the best mobile entertainment; and the power of story. 

Five More Chapters by the end of Summer 2019!

Our goal is to build five new chapters by summer's end: each focused on a unique character, with a unique narrative--and all of whom living in different times, places, and circumstances around the globe.

Through our standardized production methodology, we've innovated ways to speed up production while bringing costs down. And this trend will only continue! To create our next 5 historical character micro-narratives will require: research, writing, history curriculum, illustration, animation for mobile, specialized motion fx, animated infographics, custom 3D animation, video editing, sound design, music, voice acting, and consultation with top historians and digital literacy experts.

And as a key part of our History Adventures perks: we're going to provide you, our fans and supporters, buy-in on key creative decisions--allowing you to be a part of the story at times, and to literally see yourself in history. Since the goal of History Adventures is to spark enthusiasm for the past, and bring the pages of history to life, it's only fitting to give partial ownership of the product and its historical micro-narratives to you--the readers, supporters, and fans--to make the connection between past and present that much more visceral, tangible, and real.

story:
What is my story?

Hi, I am known to the children around Michigan area daycares as Ms. Ruth. The woman who brings MonkeyPlay to them and the reason many of them didn’t fight with their parents about going to school on the day I am there. Kids love MonkeyPlay and parents use it as a means to get the kids out the door!

Five years ago I founded the nonprofit public charity, Hutan For World Health to improve the quality of life. I have a rather unusual background as both an ethologist and a personal trainer. This entails the study of animal behavior in the wild, and, as a trainer, it’s all about how to get and keep humans healthy. For thirty years I have devoted my time to improving well being in humans by designing and implementing programs, and equally as much time to studying animal behavior for the purpose of gaining first hand knowledge in the human-wildlife conflict affecting endangered species. When I created Hutan I was able to blend these two very different career paths into one. A path that is not only fulfilling and purposeful but one that I love.

 

What are we up against?

There are a lot of problems facing children today. Problems that are far different than the ones we faced as children. Because they are living extremely sedentary lives it is not uncommon for children to leave preschool with up to four risk factors for heart disease: high blood pressure, high blood cholesterol, high levels of body fat and fatty streaks in the arteries. They now spend more than seven and a half hours a day in front of a screen.

 Have We Traded Health For Technology?

The growth and expansion of technology has reached a point where pretty much everything we need or want is available at the touch of a button. Learning, play and entertainment can all be accessed without ever leaving the sofa. For parents it has become much easier to have sedentary children due to the pressures of balancing work and family life. If you are a parent in this era of information and technology, chances are you have a child who has played, is playing right now, or will be playing video games. Juggling school, work, home, and community lives, parents now rely heavily on entertainment technology  to make their lives easier. All of this “sitting” is coming at a price; and a vital one at that. Health. As technology and sedentary choices change the way we live, those who suffer most are our children.

So what is the impact of technology on the toddlers and preschoolers?

During a child’s developmental stages their sensory, motor, and attachment systems have biologically not evolved to accommodate this sedentary, yet frenzied and chaotic nature of today’s technology. The impact of technology on the developing child has seen an increase of physical, psychological and behavior disorders that the health and education systems are just beginning to detect, much less understand. Diagnoses of ADHD, autism, coordination disorder, developmental delays-means that a young child is slower to reach milestones than other children, unintelligible speech, anxiety, depression, and sleep disorders are associated with technology overuse, and are increasing at an alarming rate. As children “sit” hour upon hour we are ignoring the elephant in the room. Sedentary bodies bombarded with frenzied sensory stimulation are resulting in the delay of developmental milestones, and have negative impacts on basic fundamental motor skill progress. If you combine this with the trend of preschool and kindergarten settings becoming much more regimented and adult-directed, because teachers are encouraged to increase literacy and numeracy instruction at the expense of play time, there is a staggering amount of time children are inactive.  These sedentary behaviors are stealing children's health right out from under our noses, eliminating crucial aspects of emotional growth, and setting them up for a lifetime of disease. As children now rely on technology for the majority of their play, grossly limiting challenges to their creativity and imaginations, as well as limiting necessary challenges to their bodies to achieve optimal sensory and motor development we are seeing more developmental delays.

Do we have to get rid of physical activity and play to make room for learning?

The answer to this is a big fat NO. There is a huge connection between motor development, play, and the physical health and abilities of young children. Research has taught us that removing play from early childhood classrooms may actually undermine intended achievement-oriented outcomes because play enhances attention, memory, self-regulation, and overall academic achievement throughout childhood. In short, physical play is necessary for learning and is critical to development. Children play because it is fun. It’s the lens through which they experience their world. Play feels good. By giving children the freedom to play we provide opportunities for them to discover new ways of thinking and doing things. It facilitates the ability to be creative later in life. When we suppress children’s freedom, their creative abilities remarkably decline.

So, how does  MonkeyPlay address all this?

MonkeyPlay creates a foundation for developing physical literacy–the “ability, confidence and desire to be physically active.” It encompasses doing, interpreting, responding and understanding, and signals an interplay with our surroundings. It involves fundamental locomotor skills, aerobic conditioning, imagination, hand eye coordination, and agility, while encouraging interaction with others. The program is based on play. That is the first half.

MonkeyPlay is also the first movement-based learning system of its kind. While children move and mimic animal behaviors they learn letters, site words, counting, geography and animal behavior.  They use their bodies and their minds simultaneously. As the studies have shown when children move while they are learning, they activate more parts of the brain than when they are sitting still.  In particular, movement has been found to activate the visual association cortex—the part of the brain that allows the processing of visual information. “Learning by doing” has never been better supported by science. That is the second half.

What do we need and what do you get?

Recently we were awarded a small grant by the 5 Healthy Towns coalition to run a MonkeyPlay intervention in Chelsea Michigan reaching 80 children. Yay! This is a big deal because we will finally be able to get the research we need to demonstrate just how effective MonkeyPlay is. But we still need about $1500 to complete the package. I have included the budget breakdown so you will be able to see all the details of our needs. If you are part of a business and would like to group your employees together to donate the full amount, not only will the business get a write off (we are a 501c3) but your company name will be mentioned in the manuals and in the follow up articles we write. You will be a huge part in making this intervention happen. If you are an individual who donates $200 or more you will also get a tax write off and we will include your name as a donor who helped make the intervention possible. We want to recognize you!

 

So what kind of impact will this program have?

Not only will you help us to get 80 children off on the right foot you will help impact the lives of their families and the community. Healthy happy children make happy parents, happy teachers, happy grandparents, happy siblings. Well, you get the idea. One life has an enormous impact on the other lives it touches. And, we don't plan to stop here. Our goal is to train teacher coaches so the program becomes self sustaining changing the way education is taught to the youngest members of society.

What kind of obstacles do we face?

Are you kidding!!! We are talking about behavior change and there is nothing more difficult to evoke than that. We get it. We have been at this type of work for a very long time. On the other hand, we have already seen the positive impacts on the lives of children. When it is MonkeyPlay day children want to come to school. And, on those days, they focus better, show more enthusiasm, build confidence, and learn!  

 

What if you can't offer a donation?

We understand. Everyone these days has a cause and a hand out to collect your money. So, maybe you know a business owner who would be interested in getting some recognition for helping kids. Maybe you can help pull a few individuals together to make a donation or you can help by simply spreading the word.  Make some noise! We want to help kids grow up healthy and stay that way and we cant do it alone.  You can be part of it, all you have to do is decide to.

You will be a huge part in making this intervention happen. If you are an individual who donates $200 or more you will also get a tax write off and we will include your name as a donor who helped make the intervention possible. We want to recognize you! So what kind of impact will this program have?Not only will you help us to get 80 children off on the right foot you will help impact the lives of their families and the community. Healthy happy children make happy parents, happy teachers, happy grandparents, happy siblings. Well, you get the idea. One life has an enormous impact on the other lives it touches. And, we don't plan to stop here. Our goal is to train teacher coaches so the program becomes self sustaining changing the way education is taught to the youngest members of society.What kind of obstacles do we face?Are you kidding!!! We are talking about behavior change and there is nothing more difficult to evoke than that. We get it. We have been at this type of work for a very long time. On the other hand, we have already seen the positive impacts on the lives of children. When it is MonkeyPlay day children want to come to school. And, on those days, they focus better, show more enthusiasm, build confidence, and learn!   What if you can't offer a donation?We understand. Everyone these days has a cause and a hand out to collect your money. So, maybe you know a business owner who would be interested in getting some recognition for helping kids. Maybe you can help pull a few individuals together to make a donation or you can help by simply spreading the word.  Make some noise! We want to help kids grow up healthy and stay that way and we cant do it alone.  You can be part of it, all you have to do is decide to.

story:
هل تبحثون عن طريقة غير تقليدية لدعم الأشخاص ذوي التحديات الذهنية وعائلاتهم في العالم العربي؟ هل تودون ترك أثر مستدام في مجتمعنا  يبقى للأبد؟

 إدعموا منصة حبايبنا بالتبرع ومشاركة رابط حملة التمويل الجماعي.. للمزيد عن الحملة باللغة العربية إضغط هنا

Our story

Reem and Mohammed Alafranji got inspired to establish Habaybna.net from their own journey with their two sons with developmental disability. Aboud and Amro both have a Global Developmental Delay, which the parents accidentally discovered in 2009.

What is Habaybna.net?

Habaybna.net is a new online resource and learning hub that provides specialized content on developmental disabilities (Autism, Down Syndrome, Cerebral Palsy, Global Developmental Delay, etc.) in Arabic throughout the Arab region. The new platform was launched in December 2017  aims to empower parents by providing customized knowledge – in Arabic – through articles and video interviews with experts giving practical guidance, as well as interviews with parents sharing their personal experiences and recommendations. Another important goal of Habaybna.net is to contest the negative stereotypes facing children with disability and focus on their special talents instead.

“The name Habaybna means “Our beloved ones” in Arabic, Reem Alafranji explains. “It reflects our firm belief that our children are our beloved ones regardless of their abilities.”

When Reem and Mohammed discovered their children’s challenges, they tried to find out where to start their new life journey and how to best support their sons.

“It turned out we couldn’t find any reliable resources in Arabic that would provide guidance and practical information,” Mohammed says. There were many websites and articles in English but that information was not customized to an Arab audience, and did not explain which resources and services were available in the Arab countries.“Clearly, this is a major challenge in the Middle East for parents with children who have developmental disabilities, so we decided to do something to address this”, Reem says.

Why we need you

We want to take habaybna.net to the next level by: 

  • Technology: Raising $25,000 will help us build an interactive technology and a directory for service providers in Jordan so parents can connect with specialists and service providers.  
  • Technology & Content: Getting $50,000 We will build an online video library with at least 1,000 videos by specialists and parents so other parents will be empowered with the guidance and information on how to deal with their children with developmental disabilities.
  • Mobile Application:  Reaching $75,000 We will develop a mobile application with features that enable parents to access and interact with organizations, doctors, specialists and service providers.
  • Outreach: reaching the $100,000 goal will enable us to deliver the information to families living in less privileged areas who have children with disabilities throughout conducting information sessions at their communities.    

Passion gets noticed

Did you miss the excellent press coverage about our work? Check out our favorite pieces by top publications and networks:

Queen Rania's Facebook post and Report

AlJazeera English: Meet the woman challenging Arab notions of disability

The World Bank: #SheCan Inspiring Women Entrepreneurs Making a Difference Across MENA

Business and Professional Women Association: Reem Alfranji at Tareeki 2018 (Arabic)

Roya TV: Donya Ya Donya Interview (Arabic)

Alaraby TV: TV report (Arabic)

Alordon Alyoom: TV interview (Arabic)

 

Thank you for making a difference!

Reem & Mohammed Alafranji

 

Reem Alafranji - Founder of Habaybna.net

She is the Co-creator and Producer of TeamHero Cartoon, an edutainment cartoon about disability that has been broadcast on MBC3 on March 2018. She holds a Diploma in Social Entrepreneurship from the Swedish Institute, Stockholm 2017. She has 12 years of experience working with local and international NGOs like UN, JICA and others.

 

Mohammed Alafranji - Co-founder of Habaybna.net

He has 18 years of experience in Project Management, Marketing and Business Development in leading firms and organizations operating in Palestine & Jordan like USAID, UKAID, Gaza Startup Weekend, and NewThink.
